title: Bosnia and Herzegovina - Floods (ECHO 02 Apr 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central and northern Bosnia and Herzegovina, in particular the Zenica-Doboj canton and the Sarajevo canton over the last 36 hours, causing floods and river overflows, particularly the Bosna river, that have resulted in population displacement and damage.Media report, as of 28 March, one evacuated family in the Olovo town, Zenica-Doboj canton. In addition, media also report flooded and damaged roads in the aforementioned town and across the Zenica city and the Kakanj town in the same canton. Local authorities of Kakanj town preemptively declared a natural disaster status.On 27 March, the Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode  to provide flood extent emergency mapping.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

title: Philippines - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 01 Apr 2025)
description: Since 17 March, heavy rainfall caused by the Easterlies has been affecting Northern Mindanao and Davao regions in the southern Philippines, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in population displacements and damage.As of 27 March, the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD DROMIC) reports 383 displaced people, including 250 in Northern Mindanao in three evacuation centres, and 133 in Davao regions. A total of 26,974 people have been affected, of whom 7,785 are in Mindanao and 19,189 in Davao regions.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are forecasted over the southern Philippines.

title: Costa Rica - Volcanic unrest (ECHO 01 Apr 2025)
description: Between late February and March, Poás Volcano, located in Alajuela province, 45 km northwest of San José, increased its activity, characterised by eruptions and gas emissions.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), as of March 25, the volcano has maintained a continuous eruption with small but frequent pulses. Moreover, strong odours and, in some cases, ash fall have been reported across several surrounding communities, affecting 460,000 people.The Civil Protection of Costa Rica has issued a yellow warning, placing the cantons of Alajuela, Poás, Grecia, Sarchí, Naranjo, Zarcero and Río Cuarto under alert.

title: Uganda - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 01 Apr 2025)
description: Intense rainfall has been affecting Kampala city area, the capital of Uganda since 26 March, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 27 March, at least seven people died, including three children, in the Kampala capital, several homes have been destroyed or flooded and roads were closed mainly due to flooding of the Nsobe river.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over most the Kampala city and southern Uganda.

title: South Korea - Wildfires, update (ECHO 01 Apr 2025)
description: Several wildfires burning across an area of 17,000 ha continue to impact the southern regions of South Korea, leading to a rising number of casualties, evacuations, and damage.According to media, 24 people died, more than 20 others have been injured, and some 27,000 were evacuated.The authorities have deployed thousands of firefighters, 5,000 military personnel and 146 helicopters to contain the fires.Over the next 72 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from low to high across southern and central South Korea.

title: Bolivia - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 31 Mar 2025)
description: Following the heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms that have been affecting most of Bolivia since the beginning of the rainy season (November 2024), the humanitarian impact has increased. The most affected departments by recent floods, landslides and severe weather-related incidents are La Paz (western Bolivia), Santa Cruz (eastern Bolivia), and Cochabamba (central Bolivia).Media report, as of 26 March, 50 fatalities, eight still missing persons, more than 368,700 affected families - with a large part of these displaced - and 770 destroyed houses across 204 municipalities throughout the country. The worst affected is the Palos Blancos municipality, La Paz department. In addition, 109 municipalities declared the state of emergency.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over northern and central Bolivia.

title: Tanzania - Severe weather  (ECHO 31 Mar 2025)
description: Since 21 March, heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting northern and eastern Tanzania, particularly the Mara and Morogoro regions, causing displacements and significant damage.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) reports, as of 25 March, 3,620 people have been affected by severe weather across Tanzania. At least 2,165 people have been displaced in evacuation centres from Ulanga district in Morogoro region and 433 houses have been destroyed. In Musoma city 65 people have been sheltered, 165 houses have been destroyed, and several power and water supply systems have been disrupted.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall and thunderstorms are still forecast over the whole country.

title: South Korea - Wildfires, update (ECHO 31 Mar 2025)
description: Several wildfires continue to affect south-eastern and central South Korea, in particular, North Gyeongsang, South Gyeongsang, and North Chungcheong provinces since the afternoon of 21 March (UTC), causing more casualties and damage.The total burn area reached more than 17,500 ha, and the wildfires are currently not fully contained. The worst affected is Uiseong county, North Gyeongsang province with over 15,150 ha of burnt area.The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) reports, as of 26 March, 18 fatalities, of whom 14 across the North Gyeongsang province and four more in the South Gyeongsang. In addition, the IFRC also reports 19 injured people - of whom six seriously injured - nearly 210 damaged buildings and over 27,070 evacuated people across the three aforementioned affected provinces.Over the next 72 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to high across south-eastern and central South Korea.

title: India - Severe weather (ECHO 31 Mar 2025)
description: On 22 March, heavy rain, hail and thunderstorms impacted most parts of Odisha state resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 26 Mach, two people died due to lightning, one in Ganjam and another in Puri districts, while 67 people were injured in Mayurbhanj district. Moreover, over 600 houses were damaged, leaving many families displaced.Over the next 96 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over the whole Odisha state.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 31 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting Java Island and Central Kalimantan since 24 March, causing severe weather-related incidents and flooding that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), as of 26 March, one person died, one has been injured and 23 houses have been damaged in Kediri Regency of East Java Province due to a severe weather-related incident. In Pati Regency of Central Java province, the overflow of the Silugonggo River affected 796 people. In Central Kalimantan province 28 houses have been affected, including 22 that have been severely damaged by strong winds.Over the next 48 hours, light to moderate rainfall is forecasted over Java Island and Central Kalimantan province.

title: Brazil - Floods (ECHO 30 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Brazil, in particular, the Acre State, bordering with Peru and Bolivia over the last week, causing floods and river overflows that have resulted in population evacuation and damage.Media report, as of 25 March, more than 2,800 displaced people and a total of approximately 52,800 affected people across the Acre state.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of Acre State.

title: USA - Wildfires, update (ECHO 30 Mar 2025)
description: Several wildfires continued to burn across the Oklahoma state over the last week, prompting population evacuations and causing damage. The active wildfires across Oklahoma are currently eight, and these wildfires have burnt so far an area of nearly 13,150 ha.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 24 March, mandatory evacuation orders are in force for more than 11,500 people. In addition, FEMA also reports 18 destroyed and three damaged structures across the affected area. The Government of Oklahoma declared the state of emergency.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to very high across most of the Oklahoma state.

title: Philippines - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 30 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting most of the Eastern Visayas region, central-eastern Philippines since 19 March, causing floods, flash floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 25 March, one fatality in the Llorente town, Eastern Samar province. In addition, the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD DROMIC) reports, as of 24 March, more than 7,500 displaced people and a total of approximately 174,200 affected people across Eastern Samar, Western Samar, Northern Samar, and Leyte provinces.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Eastern Visayas region.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic eruption, update (ECHO 30 Mar 2025)
description: Following the eruptions of the Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano, in East Flores regency, East Nusa Tenggara province on 20-21 March, almost 4,500 people have been displaced as reported by the national authorities.Since 23 March, minor explosions have been recorded and the ash column reached up to 100 m above the crater. Additionally, in the past 24 hours, fewer than 50 volcanic earthquakes have been recorded, a decrease compared to the more than 300 reported on March 20.The alert level remains at 4, the maximum. All activities within a 6 km radius of the crater are prohibited, and people must avoid the southwest-northeast sector up to 7 km from the crater.

title: Ecuador - Floods and oil spillover (ECHO 30 Mar 2025)
description: In response to the ongoing floods in Ecuador, the European Union has allocated EUR 195,000 in humanitarian funding through the Disaster Response Emergency Fund  (DREF) that will support the response of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC).The DREF will directly benefit 19,368 affected people in the provinces of El Oro, Guayas and Manabí, through cash transfers and the distribution of Non Food Items (NFIs). First aid, primary health care and psychological support will also be provided to emergency personnel and affected populations, as well as access to safe drinking water and sanitation in order to reduce the risk of disease outbreaks.On  23 March, the UNEP/OCHA Joint Environment Unit requested assistance via the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) for environmental experts to support the Government´s response efforts in the context of the major oil spill that is affecting the province of Esmeraldas. As of 25 March, an UNDAC team will be deployed to Ecuador and will be supported by technical experts from the Joint Environment Unit of OCHA and UNEP.Prompted by a landslide, the oil spill is reportedly impacting access to safe water and livelihoods as well as generating health hazards for 500,000 people who depend on the affected river system.As of 25 March, according to media sources, a new pipeline rupture was reported in Ecuador in Shushufindi, with efforts ongoing to assess the damage but fears that this could negatively impact the functioning of one of the country´s principal hydropower facility.

title: Spain, Portugal - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 29 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting southern, central and northern Spain and central and northern Portugal over the last days, causing floods, river overflows, and several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.In Spain, media report as of 24 March, approximately 150 evacuated people, of whom around 100 are across the Escalona and Santa Cruz de Retamar municipalities, Autonomous Community of Castile-La Mancha, and 48 more are in the Mejorada del Campo municipality, Community of Madrid. In addition, media reports one missing person in the area of the Pujerra town, Autonomous Community of Andalusia. Several closed roads were also reported across the affected area and one damaged bridge in the town of Talavera de la Reina, Autonomous Community of Castile-La Mancha. Some cities across the country declared a state of emergency.In Portugal, media report seven injured people, of whom six are across the area of the capital Lisbon. Several closed roads and some damaged houses were also reported across the country. Some settlements in the Santarém district were left isolated when the Tagus River overflowed its banks due to the increased flow brought on by the recent rains and the releases from the upstream dams.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over north-western Spain, while no more rainfall is forecast over the rest of the country and over the whole of Portugal.

title: Chile - Wildfires (ECHO 29 Mar 2025)
description: At least 19 wildfires have been affecting Biobío-Ñuble and La Araucanía regions, in central Chile, resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), as of 23 March, at least 2,050 people have been displaced across seven shelters, 36,660 people were affected, and several classes have been suspended in Biobío-Ñuble and La Araucanía regions.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to very high over the affected regions.

title: Bolivia - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 29 Mar 2025)
description: The humanitarian impact of the rainy season, which is hitting several parts of Bolivia, is increasing. Reyes, Borja, Rurrenabaque and Riberalta towns in the Beni Department of northern Bolivia are the most affected.According to media, as of 22 March, at least 49 people died, 324,699 families have been displaced across 3,937 communities, more than 700,000 people have been affected, 708 houses have been destroyed, and several temporary shelters have been set up. Beni department and 81 municipalities declared a state of disaster.National authorities have deployed 4,020 personnel to assist the affected people.For the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over central Bolivia.

title: Japan - Wildfires (ECHO 29 Mar 2025)
description: Several wildfires have been burning in southern Japan since 23 March, causing evacuations and damage.As of 24 March, the Fire and Disaster Management Agency (FDMA) reports that in Imabari City, Ehime prefecture, Shikoku Island, the wildfires burnt an area of 137 ha, one person has been injured, and at least 1,887 have been displaced.In Kumamoto prefecture, Kyushu island, 20 ha has burnt, and one person has been injured. In Okayama prefecture, Honshu island, approximately 250 ha has been burnt, 893 people are under evacuation order, and six buildings have been damaged.  As of the same date, media reports a total of 2,800 evacuated people.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is low or moderate in the affected area.

title: South Korea - Wildfires (ECHO 29 Mar 2025)
description: Wildfires have been affecting southern South Korea, in particular, Sancheong, Euiseong and Ulju counties, since 21 March, causing casualties and damage. The total burnt area reached nearly 8,500 ha and the wildfires are currently not fully contained.Media report, as of 24 March, four fatalities, nearly 2,750 evacuated people, the majority of whom are in several shelters, and more than 160 damaged buildings across the three aforementioned affected counties.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast remains moderate across southern South Korea.

title: Bolivia - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 26 Mar 2025)
description: Since the beginning of the rainy season, most parts of Bolivia, 186 municipalities in nine departments, are experiencing heavy rainfall and floods which resulted in casualties and damage.According to UN OCHA, 44 people have died, 10 are still missing and 68 have been evacuated. Moreover, a total of more than 216,000 families have been affected, of which more than 76,000 suffered direct impact. Nationally, 473 houses have been destroyed and 1,899 homes have been affected.National authorities are providing help for those most affected.For the next 48 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over central, northern and western Bolivia.Red hydrological warnings are in effect for some river basins in central and western Bolivia.

title: Philippines - Floods and landslides (ECHO 26 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Mindanao Island, southern Philippines, over the last week, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in population evacuation and damage.The Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD DROMIC) reports, as of 20 March, 133 displaced people, a total of nearly 19,200 affected people and 15 damaged houses across the Davao region (south-eastern Mindanao Island), where the most affected are the Davao de Oro and the Davao Occidental provinces.Over the next 72 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over most of Mindanao Island.

title: Malaysia - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 26 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall continued to affect Peninsular Malaysia, particularly the southernmost Johor state and eastern Malaysia, the Sabah and Sarawak states in the Malaysian part of Borneo Island since 19 March, causing floods and flash floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in more evacuated populations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 21 March, more than 11,000 evacuated people across the Johor state (with 9,646 evacuated people), the Sabah state (1,237 evacuated people), and the Sarawak state (188 evacuated people).  Several people were evacuated across 99 evacuation centres.  The worst affected cities are Johor Bahru, Kulai, and Pontian in the Johor state.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole country.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, thunderstorms and lightning have hit most of Sri Lanka on 28 February - 12 March, causing floods, landslides and several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.  The most affected districts were Hambantota, Moneragala, Ratnapura, Nuwara Eliya, Badulla, and Matara.The National Disaster Relief Services Centre (NDRSC) reports, as of 21 March, two fatalities, four injured, 81 evacuated people in one safety centre, and a total of 1,925 affected people across the country, where the Hambantota district is the worst impacted with 545 affected people.  In addition, NDRSC also reports 283 damaged houses across the affected area.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over western Sri Lanka, while it is forecast over most of the country starting from 23 March.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic eruption and earthquake (ECHO 26 Mar 2025)
description: A new explosive eruption of the Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano, in East Flores regency, East Nusa Tenggara province, has been recorded on 20 March. The ash column reached up to 8 km above the crater.According to media, there were no immediate reports of damage to the nearby villages. Following this event the volcano's alert level was raised from level 3 to level 4, all activities within a radius of 6 km from the crater are forbidden, and people have to avoid the southwest-northeast sector up to 7 km distance from the crater.Furthermore, on 18 March, two earthquakes, the highest of 5.5 M as recorded by national authorities,  occurred in North Tapanuli regency, in North Sumatra province. These seismic events triggered a landslide which resulted in one death, one injured person, two buried houses and 13 damaged houses.

title: France - Snow avalanche (ECHO 25 Mar 2025)
description: On 18 March, a snow avalanche occurred on the Pic du Midi de Bigorre in the commune of Bagnères-de-Bigorrein, Hautes-Pyrénées department, southwestern France, causing one casualty.Media report one fatality on the northern slopes of the Pic du Midi de Bigorre, in the White Murets sector, despite resuscitation attempts.On 20 March, dry conditions are forecast over the Hautes-Pyrénées department, while 21 March is forecast to bring rainfall.

title: Spain - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 25 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall continued to affect southern Spain (in particular, the Autonomous Community of Andalusia) since 17 March, causing floods, flash floods, and river overflows that have resulted in more casualties and damage.Media report, as of 20 March, that in addition to the three fatalities, two of them in the town of Constantina (province of Sevilla) and a third in Añora (province of Córdoba), there is also a missing person in the town of Pujerra (province of Málaga).Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the country, including the already affected Autonomous Community of Andalusia.

title: Australia - Floods (ECHO 25 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has affected North Queensland, in north-eastern Australia, on 19 March, causing severe flash floods that have resulted in significant damage. The worst-affected areas were Ingham, Townsville, Cardwell, and Halifax.As of 19 March, media reports that one person was rescued in Townsville city and two people were rescued in Ingham town, in the Shire of Hinchinbrook. Halifax town, in the same shire, has been isolated due to the flooding, while residents in the Lower Herbert area received an emergency alert on 19 March, warning them to seek shelter. The floods have caused widespread damage, disrupting roads, schools, and prompting emergency services to monitor vulnerable areas.Authorities have issued moderate flood warnings for the Herbert and Bohle rivers, a minor flood warning for the Ross River, and flood warnings for the Black River and Bluewater Creek.Over the next 48 hours, more moderate rainfall, with isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall and storms, is still forecast across Queensland.

title: Venezuela - Floods (ECHO 25 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Venezuela (in particular the La Guaira state) since 18 March, causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in affected population and damage.Media report, as of 20 March, approximately 300 affected people across the La Guaira state, where the worst affected area is the Caraballeda town. In addition, media also report a number of flooded houses across the state.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over northern Venezuela, including the already affected La Guaira state.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Mar 2025)
description: Several wildfires have been burning across the Oklahoma state over the last few days, prompting population evacuations and causing damage. The active wildfires across Oklahoma are 13, and these wildfires have burnt so far an area of more than 68,800 hectares.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 19 March, mandatory evacuation orders for approximately 15,000 people. In addition, FEMA also reports 111 damaged structures across the affected area.Over the next 72 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to very extreme across most of the Oklahoma state.

title: Malaysia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 25 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Peninsular Malaysia (particularly the southernmost Johor state) over the last 24 hours, causing floods, flash floods, and triggering landslides that have resulted in population evacuations and damage.Media report, as of 20 March, nearly 900 evacuated people across Johor state, where the worst affected cities are Johor Bahru (with 567 evacuated people), Kulai, and Pontian.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole of Peninsular Malaysia, including the already affected Johor state.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 24 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall persists across much of Ecuador, causing severe flooding and landslides that resulted in a rising death toll and extensive damage. The most affected regions are located in the west of the country, including the provinces of Manabí, Guayas, Los Ríos, El Oro, Esmeraldas, Loja, Chimborazo, Cotopaxi, Pichincha and Imbabura.As of 19 March, the National Secretariat of Risk Management (SGR) reports 20 fatalities, 6 missing, 95 injured, 306  evacuated people, and a total of 108,227 people affected. In addition, 29,984 houses were damaged, including 138 that have been destroyed.On 18 March, the Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid-mapping mode () to provide damage assessment in the affected areas.Over the next 48 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast across the entire country.

title: China - Landslide (ECHO 24 Mar 2025)
description: A landslide triggered by continuous heavy rainfall occurred on 18 March near a river in Lumadeng Township, Fugong County, in the Lisu Autonomous Prefecture of Nujiang, Yunnan Province, southwest China, resulting in casualties.As of 18 March, media reports indicated one fatality, with four people still missing and one injured person. According to the same media sources, search and rescue efforts are ongoing.Over the next 48 hours, moderate rain with isolated heavy rain is forecast for Yunnan Province, southwest China.

title: Mozambique, Malawi, Madagascar - Tropical cyclone JUDE, update GDACS, DG ECHO, UN OCHA, Copernicus EMSR (ECHO 24 Mar 2025)
description: The passage of the tropical cyclone JUDE caused very heavy rainfall and floods, and flash floods resulted in an increased number of casualties and severe damage. JUDE passed over Madagascar, with two landfalls, on 7-8 March in the north and on 15 March in the south, over northern and central Mozambique on 10-12 March, and over southern Malawi on 11 March. Across the three aforementioned countries, JUDE affected approximately 420,000 people.DG ECHO, UN OCHA and national authorities report, as of 18 March, 16 fatalities, one missing, 135 injured people, nearly 385,000 affected presons and more than 88,000 damaged houses across Mozambique.In Madagascar, the same sources report one fatality, one injured, more than 10,500 displaced people, over 15,000 affected people, and nearly 4,000 damaged houses.In Malawi, three missing, around 4,900 displaced people, and approximately 20,650 affected people were reported.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () for Mozambique and four maps were produced so far.

title: USA - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 24 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the Pacific Northwest region, in particular the Oregon state, since 15 March, causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in more casualties and damage.Media report, as of 19 March, one fatality in the Central Point city, Jackson County, southern Oregon. In addition, media also reports around 50 evacuated people and 23 rescued people across the Douglas County, south-western Oregon.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are still forecast over the whole already affected Oregon state.

title: Spain - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 23 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the Autonomous Community of Andalusia, southern Spain since 17 March, causing floods, flash floods, and river overflows that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 19 March, one fatality in tha area of the Constantina town, Seville province. In addition, media also reports one missing people in the same area and one more missing person across the Córdoba province. Several injured people were also reported in the Murcia region due to severe weather-related incidents.In addition, numerous incidents and the evacuation and rescue of people have been reported in several municipalities in the provinces of Malaga, Huelva, Cordoba and Murcia. Several schools have been closed in the aforementioned provinces and there have been road and railway network closures due to flooding.During the next 24 hours, no more rainfall is expected in the Autonomous Community of Andalusia, from 20 March the entry of a new squall will cause rainfall again in the southeast of the Iberian Peninsula and the rest of the country for 72 hours.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 23 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Madiun regency in East Java, as well as the northeast of West Java, since 15 March, causing flooding and landslides that have resulted in displacement and damage.As of 16 March, the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB) reported that at least one resident was being rescued and a total of 2,000 people had been affected across 13 villages in East Java, with approximately 500 homes damaged. According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 15 March, 57 individuals had been displaced and 966 people had been affected in West Java.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall with isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall is forecasted over most of the Java Island.

title: Italy - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 22 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern and central Italy since 14 March, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in displacements and damage. The regions most impacted are Tuscany and Emilia-Romagna.As of 17 March, at least 150 persons are isolated  and about 60 persons have been  evacuated across the province of Florence.  Several dozen people living in the  villages below the Lamone and Sieve river valleys received an evacuation order. More than 60 schools have been closed in Tuscany region, one main road has been closed between Firenze, Pisa and Livorno cities and several landslides have been recorded in Bologna province in Emilia-Romagna region.On 14 March, the Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping modeOver the next 24, drier conditions are forecast over Tuscany and Emilia-Romagna regions.

title: Peru - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 22 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Peru since December 2024, causing floods, flash floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 14 March, UN OCHA reported a total of 168,428 affected people, more than 80,000 damaged and 3,172 destroyed homes.A state of emergency has been declared for at least 962 districts.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Bolivia - Flood (ECHO 22 Mar 2025)
description: Since 13 March, heavy rainfall has been affecting western Bolivia, particularly the Viacha city area, in the Ingavi province of the La Paz department, causing rivers overflow and floods that have resulted in damage.According to media reports, as of 17 March, more than 6,000 people have been affected and several croplands have been destroyed.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the whole of Bolivia.

title: USA - Tornadoes and severe weather (ECHO 22 Mar 2025)
description: In the past few days, tornadoes, dust storms, heavy rain and very strong winds have impacted the Midwest and South of USA, causing casualties and damage.According to media, at least 40 people died, most of them (12), in Missouri, while Alabama, Kansas, Mississippi, Texas, Arkansas, and Oklahoma have also suffered casualties and damage. In addition, dozens of people have been injured and 300,000 people experienced power cuts.For the next 24 hours, rain with thunderstorms is expected across north-western and north-eastern USA. Strong winds are still forecast over most of the aforementioned States which are under red flags for wind warnings.

title: Mozambique, Madagascar - Tropical cyclone JUDE, update (ECHO 22 Mar 2025)
description: Tropical cyclone JUDE crossed southern Madagascar on 15 March and is moving south-east weakening and dissipating over the Indian Ocean.Following its passage over northern and central-northern Mozambique on 9-12 March the humanitarian impact continued to increase.According to the National Institute for Risk Management and Reduction (INGD), 16 people died -13 in Nampula, two in Zambezia and one in Niassa provinces - two people are missing and 59 others were injured. Additionally, almost 2,000 people have been evacuated in nine evacuation centres and 302,653 people have been affected across the provinces of Nampula, Zambezia, Tete, Niassa and Sofala.In South of Madagascar, according to preliminary assessments, more than 14,000 people have been affected and more than 4,000 houses have been damaged or destroyed.On 10 March, the Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode  and four maps were produced so far. For the next 48 hours, moderate rainfall is still expected over northern and parts of central coastal Mozambique.

title: JUDE-25 - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR793] Tropical Cyclone JUDE in Mozambique

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: Since 12 March, a severe storm, accompanied by heavy rain, strong winds, and snowfall in the mountains, has been affecting the West Coast of the USA, particularly Los Angeles county, causing flooding, flash floods, and resulting in damage and power outages.As of 13 March, media reports indicate that six people were rescued from trapped vehicles due to flash floods in San Jacinto, California's Riverside County. In addition, media reports state that the storm also produced a tornado that damaged homes and cars in Pico Rivera, southeast of Los Angeles.Local authorities issued evacuation orders for parts of Los Angeles county and flash flood warnings for parts of Los Angeles, Ventura, and Orange counties.Over the next 48 hours, more moderate rainfall is expected in the affected area.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: On 12 March, heavy rainfall accompanied by thunderstorms, strong winds, and hail hit the São Paulo metropolitan area, in the São Paulo state, in south-eastern Brazil, resulting in flooding, casualties, widespread damage, and power outages.According to media reports, as of 13 March, one person had been killed due to a strong wind-related incident, several buildings have been damaged, and around 500,000 people have been left without electricity. The city of São Paulo issued a flood alert, with the western zone being the worst affected.Over the next 48 hours, moderate rainfall with isolated heavy rain is forecast for the affected area in the state of São Paulo, in southeastern Brazil.

title: Peru - Floods and landslides (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Peru, in particular the Madre de Dios and the Apurímac departments since 10 March, causing floods, flash floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.The National Institute of Civil Defense (INDECI) and media report, as of 14 March, one fatality and six still missing persons across the Chalhuanca district, Apurimac department. In addition, media also report 85 evacuated people, nearly 100 damaged buildings, and a total of approximately 270 affected people across the Madre de Dios department, where the most affected cities and towns are Puerto Maldonado, Laberinto, and Las Piedras.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Colombia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Colombia, in particular the Quindío department over the last 48 hours, causing flash floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 14 March, one still missing person, two injured persons, and one destroyed building across the Armenia municipality, central Quindío department.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country, including the already affected area.

title: Mozambique, Malawi, Madagascar - Tropical cyclone JUDE, update (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: On 13 March, tropical cyclone JUDE continued south-east over the southern Mozambique Channel toward south-western Madagascar as a tropical storm, slightly strengthening. On 14 March at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 230 km east of the Anakao municipality, Atsimo-Andrefana region, with maximum sustained winds of 108 km/h (tropical storm).Media report, as of 14 March, nine fatalities, 20 injured persons, around 100,000 affected people, and over 20,000 damaged houses across Mozambique. In addition, the Department of Disaster Management Affairs in Malawi reported that a total of 11,370 people were affected across 11 districts with Phalombe being the worst affected followed by Nsanje. Furthermore, six camps were established to provide shelter to displaced people.On 10 March, the Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () and four maps were produced so far.JUDE is forecast to make landfall over the western coast of the Atsimo-Andrefana region (between Anakao and Itampolo municipalities) on 14 March in the evening, with maximum sustained winds up to 137 km/h (tropical cyclone).Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds, and storm surges are still forecast over most of Madagascar, southern Malawi, and central and southern Mozambique.

title: Italy - Earthquake  (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: The seismic swarm continues in the Campi Flegrei area, west of Naples, southern Italy. A new earthquake of 4.4 M, as recorded by the National Institute of Geophysics and Volcanology - INGV, at a depth of 2 km occurred on the coast between Bagnoli and Pozzuoli municipalities. The epicentre was located approximately 500 m west of Bagnoli municipality.At least twenty other seismic events with minor magnitude (up to 1.6 M) have been recorded in the area.According to the Italian Civil Protection and media, one person has been lightly injured and some damage has been recorded to houses and to the Church of Sant'Anna in Bagnoli.Following this event, the Italian Civil Protection Department activated the Crisis Unit in connection with the local structures of the National Civil Protection Service.

title: Benin - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: Strong winds and thunderstorms affected the commune of Zogbodomey, Zoe department, south-western Benin, on 10 March, resulting in affected people and damage.As of 11 March, according to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), 1,386 people were affected by strong wind, of which 800 were left homeless, and several structures have been destroyed or damaged, in the districts of Akiza, Kpokissa and Tanwe-Hessou, in the east and southwest of Zogbodomey.Over the next 48 hours, scattered moderate to high rainfall is forecast for the south of Benin.

title: Armenia - Snow avalanche (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: On 11 March, a snow avalanche occurred in northeast Armenia resulting in casualties.According to media, as of 12 March, one person died, seven were injured and one have been rescued after being swept away at the summit of Aragats, an extinct volcano that is the country's highest peak in Aragatsotn province, in north-eastern Armenia.For the next 48 hours, dry conditions are forecast across the country.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: Between 11 and 13 March, Thailand experienced extremely high temperatures accompanied by thunderstorms, strong winds, and hail in certain areas. The northern regions of the country were particularly affected, with strong winds causing damage.As of 11 March, the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reported that 3,015 people had been affected and 603 houses had been damaged across seven provinces, namely Lampang, Phetchabun, Uthai Thani, Loei, Nong Bua Lamphu, Yasothon, and Ubon Ratchathani. Additionally, a storm hit the provinces of Sukhothai and Tak, affecting 1,216 individuals and damaging 304 houses.Over the next 48 hours, moderate rainfall with isolated heavy rain is expected to occur mainly in the northeastern part of Thailand.

title: Mozambique, Malawi, Madagascar - Tropical Cyclone JUDE, update (ECHO 16 Mar 2025)
description: Tropical cyclone JUDE reached the Mozambique channel after it crossed northern-central Mozambique on 12 March. On 13 March at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located approximately 70 km south-east of Chinde town, Zambezia Province and 750 km north-west of the south-western coast of Madagascar with maximum sustained winds of 63 km/h (tropical storm).According to to preliminary reports by the National Institute for Disaster Management (INGD), in Mozambique 100,410 people were affected, 9 people died and 20 were injured, more than 20,000 houses were totally or partially destroyed as well as 28 health centres and 59 schools. Media reported that in Malawi two people have been injured, 1,421 displaced and 3,500 affected across eight councils.On 10 March, the Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () three maps had been produced so far.JUDE is forecasted to move south-east over the Mozambique channel on 13-14 March, lightly strengthening, and to make landfall between 14 and 15 March over south-western Madagascar.On 13-14 March, heavy to very heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected over southern Malawi and central-northern Mozambique as well as on 15-16 March over most of southern Madagascar.

title: Georgia - Severe weather (ECHO 05 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy snowfall has been affecting western Georgia since 20 February, in particular the region of Guria, resulting in casualties, several disruptions, and damage.As of 25 February, the IFRC reported three fatalities and 1,400 people affected by heavy snowfall. In addition, at least 28,870 people have been affected by power outages in 39 villages in Chokhatauri and Ozurgeti municipalities. Several houses have been damaged due to the roof collapsing, schools have been suspended and 42 roads have been closed.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated on 27 February to provide damage assessment emergency mapping.Over the next 24 hours, no more snow is forecast over the affected areas.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 05 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the Malaysian part of the Borneo Island since 26 February, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage.As of 28 February, the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports a total of 397 evacuated people. 340 of them are located across five evacuation centres in the Telupis district, and 57 are in two evacuation centres in the Paitan district, both in the Sabah state.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over most of eastern Malaysia.

title: Botswana - Floods, update (ECHO 05 Mar 2025)
description: Widespread flooding is affecting Botswana since 16 February, and has led to an increasing humanitarian impact.According to media, as of 26 February, nine people died, including six children. Approximately 2,000 people have been displaced and more than 5,000 people have been affected across the country.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is expected across northern, western and southern Botswana.

title: Japan - Wildfire (ECHO 05 Mar 2025)
description: A wildfire in the Akasakicho area in the city of Ofunato in northern Japan has caused casualties and damage. According to the Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), at least 634 hectares have been burnt in this area so far.As of 28 February, the Fire and Disaster Management Agency (FDMA) reports one fatality, 3,306 people under evacuation orders, and at least 84 damaged houses. According to media, at least 540 people have been displaced in seven shelters in Ofunato city, and power outages affected 490 households.Over the next 48 hours, according to GWIS, the fire danger forecast is low in the affected area.

title: Réunion, Madagascar, Mauritius - Tropical cyclones GARANCE and HONDE, update (ECHO 05 Mar 2025)
description: On 27 February, tropical cyclone GARANCE continued moving south while strengthening. On 28 February around 6.00 UTC, it made landfall over the north of Réunion, with maximum winds of 179 km/h.According to media, emergency accommodation centres have opened across Réunion. Around 500 people already evacuated, and schools and airports are closed.GARANCE is forecast to move southward over central Réunion on 28 February in the morning, slightly weakening.Copernicus EMS was activated () on 27 February.Meanwhile, tropical cyclone HONDE continued eastwards over the Mozambique Channel toward Madagascar. On 28 February at 6.00 UTC, it was located offshore approximately 80 km south of the south-western Madagascar coast, with maximum winds of 137 km/h.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds, and storm surges are forecast over Réunion, while heavy rainfall is forecast over Mauritius. Météo France La Réunion issued the purple cyclone alert over the whole island. Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over southern and central Madagascar.

title: Afghanistan - Severe weather and flash floods, update (ECHO 04 Mar 2025)
description: The death toll is increasing following the heavy rain and flash floods that occurred across three provinces in southern and south-western Afghanistan (Farah, Kandahar, Helmand) on 25 February.According to media, 39 people died and 44 were injured. 24 casualties fell in Farah province, nine in Kandahar province and six in Helmand province.For the next 24 hours, no more rain is expected across the affected provinces.

title: Peru - Floods and landslides (ECHO 04 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Peru since January, causing landslides and flooding that have resulted in casualties, affected populations and damage.According to UNICEF, as of 26 February, at least seven people died and 57,225 people have been affected, including 17,167 children. In addition, 27,486 houses, 200 bridges, 79 classrooms and 14 health centres have been damaged or destroyed by landslides or flooding across 20 regions in Peru, with Huancavelica as the worst affected.A state of emergency has been declared on 20 FebruaryOver the next 72 hours, more rainfall is forecast over Peru. Particularly the central Andes will experience heavy rainfall.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather, update (ECHO 04 Mar 2025)
description: Severe weather due to heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Ecuador since January. This has caused floods and landslides, and an increasing number of affected people and damage.According to media reports, at least nine people died, 19,969 people have been affected, 35 houses have been destroyed, and 5,913 houses and 12 bridges have been damaged due to landslides, floods and severe weather-related incidents across 23 out of 24 provinces in Ecuador.A state of emergency has been declared in eight provinces on 25 February.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMSR 789) was activated on 26 February to provide flood extent emergency mapping, one map has been produced so far.For the next 48 hours, more rainfall is expected across most of the country, with severe rainfall over the coastal areas.

title: Indonesia - Earthquake (ECHO 04 Mar 2025)
description: An earthquake of 6.1 M (6.0 M according to local authorities) at a depth of 10 km occurred in the Molucca Sea, 47 km east of the Minahasa Peninsula of the island of Sulawesi on 25 February at 22:55 UTC (26 February, 06:55 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 56 km east of Modisi town in North Sulawesi province, central-north Indonesia.Approximately ten aftershocks of a magnitude between 4.7 and 5.1 M have been recorded in the area.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), as of 27 February, at least 35 people have been affected, and 11 houses have been damaged in East Bolaang Mongondow regency in central North Sulawesi province.National authorities are monitoring the damaged infrastructure.

title: Réunion, Madagascar - Tropical Cyclones (ECHO 04 Mar 2025)
description: Tropical cyclone GARANCE is turning southward in the Southern Indian Ocean. On 27 February at 0.00 UTC, it was located approximately 340 km north of Réunion (France) with maximum winds of 179 km/h.GARANCE is forecast to strengthen and make landfall in Réunion early 28 February, with maximum winds of 130 km/h and gusts between 170 and 200 km/h (reported by COGIC).Authorities carried out anticipation and planning work to prepare the operational response.Meanwhile, tropical cyclone HONDE is moving southeast in the Mozambique Channel towards south-western Madagascar. On 27 February at 0.00 UTC, it is located approximately 356 km west of Toliara city, with maximum winds of 127 km/h.HONDE is forecast to strengthen and pass close to southern Madagascar on 1-2 March, with winds up to 137 km/h.For the next 48 hours, heavy to very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are expected across Réunion and south-western Madagascar. Réunion is under orange cyclone alert, while red warnings are in force in parts of Madagascar.

title: Cuba - Floods (ECHO 03 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern and western Cuba (in particular, La Habana province, and Pinar del Rio province) over the last 72 hours. The rainfall caused floods and flash floods that resulted in casualties and damage.As of 26 February, media report one fatality in the area of Havana capital city, as well as several flooded houses and roads across La Habana province.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecasted over northern, western, and central Cuba.

title: Madagascar - Floods (ECHO 03 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Madagascar over the last 10 days, in particular the Analamanga region. This has caused floods and overflows of the Sisaony and the Ikopa rivers, which resulted in casualties and damage.As of 26 February, media report 11 fatalities and several school closures across the Analamanga region.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the already affected region.

title: Reunion, Mauritius, Madagascar - Tropical cyclones GARANCE and HONDE, update (ECHO 03 Mar 2025)
description: On 25 February, tropical storm GARANCE continued gaining strength while moving southeast. On 26 February 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the southern Indian Ocean approximately 385 km north-west of Reunion and approximately 475 km north-west of Mauritius, with maximum sustained winds of 108 km/h.On the forecast track, GARANCE is expected to furhter strengthen into a tropical cyclone, and to make landfall over north-eastern Reunion on 27 February in the afternoon, with maximum sustained winds up to 190 km/h.Meanwhile, a new tropical storm named HONDE formed over the Mozambique Channel on 25 February and started moving toward Madagascar. On 26 February 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Channel approximately 515 km east of the far south-eastern Madagascar coast, with maximum sustained winds of 97 km/h.Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds, and storm surges are forecast over Reunion, Mauritius, and central and southern Madagascar.

title: Algeria  - Floods (ECHO 03 Mar 2025)
description: On 22 and 23 February, heavy rain affected Ain Témouchent province in north-western Algeria, causing floods and leading to casualties.According to media reports, three people died due to the overflow of a wadi - a river valley that is usually dry, except when heavy rain occurs.On 26 February no more rain is forecasted over the country.

title: Afghanistan - Severe weather and flash floods (ECHO 03 Mar 2025)
description: On 25 February, heavy rain hit the province of Farah in western Afghanistan (particularly the Pushtkoh district) and the province of Kandahar in southern Afghanistan. The rain caused flash floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.As of 26 February, media report 21 casualties and six people injured in Farah province due to flash floods and severe weather-related incidents. In addition, eight people died in Kandahar province following severe weather-related incidents.A joint assessment by Humanitarian Aid agencies and local authorities is underway.For the next 24 hours, no additional rainfall is expected across the affected provinces.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 02 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy snowfall and very low temperatures have been affecting north-eastern USA, in particular the New York state, since 22 February, causing several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in population displacement and damage.As of 25 February, media reports a number of evacuated and rescued people, and 27 collapsed buildings across the Oswego county, the most affected, and the neighbouring Oneida county, both in central New York state.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy snowfall mixed with heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole New York state.

title: Zambia - Floods (ECHO 02 Mar 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Zambia, in particular the Lusaka province, since 22 February, causing severe floods and flash floods that have resulted in population displacement and damage.The Disaster Management and Mitigation Unit (DMMU) reports, as of 25 February, 50 evacuated families (approximately 250 people), of whom several are in one temporary shelter, across the Lusaka province, where the most affected area is the Lusaka district. DMMU is providing food and non-food relief items to the affected population.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the country.

title: South Africa - Landslides and floods (ECHO 02 Mar 2025)
description: Since 19 February, heavy rainfall has been hitting KwaZulu-Natal province, causing floods and landslides, which resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, at least nine people died due to separate landslide and flood events in the south of Durban, Folweni, Demat and Ensimbini. Additionally, residents have been displaced, some infrastructure has been damaged and roads have been closed.On 25-26 February, moderate rainfall is forecasted across most of the affected province.

title: Thailand - Floods (ECHO 02 Mar 2025)
description: Between 23-24 February, heavy to very heavy rain brought by the northeast monsoon and easterly winds impacted three provinces of southern Thailand (Surat Thani, Nakhon Sri Thammarat and Narathiwat), causing floods and the overflow of some rivers.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 25 February, more than 1,500 people and 302 houses affected across the aforementioned provinces.During 25-26 February, scattered to fairly widespread thundershowers and isolated heavy rains are expected over the affected areas.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather, update (ECHO 01 Mar 2025)
description: Since January 2025, heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Ecuador, causing floods, triggering landslides, and resulting in casualties and significant damage.According to UN OCHA, nine people have died, while more than 7,500 others have been affected. The worst-hit provinces are Azuay, Carchi, Esmeraldas, Pichincha, Santo Domingo, Los Ríos, Guayas, and Manabí, which are experiencing river flooding and road closuresNational authorities are providing help for those affected, by distributing relief items to 464 people in Cantón Simón Bolívar.For the next 48 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected across most of the country, especially across western and coastal Ecuador.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 01 Mar 2025)
description: From February 15 to 21, the western USA, particularly Kentucky, experienced heavy rain and snowfall, strong winds, and extremely low temperatures.These severe weather conditions triggered floods, flash floods, and mudslides, along with several weather-related incidents. Strong winds, in particular, have led to a rising number of casualties and significant damage.As of February 24, media reports indicate a total of 21 fatalities across Kentucky, primarily due to flooding. Additionally, approximately 600 people that were evacuated remain in temporary shelters, and more than 100 roads are still closed.Over the next 48 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over Kentucky.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 01 Mar 2025)
description: The rainy season continues to affect most parts of Indonesia, causing floods, flash floods and landslides that result in casualties, severe weather-related incidents and damage.The National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure reports that a landslide occurred in Sisundung Village, North Sumatra province on 22 February, leading to two fatalities and two destroyed houses. Furthermore, Bandar Lampung City in Sumatra island experienced flood and landslide events which resulted in two fatalities, 9,353 affected families and one damaged house. Furthermore, on 23 February, strong winds hit Bantul Regency in the Special Region of Yogyakarta where one person has been injured and 27 families affected.From 24 to 27 February, moderate to very heavy rain is still expected over most parts of the country, including South Sumatra, Lampung and most of Java island.

title: Botswana - Floods, update (ECHO 01 Mar 2025)
description: Since 16 February, Botswana has been experiencing widespread floods caused by heavy rainfall which resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.According to UNICEF, seven people died and one person is still missing. Additionally, 1,749 people have been sheltered, and almost 3,000 people have been affected across the country.UNICEF and Botswana Red Cross Society are providing help to the affected population.On 24 and 25 February, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected across northern, central and south-eastern Botswana.

title: Peru - Floods (ECHO 26 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-eastern Peru, in particular, the Puno region, since 17 February, causing floods and rivers overflow that have resulted in affected populations and damage.The National Institute of Civil Defense (INDECI) reports, as of 20 February, around 50 affected people and approximately 50 damaged houses across the Tiquillaca district, Puno region.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Colombia - Landslide (ECHO 26 Feb 2025)
description: On 20 February, a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall, that has been affecting central-western Colombia since January, resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 21 February, two people died, three people are missing, four have been injured and ten have been rescued due to a landslide that occurred in the municipality of Villamaría in the southern department of Caldas in central-western Colombia. In addition, five houses have been destroyed.Search and rescue operations are still ongoing in the affected area.For the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over most of the country.

title: Botswana - Floods (ECHO 26 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Botswana, southern Africa since 16 February, causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 21 February, four fatalities across the area of the Gaborone city, the capital of the country in south-eastern Botswana. In addition, media also report a number of displaced people, flooded buildings and roads, and school closures across the country.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of Botswana, including the capital Gaborone.

title: Türkiye - Severe Weather  (ECHO 26 Feb 2025)
description: Since 19 February, heavy snowfall, ice and strong winds have been affecting northern and eastern Türkiye, in particular Eastern Anatolia and the Istanbul city areas, causing several disruption and damage.As of 21 February, media reports that more than 2,921 roads have been closed in Eastern Anatolia, schools have been suspended in 21 cities, more than 300 flights have been cancelled, and ship traffic has been suspended due to fog in the Bosporus Strait.Over the next 48 hours, more snow and strong winds are forecast for northern and eastern Türkiye, orange alert for snow has been issued in north-western Türkiye.

title: Greece - Seismic activity, update (ECHO 25 Feb 2025)
description: On the morning of 19 February, a 4.2 M earthquake at a depth of 16 km occurred in the same area affected by the seismic swarms in the southern Aegean Sea. The epicentre was located 14 km south-west of Arkesini Amorgos and 226 km south-east of Athens. In the past 24 hours, more than 70 earthquakes have been registered.A state of emergency has been declared on four islands, Santorini, Amorgos, Anafi and Ios, and schools have been closed until 21 February.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 25 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall, heavy snowfall, strong winds, and very low temperatures continued to affect eastern USA, in particular Kentucky, Georgia, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia states since 12 February, causing floods, flash floods, mudslides, and several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 19 February, 18 fatalities, of whom 14 across Kentucky, three across West Virginia, and one more in Georgia. In addition, FEMA reports 527 still evacuated people in 23 shelters across Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia, where the worst affected is Kentucky with 424 evacuated people in 15 shelters. Moreover, 295 road closures were reported in Kentucky.Over the next 24 hours, more snowfall is still forecast over eastern and north-eastern USA. NOAA has issued winter storm warnings over several counties in the area.

title: Philippines - Severe weather, update (ECHO 25 Feb 2025)
description: The heavy rainfall caused by the Shear Line continued to affect the MIMAROPA region, central and western Philippines since 7 February, causing floods, landslides, and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports, as of 19 February, seven fatalities, of whom six fatalities across the Palawan province and one more in the Oriental Mindoro province, both provinces in the MIMAROPA region. In addition, NDRRMC also reports 3,773 evacuated people - of which 546 across six evacuation centers - and a total of nearly 123,800 affected people across the aforementioned affected region. Moreover, 185 damaged houses and two damaged bridges were reported in the Mimaropa region.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and western Philippines.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 25 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Peninsular Malaysia, in particular the southern states of Pahang and the neighbouring Negeri Sembilan over the last 24 hours, causing floods that have resulted in population evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 20 February, a total of 251 evacuated people, of which 150 evacuated people in one evacuation center across the Pahang state, and 101 evacuated people in one evacuation center in the Negeri Sembilan state.Over the next 96 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over most of Peninsular Malaysia.

title: South Africa - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Feb 2025)
description: Since February, wildforest fires fuelled by strong winds have affected the Western Cape province, particularly the Western Cape wine geographical unit, resulting in evacuations and damage. The fires started on Oaklands farm above the town of Wellington, about 75 km north-east of Cape Town.According to media, two cottages have been evacuated, one house and two hangars have been destroyed as well as several hectares of crops.Firefighters are still battling to control raging fires in the area.For the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme over the interested region.

title: Greece - Seismic activity, update (ECHO 24 Feb 2025)
description: Seismic activity continued in the southern Aegean Sea, between the islands of Santorini (Thira) and Amorgos, south-eastern Greece.According to the National Observatory of Athens, a 5.0 M earthquake at a depth of 13  km occurred on 18 February at 04:46 UTC, 17 km south-southeast of Amorgos Island.State of emergency has been declared for Santorini, Amorgos, Anafi, and Ios.On 17 February, the Greek Civil Protection, decided to built an escape port in Santorini to allow passenger ships to dock in case of emergency. Schools will remain closed until 21 February.

title: Italy - Seismic activity (ECHO 24 Feb 2025)
description: Since 15 February, several earthquakes with maximum magnitude up to 3.9 M (on 16 and 17 February) have been registered in the Campi Flegrei area, west of Naples, southern Italy.On 19 February two earthquakes of 3.1 M (at 0.31 UTC at a depth of 2 km) and 3.0 M (at 4.15 at a depth of 2 km) in the Pisciarelli area.According to media, some schools were closed in Pozzuoli town, located close to the main epicentres on 17-18 February as a precautionary measure. Other closures also related to the municipal library of Pozzuoli and the Archaeological Park of the Campi Flegrei.The Italian Civil Protection ordered the opening of the reception and waiting areas for the citizens of the municipalities of Pozzuoli, Bacoli and Naples.

title: USA - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 24 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and freezing temperatures have been affecting the eastern United States in the last few days, causing flooding and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 19 February, at least 14 people died, including 12 in Kentucky, one in Georgia, one in West Virginia. Media also reports an unknown number of missing people in West Virginia due to flooding, 296 people were displaced and more than 1,000 people have been rescued. In addition, 10 bridges were destroyed, 340 roads were closed in Martin County in eastern Kentucky, and 78,000 people are without power across Kentucky, West Virginia, Maryland, and Pennsylvania.Over the next 48 hours, snow and freezing rain is forecast over nort-eastern United States.

title: Papua New Guinea - Earthquake (ECHO 24 Feb 2025)
description: An earthquake of 5.6 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Woodlark island, Milne Bay Province, eastern Papua New Guinea on 19 February at 2:49 UTC (12:49 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 3 km south of Kaurai village and 9 km north-east of Kulumadau village.USGS PAGER estimated that up to 3,000 people were exposed to strong shaking.According to media there are no reports of any casaulties or damage.

title: Ecuador - Landslide (ECHO 23 Feb 2025)
description: A landslide, triggered by recent heavy rainfall, occurred in the Portoviejo town area, Manabí province, western Ecuador, resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, three people died, another was injured and a house was buried by the event.For the next 24 hours, light rain is expected over the affected province.

title: Madagascar - Floods (ECHO 23 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Madagascar, in particular the Antananarivo city area, since 15 February, causing flooding and river overflow that has resulted in affected populations and damage.The National Risk and Disaster Management Programme of Madagascar (BNGRC) and media reports, as of 16 February, a total of 2,936 displaced people in five evacuation centres, 3,688 that have been affected, and 720 houses that have been damaged by the rising waters of the Sisaony river.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over northern and western Madagascar. A red warning for heavy rain has been issued for central-eastern Madagascar.

title: Philippines - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 23 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall caused by the the Intertropical Convergence Zone and Shear Line has been affecting central and southern Philippines since December causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted displacements and damage.As of 18 February, the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD DROMIC) reports a total of 13,394 displaced people in MIMAROPA, Bicol, Central Visayas, SOCCSKSARGEN regions and Zamboanga Peninsula, approximately 265,500 affected people, and 218 damaged houses in Bicol, Central, Eastern and Western Visayas.On 18-19 February, more rainfall is still forecast over the Philippines, more heavy rainfall is expected over eastern Philippines on 20 February.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 23 Feb 2025)
description: Parts of Indonesia continue to experience heavy rainfall that has caused floods and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), almost 2,400 people have been affected in Pasuruan City, East Java province as well as 867 houses. Additionally, in Bima city, Sumbawa island, West Nusa Tenggara province almost 700 people have been affected, one house has been totally damaged and 169 have been affected.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is expected across the hit areas.

title: France - Snow avalanches (ECHO 22 Feb 2025)
description: Two snow avalanches occurred in the Savoie department, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, south-eastern France on 15 February, causing casualties.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) reports, as of 16 February, two fatalities and three rescued people across the area of the Bonneval-sur-Arc town, Savoie department due to a snow avalanche. In addition, COGIC also reports, in the same department, one fatality and two injured persons in the area of the Arvillard town due to another snow avalanche event.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 22 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall, heavy snowfall, strong winds, and very low temperatures have been affecting western USA, in particular Kentucky, Georgia, Tennessee, and Virginia over the last 48 hours, causing floods, flash floods, mudslides, and several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 17 February, ten fatalities, of whom nine across Kentucky and one more in Georgia. In addition, media report approximately 100 evacuated people in a number of emergency shelters and more than 300 road closures across Kentucky, where the Governor declared the state of emergency. Moreover, 52 evacuated people were reported in Tennessee and 51 evacuated people across Virginia.Over the next 24 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over western USA, while more rainfall and snowfall is forecast over Kentucky, Georgia, and Tennessee from 18 February.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic activity, update (ECHO 22 Feb 2025)
description: The number of people affected by the eruption of the Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano, in East Flores regency, East Nusa Tenggara province, which occurred on 12 February and was characterized by an ash plume of approximately 1,500 m above the summit of the crater, has increased.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 17 February, at least 5,230 people have been affected, and people who live in six villages in the disaster-prone area of East Flores regency have been evacuated. In addition, the villages of Dulipali, Padang Pasir, Nobo, Klatanlo, Hokeng Jaya, Boru, and Nawakote are being monitored for potential lahar risk.The volcano's alert level remains at level 4, with all activities within a radius of 6 km from the crater are forbidden, people have to avoid the southwest-northeast sector up to 7 km distance from the crater.

title: Italy - Floods (ECHO 19 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central-northern Italy, in particular the western Tuscany region over the last 24 hours, causing floods, flash floods and triggering some landslides that have resulted in population evacuations and damage.Media report, as of 14 February, 12 evacuated people and nearly 40 rescued people across the Elba island, Livorno province, western Tuscany region, in particular in the area of Portoferraio municipality, the main town of the island. In addition, several flooded roads were reported across the Elba island and the Livorno province mainland. Several schools remain closed across the affected area.Over the next 12 hours, moderate rainfall is still forecast over parts of the Tuscany region.

title: Australia - Tropical cyclone ZELIA, update (ECHO 19 Feb 2025)
description: Tropical cyclone ZELIA made landfall over the area between the coastal towns of Port Hedland and Pardoo, northern Pilbara region on 14 February around 4.30 (UTC) with maximum sustained winds up to 213 km/h. On 14 February at 7.00, its centre was located inland approximately 65 km east of Port Hedland town, with maximum sustained winds of 177 km/h.After the landfall, media report approximately 160 evacuated people in a number of shelters across Port Hedland, South Hedland, and Karratha towns. Several closed roads and school closures were reported across the northern Pilbara region.ZELIA is expected to continue southward inland over the central-western Western Australia on 15-16 February, further weakening and becoming a tropical storm.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over central-western Western Australia. The warning for gales over most of the Pilbara region issued by the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) remains in force.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rain, snow and strong winds have been affecting the eastern and western United States since 12 February, causing several severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.As of 14 February, in the eastern United States, one person died in Callaway County, Missouri State, at least 20 people have been injured in severe weather-related incidents in the states of Virginia, Maryland and Kentucky, more than 136,600 people have been affected by power outages and schools have been closed in Virginia and North Carolina, according to media reports.Meanwhile, in California, in the western United States, evacuation orders have been issued for areas affected by January's severe wildfires in Los Angeles and Orange counties, and evacuation warnings have been issued for Ventura and San Bernardino counties, in southern California, due to the risk of debris flows and mudslides.Over the next 24 hours, more snow is expected in the north-eastern United States and rain and thunderstorms are still forecast for the California state.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic activity (ECHO 19 Feb 2025)
description: The Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano, in East Flores regency, East Nusa Tenggara province, has increased its activity since 13 February with ash plumes reaching 1,500 m above the summit of the crater and intense seismic activity.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), an evacuation order has been issued on 13 February for residents of the six villages in the disaster-prone area of East Flores regency.On the same day, the volcano's alert level  was raised from level 3 to level 4, all activities within a radius of 6 km from the crater are forbidden, people have to avoid the southwest-northeast sector up to 7 km distance from the crater.Local authorities are monitoring the ongoing activity.

title: Italy - Volcanic activity (ECHO 18 Feb 2025)
description: A new eruption has been observed at Mount Etna volcano, in the eastern Sicily region, in southern Italy since last week.According to the National Institute of Geophysics and Volcanology (INGV), as of 12 February the eruption is characterised by lava flows at the eastern crater (Bocca Nuova) and by strong explosive activity at the south-east crater, that has been observed alongside with a feeble ash cloud on 12 February at 9:30 UTC.Following this eruption, the National Civil Protection Department raised the Volcanic Alert Level to Yellow (low to medium eruptive activity) and according to the Volcanic Ash Advisory Centre (VAAC), the aviation colour code has been changed from red to orange on 13 February.

title: Australia - Tropical cyclone ZELIA, update (ECHO 18 Feb 2025)
description: On 12 February, tropical cyclone ZELIA continued south over the Indian Ocean toward the northern Pilbara region, central Western Australia, strengthening, with maximum sustained winds up to 157 km/h (tropical cyclone). On 13 February at 6.00 (UTC), its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 130 km north of the coastal town of Port Hedland, northern Pilbara region, with maximum sustained winds of 234 km/h.ZELIA is expected to make landfall in the area just east of Roebourne town and Karratha town, northern Pilbara region on the evening of 14 February, with maximum sustained winds up to 250 km/h. After that, it is forecast to continue inland over the Pilbara region on 15 February, weakening, with maximum sustained winds around 120 km/h.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds, and storm surges are forecast over coastal and central Western Australia, in particular over the whole Pilbara region. The warning for gales over most of this region issued by the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) is in force.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 18 Feb 2025)
