description: Strong winds and thunderstorms affected the western Florida state (USA) on 11 February, causing several severe weather-related incidents that resulted in injured people and damage.Media reports, as of 13 February, three injured people and several damaged buildings across the Escambia county, the westernmost county of the Florida Panhandle, where the most affected is the Pensacola city area.Over the next 24 hours, strong winds, thunderstorms, and rainfall are still forecast over most of Florida, including the whole Florida Panhandle.

title: Philippines - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 18 Feb 2025)
description: The heavy rainfall caused by the Shear Line continued to affect central and western Philippines, in particular the MIMAROPA region, the Eastern Visayas region, and the Bicol region over the last week, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in an increasing number of population displacements and damage.The Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD DROMIC) reports, as of 12 February, nearly 11,000 evacuated people - of whom 10,317 in MIMAROPA, 289 in Eastern Visaya, and 338 in Bicol - across 128 evacuation centers, and around 4,700 displaced people across the three affected regions. In addition, the same source reports a total of approximately 164,800 affected people, of whom 63,440 in MIMAROPA, 94,919 across Eastern Visayas, and 6,437 in Bicol.Over the next 96 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over central and western Philippines.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 05 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has continued to affect northern Indonesia since 29 January, causing flooding that has resulted in casualties and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), as of 31 January, three people died due to flooding, two in Sambas regency in West Kalimantan province, and one in Kendal regency in in Central Java province, and more than 41,080 families have been affected by floods, including 26,000 families in South Kalimantan and 12,564 families in West Kalimantan, as the most affected provinces.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over Indonesia, with locally very heavy rainfall over the south-western part of the country.

title: France - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 05 Feb 2025)
description: Widespread floods continue to affect north-western France, particularly the Redon area leading to casualties and an increasing number of evacuated people.According to the Inter-Ministerial Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC), two people have been slightly injured, nearly 1,900 people have been evacuated, and almost 500 houses are without electricity.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated on 29 January to provide the damage assessment.On 31 January, light to moderate rain is expected across northern and north-western France. On 1 February, no rain is forecast. Red warnings for floods are still in effect from 31 January to 1 February across three departments of Brittany and Pays de la Loire region, Ille-et-Vilaine, Loire-Atlantique, Morbihan. The Seiche and Vilaine rivers are particularly interested in the flood risk.

title: Indonesia - Landslide (ECHO 04 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia since 29 January, triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 30 January, according to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), one person died, 45 people have been displaced, 115 people have been affected by a landslide that occured in Tarakan City in northern-eastern North Kalimantan province. In addition, two houses have been destroyed and 22 partially damaged.On 30 and 31 January, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over north-eastern Indonesia.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 04 Feb 2025)
description: In the past few days the Sabah and Sarawak states, located in the Malaysian Borneo, are experiencing heavy rainfall and floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, at least five people died while more than 7,500 people have been evacuated, 5,385 in Sarawak and 2,240 people have been affected in the Sabah state.On 30 and 31 January, moderate to locally very heavy rainfall is forecast across the whole of Malaysian Borneo.

title: France - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 04 Feb 2025)
description: France continues to experience heavy rainfall and strong winds, particularly in the western departments, that caused widespread floods and resulted in an increasing number of evacuations.According to media, more than 1,000 people have been evacuated in Redon city, Ille-et-Vilaine department, Brittany region.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated on 29 January, to provide the damage assessment.On 30 and 31 January localised moderate rainfall is forecast over central, northern, north-western and south-eastern France. Red warnings for floods are still in effect from January 30 to 31 across three departments of Brittany and Pays de la Loire region, Ille-et-Vilaine, Loire-Atlantique, Morbihan.

title: Spain, Portugal, France, Ireland, United Kingdom - Severe weather (ECHO 02 Feb 2025)
description: After the passage of storm Eowyn, another storm named Herminia has been affecting parts of western and north-western Europe with heavy rain and very strong winds, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that are leading to casualties and damage.In Spain, a man died in Ourense, Galicia autonomous community due to a severe weather-related road accident, and more than 13,000 people in Galicia experienced power outages on 27 January.In France, several rivers overflowed, and according to the Inter-Ministerial Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC), more than 200 interventions have been carried out in Ille-et-Vilaine, the worst hit department of Brittany region. 141 firefighters have been deployed. Additionally, media reports evacuated families in the Ille-et-Vilaine department due to floods; the most impacted city is Rennes.In Ireland, after the passage of storm Eowyn, one person died, more than 168,000 people are still without power, and 74,000 others are without water.Following Ireland’s request for assistance to the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), Denmark offered generators and in addition the Emergency Response Coordination Centre (ERCC) mobilised 13 rescEU generators hosted by Poland.For the next 24 hours, moderate to localised heavy rainfall, and strong to very strong winds are forecast over the aforementioned countries of western and north-western Europe.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 02 Feb 2025)
description: Since 13 January, heavy rainfall and strong winds have continued to affect Sri Lanka, causing floods, flash floods and severe weather-related incidents resulting in casualties and damage.According to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports, as of 28 January, four people died, of whom two in Eastern province, one in Uva and one in North Central provinces, three people have been injured in Jaffna district of Northern province, 438 people have been displaced people across 10 evacuation centres, and 92,477 people have been affected across the whole Sri Lanka, including 56,884 in Eastern province, 29,299 in Northern province, and 4,599 in North Central province.On 28-29 January, moderate rainfall is expected over southern Sri Lanka, on 30 January more heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods (ECHO 02 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting southern Indonesia since 25 January, triggering landslides and causing flooding that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), as of 28 January, four fatalities and four injured people have been recorded in Mamuju city, West Sulawesi province, and one more fatality has been recorded in Tasikmalaya regency, in West Java province, due to landslides. A total of 774 falmiles have been affected by floods across West Nusa Tenggara and Lampung provinces.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over Indonesia.

title: Ethiopia - Earthquakes (ECHO 02 Feb 2025)
description: As a result of the increase in seismic activity observed in the Fentale volcanic complex in Ethiopia since December 2024, the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies reports that nearly 99,000 people have been affected across three affected regions: 60,000 in Afar, 20,000 in Oromia and 9,000 in Amhara. According to UN OCHA, approximately 75,000 people have been relocated, and the authorities are working to evacuate the remaining 25,000.The evolution of the seismic activity in the affected areas needs to be carefully followed-up for decision-making to be informed by technical specialised knowledge and recommendations as they come. In Afar, following recommendations by Ethiopian vulcanologists, Internally Displaced People, (IDP) sites that were initially established are now being shifted to areas that are further away from the epicentre.EU humanitarian funding is providing support in the affected areas of Afar, Oromia and Amhara to meet the basic needs of the displaced, through the Rapid Response Mechanism, partners on the ground and the Ethiopian Red Cross Society. The latter has also been supported through EUR 200,000 funding to the Disaster Response Emergency Fund (DREF) of the International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC).

title: Ireland, United Kingdom - Severe weather, update (ECHO 01 Feb 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting Ireland and the northwestern parts of the United Kingdom, since 24 January, causing severe weather-related incidents and flooding, that have resulted in casualties and damage. The severe weather was caused by the passage of the Éowyn on 24 January and the Herminia storms on 26 January.Media reports, as of 27 January, at least two fatalities, one in Lifford town, in  County Donegal in northwest Ireland, and one in East Ayrshire in Scotland State, north-western United Kingdom due to severe weather-related incidents caused by strong winds. In addition, more than 1 million people have been affected by power outages, still, 75,000 are without power in Northern Ireland, at least 26 flights have been cancelled, and several flooding have been reported in the south-western part of England.On 25 January, Ireland requested assistance from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) consisting of generators to cope with power outages.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (- in Ireland,  in the United Kingdom) was activated on 23 January, to provide the damage assessment.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, snow and strong winds are expected mostly across Ireland, and the United Kingdom.

title: Australia - Wildfires (ECHO 01 Feb 2025)
description: Several bushfires have been burning across the south-western part of Western Australia state.Media reports, as of 25 January, 20 evacuated people, and three destroyed houses in the Arthur river area, due to a bushfire that burnt an area of 11,000 ha. Warnings have been issued for Arthur river, Wedgecarrup, Lime Lake, Cartmeticup, Woodanilling, Boyerine and Westwood villages.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is very high over southern Western Australia.

title: France - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 01 Feb 2025)
description: In the past few days, heavy rain and strong winds have been affecting the Brittany region, north-western France, particularly the Ille-et-Vilaine and Finistère departments causing the overflow of some rivers and widespread floods that resulted in evacuations and damage.On 27-28 January, moderate to localized heavy rain with thunderstorms is expected across most parts of France, particularly over north-western France. On the same days, red warnings for floods have been issued across the affected Ille-et-Vilaine department.

title: Brazil - Floods and severe weather in São Paulo City (ECHO 01 Feb 2025)
description: On 24 January, heavy rain affected São Paulo city, south-eastern Brazil, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in damage.According to media, 180,000 people have been affected experiencing power outages while several structures have been damaged or destroyed by severe flooding triggered by the heavy rain.For the next 24 hours, rain showers with scattered thunderstorms are forecast across the affected city.

title: Chile - Wildfires (ECHO 01 Feb 2025)
description: Several wildfires have been affecting Chile, particularly one located close to San Javier de Loncomilla town (Maule region, central Chile) called "Villaboro" which is still under combat and is affecting 500 ha.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), two people have been injured and 500 have been displaced following this event.National authorities are conducting the firefighter operations.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is very high over the affected areas.

title: Ireland, United Kingdom, Norway - Storm Eowyn (ECHO 29 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and destructive winds have been affecting most of Ireland and the northwestern parts of the United Kingdom, resulting in damage and power cuts.According to the MET office, gusts up to 183 km/h have been recorded at Mace Head on the western coast of Ireland while in northern Ireland and northern Wales, the gusts reached up to 114 km/h.Media reports that, as of 24 January, more than 800,000 houses and buildings were without electricity in Ireland, and several flights were suspended and cancelled in Ireland and the United Kingdom. The Department of Transport of Ireland appeals to all the people to "Stay Back, Stay High, and Stay Dry" from all coastal regions during Storm Eowyn.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated on 23 January ( - in Ireland, in the United Kingdom) to provide the damage assessment.For the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, snow and strong winds are still expected mostly across Ireland, and the United Kingdom, but also in Norway and the Netherlands. On 24 January, red warnings for strong winds are in effect in northern, central, western and eastern Ireland, and in the central United Kingdom.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 29 Jan 2025)
description: Since 13 January, heavy rainfall and strong winds have continued to affect northern and eastern Sri Lanka, causing floods, flash floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports, as of 24 January, two fatalities, of whom one in Uva and one in North Central province, three injured people in Jaffna district of Northern province, 820 displaced people across 13 evacuation centres, and 92,382 affected people across Sri Lanka, including 56,878 in Eastern province, 29,299 in Northern province, and 4,599 in North Central province.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over Uva, Sabaragamuwa and Southern provinces.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 29 Jan 2025)
description: Very heavy snowfall and low temperatures continued to affect several state of south-eastern USA, mainly Florida, Alabama, Louisiana, Texas, Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina states, over the last four days, causing several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 24 January, 12 fatalities, of which five in the Zavala county (Texas) due to snow-related incidents, and seven fatalities across the Austin city area (Texas), the Dale County (Alabama), and the Atlanta city area (Georgia) due to very cold conditions. In addition, media also report road interruptions across the affected aforementioned states. The state of emergency declared by the governor of the Atlanta county remains in force.Over the next 24 hours, no more snowfall is forecast over the already affected States, while rainfall is forecast over southern Texas, the whole Arkansas, most of Louisiana, and most of Mississippi starting from 25 January.More than 50,000 people in Los Angeles are under mandatory evacuation orders after the Hughes Fire erupted near Castaic in California.

title: Portugal - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 29 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting northern Portugal (in particular the Norte region) since 21 January, causing floods and a number of strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.In total, between 21 January (00:00) and 24 January (08:00), 849 occurrences were registered associated with the severe weather conditions across the country.Media report, as of 24 January, three light injured people, and two evacuated persons across the area of the Santa Maria da Feira municipality, Aveiro district, Norte region. In addition, some damaged buildings were reported across the Aveiro district, mainly in the aforementioned Santa Maria da Feira municipality, and across the Espargo, and São João de Ver municipalities.More rainfall is forecast over northern Portugal starting from 25 January, while is forecast over the whole country from 26 January.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 29 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting southern Indonesia since 21 January, particularly in  West Nusa Tenggara province, causing flooding that have resulted in displacements and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 24 January, at least 34 people have been internally displaced, 7,632 people and 2,544 houses have been affected by river overflowing in Bima regency, and 200 people and one bridge have been affected in Dompu regency, in eastern West Nusa Tenggara province.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over southern Indonesia.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Jan 2025)
description: Very heavy snowfall and low temperatures have been affecting several states of the south-eastern USA, mainly Florida, Alabama, Louisiana, Texas, and Georgia states, over the last three days, causing several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 23 January, ten fatalities, of which five were in the Zavala County (Texas), two more in the same state across the Austin city area, two in the Dale County (Alabama), and one fatality in the Atlanta city area (Georgia). In addition, media also report approximately 3,800 cancelled flights. The governor of Atlanta county declared a state of emergency.Over the next 24 hours, no more snowfall is forecast over the already affected states, while rainfall is forecast over the Florida peninsula.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Jan 2025)
description: Since the start of 2025, the rainy season has been impacting most parts of Ecuador, causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the National Secretariat for Risk Management (SGR), as of 20 January, two people died, one in Tungurahua and another in Pichincha province, two others have been injured, and 1,339 people have been affected, most of them in Chimborazo and Guayas provinces.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected across most of western Ecuador.

title: Chile - Wildfire (ECHO 28 Jan 2025)
description: A wildfire has been affecting the Los Sauces municipality, Malleco province, Araucanía region, central Chile since 19 January, causing casualties and damage. According to the National System for Disaster Prevention, Mitigation and Attention (SENAPRED), the total burnt area reached nearly 1,100 ha and the wildfire is currently under containment.WHO PAHO and media report, as of 23 January, three fatalities (firefighters), nine injured people, and a number of evacuation orders across the area of the Los Sauces municipality and the neighbouring municipalities of Nahuelbe, Romulhueco, and Ninico.Over the next 72 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from low to moderate across the Araucanía region.

title: Switzerland - Snow avalanches (ECHO 27 Jan 2025)
description: On 18 January, two separated snow avalanches occurred in central and south-western Switzerland resulting in casualties.According to media, one person died in the Obrist Arni region of Giswil municipality, central Switzerland and another in the region of Mauvoisin in the Grand Tavé mountain.For the next 24 hours, light snow and moderate rain is expected over north-eastern Switzerland while light to moderate rainfall is forecast over the rest of the country.

title: Australia - Tropical cyclone SEAN (ECHO 27 Jan 2025)
description: Tropical cyclone SEAN, which formed in the eastern Indian Ocean passed very close to the northern coasts of Western Australia on 19-21 January, bringing heavy rain and strong winds over the northern and north-western coast of the aforementioned state. On 22 January at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea, approximately 700 km west of the western coast of Western Australia, with maximum sustained winds of 83 km/h.According to media, its passage resulted in flooded roads and homes, damage to power infrastructure, and ports closure. The worst-hit city was Karratha which received 274.4 mm in 24 hours.Sean is forecast to move southeastwards and it will weaken and dissipate on 23 January. For the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is expected across northern and south-eastern Western Australia.

title: USA - Wildfires, update (ECHO 27 Jan 2025)
description: National authorities continue to contain the two main fires in Los Angeles county that have been burning 15,270 ha while the humanitarian impact continues to increase.According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency as of 15 January, 27 people died, ten in the Palisades fire (56% contained) and 17 in the Eaton fire (81% contained), while more than 40,500 people are still under mandatory evacuation orders, and thousands of houses and properties have been damaged or destroyed.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme across southern California.

title: Argentina - Wildfire (ECHO 26 Jan 2025)
description: On 15 January a wildfire occurred close to the Epuyén village, Chubut Province, south-western Argentina, burning an area of 1,500 ha and resulting in displacement and damage.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), 1,500 people have been displaced, 25 houses and one school have been destroyed and 200 houses have been affected by the flames.According to (GWIS), over the next 24 hours, the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme over the affected area.

title: Colombia - Volcanic activity (ECHO 26 Jan 2025)
description: On 20 January, the Puracé volcano located in the Cauca Department, south-western Colombia increased its activity. The National Geological Service of Colombia registered intense seismic activity starting on 20 January at 4.06 UTC followed by ash emission in the atmosphere.According to the same source, the dispersion of the ash moved westwards and the ashfall affected the towns of Puracé and Coconuco.The alert level of the volcano stands at Yellow, which means that the volcano is active with changes in the base-level behaviour of monitored parameters and other manifestations.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods, update (ECHO 26 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Indonesia since 19 January, triggering landslides and causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of 21 January, four fatalities, one missing, three injured people, and five damaged houses due to a landslide that occurred on 20 January in Ubung Kaja village, in North Denpasar district of the Denpasar City regency, in southern Bali province.The death toll of the landslide that occurred on 19 January in Klungkung regency, in south Bali province, increased to four, one person is missing and four people have been injured. In addition, in the Bima regency of West Nusa Tenggara, 2,027 families and 2,112 houses in 11 villages have been affected by floods.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most parts of Indonesia.

title: Taiwan - Earthquake (ECHO 26 Jan 2025)
description: An earthquake of 6 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Taiwan on 20 January at 16.17 UTC (21 January at 00.17 local time). The epicentre was located 12 km north of Yujing district, in eastern Tainan City, southern Taiwan. The main earthquake was followed by three aftershocks, ranging between 4.7 M and 5.1 M.USGS PAGER estimated that up to 124,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 1,262,000 people to strong shaking.According to media reports, as of 21 January, at least 27 people have been injured, several buildings have been evacuated, and moderate damage to infrastructures has been recorded in Chiayi and Tainan cities. In addition, school classes have been suspended.

title: Italy - Severe weather  (ECHO 25 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting southern Italy since 17 January, causing severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in displacements and damage.As of 20 January, media reports that at least 15 people have been preventively evacuated in Randazzo municipality, in Catania province of eastern Sicily region, due to the overflow of the Nunziata stream and several structures have been damaged due to strong winds in many areas of Sicily region.On 20-21 January, local rainfall is forecast over Sicily region, and more rainfall is expected over northern and central Italy.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides (ECHO 25 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-eastern Brazil, in particular the Santa Catarina state since 16 January, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 20 January, one fatality in the area of the Praia de Palmas city, coastal Santa Catarina state. In addition, media also report more than 1,000 displaced and over 2,000 rescued people across 27 municipalities throughout the coastal area of the state, where the worst affected are Florianópolis, Balneário Camboriú, Camboriú and Itapema municipalities. National authorities declared the state of emergency for 13 municipalities.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the already affected Santa Catarina state.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather (ECHO 25 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting northern and eastern Sri Lanka since 17 January, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC), as of 20 January, one person died in Hali Ela town of Badulla district, in Uva province, due to a severe weather-related incident, three people have been injured in Jaffna district of Northern province, a total of 239 people have been displaced in eight evacuation centres, and 16,930 people have been affected across Sri Lanka, including 14,806 in Eastern province.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over eastern Sri Lanka.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods (ECHO 25 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several parts of Indonesia since 19 January, triggering landslides and causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of 20 January, three people died, one person is missing, and four people have been injured due to a landslide that occurred on 19 January in Klungkung regency, in southern Bali province. In Riau province, in the eastern part of the Sumatra island, more than 204 have been displaced due to flooding caused by river overflow.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most parts of Indonesia.

title: Mozambique - Tropical cyclone DIKELEDI, update (ECHO 25 Jan 2025)
description: Tropical cyclone DIKELEDI made landfall over the coastal Nampula province, north-eastern Mozambique on the morning of 13 January and passed over the eastern area of the province on 13-14 January. Its passage caused very heavy rainfall resulted in casualties and severe damage.As of 17 January, the National Institute for Disaster Risk Management and Reduction (INGD) reports that tropical cyclone DIKELEDI has left 249,787 affected people (49,407 families), 11 deaths, 47,216 damaged or destroyed houses and 43 health centres and 154 schools damaged.Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of Mozambique, except over the southern area.

title: Albania - Floods (ECHO 22 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-western and central-western Albania, in particular the Vlorë county since 13 January, causing floods that have resulted in affected population and damage.Over the next 24 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: French Southern and Antarctic Lands (France) - Wildfire (ECHO 22 Jan 2025)
description: A wildfire has been burning in northern Amsterdam Island of the French Southern and Antarctic Lands in the southern Indian Ocean since 16 January, resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the Interministerial Operational Center for Crisis Management (COGIC), 31 people have been displaced from the Martin-de-Viviès permanent scientific base in Amsterdam Island. All 31 people are secured.Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping () was activated on 16 January to provide an initial rough estimation of the wildfire extent.According to (GWIS), over the next 24 hours, the fire danger forecast is low over the French Southern and Antarctic Lands.

title: Argentina - Wildfire (ECHO 22 Jan 2025)
description: Since 15 January, a wildfire has been burning in southern Argentina resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the burnt area is approximately 2,934 ha.As of 17 January, IFRC reports that at least 1,500 people have been displaced, another 150 have been affected, 25 houses and one school have been destroyed, and 200 houses have been affected in Epuyén town in Cushamen Department, in the north-western part of the province of Chubut, Patagonia geographical region.According to (GWIS), over the next 24 hours, the fire danger forecast is very high over the affected areas.

title: Madagascar, Mozambique - Tropical cyclone DIKELEDI, update (ECHO 22 Jan 2025)
description: On 16 January, tropical cyclone DIKELEDI continued southeastward over the southern Indian Ocean, well off the coast of southern Madagascar, with maximum sustained winds up to 201 km/h. On 17 January at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the far southern Indian Ocean, approximately 1,250 km south-east of Madagascar, with maximum sustained winds of 127 km/h.In northern Madagascar, UN OCHA reports as of 17 January, three fatalities, more than 7,000 affected people, and over 2,000 damaged or destroyed houses. In central and northern Mozambique, the death toll stands at five. In addition, the National Institute for Disaster Risk Management and Reduction (INGD)  reports around 50,000 affected people, and approximately 11,000 damaged or destroyed houses.DIKELEDI is forecast to continue eastward over the southern Indian Ocean on 17-19 January, further weakening and dissipating on 20 January.Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and southern Madagascar, and central Mozambique.

title: Iceland - Seismic activity (ECHO 21 Jan 2025)
description: A strong seismic swarm is occurring in the northwestern part of the Bardarbunga caldera, central Iceland.On 13-14 January, more than 100 earthquakes were recorded with the highest one of 5.1 M. Moreover, 17 other earthquakes with a magnitude of 3 M or higher were registered, including at least two of 4 M or above.The earthquake activity was intense until 9.00 UTC on 14 January, after that it began to decrease but earthquakes have still been detected in the area.The Icelandic Meteorological Office is monitoring the situation closely and national authorities declare a level of uncertainty due to increased seismic activity in the interested area.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods (ECHO 20 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several parts of Indonesia since 13 January, triggering landslides and causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as 15 January, at least 17 fatalities due to three different landslides, including two in North Sumatra province that caused 14 fatalities and 258 displaced people, and one in Tiban Batu Village of the Batam City, Riau Islands Province, western Indonesia that caused three fatalities, one missing person and five injured people. At least 341 people have been displaced and more than 7,500 people have been affected by floods across Aceh, North Sumatra and Riau provinces.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast for most of western and central Indonesia.

title: Mozambique, Madagascar - Tropical Cyclone  DIKELEDI, update (ECHO 20 Jan 2025)
description: Tropical cyclone DIKELEDI is moving southwards in the Mozambique Channel after it made landfall over northern Nampula province, northeastern Mozambique. On 15 January at 6.00 UTC its centre was located 306 km west of Morombe urban municipality, Atsimo-Andrefana region, with maximum sustained winds of 120 km/h (tropical storm).After its passage on 11 January over northern Madagascar, national authorities report that the death toll stands at three people, 352 people have been displaced and 5,803 affected across Analanjirofo, Diana and Sava regions, northern Madagascar.DIKELEDI is forecast to move south-east strengthening over the sea and it will pass approximately 200 km west of the south-western coast of Madagascar on 15-16 January strengthening. After that, it will continue over the southern Indian Oceanweakening and dissipating in the sea.On 15-17 January, moderate to heavy rain with locally heavy rainfall is expected across most parts of Madagascar and central-eastern Mozambique while strong winds are forecasted particularly over the western and south-western coast of Madagascar.

title: Myanmar - Landslide (ECHO 20 Jan 2025)
description: On 13 January, a landslide occurred in a jade mine pond located in Sa Paut village in Hpakant township, Kachin State, northern Myanmar leading to casualties and damage.According to media, at least 12 people died, many others are unaccounted for and 50 houses have been buried.Rescue and emergency operations have been deployed in the affected area.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the impacted area.

title: Australia - Landslide (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: On 13 January at 21.45 UTC (14 January at 8.45 local time), a landslide occurred in the McCrae suburb of Melbourne, Mornington Peninsula, Victoria State, southern Australia resulting in casualties, evacuations and damage.According to media, following this event one person was injured, a house has been destroyed, and people living in six nearby houses have been evacuated.Local authorities are working to ensure the safety of residents across the impacted area.On 14 January, drier conditions are expected while on 15 January, light rain could interest the Melbourne area.

title: Brazil - Landslides (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: Since 11 January, several landslides have been triggered by heavy rainfall in Minas Gerais state, central-eastern Brazil, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 14 January, media report ten fatalities, including nine in Ipatinga municipality and one in Santana do Paraiso municipality, eastern Minas Gerais state, and one person is missing in Bethania city. In addition, one house has been destroyed and several roads have been affected.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is expected over central Brazil.

title: Japan - Earthquake (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: A 6.8 M earthquake (6.9 M as recorded by the Japan Meteorological Agency - JMA) at a depth of 36 km occurred offshore 10 km east of the eastern coast of Miyazaki prefecture, Kyushu island, southern Japan on 13 January at 12.19 UTC (21.19 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 18 km south-east of Miyazaki city and 45 km north-east of Miyakonojo city.Following this seismic event, a small tsunami has been recorded over the eastern coast of Miyazaki prefecture, one of 20 cm across Miyazakiko and another of 20 cm Nicinanshi Aburatsu as registered by the JMA.US PAGER estimates that up to 407,000 people were exposed to strong shaking.According to media, one person was slightly injured in Kyushu while some trains have been stopped, and a prefecture road has been blocked.

title: Madagascar, Mayotte (France), Comoros, Mozambique - Tropical cyclone DIKELEDI, update (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: On 13 January, tropical cyclone DIKELEDI continued westward over the Mozambique Channel and made landfall south of the Nacala city, northern Nampula province, northeastern Mozambique around 12.00 UTC, with maximum sustained winds up to 158 km/h. On 14 January at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore over the Mozambique Channel, just off the coast of southern Nampula province, with maximum sustained winds of 114 km/h (tropical storm).In northern Madagascar, UN OCHA reports as of 13 January, three fatalities, 352 evacuated people in six temporary sites, 11 destroyed, 370 damaged houses, 69 damaged or destroyed schools, and a total of 5,216 affected people.DIKELEDI is forecast to continue southeastward over the Mozambique Channel on 14-16 January, further strengthening, with maximum sustained winds up to 232 km/h.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the whole Madagascar, and central-northern Mozambique. The same conditions are also forecast over southern Mozambique starting from 15 January.

title: USA - Wildfires, update (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: A number of wildfires continues to burn across southern California (USA) since 7 January, causing severe and widespread damage resulted in an increased number of casualties.According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), as of 12 January, the ongoing active wildfires are currently four across the Los Angeles county, which is the worst  affected, and the neighbouring Ventura, and San Bernadino counties. Palisades, Eaton, Hurst and Kenneth wildfires have burnt so far an area of approximately 16,000 ha and are currently not fully contained.Media reports, as of 13 January, 24 fatalities across the affected counties. FEMA reports nearly 900 evacuated people in eight shelters, 19 evacuated healthcare facilities, and more than 105,000 mandatory evacuation orders. In addition, the state of emergency was declared by the California Government for Los Angeles, and Ventura counties, where the curfew is in force in the evacuation zones.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Peninsular Malaysia since 10 January, causing floods that have resulted in population displacement and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 12 January, 3,844 people have been displaced in 38 evacuation centres, of whom  3,779 people in Johor, 34 in Perak, and 31 in Terengganu states, in southern Peninsular Malaysia.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over southern Peninsular Malaysia.

title: Mozambique -  Tropical Cyclone CHIDO, update (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: On 15 December 2024, tropical cyclone CHIDO brought torrential rainfall exceeding 250 mm in 24 hours and winds up to 120 km/h. According to the National Institute for Disasters’ Management (INGD), as of 24 December,  453,971 people have been affected, with 120 fatalities and 868 injuries, over 102,000 houses completely or partially destroyed along with 250 schools and 52 health centres.Mozambique is simultaneously grappling with compounded challenges of a drought affecting 1.4 million people; ongoing conflict affecting 1.3 million people and a cholera outbreak that has so far affected 302 people and caused 29 deaths.On 9 January, UN OCHA released a multi-sectoral Flash Appeal for tropical cyclone CHIDO targeting 320,000 people amounting to USD 88 million. The most critical needs are Food, WASH and Shelter.With multiple crises to address, the humanitarian response remains severely underfunded as only 13% of the Emergency Drought Appeal and 39% of the 2024 Humanitarian Response Plan have been covered.

title: Madagascar, Mayotte (France), Comoros, Mozambique - Tropical cyclone DIKELEDI, update (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: On 11 January, tropical cyclone DIKELEDI passed over the far northern Madagascar,  on the following day it passed south of Mayotte (France) and Comoros. On 13 January at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore over the Mozambique Channel, approximately 75 km east of the coast of the Nampula province, northeastern Mozambique, with maximum sustained winds of 137 km/h.Media report, as of 13 January, three fatalities, and around 15,200 displaced people across northern Madagascar. In addition, the Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) reports approximately 20,000 evacuated people across Mayotte.DIKELEDI is forecast to pass along the coast of the Nampula province on 13 January, with maximum sustained winds up to 155 km/h. After that, it is expected to continue moving southward over the Mozambique Channel on 14-15 January, further strengthening.Over the next 96 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over most of Madagascar. The same conditions are also forecast over the next 48 hours for Mayotte, Comoros, and the central-northern coast of Mozambique.

title: Ethiopia - Seismic and volcanic activity, update (ECHO 17 Jan 2025)
description: The intense seismic activity that has been affecting the southern Afar and northern Oromia regions, near the Fentale and the Dofan volcanoes in the Main Ethiopian Rift, continues.About 50 earthquakes of magnitude 4.2 to 5.8 have been recorded between 4 and 10 January 2025; the most recent one, of 5.2 M, was reported on 11 January at 00:19 UTC (03:19 local time) at a depth of 10 km, approximately 160 km north-eastern of Addis Ababa.According to UN OCHA, as of 11 January, at least two people have been injured by the seismic activity, more than 60,000 people have been evacuated, including 51,456 registered and partially evacuated in Afar and 20,325 in Oromia, and emergency shelters have been set up. Significant damage has also been recorded, with 16 schools severely damaged, and 21 partially.On 10 January, UNEP/OCHA Joint Environment Unit requested assistance via the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) for expertise in civil engineering and geology, supporting the situational assessment and the overall response for managing the consequences of the volcanic and seismic activities.Two ECHO-supported Rapid Response Mechanism partners are preparing to respond in Afar.

title: Haiti - Torrential rains caused death and displacement in North-western Haiti (ECHO 05 Jan 2025)
description: Since December 20, torrential rains have caused flooding, affecting the departments of Grand'Anse, Nippes and North-West. Local authorities reported on December 29th a provisional toll of thirteen deaths, fifteen wounded, one missing person and several hundred of houses damaged.The priority needs reported are temporary shelter, food, access to clean water and medical care. In support of the response launched by the Haitian civil protection and local authorities, ECHO partners are providing hot meals to the most vulnerable displaced people in the city of Port-de-Paix.Since November, more than 40 000 families (around 200 000 people) have been affected by floods.

title: Ethiopia - Drought and Conflict (ECHO 04 Jan 2025)
description: The combination of drought and conflict has deteriorated the humanitarian situation in Bugna and Lasta districts, North Wollo, Amhara region, affecting 77,000 people, including 10,000 displaced.Access restrictions imposed by local militia prevent population’s access to services. Telecommunications and the banking system are unfunctional. No Government structure has been present for 3 months.Low crop production, high food prices, and lack of humanitarian and social protection support, have increased acute food insecurity. Around 79% of pregnant and lactating women and 70% of children under are acutely malnourished, 9.2% severely. The provision of nutrition supplies has been interrupted for one year.5,747 malaria cases have been reported, with scabies also affecting the area. There is no operational ambulance. 77% of people have no access to water. Only 35% of the primary scholar-aged children are regularly attending school.WFP and ERCS started in-kind food distributions. The new ECHO-funded Rapid Response Mechanism has been triggered to provide immediate nutrition, water, and sanitation support.

title: CHIDO-25 - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR781] Tropical Cyclone CHIDO in Mozambique

title: Australia - Floods (ECHO 25 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern Australia since 17 December, causing flooding, that has resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 20 December, one person has been injured and two persons have been rescued in the Maranoa region of southern Queensland state, eastern Australia due to floods. In addition, more than 300 buildings have been affected by power cuts in the area and several roads, including one major highway, have been closed.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is expected over the eastern part of Queensland state, and several flood warning have been issued.

title: Colombia - Landslide (ECHO 25 Dec 2024)
description: A large landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in the morning of 17 December between Santa Bárbara de Iscuandé and the bordering Policarpa municipality, in the north-eastern Nariño department, in western Colombia, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 19 December, media reports two fatalities and three injured people, of whom one was seriously injured, due to a mudslide that hit one main road. In addition, several houses have been affected.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is expected over western Colombia.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 25 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern and central Indonesia since 17 December, triggering landslides and causing floods that have resulted in population displacement and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as 20 December, nearly 110 evacuated people in four evacuation centres, and more than 30 damaged houses across the Makassar regency , South Sulawesi province. In addition, ADINet also reports more than 6,800 affected people, and over 1,700 damaged houses in the Dompu regency, West Nusa Tenggara province. Moreover, approximately 950 affected people, and over 300 damaged houses were reported in the Jayapura regency, Papua province.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of eastern and central Indonesia.

title: Mozambique, Mayotte, Malawi, Madagascar, Comoros - Tropical cyclone CHIDO, update (ECHO 25 Dec 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone CHIDO passed over northern Madagascar on 13 December, over Mayotte, and Comoros on 14 December, and over northern Mozambique and southern Malawi over 15-17 December caused very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges that resulted in an increased number of casualties and severe damage.In Mozambique, media report as of 20 December, 73 fatalities, and 543 injured people. In addition, WFP also reports approximately 184,000 affected people, more than 2,250 destroyed and nearly 40,000 damaged houses across the provinces of Cabo Delgado, Nampula, Niassa and Tete.In Mayotte, as of 19 December, the death toll stands at 31 fatalities, and around 2,000 injured people.  ACTED reports over 7,800 destroyed or damaged houses. In northern Madagascar, WFP reports as of 20 December, around 19,000 affected people. In Malawi, media report 13 fatalities, 29 injured people, 227 displaced people, and over 44,162  affected people.Following France’s request for assistance for the island of Mayotte to the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), Germany, Sweden, Belgium and Italy offered various shelter items (tents, blankets, sleeping beds, hygiene kits).The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode for Mayotte () with 25 maps produced and for Mozambique () with 14 published maps so far.Over the next 72 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over most of the already affected countries.

title: M7.3 in Vanuatu - UNITAR-UNOSAT Activation
description: UNITAR-UNOSAT Potentially Damaged Buildings has been activated

title: Romania - Snowstorm (ECHO 24 Dec 2024)
description: On 15 December, a snowstorm affected the Leaota Peak area of the Carpathian Mountains, in central Romania, causing casualties.According to media reports, as of 16 December, one person died, and 22 people have been affected by severe weather in the Dâmbovita county area.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast over the affected areas.

title: Australia - Wildfires (ECHO 24 Dec 2024)
description: Several bushfires have been affecting the Grampians National Park area, in the Grampians region of western Victoria state, in southern Australia over the last 24 hours, causing evacuations and damage. The bushfire is currently not contained.As of 18 December, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the most extensive bushfire burnt an area of 8,178 ha.Media reports, as of 19 December, evacuation orders are in place for residents in Big Cord, Grampians, Mirranatwa, and Jimmy Creek villages and an evacuation centre has been set up at Dunkfield, in the western Grampians region.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast remains high to extreme in the already affected area.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods (ECHO 24 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central and western Indonesia, in particular the Java island, and the Sumatra island since 13 December, triggering a landslide and causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports as 19 December, one fatality, one injured, two displaced people, three damaged houses, and a total of 14 affected people in the Temanggung regency (Central Java province) due to a landslide occurred on 17 December. In addition, BNPB also reports 93 evacuated families, and more than 4,350 affected families across the Indramayu regency (West Java province), due to floods. Moreover, BNPB reports ten injured people, 250 evacuated families, and nearly 500 affected families in the South Tapanuli regency (North Sumatra province) due to flash floods.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the already affected Java island, and Sumatra island.

title: Mozambique, Mayotte, Malawi, Comoros - Tropical cyclone CHIDO, update (ECHO 24 Dec 2024)
description: The passage of the tropical cyclone CHIDO  over Mayotte and Comoros on 14 December, and over northern Mozambique and southern Malawi over 15-17 December caused very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges resulted in an increased number of casualties and widespread damage. The humanitarian impact could still increase.In Mozambique, WHO and UNICEF report, as of 18 December, 45 fatalities, 493 injured people, several displaced people, approximately 181,000 affected people, and according to media around 35,000 destroyed houses across the provinces of Cabo Delgado, Nampula, Niassa and Tete.In Mayotte, media report, as of the same date, 31 fatalities, and around 2, 000 injured people. DG ECHO also reports, approximately 100,000 displaced people. In Malawi, 13 fatalities, 29 injured people, 227 displaced people, and over 45,000 affected people have been reported. Furthermore in Comoros, DG ECHO reports, as of 17 December, five injured people, 140 displaced and over 64,150 affected people.France made a request for assistance through the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) consisting of various shelter items. Several Member States expressed willingness to contribute and are in the course of finalising offers of assistance.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode for Mayotte () with 25 maps produced and for Mozambique () with 5 published maps so far.

title: M7.3 in Vanuatu - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR782] Earthquake in Vanuatu

title: Canada - Landslide (ECHO 23 Dec 2024)
description: On 14 December, a landslide hit the Sky Highway in northern Lions Bay municipality, of British Columbia Province in western Canada, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 18 December, media reports one fatality and one missing person, the highway that has been hit has been closed, and one house has been damaged.The search operations for the missing person are still ongoing and a state of emergency has been declared.On 18-19 December, showers are expected over the British Columbia Province.

title: Thailand - Floods, update (ECHO 23 Dec 2024)
description: Thailand continues to experience heavy rainfall causing floods and resulting in damage.According to media, in recent days, 128,000 families living in almost 2,000 villages in Chumphon, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Phatthalung, Ranong, and Surat Thani provinces have been affected by floods. In this rainy season, widespread floods resulted in 35 fatalities and more than 737,000 affected people across 11 provinces of Thailand.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is still expected across southern Thailand.

title: Vanuatu - Earthquake (ECHO 23 Dec 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact is increasing after the earthquake of 7.3 M occurred on 17 December in the sea, 30 km east of Port-Vila the capital city, in Shefa province, in central Vanuatu.According to UNICEF, as of 18 December, at least 14 people died, mainly from landslides triggered by the earthquake or collapsed buildings, more than 200 people have been injured, and an undefined number of people are still missing. Approximately 80,000 people have been affected and the main hospital has been damaged. Water and telecommunications have not yet been restored, and there are power cuts and widespread damage have been recorded to buildings and roads. In addition, several landslides are blocking roads to the Port-Vila airport and to the international seaport, which is closed.National authorities are conducting search and rescue operations.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 17 December to provide the damage assessment.

title: Mozambique, Malawi, Madagascar, Mayotte, Comoros - Tropical cyclone CHIDO, update (ECHO 23 Dec 2024)
description: The passage of tropical cyclone CHIDO between 13 and 17 December, also affected Malawi resulting in casualties while the humanitarian impact in Mayotte and Comoros continues to increase.According to media, in Malawi seven people died (three in Salima and one respectively in Kasungu, Machinga, Blantyre and Lilongwe districts Kasungu, Machinga, Blantyre and Lilongwe districts), 16 people have been injured and 34,741 people have been affected. In Mayotte, 22 people died. Furthermore, in Comoros, 64,000 people have been affected and the death toll in Mozambiques stands at 34 people.From 18 to 19 December, light to moderate rain is expected in Comoros, Mayotte, and northeastern Mozambique. Moderate to very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of Zimbabwe.On 17 December, France requested assistance from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) for the island of Mayotte in the form of family tents and shelter kits.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode for Mayotte () with 17 maps produced and for Mozambique () with 3 published maps so far.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 22 Dec 2024)
description: Since 14 December, heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting southern Brazil, particularly Rio Grande do Sul state, causing severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 17 December, according to media reports, two people have been injured and several buildings were damaged in Butiá municipality, in the central-eastern part of Rio Grande do Sul, due to a severe weather-related incidents. In addition, at least 230,000 power outages were reported in several areas, including in Camaquã and Pelotas municipalities.Over the next 48 hours, isolated showers are forecast for the eastern part of Rio Grande do Sul state.

title: Iraq, Iran - Dust storm (ECHO 22 Dec 2024)
description: Very strong winds have been affecting northern and central Iraq, in particular the Saladin, and the Baghdad governorates and the neighbouring Iran over the past few days, causing a severe dust storm that has resulted in casualties.Media report, as of 17 December, at least 65 injured people across the Saladin, and the Baghdad governorates, where the most affected area is the Balad district, Saladin governorate, just north of the capital city Baghdad.Over the next 96 hours, no strong winds are forecast over both of the already affected countries.

title: Pakistan - Landslide (ECHO 22 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting north-eastern Pakistan, particularly the Gilgit-Baltistan region since 15 December, triggering a huge landslide that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 17 December, five fatalities in the area of the Rondo Malupa village, Skardu district, central Gilgit-Baltistan region due to a landslide event occurred on 15 December.Over the next 96 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Vanuatu - Earthquakes and tsunami (ECHO 22 Dec 2024)
description: An earthquake of 7.3 M at a depth of 57 km occurred in the sea area east of the island of Efate, central Vanuatu on 17 December at 01.47 UTC (12.47 local time). The epicentre was approximately 30 km east of Port-Vila city, the capital of Vanuatu, in Shefa province on Efate island.The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center issued a tsunami threat, a maximum tsunami height of 0.25 m was observed south-west of Port Vila city. The tsunami threat was later cancelled.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 65,000 people were exposed to severe shaking and 27,000 to very strong shaking. The earthquake is expected to have high humanitarian impact based on the magnitude, the affected population and their vulnerability.According to media reports, one person died and several buildings have been damaged, including buildings hosting foreign missions and embassies, several landslides have been triggered by the earthquake blocking some roads.National authorities are conducting the damage assessment.

title: Mozambique, Madagascar, Mayotte, Comoros - Tropical cyclone CHIDO, update (ECHO 22 Dec 2024)
description: On 16 December, tropical cyclone CHIDO continued southwestward inland over the Nassa, the Tete, and the Manica provinces, northern Mozambique and over the neighbouring southern Malawi, as a tropical storm, weakening. After that, it dissipated on 17 December (UTC), in the area north of the Harare city, the capital of Zimbabwe.Its passage over northern Madagascar, Mayotte (France), Comoros and northern Mozambique over 13-16 December caused very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges resulted in an increased number of casualties and widespread damage. The humanitarian impact could increase.In Mozambique, INGD reports as of 17 December, 34 fatalities, 319 injured people, more than 174,500 affected people, around 23,600 destroyed and 11,750 damaged houses. In Mayotte, IFRC reports, as of the same date, 21 fatalities, 1,418 injured people, around 100,000 evacuated people and over 7,800 destroyed and damaged houses.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the Tete, and the Manica provinces, northern Mozambique and over the whole Zimbabwe.

title: Flood in Malaysia - UNITAR-UNOSAT Activation
description: UNITAR-UNOSAT Potentially Damaged Buildings has been activated

title: CHIDO-25 - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR780] Tropical Cyclone CHIDO in Mayotte, France

title: Italy - Snow avalanche (ECHO 21 Dec 2024)
description: On 15 December, a snow avalanche occurred in Valtournenche municipality, in the Valle d'Aosta region, in north-western Italy, bordering southern Switzerland, and involved some people.According to media reports, as of 16 December, one person has been injured and at least seven people have been affected by a snow avalanche that occurred at 14.30 UTC on Grandes Mourailles Mountains.On 16 December moderate avalanche danger forecast has been confirmed for the northern and western Valle d'Aosta region, and sunny conditions are expected on 16-17 December.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Dec 2024)
description: On 14 December, snowstorms, ice storms, and strong winds affected the western and central United States, causing casualties and widespread damage.According to media reports, as of 15 December, one person died in Arlington village in Washington County, in Nebraska State due to a severe weather-related incident, five people have been injured and several buildings have been damaged in Scotts Valley city of the Santa Cruz County, central-western California State, due to strong winds mainly due to a tornado.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over northern California, and snowfalls are predicted over north-western Nebraska.

title: Mayotte, Comoros, Mozambique - Tropical cyclone CHIDO, update (ECHO 21 Dec 2024)
description: Following the activity of tropical cyclone CHIDO that crossed Mayotte island on 14 December and made landfall approximately 30 km south of Pemba city, Capo Delgado province, north-eastern Mozambique, on 15 December, the humanitarian impact is increasing. On 16 December at 6.00 UTC, the centre of the cyclone is located in southern Malawi with maximum sustained winds of 74 km/h (tropical storm).According to the Inter-ministerial Crisis Management Operational Center (COGIC) and media, in Mayotte 19 people died, more than 830 have been injured (24 seriously injured), 100,000 have been sheltered in 70 emergency centres and 15,000 others experienced power outages. In Comoros, minor damage to crops has been recorded while in Mozambique the amount of damage is under evaluation. The National Institute for Disaster Risk Reduction and Management of Mozambique (INGD) reports that the districts that are the worst affected are Mecufi (Capo Delgado province) and Memba (Nampula province).On 16-17 December, CHIDO is forecast to weaken as a tropical depression, it will cross southern Malawi and north-western Mozambique and dissipate over north-eastern Zimbabwe. For the next 24 hours, heavy to very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of northern Mozambique, southern Malawi and north-eastern Zimbabwe.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode for Mayotte ( and for Mozambique ().

title: Mayotte, Mozambique - Tropical cyclone CHIDO, update  (ECHO 20 Dec 2024)
description: Tropical Cyclone CHIDO hit Mayotte on December 14 with winds exceeding 220 km/h, causing damage described as catastrophic by local authorities including disruptions to electricity, water, and communications, while key infrastructure like hospitals, the airport, and roads were severely affected. The peak of the phenomenon occurred at 9.00 AM (local time), accompanied by heavy rainfall and destructive swells.At least 10 people are estimated to have died, with 9 critically injured and 246 seriously injured. French authorities warn that the death toll is provisional and likely to rise, with a full assessment expected to take several days.French Civil Security teams, including over 100 personnel with three tons of equipment, were pre-positioned on 13 December. Additional reinforcements and specialized teams, including 140 personnel with medical teams, are scheduled to deploy on 15 December.The focus is on setting up advanced medical posts, clearing debris, reopening critical routes, and restoring emergency communications.Tropical Cyclone CHIDO made landfall in Mozambique on 15 December at 6.15 CAT in the Cabo Delgado province with strong gusts of 220 km/h and is expected to weaken significantly.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode (and ).

title: Mozambique - Severe weather (ECHO 04 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds affected north-eastern Mozambique, in particular the Nampula province on 25-26 November, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and severe damage.IOM reports, as of 28 November, two injured people, a total of more than 600 affected people, over 100 destroyed shelters and 61 damaged shelters across the Corrane refugee site, Meconta district, central Nampula province.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the Nampula province, while heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the province starting as of 30 November for 48 hours.

title: Malaysia, Thailand - Severe weather, update (ECHO 04 Dec 2024)
description: The Northeast Monsoon (MTL), continues to bring very heavy rainfall between Peninsular Malaysia and southern Thailand, causing floods and flash floods that resulted in casualties and damage.In Malaysia, the ASEAN Coordinating Centre for Humanitarian Assistance (AHA Centre) reports four fatalities, and 52,360 displaced people in 385 evacuation centres. The hit states are Johor, Kedah, Kelantan, Perak, Perlis, Sarawak, and Terengganu and most of the displaced people are located in Kelantan and Terengganu.In Thailand, a total of 136,219 households have been affected in Satun, Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Songkhla, Pattani, Narathiwat, and Yala provinces.National authorities of both countries are providing help for those affected.For the next 48 hours, heavy to very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the impacted areas of southern Thailand and Peninsular Malaysia.

title: Republic of Korea - Severe weather (ECHO 04 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy snowfall has been affecting northern Republic of Korea, in particular the Seoul capital city area, the Gyeonggi province and the Gangwon province over 27-28 November, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties.Media report, as of 29 November, five fatalities across the Seoul capital city area, and the Gyeonggi province. In addition, media also report 11 injured people in the Wonju city, Gangwon province.Over the next 24 hours, moderate snowfall is still forecast over parts of the already affected provinces and the Seoul area.

title: Uganda - Severe weather (ECHO 04 Dec 2024)
description: Following heavy rains on 27 November, the Bulambuli district in the Mount Elgon subregion has been severely affected by flooding and landslides. The roads have been cut-off by flood waters, including the main road from Sironko town to Kapchowa town, a bridge swept away and the River Simu has burst its banks.The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) indicates that 125 people are unaccounted for, and at least 15 people have been killed by landslide. Death toll may increase further. At least 22 people have been injured and are receiving medical attention in a local health centre. Local authorities have indicated that the majority of killed and injured people are children. Close to 1,000 people have been displaced.Impassable roads continue preventing rescue vehicles to reach the worst affected areas.More rain is forecasted over the country on 29 and 30 November.DG ECHO partner Oxfam is responding to the disaster through a consortium with the Uganda Red Cross and Caritas Tororo.

title: Flood in Spain - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR773] Flood in Valencia Region, Spain

title: South Africa - Severe weather (ECHO 03 Dec 2024)
description: Since 27 November, heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting Gauteng and Mpumalanga provinces in eastern part of South Africa, causing severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.As of 28 November, according to media reports, one person died due to a severe weather-related incident in Eldorado Park, in the city of Johannesburg in central Gauteng province, and dozens of people have been injured across Randfontein town in Gauteng province and Middelburg town in Mpumalanga province. Thousands of people have been displaced across the two affected provinces and hundreds of houses have been damaged.Light rain is expected on 28-29 November over the eastern coasts of South Africa, and drier conditions are forecast on 30 November over the whole country.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather, update (ECHO 03 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting northern Sri Lanka since 23 November, causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 28 November, eight people died, including four in Karaitivu town, Eastern province, nine have been injured, four people are missing, and five people have been rescued. More than 276,000 have been displaced across 165 relief centres. In addition, more than 600 houses were destroyed.Over the next 24 hours, thundershowers and strong winds are forecast over northern and north-central provinces.

title: Malaysia - Severe weather (ECHO 03 Dec 2024)
description: Since early November, Malaysia has been experiencing heavy rainfall and consequent floods brought by the Northeast Monsoon (MTL) leading to casualties and damage.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), as of 28 November, one person died in Kelantan, a total of 31,798 individuals have been affected across the states of Kelantan, Terengganu, Kedah, Perlis, Johor, and Perak (Peninsular Malaysia). Moreover, 296 temporary evacuation centres have been established to accommodate those impacted.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across most of Malaysia, affecting both the peninsula, particularly the north-eastern states and Borneo.

title: Bolivia - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 02 Dec 2024)
description: Following the heavy rainfall that affected western Bolivia on 23-24 November and caused floods, rivers overflow and a landslide, the number of casualties has increased.Media reports, as of 27 November, two fatalities, 26 injured people, more than 30 displaced people, a number of rescued people and around 70 damaged houses due to the overflow of the Pasajahuira river and due to a landslide event occurred in the area of the La Paz capital city.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over western Bolivia, including the already affected La Paz capital city area.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Landslide, update (ECHO 02 Dec 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact of the landslide that occurred in Nkubi village of the Kalehe territory, in South Kivu province, in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo on 22 November, which resulted in casualties and damage, is increasing.As of 27 November, media reports 11 fatalities and three injured people. In addition, at least seven houses have been destroyed and 31 have been damaged.Search and rescue operations are still ongoing.On 27-28 November, more rainfall is expected over most of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, with locally heavy rainfall over the western part of the country.

title: Japan - Earthquake (ECHO 02 Dec 2024)
description: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 M at a depth of 10 km occurred on 26 November at 13:47 UTC (22:47 local time) in the sea at approximately 30 km west of the Noto Peninsula coasts, Honshu Island, central Japan. The epicentre was located approximately 42 km west-north-west of Hakui city, in the Ishikawa prefecture.At least three aftershocks up to 4.9 M hit the same area on 26 November.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 23,000 people were exposed to strong and 1,1 million to moderate shaking.According to media, as of 17 November, one person has been injured in the Tsubata town in Kahoku District, in central Ishikawa prefecture, and train disruptions have been reported between Toyama and Kanazawa.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather (ECHO 02 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting most of Sri Lanka since 23 November, causing floods, landslides and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage. The affected provinces are Northern, Uva, North-Western, Sabaragamuwa, and Southern.Media report, as of 27 November, one fatality and one injured people in the Bandarawela town, Badulla district, Uva province due to the collapse of a wall. In addition, media also report approximately nearly 16,000 affected people across all the aforementioned affected provinces, where the worst affcted area is the Jaffna district, Northern province.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the country.

title: Tanzania - Floods (ECHO 02 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Tanzania, in particular the Mara region, bordering with southern Kenya over the past few days, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The IFRC reports, as of 27 November, nine fatalities, 40 injured people and a total of approximately 100 affected people across the Tarime district, northern Mara region. In addition, the same source reports a number of displaced families and four severely damaged houses across the affected area.Over the next 96 hours, more rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole already affected Mara region.

title: Iceland - Volcanic eruption, update (ECHO 01 Dec 2024)
description: The volcanic activity between Stóra-Skógfell and Sýlingarfell, Reykjanes Peninsula continues. The lava flow moving westward has slowed and cooled on the surface but may still continue to flow beneath this solidified crust, toward the protective barriers near Svartsengi and the Blue Lagoon.Fairly high concentrations of gas pollution have been recorded, and westerly and southwesterly winds are expected on 26 November.A new hazard map has been issued on 25 November that will be valid until the 27 of November.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 01 Dec 2024)
description: The heavy rainfall and strong winds brought by storm "Bert" have also affected 9 departments located in east and south-east France resulting in casualties and damage.According to the Interministerial Crisis Management Operations Centre (COGIC), seven people have been slightly injured in severe weather-related incidents. In addition, a total of 22,400 houses experienced power outages.On 26-27 November, light to locally moderate rain is forecast over parts of northern and central France.

title: Bolivia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 01 Dec 2024)
description: On 23-24 November, western Bolivia experienced heavy rainfall, particularly in the La Paz capital city area, that caused floods, the overflow of rivers and triggering a landslide that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 26 November, one person is missing and more than 30 people have been displaced due to the overflow of the Pasajahuira river that affected the neighbourhood of Bajo Llojeta on the outskirts of La Paz capital city. In addition, 26 people have been injured and over 20 houses damaged.Moreover, approximately 40 houses were reported damaged due to a landslide occurred on 24 November across the same area.Over the next 96 hours, more rainfall is forecast over western Bolivia, including the already affected La Paz capital city area.

title: Colombia - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 01 Dec 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting central, northern and western Colombia, in particular the Chocó, and the La Guajir departments since mid-October, causing floods, a number of severe weather-related incidents and triggering landslides that have resulted in population displacement and damage.UN OCHA reports, as of 25 November, around 28,500 displaced people and a total of approximately 383,300 affected people across 36 municipalities of the aforementioned affected departments. In addition, 105 damaged schools have been damaged in the Chocó, and the La Guajir departments.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and flash floods, update (ECHO 01 Dec 2024)
description: The death toll increased following the landslides and flash floods event that affected North Sumatra province in the past few days.According to national authorities and media, 20 people died across four districts, Karo, South Tapanuli, Padang Lawas and Deli Serdang. Most of the casualties have been recorded in Karo district where ten people died, and two houses and one mosque have been heavily damaged due to landslide events.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally very heavy rainfall is expected across the hit province.

title: United Kingdom, Ireland - Severe Weather and floods (ECHO 30 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been hitting several counties of the UK and parts of Ireland since 22 November causing severe weather-related incidents, the overflow of some rivers and floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, in the UK, at least five people died across the countries of England and Wales. Moreover, thousands of houses experienced power outages, and flights and train services have been delayed and cancelled. Furthermore, the Taff river overflowed in Pontypridd town (Wales), flooding homes, and resulting in business closures.In Ireland, over 60,000 households, farms, and businesses were without power on 22-23 November.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rainfall is expected over north, west and southwest Ireland while similar weather conditions are forecasted across the northern and western areas of the UK.

title: United States - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 30 Nov 2024)
