description: Since 19 November, heavy rainfall and strong winds caused by atmospheric rivers have been affecting the western part of the United States, causing casualties and widespread damage.According to media reports, as of 25 November, at least four people died, of whom two in western Washington State due to severe weather-related incidents, and two in Sonoma County, in northern California, due to flooding. In addition, more than 1 million people have been affected by power outages, two major highways were blocked and approximately 20 landslides were recorded.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the western United States.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Landslide (ECHO 30 Nov 2024)
description: On 22 November, a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in Kalehe territory in South Kivu province, in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 25 November, media reports at least ten fatalities, three injured people including eight children, seven houses destroyed and 31 damaged.On 25-26 November, more heavy rainfall is expected over most parts of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: Indonesia - Flash floods and landslides (ECHO 30 Nov 2024)
description: Since 23 November, heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Sumatra island, triggering landslides and flash floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to national authorities and media, at least 16 people died, most due to a landslide in North Sumatra province where four people died and a flash flood event in the same province that resulted in four fatalities and two missing people. Moreover, a total of six people are missing, several have been injured and hundreds of houses have been damaged.For the next 48 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over most of Sumatra island.

title: SARA-24 - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR777] Tropical Storm Sara in Belize

title: SARA-24 - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR778] Tropical Storm Sara in Honduras

title: Iceland - Volcanic eruption, update (ECHO 27 Nov 2024)
description: The eruptive activity that began on the Sundhnúkur fissure swarm (Reykjanes Peninsula) between Stóra-Skógfell and Sýlingarfell on 20 November is still continuing.According to the Icelandic Meteorological Office (IMO), as of 21 November, the lava is flowing westwards at a rate higher than 100 m/h hour, and the lava field is extending further west than any previous flow. It has reached the Blue Lagoon's car parking lot and the hot water pipeline, which is still operational, as well as the Svartsengi power station which is running on back up power. The lava has crossed the Grindavíkurvegur road which is impassable.According to media reports, at least 200 tourists have been evacuated in the Blue Lagoon area, and around 60 houses in Grindavík. In addition, a number of roads have been closed.Seismic activity and deformation is currently minimal.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Nov 2024)
description: Strong winds, heavy snowfall and low temperatures have been affecting most of the France, in particular Brittany, Aquitaine, Pays de la Loire, Normandy, and Ile-de-France regions, Corsica, over the last 24 hours, causing several severe weather-related incidents mainly due to the strong wind that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) and media report, as of 22 November, 247 injured people, of which 15 seriously injured, across the affected regions. In addition, media also reports several closed roads and a number of major delays in the Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle international airport.Over the next 24 hours, more snowfall is forecast over north-eastern and central-eastern France, while more strong winds are forecast over northern and southern regions, in particular across the south-western regions.

title: Finland - Severe weather  (ECHO 27 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy snowfalls and strong winds have been affecting southern and western Finland since 20 November, causing casualties and widespread damage.According to media reports, as of 21 November, one person died in Laukaa city in the Central Finland region, and nine people have been injured in Porvoo city, in the Uusimaa region of southern Finland, due to severe weather-related traffic accidents.In addition, one building has been damaged, more than 100,000 people have been affected by power outages, and 17 flights have been cancelled at the Helsinki city airport.On 22 November, more snow is still forecast across the whole country, drier conditions are expected on 23 November.

title: Philippines - Tropical cyclone MAN-YI, USAGI and TORAJI, update (ECHO 27 Nov 2024)
description: The passage over central-northern and far northern Luzon island, northern Philippines of tropical cyclones MAN-YI on 16-17 November, USAGI on 14 November, and TORAJI on 11 November as typhoons, caused very heavy rainfall, floods and landslides that have resulted in an increased number of casualties.NDRRMC reports, as of 22 November, 12 fatalities, three persons missing, 14 injured people, nearly 361,400 evacuated people, of which approximately 244,500 in 1,913 evacuation centres, and a total of nearly 3,967,000 affected people across the affected area, due to the combined effects of the three typhoons.Over the next 48 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over the northern and eastern Luzon island.

title: Mauritius, Réunion - Tropical cyclone BHEKI, update (ECHO 27 Nov 2024)
description: On 21 November, tropical cyclone BHEKI continued southwest over the southern Indian Ocean passing very close to Mauritius main island and Réunion, with maximum sustained winds up to 74 km/h (tropical storm). On 22 November at 0.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 105 km south-west of Reunion, with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h.BHEKI is forecast to continue southwest on 22-23 November as a tropical storm, far from the coast of Reunion, further weakening. It is expected to became a tropical depression and to dissipate over the Ocean on 24 November.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over Mauritius, while moderate rainfall is forecast over Réunion over the next 72 hours.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Floods, update (ECHO 25 Nov 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact of the flooding that has been affecting the Ituri province, in the north-eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, since the beginning of November is still increasing.According to UN OCHA, as of 19 November, at least 55,000 people have been affected in Djugu, Mahagi and Irumu territories in the Ituri province, due to the rising water level of Lake Albert. In addition, several buildings and roads have been damaged.Heavy rains and inadequate waste management have also resulted in large volumes of plastic waste flowing from the mountainous terrain into Lake Kivu, where it accumulates and clogs the Ruzizi hydroelectric dam, causing power outages in Bukavu and surrounding areas in South Kivu province.For the next 48 hours, more rainfall is expected over most of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: Mauritius, Réunion - Tropical cyclone BHEKI, update (ECHO 25 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone BHEKI passed north of Rodrigues island on 19-20 November and continued west-southwest weakiening over the southern Indian Ocean towards Mauritius. On 20 November at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 477 km north-east of Mauritius and 710 km north-east of Réunion, France, with maximum sustained winds of 75 km/h.BHEKI is forecast to continue southwest still weakening on 20-21 November. It is expected to pass south of Mauritius on 20 November very early in the morning (UTC), and south of Réunion on 21 November with maximum sustained winds up to 75 km/h.Over the next 48 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over Mauritius, including the Rodrigues island and Réunion.

title: Türkiye - Landslide (ECHO 25 Nov 2024)
description: A landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in Çayeli district of the Rize province in north-eastern Türkiye on 19 November in the morning, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 20 November, media reports one fatality and four injured people, 91 people have been displaced and one building has been damaged.On 20 November, more rainfall is expected over northern and eastern Türkiye, drier conditions are expected on 21 November.

title: Indonesia - Landslide (ECHO 25 Nov 2024)
description: On 19 November at 7.00 UTC, a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in Purworejo regency, in southern Central Java province, in central Indonesia, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 20 November, the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports three fatalities, one missing person and several evacuated people in Peniron hamlet, Plipiran village, in Bruno District of the Purworejo regency.Search and rescue operations are still ongoing.On 20 and 21 November, more heavy rainfall is expected over central and western Java Island.

title: USA - Wildfire (ECHO 24 Nov 2024)
description: A wildfire has been burning across the border area between the New Jersey and the New York states, north-eastern USA since 16 November, prompting evacuations and causing damage. The wildfire has burnt so far an area of nearly 3,050 ha - of which over 2,000 ha across the New York state and nearly 1,000 ha in the New Jersey state - and it is currently under containment.Media report, as of 19 November, several evacuated people across the Greenwood Lake village, and the Warwick town, Orange county, New York state.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to high across the border area between the New Jersey and the New York states.

title: Central America - Tropical storm SARA, update (ECHO 24 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical Storm SARA dissipated over the southern Gulf of Mexico after it made landfall on 14 November close to the Honduras-Nicaragua border and crossed Belize and south-eastern Mexico on 17-18 November. In the meantime, ongoing rain continue to affect parts of Central America.According to UN OCHA, in Honduras, two people died, more than 6,700 people have been sheltered and 127,716 people affected. In Costa Rica, five people died, five are missing and 3,418 others have been displaced. In Guatemala, more than 350 people have been displaced, and 50,240 affected. In Belize, more than 123,000 people have been affected and at least 162 people have been sheltered. In El Salvador, 30 people have been evacuated and 2,500 affected.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode for Honduras () and for Belize (), a total of 7 maps have been produced so far.On 19-20 November, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected over most of Central America, particularly over the southern and western countries and over south-eastern Mexico.

title: Mauritius, Réunion - Tropical cyclone BHEKI, update (ECHO 24 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone BHEKI continued southwest over the southern Indian Ocean towards Mauritius on 18 November, with maximum sustained winds up to 201 km/h, slightly weakening. On 19 November at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 1,000 km north-east of Mauritius and 1,220 km north-east of Réunion, France, with maximum sustained winds of 137 km/h.BHEKI is forecast to continue southwest on 19-20 November as a tropical storm. It is expected to pass close to the Rodrigues island, Mauritius on 20 November very early in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 75 km/h. After that, it is forecast to pass very close to Mauritius and Réunion on the morning of 21 November, with the same maximum sustained winds.Over the next 96 hours, heavy rainfall is forecast over Mauritius, including the Rodrigues island and Réunion.

title: Philippines, China, Viet Nam - Tropical cyclone MAN-YI, update (ECHO 24 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone MAN-YI (named "Pepito" in the Philippines) is moving westwards over the South China Sea and is weakening. On 19 November at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 360 km east of Hainan island, south-eastern China, with maximum sustained winds of 74 km/h (tropical storm).Following its passage over central-northern Luzon in combination with tropical cyclones USAGI and TORAJI, the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports 25 injured people, almost 620,000 displaced people and more than 1.8 million affected people. Moreover, according to media, a landslide occurred on 18 November in Ambaguio town, Nueva Vizcaya province, Cagayan Valley region and resulted in seven fatalities and two injured people.MAN-YI is forecast to continue west and west-southwest weakening and dissipating in the sea south of Hainan island.For the next 48 hours moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected across most of Hainan and central-northern Vietnam.

title: Ecuador - Wildfires (ECHO 23 Nov 2024)
description: Since 10 November, at least 25 wildfires have been burning across Azuay and Loja provinces, in south-western Ecuador, resulting in damage. According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the wildfires have burnt an area of more than 5,900 ha in Cajas National Park, western of Cuenca city in Azuay province, and an area of 4,600 ha in Podocarpus National Park in Loja province.According to media reports, as of 17 November, the most affected are Paltas, Calvas and Loja cantons in the province of Loja. National authorities declared a state of emergency for Cuenca.The ERCC is in contact with the Ecuadorian authorities in order to clarify their needs for assistance and to explore means of support.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme in the affected provinces.

title: Honduras, Belize, Nicaragua, Guatemala, Mexico, El Salvador - Tropical cyclone SARA, update (ECHO 23 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone SARA approached the northern coast of Honduras on 15 November and on 17 November, made landfall north of Dangriga town, eastern Belize, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds. After that, it crossed central Belize, north-eastern Guatemala and south-eastern Mexico, and on 18 November at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located inland in south-eastern Mexico, approximately 36 km east-southeast of Candelaria Municipality, Campeche state with maximum sustained winds of 46 km/h (tropical depression).Following its influence across north-eastern Central America, the IFRC Disaster Response and Preparedness reports three missing people and 20,000 affected in Honduras, 123,276 affected people in Belize, and almost 8,000 affected people in Guatemala.SARA is forecast to move north-west and reach the southern Gulf of Mexico, weakening and dissipating on 18 November. For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over Belize, El Salvador, eastern Guatemala, western Nicaragua and the Mexican state of Quintana Roo.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode, (EMSR778) for Honduras and (EMSR777) for Belize.

title: Mauritius, Reunion - Tropical Cyclone BHEKI (ECHO 23 Nov 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named BHEKI, formed over the southern Indian Ocean, is moving south-west. On 18 November at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located in the sea, approximately 670 km north-east of Rodrigues island, Mauritius with maximum sustained winds of 155  km/h (tropical cyclone).BHEKI is forecast to continue south-west, it will pass north of Rodrigues island on 19 November and on 20-21 November it will move very close to Mauritius first as a tropical storm and Reunion after as a tropical depression.On 19 November, heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected across Rodrigues island while on 20-21 November heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast across Mauritius and Reunion.

title: Philippines, China, Viet Nam - Tropical cyclone MAN-YI, update (ECHO 23 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone MAN-YI (named "Pepito" in the Philippines) crossed north-central Luzon after it made landfall in the vicinity of Dipaculao, north-eastern Central Luzon region as a typhoon with winds up to 259 km/h. On 18 November at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the South China Sea approximately 270 km west of Batac city, Ilocos Norte, with maximum sustained winds of 110 km/h (tropical storm).National authorities report that, as of 18 November, there were two injured, more than 685,000 displaced people and 1,145,942 affected people across six regions. This humanitarian impact is also due to the combination of tropical cyclones USAGI and TORAJI that affected the same region over the past week.MAN-YI is forecast to continue over the South China Sea moving eastwards, it could pass close to the southern coast of Hainan island, south-eastern China on 19 November and eastern Viet Nam on 20 November as a tropical depression.For the next 48 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over western Luzon while moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected across Hainan and eastern Viet Nam.

title: Haiti - Floods (ECHO 23 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected the southern Haiti from 10 to 12 November, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to UN OCHA, as of 15 November, at least one person died in Ile-à-Vache and two are still missing in Port-à-Piment and Les Cayes municipalities due to flooding in the South Department in south-western Haiti. At least 3,558 families and 3,554 houses have been affected across Les Cayes, Torbeck, Saint-Louis-du-Sud, Maniche and Port-Salut which are the most affected municipalities.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecasted over southern Haiti.

title: Spain - Severe weather, update (ECHO 20 Nov 2024)
description: Since 13 November, heavy rainfall has been affecting southern and eastern Spain, particularly Malaga and Catalonia province, causing severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in displacement and damage.As of 15 November, more than 4,200 that were preventively evacuated people from six municipalities, including Malaga city, in Malaga province, mainly people that live on the riverbank of the Guadalhorce and Campanillas rivers are allowed to return to their houses. 22 people have been rescued in Vélez-Málaga municipality, several houses and roads have been affected and two highways are still closed.Eastern Spain was hit by a high-altitude isolated depression (DANA in Spanish) on 28-29 October, which caused 223 fatalities across the Autonomous Region of Valencia, the Castilla-La Mancha autonomous community, Andalusia Autonomous Region. 16 people are still missing.Folowing Spain's request for assistance from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), teams from Portugal and France and two ERCC Liaison Officers have been deployed to assist. Belgium, France, Portugal, Lithuania, and Romania offered assistance including civil protection experts, cleaning capacities, excavators, trucks and transportation vehicles. The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode ( and 40 maps have been produced so far.On 15 November, more heavy rainfall is expected over Extremadura and western Andalucia regions. Drier conditions and best weather are expected on 16 November.

title: Honduras, Belize, Nicaragua, Guatemala, Mexico, El Salvador - Tropical storm SARA  (ECHO 20 Nov 2024)
description: A new tropical storm named SARA which formed in the Caribbean Sea on 13 November, moved towards central America and made landfall in an area very close to Barra Patuca and Brus Laguna in north-eastern Honduras  between the night of 14  November and the early morning of 15 November. On 15 November at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located inland, approximately 135 km east-southeast Isla Guanaja (Honduras) with maximum sustained winds of 75 km/h (tropical storm) with higher gusts.SARA will continue close to the northern coast of Honduras through early 16 November, then it will approach the coast of Belize on 17 November as a tropical storm.For the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected particularly over northern Honduras and eastern Belize but also across eastern Guatemala, western Nicaragua, El Salvador and the Mexican state of Quintana Roo.A tropical storm warning is in effect for the northern coast of Honduras.

title: Papua New Guinea - Earthquake (ECHO 20 Nov 2024)
description: An earthquake of 6.6 M at a depth of 52 km occurred in Papua New Guinea on 15 November at 5.28 UTC (15.28 local time). The epicentre was located on the sea 35 km east of the coast of New Ireland Island at 123 km east-south-east of Kokopo town, in East New Britain Province, eastern Papua New Guinea.USGS PAGER estimated that up to 5,000 people were exposed to moderate shaking and up to 622,000 people to light shaking.According to media reports, as of 15 November, there are no immediate reports of any casualties or damage.

title: Madagascar - Landslide (ECHO 20 Nov 2024)
description: On 12 November, a large landslide hit the Menabe region in central-western Madagascar, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 14 November, media reports 16 fatalities and 10 rescued people in Belo-sur-Tsiribihina village, north-western Menabe region, along the Tsiribihina River due to a landslide that reached the river and hit a boat.On 15-16 November, drier conditions are expected over the affected area.

title: Philippines - Tropical cyclone MAN-YI, update (ECHO 20 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone MAN-YI (named "Pepito" in the Philippines) continued moving west over the Philippine Sea toward the central-northern Philippines on 14 November, as tropical storm, strengthening. On 15 November at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea approximately 700 km south-east of the central Bicol region, central Philippines, with maximum sustained winds of 167 km/h (typhoon).MAN-YI is expected to continue northwestward over the sea and to make landfall over the central Bicol region, close to the Bato town on 16 November in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 220-230 km/h (typhoon).Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over central and northern Philippines over the period from 16 to 19 November.

title: Italy - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 19 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Italy, in particular Catania and Messina provinces in the Sicily region, since 12-13 November, causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in severe weather-related incidents, displacements and damage.As of 14 November, media reports that five families have been displaced in Giarre municipality in Catania province, several people have been rescued across Giarre, Acireale, Riposto and Linguaglossa municipalities due to river overflow, one highway and several streets have been blocked in Catania and Messina provinces, school classes have been suspended. In addition, landslides have been recorded in Mascali and Acireale municipalities.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over the eastern part of Sicily region.

title: Spain - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Nov 2024)
description: Since 13 November, heavy rainfall has been affecting southern and eastern Spain, particularly Malaga and Catalonia province,  causing severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in displacement and damage.According to media reports, as of 14 November, approximately 3,000 people have been preventatively displaced, of whom more than 500 have been sheltered for the past night, from Guadalhorce riverbank in Álora, Cártama, Alhaurín de la Torre, Pizarra municipalities and Malaga city, in the Malaga province.Eastern Spain was hit by a high-altitude isolated depression (DANA in Spanish) on 28-29 October, which caused 223 fatalities across the Autonomous Region of Valencia, the Castilla-La Mancha autonomous community, Andalusia Autonomous Region.On 8 November, Spain requested assistance from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM). Teams from Portugal and France and two ERCC Liaison Officers have been deployed to assist. Belgium, France, Lithuania, Portugal and Romania offered assistance including civil protection experts, cleaning capacities, excavators, trucks and transportation vehicles.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 29 October, 40 maps have been produced so far.On 14-15 November, more rainfall is expected over Extremadura and Andalucia regions.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, Japan - Tropical cyclone USAGI, update (ECHO 19 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone USAGI ("Ofel" in the Philippines) is approaching the coasts of north-eastern Luzon, and on 14 November at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located approximately 50 km east-northeast of Tuguegarao City, Cagayan valley region with maximum sustained winds of 175 km/h (typhoon) with gusts up to 240 km/h.Its impact combined with the passage of TORAJI resulted in two injured people, more than 46,000 displaced and about 310,000 affected people, as reported by national authorities on 14 November.USAGI is expected to move northwestward and then northward, it will cross Babuyan and Batanes on 15 November and it will pass close to the southern coast of Taiwan on 16 November as a typhoon with winds up to 130 km/h. After that, it will continue over the western Philippine sea passing close to the eastern coast of Taiwan as a tropical storm.Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern Luzon, the Babuyan islands, the Batanes islands, most of Taiwan and southern Ryukyu islands, southern Japan over 15-17 November.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic eruption, update (ECHO 19 Nov 2024)
description: New eruptions have been recorded as well as volcanic earthquakes in the Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano, East Flores regency, East Nusa Tenggara province. On 14 November the volcanic ash reached up to 3,000 m above the crater.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB) as of 13 November, 13,116 people have been sheltered across eight evacuation centres, most of them in the Titehena district which is hosting almost 7,000 people. In addition, in the past few days some flights in Blai islands have been cancelled due to the volcanic activity.National authorities continue to provide emergency assistance for those affected.The alert level of the volcano still stands at level 4.

title: Yemen - Landslide (ECHO 18 Nov 2024)
description: A rock fall occurred on 11 November in the village of Beit Al-Baras, Al-Mahwit province, western Yemen resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, at least seven people died, several people were injured and homes were damaged by the event. Rescue operations have been activated to help those affected.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected across the affected province.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 18 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the Peninsular Malaysia, in particular the southern state of Pahang since 10 November, causing floods that have resulted in population displacement and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 13 November, a total of more than 450 evacuated people, across the Raub district, Pahang state.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Peninsular Malaysia.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, Japan - Tropical cyclone USAGI (ECHO 18 Nov 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named USAGI ("Ofel" in the Philippines) formed over the North Pacific Ocean on 9 November and started moving west over the Philippine Sea toward the far northern Luzon island, northern Philippines and southern Taiwan, strengthening. On 13 November at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea, approximately 640 km south-east of the Babuyan islands, northern Philippines, with maximum sustained winds of 139 km/h (typhoon).USAGI is expected to continue northwestward over the Philippine Sea and to pass over the far northern Luzon, the Babuyan islands and the nearby Batanes islands, northern Philippines, close to southern Taiawan on 14-15 November as a typhoon, with maximum sustained winds up to 185 km/h (typhoon).Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern Luzon, the Babuyan islands, the Batanes islands, most of Taiwan, and the Ryukyu islands, far southern Japan over 14-17 November.

title: Spain - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 05 Nov 2024)
description: Extreme heavy rainfall due to a high-altitude isolated depression (DANA in Spanish) has particularly affected the province of Valencia in eastern Spain since 28 October, causing flash floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Department of National Security of Spain (DSN) and media, as of 31 October, the death toll reached 132 people, with 114 people still missing, mainly in the Autonomous Region of Valencia. 3 casualties are reported in Castilla-La Mancha autonomous community, and 1 in Andalusia autonomous Regions. At least 447 people have been sheltered and 3,500 rescued. More than 155,000 households have been affected by widespread power outages and 315,000 are without water service.In addition, more than 70 roads are still affected, some main roads, such as the A-3 and A-7, have been closed in the Autonomous Region of Valencia, and authorities have recommended avoiding roads in the provinces of Valencia, Cádiz, Seville and Huelva.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 30 October to provide emergency mapping of flood extent in the Valencia region.On 31 October - 1 November, more rainfall is expected over eastern Spain, with local thunderstorms in north of Valencia, Catalonia and southern Aragon.

title: Mexico - Flood (ECHO 05 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the south-eastern Veracruz state in Mexico since 25 October, causing the Papaloapan and Coatzacoalcos river overflow and floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 28 October, several people have been displaced in Minatitlán city in southern Veracruz state, 20 shelters have been set up in six municipalities and at least 1,140 people have been affected across the City of Tlacotalpan and 36 municipalities in Veracruz state, due to the rising water of the Papaloapan River. In addition, Minatitlán city, Hidalgotitlán, Jáltipan and Texistepec towns have been isolated and one bridge has been destroyed in Santiago Tuxtla municipality.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 29 October to provide emergency mapping of flood extent, one map has been produced so far.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is expected over Veracruz State and south-eastern Mexico.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 05 Nov 2024)
description: On 30 October, Sidenreng Rappang Regency (South Sulawesi province, central-northern Indonesia) experienced strong winds that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), one person died, two people have been injured and 272 people have been affected. In addition, 62 houses were partially damaged, and six others were destroyed.For the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is expected across the affected province.

title: Taiwan, Japan - Tropical Cyclone KONG-REY (ECHO 05 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical Cyclone KONG-REY made landfall over the north-eastern coast of Taitung county (south-eastern Taiwan) on the morning of 31 October and continued moving north-west. On 31 October at 6.30 UTC, its centre was located inland approximately 40 km north-northeast of Taitung city (south-eastern Taiwan), with maximum sustained winds of 184 km/h as registered by the Central Weather Administration of Taiwan (CWA).According to media, schools and workplaces across the whole of Taiwan have been closed and hundreds of flights and ferries have been suspended.KONG-REY is forecast to cross central and north-western Taiwan during the rest of the day. After, it will change direction from north-west to north and finally to north-east and it will move over the East China Sea towards the southern coast of Kyushu island (southern Japan).On 31 October - 1 November, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are expected across most parts of Taiwan. Red warnings for heavy rain are in effect across central and northern Taiwan.

title: Viet Nam, China - Tropical Cyclone TRAMI, update (ECHO 05 Nov 2024)
description: Following the passage of Tropical cyclone TRAMI over eastern Viet Nam on 27 October, the number of casualties increased. In addition, Hainan island in southern China experienced heavy rain and strong winds that also resulted in casualties and damage.According to ADINet, in Viet Nam, five people died in Quang Binh province and five others were injured (four in Quang Nam and one in Quang Tri). Moreover, 143,424 people have been affected and 318 houses damaged.In China, seven people died and another person is still missing across Hainan island.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected over eastern Viet Nam and Hainan island.

title: Spain - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 04 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern and southern Spain since 28 October, causing flooding and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the authorities, as of 30 October, the number of deaths exceeds 50 in the autonomous Region of Valencia (eastern Spain), and six still missing in Letur municipality in Albacete province in Castilla La Mancha autonomous Region. Dozens have been rescued and several have been displaced in Valencia province. In addition, a bridge collapsed in Ribarroja del Turia (Valencia province), several roads have been closed, including some in Granada and Malaga cities in the Andalucia region, and train disruptions have been recorded in the affected area.On 30 - 31 October, more rainfall is expected over eastern Andalucia, Murcia, Castilla-La Mancha and Valencia areas.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode ( on 30 October to provide emergency mapping of flood extent in Valencia region.

title: United States - Wildfires (ECHO 04 Nov 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been burning in the United States in the last few days, resulting in casualties and evacuations. At least three major wildfires are burning across Connecticut, Colorado and Oklahoma states.According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), as of 29 October, a wildfire in Hartford county in the state of Connecticut, has burnt an area of 48 ha, one person died and four have been injured, including two firefighters. As of 29 October, media reports that in Teller County, Colorado state, at least 700 households have been evacuated and one structure has been destroyed in the area of Divide town due to the Highland Lake Fire. In the eastern Payne county, in the state of Oklahoma, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), several wildfires have been burning across Cushing, Cashion, and Wellston towns, where an evacuation order has been issued. The largest wildfire has so far burnt an area of 614 ha.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to locally very extreme in Oklahoma, from high to very high in Colorado state and moderate in Connecticut.

title: Pakistan - Severe Weather (ECHO 04 Nov 2024)
description: On 29 October, heavy rainfall hit north-western Pakistan, in particular the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Provincial Disaster Management Authority (PDMA) reports, as of 29 October, two fatalities in Shangla district, two injured people in Lower Kohistan district and two damaged houses across both aforementioned districts.On 30 October, isolated light rainfall is expected while on 31 October no rainfall is forecast over parts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.

title: Vietnam - Tropical Cyclone TRAMI, update (ECHO 04 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone TRAMI dissipated over the South China Sea after it crossed central eastern Vietnam on 27 October and the central Philippines on 23-24 October.In Vietnam, the death toll reached three people, all in Quang Binh province, and four others have been injured (one in Quang Tri and four in Quang Nam province), as reported by ADINet. The same source registered 143,424 affected people as well as almost 36,000 houses.For the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall is expected across central-northern Vietnam and northern Philippines.

title: Taiwan, Philippines - Tropical Cyclone KONG-REY, update (ECHO 04 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone KONG-REY ("Leon" in the Philippines) is moving north-west toward central-eastern Taiwan, strengthening and passing close to the north-eastern coast of Luzon (northern Philippines). On 30 October at 7.15 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 443 km north-east of Taitung city (far south-eastern Taiwan) and 253 km north-east of Santa Ana city (north-eastern Philippines), with maximum sustained winds of 190 km/h as registered by the Central Weather Administration of Taiwan (CWA).On the forecast track, KONG-REY is expected to continue moving northwestward over the northern Philippine Sea and it could make landfall on 31 October across an area between Taitung and Hualien county, with maximum sustained winds of 190 km/h.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern Luzon island (northern Philippines) and the whole of Taiwan where red warnings for typhoon and heavy rain are in effect.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 03 Nov 2024)
description: On 27 October, Mount Marapi, located in Agam City regency (West Sumatra province), increased its activity, and an ash column reached up to 2,000 m above the crater.According to media reports, following this eruption, the volcanic ash drifted westward over populated areas and spread for several kilometres, covering nearby villages and towns with thick volcanic residue.In early December 2023, Marapi erupted and killed 24 people and injured several others.The alert level of the volcano is at level 2, the community around Marapi and visitors should not enter and not carry out activities within a radius of 3 km from the eruption centre.

title: Brazil, Uruguay - Severe weather (ECHO 03 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds affected southern Brazil (in particular Rio Grande do Sul, Parana, Rio de Janeiro, Sao Paulo, and Santa Catarina states) and the neighbouring Uruguay over the period from 23 to 25 October, causing floods, flash floods and several severe weather-related incidents (mainly due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage.In Brazil, media report as of 29 October, five fatalities, of which three in the Nova Iguacu city (Rio de Janeiro state), one in the Campinas city, and one more in the Jundiaí city (both in the Sao Paulo state). In addition WHO PAHO also reports two injured persons and 145 damaged houses across the Rio Grande do Sul state, and 230 damaged houses throughout the Santa Catarina state.Over the next 72 hours, moderate rainfall is still forecast over Rio de Janeiro, and Sao Paulo states.

title: Philippines, Taiwan - Tropical cyclone KONG-REY (ECHO 03 Nov 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named KONG-REY ("Leon" in the Philippines) formed over the northern Philippines Sea on 25 October and started moving west toward the Luzon Strait (between northern Philippines and southern Taiwan), strengthening. On 29 October at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea approximately 760 km south-east of the Taitung city (far south-eastern Taiwan) and 450 km east of Santa Ana city (north-eastern Philippines), with maximum sustained winds of 176 km/h (typhoon).On the forecast track, KONG-REY is expected to continue moving northwestward over the northern Philippine Sea and the Luzon Strait on 29-30 October, further strengthening. KONG-REY is forecast to make landfall over the Taitung city area (Taiwan) on 31 October early in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 213 km/h (typhoon).Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern Luzon island (northern Philippines) and the whole Taiwan.

title: Philippines, Viet Nam - Tropical cyclone TRAMI, update (ECHO 03 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone TRAMI is dissipating over the South China Sea after it made landfall over eastern Quang Nam province (eastern-central Vietnam) on 27 October.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), in Vietnam, one person died and another is still missing in Quang Binh province while five people have been injured across the provinces of Quang Tri and Quang Nam. Moreover, more than 138,000 people have been affected as well as 34,519 houses.Its passage over the Philippines on 23-24 October, resulted in 111 fatalities, 74 injured people and 30 still missing. In addition, a total of 7,134,954 people have been affected and almost 1,000,000 displaced across most regions of the country.The Government of the Philippines is providing the relief efforts while OCHA, with national authorities and humanitarian partners, is conducting also the damage assessment.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is still expected across central Vietnam and Hainan island (southern China). Moderate rain is forecast over most of central and southern Philippines.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 02 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-eastern France since 25 October, causing floods that have resulted in preventive evacuations and damage.According to the Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC), as of 26 October, more than 100 people had been preventively evacuated and 12 had been rescued by helicopter in the departments of Var, in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region, due to the overflow of the Argens and Var Rivers. According to media reports, at least 400 people have been affected by power outages, and 13 roads have been flooded.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the affected areas.

title: Italy - Floods and landslides (ECHO 02 Nov 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting north-western Italy mainland (in particular the Liguria and the neighbouring Piedmont regions) and the Sardinia island over the last 48 hours, causing floods, flash floods and triggering a number of landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 28 October, two pesons still missing, of which one in the Nuxis municipality (South Sardinia province, south-weastern Sardinia island) due to flash floods and one more in the Arenzano municipality (Genoa province, central Liguria region) due to a landslide. In addition, media also reports eight rescued people across the Cagliari province (southern Sardinia) and one collapsed bridge in the South Sardinia province.Over the next 72 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over the already affected Sardinia, Liguria, and Piedmont regions. The orange alert for hydrogeological risk over southern Sardinia, issued by the Italian Civil Protection, remains in force.

title: India - Tropical cyclone DANA, update (ECHO 02 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone DANA made landfall over the north-western Odisha state, near the border with the West Bengal state, in the night between 24-25 October (UTC) as a tropical cyclone, then weakened and dissipated over northern Odisha.Its passage caused heavy rainfall, strong winds, storm surges, floods and severe weather-related incidents, resulting in casualties and damage. According to media, as of 26 October, at least four people died in West Bengal state due to the storm. As of the same date, the Ministry of Home Affairs Disaster Management Division-National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports that more than 810,800 people have been evacuated in Odisha and 216,000 in West Bengal in a total of 7,457 shelters, and 3.81 million people have been affected.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over Odisha state.

title: Philippines, Viet Nam, China - Tropical cyclone TRAMI, update (ECHO 02 Nov 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone TRAMI ("Kristine" in the Philippines) continued moving westward over the South China Sea on 25-27 October, further weakening but remaining a tropical storm. On 28 October after 0.00 UTC it made landfall over the Da Nang city area (central Viet Nam), with maximum sustained winds of 83 km/h. On 28 October at 0.00 UTC its centre was located inland over the central Quang Nam Province (central Viet Nam), with maximum sustained winds of 56 km/h (tropical depression).In the Philippines, its passage over Luzon, Visayas and northern Mindanao caused very heavy rainfall, floods and landslides. NDRRMC reports, as of 28 October, 97 fatalities, 30 people still missing, 69 injured people, 6.7 million affected and over 980,000 displaced people.In central Viet Nam, ADINet reports one person still missing, four injured people, nearly 62,000 affected people, and around 15,500 damaged houses.On the forecast track, TRAMI is expected to continue moving eastward, re-entering in the South China Sea on 28-29 October, further weakening and dissipating.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and northern Viet Nam and over the Hainan island (southern China).

title: Flood in Italy - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR771] Flood in Emilia- Romagna, Italy

title: Cuba, The Bahamas - Tropical cyclone OSCAR, update (ECHO 30 Oct 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone OSCAR passed over southern Bahamas and south-eastern Cuba on 20-22 October as a category 1 hurricane (with maximum sustained winds of 139 km/h) and as a tropical storm, then dissipated over the western North Atlantic Ocean on 22 October. Its passage caused heavy rainfall, strong winds, storm surges and flooding that have resulted in casualties and damage.In Cuba, the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) reports, as of 22 October, six fatalities in the province of Guantanamo, with about 15,000 people evacuated in the municipalities of Imías and San Antonio del Sur, in the southern Guantanamo Province. In addition, more than 1,800 houses have been affected in the municipalities of Maisí and Baracoa.Over the next 48 hours, light rainfall is forecast over south-eastern Cuba and the southern Bahamas.

title: Philippines, China, Viet Nam - Tropical cyclone TRAMI, update (ECHO 30 Oct 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone TRAMI (named "Kristine" in the Philippines) passed over the central and western parts of the northern Luzon island, northern Philippines on 24 October, as a tropical storm. On 25 October at 0.00 UTC its centre was located over the eastern South China Sea, approximately 950 km east of the Hainan island, southern China, with maximum sustained winds of 93 km/h (tropical storm).Its passage over the Luzon island caused very heavy rainfall, floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage. The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports, as of 25 October, 13 fatalities, seven people still missing, and five injured across five regions. NDRRMC also reports nearly 319,700 displaced and a total of approximately 2,656,500 affected people across most of the Luzon island.TRAMI is expected to continue westward over the South China Sea on 25-28 October, further weakening but remaining a tropical storm.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over northern and central Philippines. Heavy rainfall is also forecast over the Hainan island and the central coast of Viet Nam starting from 27 October.

title: Azerbaijan - Floods (ECHO 30 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall hit eastern Azerbaijan, particularly the Absheron peninsula, on 21-23 October, causing severe flooding that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 24 October, two people died due to flooding in the Sabunchu district of the capital city of Baku, at least 31 people have been displaced and several people have to be rescued from their flooded homes. In addition, several buildings and roads have been affected, causing traffic disruptions. The most affected districts are Sabunchu, Surakhani, Khazar, Binagadi and Yasamal in Baku city area.On 25-26 October, drier conditions are forecast over the whole country.

title: India - Tropical cyclone DANA, update (ECHO 30 Oct 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone DANA made landfall over the area between the Paradeep city and the Balasore city, far north-western Odisha state, near the border with the West Bengal state very late in the evening (UTC) on 24 October, with maximum sustained winds up to 120 km/h (tropical cyclone). On 25 October at 3.00 UTC its centre was located inland approximately 35 south-west of the Balasore city, with maximum sustained winds up to 90 km/h (tropical storm).Its passage caused heavy rainfall, strong winds, storm surges, floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in population displacements and damage. Sphere India reports, as of 24 October, more than 500,000 evacuated people in 7,285 shelters across Odisha and nearly 243,400 evacuated people in several shelters throughout West Bengal.DANA is expected to continue westward inland across central Odisha state, further weakening and dissipating in the morning on 26 October.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over most of West Bengal, Odisha, and Jharkhand states.

title: Costa Rica - Landslide (ECHO 29 Oct 2024)
description: On 20 October, a huge landslide occurred in Toro Amarillo locality, Sarchí canton, central Costa Rica and resulted in casualties.According to media, at least two people died due to this event.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over central Costa Rica.

title: South Africa - Floods (ECHO 29 Oct 2024)
description: Over the past couple of days, the Eastern Cape province in south-eastern South Africa experienced heavy rainfall and consequent floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, at least ten people have died and 3,000 others have been displaced and accommodated in community halls and recently constructed houses. In addition, 30 houses have been destroyed as well as 12 bridges.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected across the affected province.

title: Philippines - Tropical storm TRAMI, update (ECHO 29 Oct 2024)
description: Tropical storm TRAMI (named Kristine in the Philippines) made landfall over the eastern coast of Cagayan Valley, north-eastern Luzon in the afternoon of 23 October. On 24 October at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located inland in the vicinity of Aguinaldo municipality, Ifugao Province, Cordillera Administrative Region region, northern Philippines with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h (tropical storm) and gusts up to 115 km/h.As of 24 October, the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports that the passage of TRAMI is leading to seven fatalities, of whom six in Bicol and one in Calabarzon, seven missing people and four others injured. In addition, almost 200,000 have been displaced and more than 2 million people have been affected.TRAMI is expected to continue crossing northern Luzon in the coming hours, after that it will continue westwards over the South China Sea towards Vietnam.For the next 24 hours, heavy to very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of central and northern Philippines.

title: India - Tropical cyclone DANA (ECHO 29 Oct 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named DANA formed over the eastern Bay of Bengal in the morning (UTC) of 23 October and started moving north-west toward eastern India, strenghtening. On 24 October at 0.00 its centre was located over the northern Bay of Bengal, approximately 270 south-est of the Puri city, eastern Odisha state, with maximum sustained winds of 111 km/h (tropical storm).DANA is expected to make landfall over the area between the Puri city and the Digha city, far south-western West Bengal state on 25 October before 12.00, with maximum sustained winds up to 120 km/h (tropical cyclone).Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the West Bengal state, most of the Odisha state and southern Jharkhand state.

title: Vietnam - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 28 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting Vietnam, particularly Nghe An, Quang Binh, Quang Nam, Quang Ngai, Binh Thuan, and Tra Vinh provinces, since 20 October, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 23 October, the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports that two people died, 108 people, 27 houses and 13 roads have been affected. In addition, 1,272 ha of crops have been damaged by floods.On 23-24 October, more rainfall is still forecast over most of Vietnam, including the already affected provinces.

title: India - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 28 Oct 2024)
description: Intense rainfall has been affecting southern India since 19 October, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 23 October, seven people died, including two children in Kengeri Lake, in Bengaluru city, the capital of the Karnataka state, south-western India, six have been injured, 16 have been rescued, and several people have been displaced in Yelahanka area, in northern part of Bengaluru city. In addition, more than 1,000 houses have been affected by floods and schools have been closed.For the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over southern India. Yellow warnings for thunderstorms and lightning are in effect in southern and eastern India.

title: Cuba - Tropical storm Oscar, update (ECHO 28 Oct 2024)
description: Tropical storm Oscar, after making landfall as category 1 hurricane on  20 October, moved across Eastern Cuba bringing heavy rains and floods affecting in particular the provinces of Guantánamo, Holguín, Las Tunas, and Santiago de Cuba, with greater severity in the municipalities of Imías and San Antonio del Sur in Guantánamo.The president of the National Defence Council, Miguel Díaz-Canel, informed that Imías and San Antonio del Sur are in a state of emergency due to severe damage.Since 18 October, Cuba has also been grappling with a nationwide power outage, with the National Electricity System currently restoring services.

title: Italy - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 27 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has continued to affect southern Italy, in particular the Calabria, and the Sicily regions over the last 36 hours, causing floods, and river overflow and triggering several landslides that have resulted in damage.Media report, as of 22 October, eleven rescued persons in the Lamezia Terme city area, Catanzaro province, southern Calabria region. In addition, media also reports one collapsed bridge.Over the next 72 hours, light rainfall is forecast over the Calabria and the Sicily regions.

title: USA - Flash floods (ECHO 27 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms affected eastern New Mexico in the south-western United States on 19-20 October, causing flash floods and floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 21 October, two people died, 38 have been injured, at least 309 people have been rescued and one shelter has been opened for displaced residents in Roswell city, in central Chaves County, eastern New Mexico, due to a severe flash flood. In addition, one bridge on a highway has been destroyed, and several roads and houses have been flooded.Rescue operations are still ongoing and an emergency declaration has been issued for Chaves County.Over the next 72 hours, drier conditions are expected over New Mexico and the south-western United States.

title: Cuba, The Bahamas - Tropical cyclone OSCAR, update (ECHO 27 Oct 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone OSCAR continued inland over south-eastern Cuba on 21 October, as a tropical storm, further weakening. On 22 October at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the North Atlantic Ocean approximately 70 km south-west of the Crooked Island, far southern Bahamas, with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h (tropical storm).Its passage over south-eastern Cuba caused heavy rainfall and resulted in casualites and damage. Media reports, as 22 October, six fatalities across the San Antonio del Sur community, Guantanamo province. Several municipalities received more than 300 mm of rain, causing heavy flooding, severe damage to infrastructure and the blocking of roads and highways.OSCAR is expected to pass over southern Bahamas (between the Crooked Island, and the Long Island) on 22 October, as a tropical storm, with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h (tropical storm).Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are still forecast over south-eastern Cuba and central and southern Bahamas. The tropical storm warning over central and southern Bahamas issued by NOAA remains in force.

title: Indonesia - Earthquakes (ECHO 27 Oct 2024)
description: An earthquake of magnitude 5.8 M at a depth of 16 km occurred on 21 October at 3:24 UTC at Tapat Island in eastern North Maluku province, western Indonesia. The epicentre was located approximately 60 km south of Labuha city in Bacan Island in North Maluko province.On 21 October, a 5.7 M aftershock and four aftershocks with a magnitude between 4.5 and 5 M hit the same area.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 2,000 people were exposed to strong and more than 11,000 to moderate shaking.According to media reports, as of 22 October, the earthquake was felt in Labuha City on Obi Island, but there are no reports of any damage or casualties.

title: Philippines - Tropical cyclone TRAMI (ECHO 27 Oct 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named TRAMI ("Kristine" in the Philippines) formed over the western Philippine Sea on 20 October very early in the afternoon (UTC) and started moving west toward central-northern Luzon island, northern Philippines, strengthening. On 22 October at 0.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea, approximately 320 km east of the central Bicol region (southern Luzon island), with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h (tropical storm).On the forecast track, TRAMI is expected to continue moving northwestward further strengthening and to make landfall over the eastern Cagayan Valley region, northern Luzon island on 23 October very early in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 93 km/h (tropical storm).Over the next 96 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storms surges are forecast over the whole Luzon island.

title: Mexico - Floods (ECHO 26 Oct 2024)
description: On 16-17 October, heavy rainfall affected the Monterrey municipality area, Nuevo Leon state, north-eastern Mexico, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, at least three people died and 121 houses were flooded.For the next 24 hours, moderate to localised heavy rainfall is forecast over most parts of Nuevo Leon state, including Monterrey municipality.

title: Italy - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 26 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall continued to affect northern, central and southern Italy over the past 72 hours, causing floods, rivers overflow and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage. The worst affected is the Emilia-Romagna region, northern Italy, in particular the provinces of Bologna, Modena, Reggio Emilia, Ravenna and Forlì-Cesena.The Italian Civil Protection and media report, as of 21 October, one fatality in the Botteghino di Zocca village, Pianoro municipality, Bologna province due to floods. In addition, the same sources also report approximately 3,100 evacuated people, of which 2,100 people across the Bologna province and around 1,000 people in the Reggio Emilia province.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 20 October to provide the damage assessment over Bologna, Modena and Reggio Emilia provinces.Over the next 48 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over the whole Emilia-Romagna region. The orange alert for hydrogeological and hydraulic risk issued by the Italian Civil Protection over this region is still in force.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 26 Oct 2024)
description: On 18-19 October, heavy rainfall hit several neighbourhoods of Kinshasa, the capital and largest city of DRC, located in the western part of the country, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, one person died while houses, buildings and roads were flooded and damaged across the affected city.On 21 October, drier conditions are expected, while on 22 October moderate rain is forecast in that area.

title: Cuba, The Bahamas, Turks and Caicos - Tropical cyclone OSCAR (ECHO 26 Oct 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named OSCAR formed over the western North Atlantic Ocean on 19 October in the afternoon (UTC) and started moving west toward Turks and Caicos islands (UK), strengthening. After it passed over Turks and Caicos and southern Bahamas on 20 October, as a category 1 hurricane and made landfall over the Baracoa city area (far eastern Cuba) on 20 October, with maximum sustained winds of 130 km/h (category 1 hurricane).On 21 October at 6.00 UTC its centre was located inland approximately 30 km east of the Guantanamo city area, eastern Cuba, with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h (tropical storm).OSCAR is expected to continue inland over eastern Cuba on 21 October as a tropical storm. After that, it is forecast to turn northward and to re-enter in the Ocean toward central Bahamas on 22-23 October, remaining a tropical storm.On 18 October, an incident in Cuba’s largest power plants left vast parts of the country without electricity during weekend, with continued blackouts still affecting most of the country, as of 21 October.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over eastern Cuba and southern and central Bahamas. NOAA has issued a tropical storm warning over these areas.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 23 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting southern, south-western and northern France, in particular Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes, Alpes-Maritimes, Nouvelle-Aquitaine, Centre-Val de Loire regions, and the greater Paris area over the last 48 hours, causing floods, rivers overflow and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 18 October, one fatality, due to a strong wind-related incident and two injured persons due to floods in the greater Paris area.Media also report more than 900 evacuated people across the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, where the affected departments are Ardèche, Rhône, and Haute-Loire departments. Around ten evacuated people were reported across the Alpes-Maritimes department, Alpes-Maritimes region.In addition, the Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) reports 2,485 rescued people across the affected regions.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of France, except over the north-western departments.

title: India - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 23 Oct 2024)
description: Very heavy rainfall has been affecting India since 14 October, particularly Tamil Nadu State in the south-eastern part of the country, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Ministry of Home Affairs Disaster Management Division (National Emergency Response Centre) of India, at least 20 people died between 14 and 16 October, including seven in Tamil Nadu and seven in Gujarat states, 1,681 have been displaced and 7,090 people have been affected.According to media reports, Chennai and Bengaluru cities are the most affected, where school classes have been suspended and several power outages have been recorded.For the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over southern India. Yellow warnings for thunderstorms and lightning are in effect in Tamil Nadu and Kerala states.

title: Vietnam - Floods and landslides (ECHO 23 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting north-western and south-eastern Vietnam, mainly Yen Bai, Lao Cai, Binh Thuan and An Giang provinces since 16 October, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 18 October, more than 150 evacuated and a total of approximately 200 affected people, 50 damaged houses, 18 affected bridges across Yen Bai, and Lao Cai provinces in the north-west. In addition, ADINet also reports nearly 500 affected people and over 120 damaged houses in Binh Thuan, and An Giang provinces in the south-east.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over most of Vietnam, including the already affected provinces.

title: Italy - Severe weather, floods and landslide (ECHO 23 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms started on 16 October have continued to affect the north-western part of Italy, including Tuscany, with the Liguria region as the worst affected, causing floods, landslides, and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Several roads have been blocked due to the overflow of the Entella river in Chiavari and Lavagna municipalities and of some streams in Recco and Sori municipalities in Genova province. In addition, in Siena city in Tuscany, train disruptions have been recorded. School classes are suspended in Siena, and Savona provinces, and in some municipalities in Genova province.On 18 October, more heavy rainfall is forecast over northern Italy, gradually subsiding during the day, and more heavy rainfall is expected on 19 October over the whole country.

title: Italy - Severe weather and landslide (ECHO 22 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting north-western Italy since 16 October, causing floods that have resulted in people displacement and damage.As of 17 October, according to media reports, three families have been displaced due to a landslide in the Varazze municipality, in the Savona province, in the western Liguria region. In addition, in the Savona province, train disruptions have been recorded between Loano and Pietra Ligure municipalities, one main highway has been closed due to rain floods, and school classes have been suspended in Genova, Savona and La Spezia provinces.On 17-18 October, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over northern Italy, particularly over Liguria, Emilia Romagna, Piemonte and Lombardia regions.

title: Guatemala - Rainy season, update (ECHO 22 Oct 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact is still increasing due to the rainy season that has been affecting 13 departments of Guatemala.According to the National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED), 34 people died, two are still missing, 15 have been injured, almost 30,000 have been evacuated, and more than 15,000 houses have been damaged or severely damaged.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over the whole country, with heavy rainfall over the northern part of Guatemala.

title: Nigeria - Floods (ECHO 22 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Nigeria in the last few weeks, causing severe floods and rivers overflow that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage.According to media, as of 16 October, more than 2 million people across 200 communities have been displaced in the Kogi state, central Nigeria, including Kogi, Lokoja, Adavi, Ofu, Ajaokuta, Idah and Ibaji, Igalamela and Omalla areas, 68 evacuation camps have been opened, and several infrastructures have been severely damaged.UN OCHA reports, as of 15 October, a total of 317 fatalities, 2,852 injured people, 713,691 displaced people, and 1,28 million people affected by floods in 2024.On 17-18 October, more rainfall is still forecast over southern Nigeria.

title: Morocco - Floods (ECHO 22 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms have affected several provinces in north-western and central Morocco, since 11 October, causing flooding that has resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 17 October, four people died, including two in the Taza province, one in the Khémisset province, and one in the city of Qalaat Sraghna. In addition, eight people have been injured, and several houses have been damaged in Taza province.On 17-18 October, drier conditions are expected over northern Morocco.

title: Philippines - Flood (ECHO 22 Oct 2024)
description: On 14 October, heavy rain and thunderstorms affected Oriental Mindoro province, Mimaropa region, central-western Philippines, causing floods and resulting in damage and displacements.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports 95 evacuated people in one evacuation centre and 1,115 affected people.For the next 24 hours, partly cloudy to cloudy skies with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms are forecast over the affected area.

title: Türkiye - Earthquake (ECHO 22 Oct 2024)
description: A 5.9 M earthquake (as registered by the Disaster and Management Unit - AFAD) at a depth of 10 km occurred on 16 October at 7.46 UTC (10.46 local time) in Kale district, Malatya province, eastern Türkiye. The epicentre was located approximately 42 km east of Malatya city and 48 km south-west of Elazig city.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 2,000 people were exposed to severe shaking, 40,000 to very strong shaking and 65,000 to strong shaking.According to media, almost 200 people have been injured, four others have been rescued from a partially damaged building and two buildings have been seriously damaged. There were no reports of any fatalities.On 6 February 2023, the interested area experienced the effects of two earthquakes of 7.7 and 7.6 M that struck 11 provinces, including Malatya as well as Adana, Adiyaman, Diyarbakir, Elazig, Hatay, Gaziantep, Kahramanmaras, Kilis, Osmaniye, and Sanliurfa. These two seismic events resulted in more than 56,000 fatalities across the aforementioned provinces and northern Syria.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 21 Oct 2024)
description: A wildfire has been burning in Sheridan County, in northern Wyoming, western United States, since 28 September, causing casualties and damage. As of 16 October, the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS) reports a burnt area of 40,826 ha.As of 15 October, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports six injured and at least  490 evacuated people, 2,750 threatened structures, and three destroyed houses due to the Elk Fire.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme in the affected area.

title: Mauritania - Floods (ECHO 21 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Mauritania, in particular the Guidimagha and the nearby Trarza regions since September, causing floods and the overflow of rivers that have resulted in population displacement and damage.The International Federation of Red Cross (IFRC) reports, as of 15 October, 1,125 displaced people across the Ghabou, Wembou, and Gouraye departments in the Guidimagha region, where the worst affected are the Diyagili, and Selo villages in the Ghabou department and across the Ntikan department in the Trarza region. In addition, a number of temporary shelters have been provided to host the displaced people.Over the next 96 hours, drier conditions are expected over the whole of Mauritania.

title: Burkina Faso - Floods (ECHO 21 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected western, southern and northern Burkina Faso, in particular the three neighbouring regions of Boucle du Mouhoun, Cascades, and Hauts-Bassins in the south-west and the Nord region over the period from 7 to 13 October, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The International Federation of Red Cross (IFRC) reports, as of 14 October, one fatality, six injured people and a total of approximately 4,500 affected people across the aforementioned regions. The worst affected communes are Founzan (Boucle du Mouhoun region), Bama, and Karangasso Samblan (Hauts-Bassins region), Sindou (Cascades region), and Séguénéga (Nord region).Over the next 96 hours, more rainfall with locally heavy rainfall is still forecast over western, southern and central Burkina Faso.

title: Ethiopia - Heavy rain in Oromia  (ECHO 21 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rains at the end of September in West Guji, Oromia have particularly hit three districts (Qarca, Hamballa and Bule) where 5,226 households (38,628 people) have been impacted. Over 4,460  ha of cropland have been damaged.The emergency response is focusing on food items, non-food items, household NFIs and health.In West Hararge Zone, at least 22 people have lost their lives in a landslide that occurred on 9 October, that also left three people missing and 72 people wounded in its wake. Property and cropland have been destroyed too. It is estimated that 604 households (2,584 people) have been affected. Search and rescue operations continue to find survivors.Displaced people who have taken refuge in other areas are in urgent need of food, non-food items, shelter, health and other basic necessities.

title: Sierra Leone - Floods  (ECHO 21 Oct 2024)
description: Since 23 September, Sierra Leone has been experiencing extensive flooding due to heavy rainfall, that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), as of 8 October, 716 people have been displaced due to the overflow of the Bumbuna dam in Bumbuna town, in the central of Tonkolili District (Northern province), and 23,596 people have been affected floods across Bo, Bonthe, Bombali, Falaba, Kambia, Moyamba, Tonkolili, Port Loko, Pujehun, and the Western Area districts, the worst affected areas. In addition, 167 houses, including schools and hospitals, have been destroyed, and 7,374 ha of crops have been flooded.DG ECHO has allocated EUR 200,000 to contribute to the Disaster Response Emergency Fund (DREF) of the International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC) to assist floods affected people in the country.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 20 Oct 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact and the amount of damage are increasing following the severe weather conditions and consequent floods that have been affecting 16 districts of Sri Lanka.According to the National Disaster Relief Services Centre, the death toll stands at three, while 10,743 people have been evacuated to 80 safety centres. Moreover, 155,759 people have been affected, Colombo and Gampaha districts are the worst-hit. One house has been fully damaged, and 490 others are partially damaged.For the next 24 hours, showers with localised thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-western and Northern provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya and Trincomalee districts.

title: Thailand - Floods (ECHO 20 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the far southern Thailand, in particular the Nakhon Si Thammarat and the Yala provinces in the Malay peninsula since 11 October, causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 15 October, three fatalities, of which two in the Phrom Khiri district, Nakhon Si Thammarat province and one more in the Betong district, Yala province. In addition, media also reports six evacuated people, four rescued people and two destroyed houses across both the aforementioned districts.Over the next 96 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole of peninsular Thailand.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 20 Oct 2024)
description: Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano, located in East Flores regency, East Nusa Tenggara province is increasing its activity. On 12 October, two major explosions were reported and the ash column reached 1 km above the summit of the crater. The activity is still ongoing.Following this volcanic events, the ash fall reached the two sub-districts in East Flores regency and one sub-district in Sikka regency.The alert level of the volcano is at level 3 (standby), all activities within a radius of 3 km from the crater and sectorally 4 km in the north-northeast direction and 5 km in the northeast sector are forbidden.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Oct 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds affected south-eastern and central Brazil, in particular the Sao Paulo state and the capital city Brasilia over 11-12 October, causing several severe weather-related incidents, mainly due to the strong wind that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 14 October, eight fatalities, of which seven across the Sao Paulo state and one more in the capital city Brasilia. In addition, media also report two injured persons, of which one in the greater Sao Paulo area and one in the Brasilia city.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the area of the capital city Brasilia, while no more rainfall is forecast over the whole Sao Paulo state.

title: United States - Hurricane MILTON, update (ECHO 19 Oct 2024)
description: Hurricane MILTON made landfall over the Sarasota city area, just south of the Tampa city area, western coast of the central Florida peninsula on 10 October around 0.30 UTC, with maximum sustained winds of 205 km/h (category 3 hurricane). After that, it passed over the central Florida peninsula in the morning  of 10 October and continued eastward over the North Atlantic Ocean, further weakening and dissipating on 11 October.Its passage caused very heavy rainfall, strong winds, storm surges and severe flooding. HOPE reports, as of 12 October, 17 fatalities across the Florida peninsula.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 13 October, nearly 2,800 still evacuated people in 40 shelters, around 3,500 evacuated households - in Hernando county alone - 573 rescued people, 50 closed roads and six counties still under evacuation orders across the Florida peninsula. The Government of Florida declared the state of emergency for 51 counties, out of a total of 67.Over the next 48 hours, drier conditions are expected over the whole of Florida.

title: Forest fire in Portugal - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR760] Wildfire in Portugal

title: Greece - Wildfire (ECHO 05 Oct 2024)
