description: On 26 August, tropical cyclone SHANSHAN continued moving north and strenghtening over the far northern Philippine Sea and over the northern Ryukyu islands (far southern Japan) toward the Kyushu island (south-western Japan).According to the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), on 27 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located offshore, approximately 310 km south of the Kagoshima city area (southern Kyushu island), with maximum sustained winds of 185 km/h (typhoon).As of 27 August, national authorities have issued a number of evacuation orders across the Kyushu island.SHANSHAN is forecast to continue moving northward and to make landfall over the western Kagoshima prefecture on 29 August early in the morning (UTC) with maximum sustained winds up to approximately 175 km/h.Over the next 96 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over southern (including the Ryukyu islands) and central Japan.

title: USA - Landslide and floods (ECHO 01 Sep 2024)
description: Landslides and floods, triggered by heavy rainfall, have been affecting several parts of the United States in the last few days, causing casualties and severe damage.According to media, as of 26 August, a landslide occurred in Alaska (north-western United States) on 25 August at 8:00 UTC, one person died, three people have been injured and 100 have been evacuated in Ketchikan city in the Ketchikan Gateway Borough on Revillagigedo Island in southern Alaska. Power outages and communication disruptions have also been reported.The same sources report flooding in Havasu Creek in the Grand Canyon National Park, in northern Arizona (south-western United States), on 22 August,  where one person died and 100 people have been evacuated.On 27-28 August, rainfall is expected over southern Alaska and drier conditions are expected over the affected areas in Arizona.

title: Brazil - Wildfires (ECHO 01 Sep 2024)
description: Wildfires are ravaging the southeastern state of Sao Paulo, killing two people and disrupting traffic on a dozen of highways. 800 people were evacuated.A crisis cabinet has been set up by the São Paulo state government, which has decreed a state of emergency in 45 municipalities and has put 48 Brazilian cities on high alert. In addition, at least 7,300 government workers and volunteers, plus a military aircraft have been deployed.Brazil has been hit by a series of extreme weather events, such as a massive wildfire in the Pantanal wetlands in June and a record number of fires in the Amazon rainforest in July, confirming that this year's wildfire season started earlier and is more intense than in previous years.

title: Indonesia - Flash floods (ECHO 01 Sep 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central-eastern Indonesia (in particular the Maluku islands) since 25 August, causing flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) and the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) report, as of 27 August, 16 fatalities, three persons still missing and 15 injured people due to flash floods occurred in the Ternate regency (North Maluku province). In addition, same sources also reports 25 damaged houses and a total of approximately 600 affected people.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the Maluku islands.

title: Sudan - Flash floods (ECHO 01 Sep 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact of the widespread flooding caused by heavy rainfall, which has been affecting Sudan since July, is still increasing.As a result of the flood, the Arba’at Dam, located approximately 38 km northwest of Port Sudan, collapsed, reportedly killing at least 132 people according to AFP. Approximately 50,000 people living on the western side of the Dam have been severely affected.According to UN OCHA, the floods had already displaced at least 118,000 people prior to the dam collapse, and 317,000 were already affected across 16 of the 18 Sudanese states. The worst affected states are Khartoum, Gezira, Kordofan and Darfur.The floods also contribute to the spread of waterborne diseases. In August, WHO reported at least 11,327 cholera cases in Sudan, 316 of them deadly, since June 2023.

title: Forest fire in Portugal - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR748] Wildfire in Central Madeira, Portugal

title: Thailand - Landslides and floods (ECHO 31 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Thailand since 16 August, causing floods and landslides that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 26 August, at least 22 people died, including 13 people due to a landslide in Phuket island, where 20 people have also been injured, 20 have been sheltered and 209 houses have been affected. In addition, at least 30,000 people have been affected by floods across five provinces, including Chiang Rai, Sukhothai and Prae in northern Thailand.On 26-27 August, more rainfall is expected over the whole country.

title: Nigeria - Floods (ECHO 31 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Nigeria since 20 August, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 24 August, at least 33 people died, 44,000 have been displaced and 7,800 houses have been destroyed in Jigawa State in northern Nigeria.  UN OCHA reports, as of 23 August, 45 missing people, 10,264 displaced people, 12,583 affected people and 298 destroyed houses due to floods across the Adamawa state in north-eastern Nigeria.For the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecasted over the whole country, with locally very heavy rainfall in the western part of Nigeria.

title: India - Floods update (ECHO 31 Aug 2024)
description: Tripura, located in Northeast India, has experienced significant flooding due to extraordinary rainfall over a 72-hour period starting as of 19 August 2024.The floods and resulting landslides have affected nearly 1.7 million residents across all eight districts, leading to the displacement of over 117,000 people who are now sheltered in 557 relief camps organized by the district authorities.The State Emergency Operations Center (SEOC) has confirmed 26 fatalities and reported that approximately 20,300 homes have been damaged.In response to the crisis, five teams comprising the National Disaster Response Force and the State Disaster Response Force, with a total of 500 volunteers, are actively involved in conducting relief and rescue operations. These teams have successfully distributed 27,000 food packets to those affected by the flooding.

title: Bangladesh – Flash Floods  (ECHO 31 Aug 2024)
description: According to the Disaster Management Ministry, at least 20 casualties have been reported and more than 5.2 million affected by flash floods induced by heavy rains and rush of water from upstream in eastern Bangladesh. 1,047,029 people are trapped in floodwaters in 11 districts, with 77 upazilas almost completely submerged. At least 415,273 people have taken shelter in 3,654 shelter centres. The most affected districts are Noakhali, Feni and Cumilla with strong currents washing away parts of embankments. About 1.1 million still remain without electricity.Rescue operations are still ongoing and insufficient assistance is being provided by the government and humanitarian partners (including Red Cross, WFP and Start Fund) via cash, rice and dry food. 748 medical teams have been deployed. Relief materials could not reach many remote areas which remain inaccessible. Drinking water and food have been reported among the most urgent needs.While the rainfall situation may improve in the next 48 hours, the water in the rivers continues to flow above the danger level.

title: Iceland - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 28 Aug 2024)
description: A new volcanic eruption began on 22 August after an intense earthquake that occurred at 20:48 UTC in the Sundhnúks crater row, near Grindavik, on the Reykjanes Peninsula in south-western Iceland.As of 22 August, the Icelandic Met Office (IMO) reports that a fissure has opened between Stóra-Skógfell and Sýlingarfell. A gas plume reached approximately 1 km height and the lava has flowed east and west towards Grindavíkurvegur, it is not flowing towards Grindavik.According to the Icelandic Civil Protection, Grindavík town was evacuated, and some roads have been closed.National authorities declared a state of emergency due to volcanic eruption.

title: Hawaii (USA) - Tropical storm HONE (ECHO 28 Aug 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named HONE formed over the Pacific Ocean on 22 August and started moving west toward Hawaii, as a tropical storm. On 23 August at 6.00 UTC its centre was located approximately 1,200 km south-east of Hawaii's main island, with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h.HONE is forecast to continue moving westward over the ocean and to pass approximately 160 km south of Hawaii's main island on 25 August in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 111 km/h (tropical storm).Heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over Hawaii's main island starting on 26 August. NOAA has issued a tropical storm watch over Hawaii.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, thunderstorms and lightning continued to affect most of Sri Lanka over the last week, causing floods, landslides and several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage. The affected provinces are: Sabaragamuwa, Northern, Eastern, Western, Southern and North Western.The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports, as of 23 August, three fatalities (two in the Western province and one in the Sabaragamuwa province). In addition, DMC reports one person still missing, two injured and 72 evacuated in three shelters. 141 houses have been damaged and nearly 40,500 people have been affected across ten districts throughout the affected provinces.Over the next 72 hours, no rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Thailand - Floods and landslides (ECHO 27 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rain has been affecting Thailand since 16 August, causing floods, flash floods and landslides that resulted in widespread damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 21 August, 20,105 people and 4,021 houses have been affected across Phetchabun, Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai, Nan, Phayao, Lampang, Phrae, Udon Thani, Rayong and Phuket provinces.On 22-23 August, more rainfall is expected over the whole country, with localised heavy rainfall over the northern part of Thailand.

title: India - Landslide (ECHO 27 Aug 2024)
description: A massive landslide event occurred in Sikkim state (north-eastern India) on 20 August, causing population displacement and severe damage.Media report, as of 22 August, six evacuated families in one relief camp, 18 damaged houses and disrupted roads in the area of  the Dipu Dara village (Singtam municipality, Gangtok district, southern Sikkim state) due to a landslide that occurred on 20 August. In addition, media also report damage to a hydroelectric power plant on the Teesta river.There are over 34,000 displaced in 346 camps in Tripura, 10 fatalities, with disruptions to roads and communications affecting daily life and emergency response.The India Meteorological Department (IMD) downgraded the rainfall alert from red to orange on 22 August. Rivers Khowai, Howrah, Manu, and Gomati are above danger levels. Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole of Sikkim state.

title: China - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southeastern China (particularly Guangdong province) over the past 48 hours, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in population displacements and damage.Media report, as of 22 August, approximately 86,000 preventively evacuated people and several flight and railway disruptions across 65 townships and sub-districts in the Guangdong province.Over the next 24 hours, according to the China Meteorological Administration (CMA), more heavy rainfall is forecast over the already affected Guangdong province.

title: Vietnam - Floods and landslides (ECHO 27 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Vietnam since 20 August, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage. The affected provinces are: Bac Kan, Hoa Binh, Quang Ninh, Tuyen Quang, Yen Bai and Dien Bien.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 22 August, one fatality in the Tuyen Quang province. In addition, ADINet reports approximately 140 affected people, 35 damaged houses and one damaged school across the aforementioned affected provinces.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole of northern Vietnam.

title: Bangladesh – Flash Floods  (ECHO 27 Aug 2024)
description: Floods in eastern Bangladesh, caused by heavy monsoon rains and upstream onrush of water, have impacted 3 million people since 21 August.Over 60,000 people are displaced in 500 communal shelters, and one casualty has been reported.Affected districts have been without electricity since 20 August. The government has provided dry food and cash and the army has been deployed for rescue operations.An assessment will be conducted next week, led by the UN Resident Coordinator Office.Bangladesh Meteorological Department issued a warning for heavy rainfall for the next 48 hours and the floods situation may further worsen in the days to come.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorms and strong winds affected southern Italy on 19 August, causing severe weather-related incidents.As of 21 August, according to media, one person died, six are still missing, and 15 have been rescued due to a severe weather-related incident that occurred on the sea close to the coast of Palermo city, in Sicily region.On 21-22 August, drier conditions are expected over the affected area.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind and thunderstorms have been affecting north-eastern United States since 18 August, causing floods and flash floods.As of 21 August, media report two fatalities while hundreds of people have been rescued due to flooding of the Little River in Oxford municipality, south-western Connecticut State. Several houses, roads and bridges have been damaged and a landslide blocked the railway in Seymour municipality. In Fairfield County a severe weather-related incident has led to evacuations. In New York City, more than 700 flights have been cancelled from three airports.On 21-22 August, more rainfall and thunderstorms are forecast over the north-eastern United States.

title: Republic of Korea, Democratic People's Republic of Korea - Tropical storm JONGDARI update (ECHO 26 Aug 2024)
description: Storm JONGDARI made landfall as a tropical depression over the border area between the Republic of Korea and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK), just west of Seoul, on 20 August. On 21 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located inland over south-eastern DPRK, as a tropical depression.Its passage caused a number of evacuation orders and some material damage across southern Republic of Korea and the Seoul area.JONGDARI is forecast to continue moving northeastward over the Sea of Japan, dissipating on 21 August in the afternoon (UTC).Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the whole Korean peninsula.

title: Kyrgyzstan  - Landslides and flash floods (ECHO 26 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern Kyrgyzstan (in particular Issyk-Kul, the easternmost region of the country) over the past few days, triggering mudslides and causing flash floods that have resulted in widespread damage.Media report, as 21 August, one destroyed house, nearly 500 damaged houses and several damaged roads across the villages of Kyzyl-Suu, Bulan Sogottu, Korumdu, Temir and Jeti-Oguz (Issyk-Kul region), mainly due to mudslides occurred on 18 August in the evening (UTC).Over the next 72 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over parts of the Issyk-Kul region.

title: India - Monsoon rains, floods and landslides update (ECHO 26 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy monsoon rains and thunderstorms continue to affect several states of India, triggering landslides and causing floods, flash floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents (mainly due to lightning) that have resulted in an increased number of casualties and severe damage.The National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports, as of 21 August, 15 fatalities across seven states: five fatalities in Madhya Pradesh, three in Uttarakhand, two in Maharashtra, two in Assam, one in Karnataka, one in Himachal Pradesh and one in Tamil Nadu over the period from 16 to 18 August. In addition, NDMI reports around 8,600 evacuated people, 259 damaged houses and more than 101,300 affected people across the affected area during the same period.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the country, except over western India.

title: France - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Aug 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been affecting southern France since 18 August, resulting in evacuations and damage.As of 20 August, media reports that a wildfire has been burning an area of two hectares (ha) in Canet-en-Roussillon municipality in Perpignan district in the north-western Pyrénées-Orientales department in Occitanie region, leaving thirteen injured people, including two firefighters, and the evacuation of 3,000 people from a camp area to an evacuation centre. In addition, one mobile home has been destroyed, and several structures have been affected by the wildfire. Another wildfire in Frontignan municipality in the Hérault department burnt an area of 350 ha and caused the evacuation of dozens of people.The same source reports that the national authorities deployed 600 firefighters and that the wildfires are under control.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is from very high to extreme in the affected area.

title: Republic of Korea, Democratic People's Republic of Korea - Tropical storm JONGDARI (ECHO 25 Aug 2024)
description: A new tropical storm named JONGDARI formed over the southern East China Sea (in the area of the Ryukyu islands, far southern Japan) on 19 August early in the morning (UTC) and started moving north toward the Korean peninsula, as a tropical storm. On 20 August at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the East China Sea approximately 225 km south of the Jeju-Do Island and 345 km south of the Jeollanam-do province (southern Republic of Korea), with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h (tropical storm).JONGDARI is forecast to continue moving northward and to make landfall as a tropical depression on 20 August late in the evening (UTC) over the border area between the Republic of Korea and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK).Over 20-22 August, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the whole Korean peninsula.

title: Mexico - Severe weather (ECHO 25 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected Jalisco State in central-western Mexico on 14 August, causing a dam overflow that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), as of 15 August, one person died, 40 people have been displaced, 137 houses have been affected and 10 have been damaged due to the La Tecata Dam overflow in Zapotlanejo municipality in central Jalisco State.On 20-21 August, more rainfall is expected over Mexico with locally very heavy rainfall and thunderstorms on the western and eastern coast of Mexico.

title: Guatemala - Rainy season, update (ECHO 25 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting most of the country since the beginning of the rainy season (May 2024) causing floods, landslides and a number of severe weather-related incidents (in particular due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage.The National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED) and WHO PAHO report, as of 19 August, 22 fatalities across nine departments of the country, where the worst affected is Suchitepéquez with four fatalities. In addition, CONRED reports one person still missing, 13 injured and 23,235 evacuated, with approximately 15,500 people further affected. More than 8,300 damaged buildings (of which 373 are severely damaged) and five destroyed bridges were also reported across the country.Over the next 72 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over most of the country.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 25 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting Sumatra Island in south-western Indonesia since 18 August, causing floods and river overflow that resulted in population displacement and damage.As of 19 August, the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports 670 displaced people, 1,362 affected people and 339 affected houses in Aceh Jaya regency in Aceh province (northern Sumatra Island), and 2,400 affected people in Nias Utara regency in North Sumatra province.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over northern Sumatra Island.

title: Libya - Floods (ECHO 25 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-western Libya (in particular the south-western Fezzan region, bordering Algeria) since 16 August, causing floods that have resulted in population displacements and damage.IOM DTM reports, as of 18 August, more than 5,800 displaced people across Ghat, Albarkat, Tahala and Issein towns (Ghat district), where the Ghat town is the worst affected with 3,280 displaced people. In addition, IOM DTM reports that displaced people are sheltering in 14 temporary accommodation centres across Ghat and Tahala towns.Over the next 72 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Portugal - Wildfire (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: A wildfire has been affecting central Madeira Island, western Portugal, since 14 August, resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the wildfire has burnt so far an area of 6,983 ha.As of 19 August, media reports that at least 160 people have been preventively evacuated across Ribeira Brava and Camara de Lobos municipalities in central Madeira island, and 50 are sheltered in two evacuation centres. The same source reports that the national authorities deployed 200 firefighters, 38 vehicles, and one helicopter. The wildfire is under control over most of the perimeter, with an active front under suppression.The rescue resources on the island of Madeira were supplemented by emergency professionals from the mainland and the Azores, totaling 91 individuals.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is very high in Madeira Island.

title: Russia - Earthquake and volcanic eruption (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: An earthquake of magnitude 7 M at a depth of 29 km occurred on 17 August at 19:10 UTC (18 August 7:10 local time) in the sea at approximately 10 km south-east of the Kamchatka peninsula. The epicentre was located approximately 102 km east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky City.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 3,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and 257,000 to moderate shaking.According to media, as of 18 August, the strong earthquake triggered the eruption of the Shiveluch volcano causing an ash plume of 9,000m and an ashfall in the Ust-Kamchatsk village in the Ust-Kamchatsk district, in the eastern Kamchatka (Far Eastern Federal District).There are no reports of any damage or casualties, neither due to the earthquake nor to the volcanic eruption.

title: Japan - Tropical cyclone AMPIL, update (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: The passage of the typhoon AMPIL over the northern Pacific Ocean, close to central Honshu island (particularly nearby the Greater Tokyo Area) on 16 August caused heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges.The Fire and Disaster Management Agency (FDMA) reported, as of 17 August, four injured people, two of which in the Kanagawa prefecture and one each in the Fukushima and the neighbouring Ibaraki prefecture.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall is still forecast over central Honshu island.

title: Nepal - Flash floods and landslides (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: A glacial lake outburst occurred in the Koshi province (the easternmost province of Nepal) on 16 August, causing flash floods and mudslides that have resulted in population displacement and damage.Media report, as of 19 August, 135 displaced people, of which 42 in shelters, 93 rescued people, 20 destroyed houses, one destroyed school and one destroyed health facility across the area of the Thame village (Solukhumbu district, Koshi province).Over the next 72 hours, very heavy precipitation is forecast over the whole country.

title: Pakistan - Severe weather and floods, update  (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: Flash floods have killed 8 people, injured dozens and damaged crops and infrastructure in Pakistan. Landslides and snow melting in various regions of Ghizer district have affected 85 houses and 45 cattle shelters. The Karakoram Highway has been blocked at three locations.Rains continued affecting Sindh province, with Sukkur city receiving 227 mm rain in 24 hours. 5 people died, 29 were injured and 126 houses fully or partially damaged in the last 24 hours.Baluchistan remained cut off from the rest of the country as floods wreak havoc, blocking highways and washing away railway lines. The worst affected districts include Chaman, Qilla Abdullah, Mastung, and Jafferabad.The NDMA reports 195 deaths, 362 injuries, and 2,293 houses partially or fully damaged since 1 July, 2024.The Pakistan Meteorological Department forecasted flash flooding in the Hill Torrents of DG Khan division and in the Nullahs of Sibbi, Nasirabad, Zhob, Kalat Larkana and Hyderabad (Dadu and Naushahro Feroze Districts) Divisions from 17 August (evening) to 19 August 2024.

title: Chad - Floods, update (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact of the widespread flooding caused by rainfall and strong winds that have been affecting central and south-western Chad is increasing.As of 16 August, media report at least 54 fatalities, while the most affected area is the Tibesti region, in north-western Chad. The UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) reports more than 5,300 displaced people, 261,000 people affected by floods and 16,200 damaged or destroyed houses from 15 July to 15 August.On 19-20 August, more rainfall is forecast over western and southern Chad, with locally very heavy rainfall in the western part of the country.

title: Ethiopia - Floods (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall in Gambella region, western Ethiopia, has caused the Baro and Gilo rivers to overflow.30,145 people from six woredas (towns) in Anywaa, Nuer zone have been affected and a total of 21,060 people have been displaced, out of whom close to 5,000 are children under five.The floods damaged homes and properties, destroyed over 2,000 hectares of cultivated land, and have contaminated water supply schemes, causing sanitation issues and a major shortage in drinking water. A severe malaria outbreak has been reported in the area. 12 health facilities and 46 schools have been flooded.The most urgent needs of the displaced are food security, NFIs, WASH, health, and education.

title: Türkiye - Wildfire (ECHO 24 Aug 2024)
description: A huge wildfire has been burning across western Türkiye (in particular in the Izmir province) since 13 August, causing population evacuations and damage.According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the wildfire has burnt an area of nearly 4,000 hectares in the area of the coastal city of Izmir. The wildfire is not yet fully contained.Media report, as of 19 August, approximately 4,000 evacuated people, 29 injured people and 17 destroyed houses across the affected area.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is expected to be high across most of western Türkiye.

title: Spain - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting the Balearic Islands in eastern Spain since 14-15 August, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 15 August, at least nine people have been injured due to a severe weather-related incident on Formentera Island, and 39 people have been evacuated in central Palma de Mallorca due to floods, including 29 from a train on the line between Palma and Manacor municipalities. In addition, several boats have been damaged in the affected ports and at least 50 flights were cancelled across the airports in the Balearic Islands.On 16-17 August, more rainfall and storms are expected, which may be locally heavy over the Balearic Islands.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms affected central and south-eastern France on 13 August, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 15 August, according to media, one person died due to a severe weather-related incident in Pressins municipality, in the Isère department, and two people have been injured in Duingt in Haute-Savoie department (Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region). In addition, at least 160,000 people have been affected by power outages in the Haute-Savoie department and dozens of roads were temporarily closed due to severe weather conditions, including one main road between Lyon and Grenoble in Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region.

title: Canada - Wildfires  (ECHO 21 Aug 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been affecting northern Manitoba province, in particular the Oxford House community, in central Canada, since 13 August, resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the burnt area is more than 9,240 ha in Oxford House.As of 15 August, media reported that at least 2,500 people were evacuating from the First Nation community of Oxford House to Winnipeg, Brandon and Thompson cities. The wildfire is still out of control.Over the next 24 hours, according to GWIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from low to high in the affected areas.

title: Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Bermuda - Tropical cyclone ERNESTO, update (ECHO 21 Aug 2024)
description: On 14-15 August, tropical cyclone ERNESTO continued moving northward over the North Atlantic Ocean, strengthening. On 16 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the ocean, approximately 490 km south-west of Bermuda, with maximum sustained winds of 155 km/h (cat. 2 hurricane).Its passage close to Puerto Rico on 13-14 August caused heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges that have resulted in 341 people evacuated in 108 shelters across the island.ERNESTO is forecast to pass over Bermuda on 17 August around 12.00 UTC, with maximum sustained winds of 157 km/h (cat. 2 hurricane).Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over Bermuda starting from the afternoon of 16 August. NOAA has issued a hurricane warning over Bermuda.

title: Japan - Tropical cyclone AMPIL (ECHO 21 Aug 2024)
description: On 14-15 August, tropical cyclone AMPIL continued moving north over the northern Pacific Ocean toward central Honshu island (the main island of Japan), strengthening, as a typhoon. According to the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), on 16 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located offshore, near the coast of central Honshu island, approximately 190 km south-east of the Greater Tokyo Area, with maximum sustained winds of 185 km/h (typhoon).Media report, as of 16 August, preventive evacuation orders for around 17,000 households issued by national authorities across the Greater Tokyo Area and the coastal areas of central Honshu island.On 16 August, AMPIL is forecast to continue moving north-eastward over the ocean, close to the coast of central Honshu island, strengthening, with maximum sustained winds up to 210 km/h. On 17 August, it is expected to continue moving north-eastward well off the coast of northern Honshu island, weakening, with maximum sustained winds of 165 km/h.Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over central and northern Honshu island.

title: Forest fire in Greece - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR746] Wildfire in Attica region, Greece

title: Pakistan - Monsoon season, update (ECHO 19 Aug 2024)
description: The number of casualties is increasing due to the monsoon rainfalls that have been affecting several Provinces of Pakistan causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents (mainly due to the strong wind).Over the 24 hours from 12 to 13 August, the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) reports three fatalities (two in the Balochistan province and one more in the Punjab province) and five injured people.Since the beginning of the monsoon season (late June), 179 fatalities, 315 injured people, 2,234 damaged houses and 28 damaged bridge were reported by NDMA across the country. The most affected provinces are Punjab and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over northern Pakistan.

title: Libya - flooding  (ECHO 19 Aug 2024)
description: Nearly 3,000 individuals have been displaced in Alkufra and Rabiana (southeastern Libya) after an unprecedented rainfall, the highest recorded since 1946, caused flooding and a power outage on 11 August 2024.As a result of the flooding, Al Kufra Central Hospital and Al Kufra Maternity Hospital are currently out of service. A total of 24 patients, including 10 critical Intensive Care Units cases (9 of whom are Sudanese refugees), have been urgently transferred to Alhawari Rural Hospital and two private clinics. Unfortunately, the hospital’s pharmacy and main stock have been completely damaged by the floods.To address the immediate healthcare needs, 4 WHO mobile clinics have been set up in front of Al-Kufra Hospital to provide temporary services to the affected population, emergency kits have been shipped from Benghazi and 6 tons of pharmaceutical material have been sent to Alhawari hospital.According to field reports, around 600 individuals, including 50 Sudanese families, are sheltered in four schools, one guesthouse and one health centre in the municipalities of Alkufra and Rabiana.

title: Italy - Wildfire (ECHO 18 Aug 2024)
description: A wildfire has been burning in Terracina municipality in Latina province, Lazio region, in central Italy since 11 August, resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the wildfire has burnt approximately 273 hectares.According to media reports, as of 12 August, at least 50 people have been evacuated from ten houses in San Silviano e Campolungo areas to one temporary shelter in Terracina.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme in the Lazio region.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 18 Aug 2024)
description: Wildfires have been burning across the Attica region (central Greece, near Athens) since 10 August, causing casualties and damage.According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the main wildfire has burnt approximately 10,630 hectares in the East Attica regional unit (Attica region).As of 13 August, media report one fatality in Vrilissia municipality in North Athens region, 18 injured people and thousands evacuated people around Varnavas, Marathon, Penteli, and Dionysos municipalities (East Attica regional unit, Attica region). In addition, in Penteli municipality, at least three hospitals have been evacuated.National authorities deployed 685 firefighters, 190 vehicles, 17 helicopters and 16 aircraft.On 12 August, Greece activated the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM). The Emergency Response Coordination Centre (ERCC) mobilised two rescEU firefighting planes from Italy and a rescEU helicopter from France and Serbia deployed one helicopter. In addition, Czechia, France, Italy, Serbia and Romania deployed ground firefighting teams while Romanian and Moldovan firefighters, already prepositioned in Greece under the UCPM, were among the first responders battling the fires.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 12 August to provide an initial rough estimation, fire extent and damage assessment, one map has been produced so far.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected from high to very extreme in the affected areas.

title: Japan - Tropical cyclone MARIA, update (ECHO 18 Aug 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone MARIA passed over over northern Miyagi, Iwate and Akita prefectures (far northern Honshu island, the main island of Japan) on 12 August in the morning (UTC) as a tropical storm and dissipated over the eastern Sea of Japan between 12 August in the evening and 13 August very early in the morning.After its passage, media report, as of 13 August, approximately 2,000 evacuated people across the Iwate prefecture and evacuation advices for around 170,000 people across Iwate, Miyagi and Aomori prefectures.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over central and northern Honshu island and over the central and southern neighbouring Hokkaido island.

title: Lesser Antilles, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico - Tropical cyclone ERNESTO (ECHO 18 Aug 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named ERNESTO formed over the western Atlantic Ocean on 11 August in the evening (UTC) and started moving west toward the Leeward Islands (the northern part of the Lesser Antilles), streghtening. On 13 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 65 km east of the Guadeloupe island (France) and 570 km south-east of Puerto Rico (USA), with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h (tropical storm).ERNESTO is forecast to continue moving northwestward over northern Guadeloupe island and closes to the Montserrat island (UK) on 13 August, sightly strenghtening but remaining a tropical storm. After that it is forecast to pass between the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico on 14 August in the morning, as a tropical storm.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over the Leeward Islands, the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico. NOAA has issued a tropical storm warning over these islands.

title: Uganda - Landslide, update (ECHO 18 Aug 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact due to the landslide triggered by heavy rainfall that occurred in Kampala city, in central-southern Uganda, on 9 August, is increasing.As of 13 August, according to media reports, at least 25 people died due to a landslide in a garbage dump, at least five of them are children, 14 people have been rescued and 14 have been injured. Rescue operations are still ongoing though with no hope of finding more people alive. It is unclear how many people remain unaccounted for. A new crack has developed in the garbage heap posing a risk of more damage to about 100 households if it collapses.On 13-14 August, more rainfall is expected over northern and central Uganda, with locally heavy rainfall.

title: Greece - Wildfire  (ECHO 05 Aug 2024)
description: A wildfire has been burning in Evia Island in southern Greece since 29 July. According to the European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the burnt area is approximately 790 hectares across Petries, Krieza, and Alonia in Central Greece.According to national authorities and media reports, as of 30 July, two firefighters have been slightly injured and several villages have been evacuated, including Krieza, Koskina and Petries. National authorities have deployed 205 firefighters, 11 ground forest firefighting units, 56 vehicles, 16 aircraft and 10 helicopters to control the wildfire.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 30 July for the wildfire affecting Petries and Krieza municipalities to provide initial rough estimation, fire extent and damage assessment emergency mapping.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from extreme to very extreme in southern Evia Island.

title: North Macedonia - Wildfires (ECHO 05 Aug 2024)
description: North Macedonia continues to experience widespread wildfires across the country, particularly in the northern, eastern, and southern regions, which are leading to casualties and damage.According to media, one person died in Kokosinje village (north-eastern Macedonia) and three others have been injured. In addition, several people have been evacuated, and several houses damaged and destroyed.On 30 July, North Macedonia requested three aerial forest firefighting modules with helicopters and two modules with planes through the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM),and the ERCC mobilised two rescEU airtractors from Germany and one rescEU helicopter from Czech Republic.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to locally extreme across most parts of the whole country, particularly due to very dry and hot conditions and strong winds.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 05 Aug 2024)
description: Wildfires have been impacting parts of USA, resulting in casualties and evacuations. At least four major wildfires are burning across California and Washington.The Park fire (Butte/Tehama, county, California), is burning 151,092 ha and following this event, almost 17,000 have been evacuated. In the Borel fire (Kern country, California), which is burning an area of 22,419 ha, three people have been injured and 2,400 people have been evacuated. Furthermore, the Swawilla fire (Ferry county, Washington) is affecting an area of 19,097 ha and has resulted in four injured people and more than 700 evacuated people.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate high to locally extreme in the affected counties.

title: Sudan - Flood (ECHO 05 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern Sudan since 26 July, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage. Kassala, Aj Jazirah, East Darfur and North Kordofan are the states most affected.According to UN agencies, as of 31 July, in Kassala state, in Shagarab at least 400 shelters, several roads, water and sanitation infrastructures have been damaged. In Aj Jazirah, East Darfur and North Kordofan at least 280 households have been affected.Floodwaters have submerged roads and damaged water and sanitation infrastructure, forcing many IDPs to live in the open along roadsides without access to food, drinking water, or sanitation. There are rising fears of outbreaks of deadly water-borne diseases.On 31 July-1 August, more rainfall is expected in the central and southern parts of the country.

title: Mali - Floods (ECHO 05 Aug 2024)
description: Since 22 July, Bla town, in Segou region (central Mali), has been experiencing days with heavy rainfall, causing floods that have resulted in damage.According to UN OCHA, as of 29 July, 8,700 people have been affected in the aforementioned town.Regional authorities are coordinating the response for those affected by the floods.On 31 August, no rain is expected while on 1 August isolated light rainfall is forecast over the hit region.

title: Lithuania, Latvia - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 04 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting Lithuania and Latvia since 29 July, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, in Lithuania, one person died in Vilnius city due to a severe weather-related incident and several flights have been cancelled in Vilnius and Kaunas cities. In Latvia, around 50,000 households were affected by power outages and railway services disrupted. The most affected areas are Riga, Jelgava and Jurmala. Approximately 200,000 people have been affected by power outages across both countries.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 29 July for Latvia to provide the damage assessment.The Latvian Environment, Geology and Metereology Centre (SSLC) and State Fire and Rescue Service of Latvia have issued a yellow alert for increased water levels and will remain in force until 2 August.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is still forecast across eastern Lithuania and Latvia.

title: Albania - Wildfire (ECHO 04 Aug 2024)
description: In the past few days, a wildfire has been burning in the Shëngjin Mountain (Lezhë County, northwestern Albania), resulting in evacuations. As of 29 July, the extent of the burnt area is about 103 ha, as recorded by the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS).According to media, on 29 July, the fire advanced towards the tourist areas of Rana e Hedhun, causing the evacuations of several tourists and residents on the night of the same day. National authorities deployed 20 firefighting vehicles over the interested zone.On 30 July, Albania activated the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) requesting aerial firefighting means to support national efforts, and the ERCC mobilised two rescEU Canadair aircraft from ItalyFor the next 72 hours, according to EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme across the affected area.

title: Mexico - Severe weather (ECHO 04 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected central Mexico on 26 July, causing evacuations and damage.According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), as of 29 July, several families have been evacuated from Charcas municipality in north-western San Luis Potosí State to three evacuation centres due to the overflow of the Charco de Álvaro Obregón dam. In addition, 27 houses have been affected, and 150 people have been affected by power outages.On 30-31 July, drier conditions are expected over the affected areas.

title: Democratic People's Republic of Korea - Floods (ECHO 04 Aug 2024)
description: On 27-28 July, heavy rainfall hit the northern parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea causing floods, the overflow of rivers and resulting in damage and evacuations.According to media, about 4,200 people have been rescued. Sinuiju City and Uiju County in North Pyongan Province near the China border are the worst-hit locations. The authorities declared emergency disaster zones in areas of Changang, North Pyongan, and Ryangang provinces along the Yalu River.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over the eastern and north-eastern parts of the country.

title: India - Landslides (ECHO 04 Aug 2024)
description: On 30 July, a series of landslides triggered by the monsoon rainfall occurred in the Wayanad district (Kerala state, southern India) and resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, at least 41 people have died, 70 others have been injured and a bridge has been destroyed. In addition, the landslides have cut off at least four villages, including Mundakkai, Chooralmala, Attamala, and Noolpuzha.The authorities deployed relief efforts in the area, with two Indian Air Force helicopters mobilised.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is expected across most parts of the affected Kerala state where red warnings for extremely heavy rain and strong winds are in effect on 30 July.

title: Myanmar - Tornado (ECHO 03 Aug 2024)
description: On 26 July, a tornado event affected two villages in Kungyangon township of Yangon region (central Mynamar) resulting in damage.According to media, over 340 people have been affected and 71 houses have been damaged (34 completely destroyed).On 29-30 July, moderate to locally heavy rainfall with localized thunderstorms are forecasted across the affected region.

title: USA - Wildfire, update (ECHO 03 Aug 2024)
description: Following the wildfires that have been burning across the western United States, in particular California, Washington and Oregon, since 17 July, the number of casualties and damage is increasing.As of 28 July, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports a total of 86 wildfires that have burnt an area of approximately 647,500 ha. In Oregon State one person died, 27 people have been injured and 2,577 are still displaced. In northern California, in Kern County, two people have been injured, 2,292 people have been displaced and a state of emergency for Butte and Tehama counties has been declared. In Yakima and Ferry counties (Washington), four people have been injured and 725 have been displaced.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to very extreme in the affected areas.

title: Uganda - Floods (ECHO 03 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected north-eastern Uganda on 24 July, causing flash floods and leading to casualties and damage.As of 29 July, according to media, two children in two separate incidents were killed by flash floods in Moroto district, one in Katanga and one in the Kakoliye area, in the north-eastern Karamoja sub-region of Uganda, due to the unusual heavy rainfall and subsequent floodings.For the next 48 hours, more rainfall is expected over northern Uganda, with locally very heavy rainfall.

title: Sudan - Floods (ECHO 03 Aug 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected eastern Sudan on 26 and 27 July, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.In Kassala, the floods have directly impacted at least 10 178 newly arrived IDPs that had fled the fighting in Sennar state. As gathering sites have been submerged, IDPs have no access to basic needs (flooded shelters, no clean drinking water etc.). According to media reports, as of 29 July, at least 12 people died in Kassala state, near the Eritrean border.Earlier last week, between 23-25 July, over 1 000 households have been displaced in the west of the country due to heavy rain and floods, mostly in North Darfur, a state already massively affected by the conflict.On 29-30 July, drier conditions are expected in the East of the country. Yet, 13 million people are projected to face exceptionally heavy rainfall between 24 and 31 July, according to the IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical Cyclone GAEMI, update (ECHO 03 Aug 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone GAEMI affected northern Philippines (22-23 July), northern Taiwan (24 July), and southeastern China (25 July), causing casualties and damage.Taiwan reported ten fatalities, while in China 15 died in a Hunan province landslide, and 3,832 were evacuated due to a river dike breach.In the Philippines, the Department of Social Welfare and Development of the Philippines (DSWD)  reports 273,757 displaced, 3,617,365 affected across 11 regions (particularly in northern Philippines) and 1,256 houses damaged or destroyed.On 28 July, the ERCC received a request for assistance from the DSWD. DSWD requests to the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) five forklifts with their operators for a period of 30 days to operate in Pasay and Valenzuela cities near Manila. The request aims to augment logistical capacities in the preparation and delivery of food from designated hubs.The Copernicus Emergency Management System () was activated in rapid mode on 25 July to support the damage assessment linked to the capsizing of a boat off Manila Bay.For the next 24 hours, moderate to local heavy rainfall is forecasted over most of the Philippines, eastern and southern Taiwan and south-eastern China.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 31 Jul 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been burning across California, Washington and Oregon (western United States), since 17 July, prompting evacuations and causing damage.As of 25 July, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports five wildfires in Oregon that have been burning a total area of approximately 266,014 ha across Baker, Malheur, Grant, Harney, Gilliam, Morrow and Umatilla counties, resulting in 21 injured people and the prompt evacuation of a total of 3,189 people. A wildfire close to Chico city in Butte county in northern California has been burning an area of approximately 2,600 ha, 2,000 people have been evacuated and 1,500 houses have been threatened. In Washington a wildfire has been burning an area of 6,000 ha near the communities of Keller, Koontsville, and Seatons Grove, 60 homes have been evacuated and 210 houses have been threatened.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to extreme in the affected areas.

title: Japan - Severe weather, floods and landslides (ECHO 31 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Japan since 25 July, in particular Yamagata, Shiga and Akita prefecture, causing floods and landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the Fire and Disaster Management Agency (FDMA) and media, as of 26 July, one person died in Omonogawa in Akita prefecture, and three people are missing, including two in Shinjo city (Yamagata prefecture) and one in Yuzawa City (Akita prefecture), two people have been injured in Okura Village in Yamagata prefecture. In addition, an evacuation order has been issued for 198,150 people across Akita, Yamagata and Shiga prefectures.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecasted over northern Japan, and emergency warnings for rainfall and landslides have been issued for the Akita prefecture.

title: India - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 31 Jul 2024)
description: Cloudburst on July 25 causes heavy rainfall and flooding across parts of India, including Maharashtra, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, and Himachal Pradesh.Casualties reported include three in Gujarat, four in Maharashtra, with media indicating higher numbers: 49 in Himachal Pradesh and 61 in Gujarat since June 2024.National Disaster Management Department records 464,532 people affected and 3,638 houses damaged as of July 24. State Governments lead search and rescue efforts, seeking additional relief support.Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) issues red alerts for "exceptionally heavy rainfall" in Maharashtra, Gujarat, and the Konkan region.

title: China, Taiwan, Philippines - Tropical Cyclone GAEMI, update (ECHO 31 Jul 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone GAEMI made landfall on 25 July in the mid-morning (UTC) over the eastern coast of Fujian province as a tropical storm and is expected to move north-west over the province and dissipate over the Jiangxi province on 27 July.According to the media, in China, more than 240,000 people were temporarily evacuated in the province of Fujian and more than 5,000 rescuers were deployed in the cities of Fuzhou, Putian and Ningde, and Pingtan County. In Taiwan, three people died following its passage on 24 July.In the Philippines, more than 1,3 million people have been affected (in combination with the southwest monsoon) and over 800 000 have been displaced.On 26-27 July, moderate to very heavy rainfall is expected to most of south-eastern China, the whole of Taiwan, southern Ryukyu islands (southern Japan) and most of the Philippines (particularly the northern regions).

title: Malawi - Drought Flash Appeal (ECHO 31 Jul 2024)
description: On 23 July, the United Nations in collaboration with the Government of Malawi launched a USD 136.5 million Flash Appeal to address the devastating impacts of El Niño-induced drought currently affecting the country. The appeal seeks to provide life-saving assistance to 4.7 million most vulnerable people.The appeal follows a declaration of a State of Disaster in 23 out of the country’s 28 districts by President Lazarus Chakwera on 23 March due to inadequate rains and prolonged dry spells that have severely damaged crops and food production. The UN urged its partners to support the cause, with top priority on food assistance, agriculture and logistics.Between May and September 2024, approximately 4.2 million people in Malawi will face acute food insecurity (IPC 3 or above) with an additional 6.7 million people classified as IPC 2. This situation is expected to deteriorate during the October 2024- March 2025 lean season with 5.7 million people (28 per cent of the population) predicted to be in IPC Phase 3 or above.

title: Ethiopia - Landslides, update (ECHO 31 Jul 2024)
description: According to UN OCHA, as of 24 July, 257 people died but the death toll is expected to rise to 500 following the landslides triggered by heavy rainfall that occurred on 21-22 July in Gezei Gofa Woreda of Gofa Zone (South Ethiopia Region, south-western Ethiopia). Over 15,000 affected people reportedly need to be evacuated.Search and rescue operations conducted by local authorities with support from the Ethiopian Red Cross Society and community members are still ongoing.The ERCC has received an urgent request for assistance from UNEP/OCHA Joint Environment Unit (JEU), asking the Union Civil Protection Mechanism to deploy one environmental expert in Ethiopia to support the response to the landslides.For the next 24 hours, the weather is forecasted to be partly cloudy with possible showers and localized thunderstorms.

title: France - Landslide (ECHO 30 Jul 2024)
description: On 24 July at 6.30 a landslide occurred near the commune of Eus, in the district of Prades, in the Pyrénées-Orientales department, in the Occitania region (southern France), causing a landslide-related incident that has resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 25 July, five people have been injured, the Perpignang-Villefranche-de-Conflent railway line has been suspended and a bridge has been damaged as a result of the train derailment caused by the landslide.Sunny conditions are expected over the affected area on 25-26 July.

title: Italy - Wildfires (ECHO 30 Jul 2024)
description: Since 24 July wildfires have been burning across the Baia San Felice area in Vieste municipality (Foggia province, Apulia region, south-eastern Italy), resulting in evacuations.According to Apulia Region, 540 people have been evacuated following the event. National authorities deployed three Canadair and two helicopters over the affected area.Over the next 72 hours, according to the JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is from high to very high over Vieste municipality.

title: Niger - Floods, update (ECHO 30 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Niger since June, causing flooding that has resulted in casualties and damage.As of 22 July, UN OCHA reports a total of 53 fatalities and at least 37,913 affected people. In addition, 1,636 houses and 29 schools have been destroyed, and 10,930 livestock have been lost.On 25-26 July, drier conditions are expected over Niger, with locally heavy rainfall over the central part of the country.

title: Taiwan, Philippines, China - Tropical Cyclone GAEMI, update (ECHO 30 Jul 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone GAEMI crossed northern Taiwan on 24 July and is moving over the Taiwan Strait approaching the coast of south-eastern China. On 25 July at 5.15 UTC, its centre was approximately 100 km east-southeast of Putian city (Fujian province, south-eastern China) with maximum sustained winds of 222 km/h (typhoon).Following its passage over northern Taiwan, media report three fatalities and 8,500 evacuated people.In the Philippines, the passage of GAEMI combined with the Southwest Monsoon has resulted in floods, displacing more than 629,000 people and affecting more than 1.1 million people throughout the country.GAEMI is forecasted to make landfall over the eastern coast of Fujian province in the morning of 25 July with maximum sustained winds up to 120 km/h. After that, it will move inland and is expected to weaken and dissipate on 27 July.Heavy rain to very heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected across the whole of Taiwan, south-eastern China, southern Ryukyu Islands and north-western Philippines. Typhoon warnings are still in effect over Taiwan and south-eastern China.

title: Italy - Volcanic activity (ECHO 29 Jul 2024)
description: On 23 July 2024 another intense eruptive episode activity taking place at Mount Etna, located in eastern Sicily, southern Italy, ended. As reported by the National Institute of Geophysics and Vulcanology (INGV) the eruptive activity began in the late afternoon of 22 July and reached its climax at 6.30 UTC of 23 July, when hundreds meter high lava fountains and an ash plume reached an altitude of 8 km above sea level.Ash fall deposits have been recorded in different localities close to the volcano, including Rifugio Sapienza, Piano Vetore, C.da Milia, Nicolosi, Tremestieri Etneo and also the area of Catania city.Following this eruption, media report that the flights landing or departing at the International Airport of Catania have been cancelled on 23 July until 16:00 UTC.

title: Phillippines, Taiwan, Japan, China - Tropical cyclone GAEMI, update (ECHO 29 Jul 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone GAEMI ("Carina" in the Philippines) is approaching north-eastern Taiwan moving north-west, and on 24 July at 0.00 UTC, its centre was approximately 200 km south-east of Yilan city, northeastern Taiwan with maximum sustained winds of 222 km/h (typhoon).According to media, residents have been evacuated in Hualien county from areas vulnerable to landslides, floods, and other disasters. In addition, several flights and train services have been cancelled in Taiwan.GAEMI is forecasted to continue north-westward over the northern Philippine Sea, and it is expected to make landfall over the north-eastern coast of Yilan county on 24 July around early afternoon, with maximum sustained winds up to 230 km/h (typhoon). After that, it will move over south-eastern China, approaching the coast of Fujian province on 25 July.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecasted over most of north-eastern Luzon Island, northern Philippines, the whole of Taiwan, southern Ryukyu Islands, southern Japan and south-eastern China. A Typhoon Warning is in effect for Taiwan.

title: Philippines - Mindanao floods and conflict (ECHO 29 Jul 2024)
description: Areas of the Philippines, especially Mindanao are currently affected by significant experiencing floods and landslides due to continuous rainfall, affecting 882,861 people of which 612,234 are displaced.In addition, armed conflict incidents affected the villages of Sitio Mapayag in Barangay, Tugal and Sitio Gibal, and Dryier in Barangay Nabalawag, in the Special Geographic Areas of the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (SGAs BARMM) on 22 July.Approximately 500 families (2,500 individuals), were displaced by the conflict to makeshift evacuation sites in nearby villages.

title: Ethiopia - Landslides, update (ECHO 29 Jul 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact is increasing following the landslides triggered by heavy rainfall that occurred on 21-22 July in Gezei Gofa Woreda of Gofa Zone (South Ethiopia Region, south-western Ethiopia).According to UN OCHA, as of 23 July, at least 157 people died and more than 14,000 people have been affected (including 6,750 people in Koncho Gozji Kebele and 7,765 people in Koncho Wiza Kebele). The death toll is expected to rise – the media reports that 229 bodies were pulled from the mud.National authorities, UN OCHA and humanitarian partners are providing the search and rescue operations and emergency support for those affected. The most acute needs among those affected are food, emergency shelter, core relief items as well as water, sanitation and hygiene.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is expected across the Gofa district.

title: Panama - Earthquakes (ECHO 28 Jul 2024)
description: An earthquake of magnitude 5.7 at a depth of 3 km occurred on 22 July at 19:19 UTC (at 14:19 local time) in the sea at approximately 4 km from the south-western coast of Panama close to the Casta Rica-Panama border. The epicentre was located approximately 5 km south-east of Puerto Armuelles city, Barú District district, Chiriquí Province.Other two aftershocks of 5.6 and 4.9 magnitude hit the area on the same day respectively at 20:17 and 20:51 UTC.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 26,000 people were exposed to very strong and 42,000 to strong shaking following the 5.7 M event.According to the National Civil Protection of Panama (SINAPROC) and media, there are no reports of any damage or casualties.

title: Ethiopia - Landslides (ECHO 28 Jul 2024)
description: On 21-22 July, three landslides triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in Gofa Zuria zone (South Ethiopia Regional State). According to the media, at least 146 people have died, including some rescuers who were deployed to the area. Search and rescue activities are still ongoing and the death toll could rise.The Ethiopian Disaster Risk Management Commission has deployed its Rapid Response Team to assess the situation and start the coordination on the ground.OCHA is joining the efforts, contributing to the assessments and mapping the humanitarian partners operating in the area and its surroundings with capacities to respond. It is planned that a first response providing NFIs to most affected households will take place on 23 July.World Vision International is implementing a multi-sectorial development program in the area, which includes a Crisis Modifier to be triggered for the response.On 23-24 July, light moderate rain is expected across the Gofa district.

title: China, Vietnam - Tropical storm PRAPIROON, update (ECHO 28 Jul 2024)
description: Tropical storm PRAPIROON passed over the Hainan Island, southern China on 22 July and continued north-west over the Gulf of Tonkin toward the border area between south-western China and north-eastern Vietnam, strengthening. It made landfall over this area on 22 July very late in the evening (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 102 km/h. On 23 July at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located inland in Vietnam, close to the coast, near the border area with south-western China, with maximum sustained winds of 83 km/.Media report, as of 23 July, approximately 6,000 isolated people across the Cat Ba and Co To islands, northern Vietnam.On 23-24 July, PRAPIROON is forecasted moving inland over the border area between south-western China and north-eastern Vietnam, further weakening as a tropical depression.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecasted over Hainan and northern Vietnam.

title: Phillippines, Taiwan - Tropical cyclone GAEMI, update (ECHO 28 Jul 2024)
description: On 22 July tropical cyclone GAEMI ("Carina" in the Philippines) continued moving north westward over the northern Philippine Sea, well off the coast of north-eastern Luzon Island, northern Philippines, further strengthening. On 23 July at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located offshore, approximately 630 km south-east of Taipei city area, northern Taiwan, with maximum sustained winds of 148 km/h (typhoon).On 23-24 July, GAEMI is forecast to continue moving north westward over the northern Philippine Sea, further strengthening, and it is expected to make landfall over the coast of north-eastern Taiwan on 24 July around 12.00 UTC, with maximum sustained winds up to 165 km/h (typhoon).Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecasted over most of Luzon Island and the whole Taiwan. PAGASA has issued a tropical cyclone wind signal no.2 over the Batanes islands, far northern Philippines.

title: Mozambique – Drought (ECHO 28 Jul 2024)
description: The main 2023/2024 cropping season was impacted by El Niño-induced drought occurring around the vital period of the farming season from December 2023 to February 2024, with a consecutive 30-day dry spell. In collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture and Mozambique Vulnerability Assessment Committee (MOZVAC), Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) conducted an assessment to better comprehend the magnitude of the drought’s effects on food production.The assessment confirmed a reduction of 25% over the previous year of the national planted hectarage due to drought, with biggest reductions reported in Manica (36%), Sofala (34%) and Gaza (25%) provinces. Maize yields fell below the 5-year median, with predicted production down 20% from the 5-year average.The total crop production lost is estimated in 719,259 Mt (Metric tonnes) or approximately 19% of the overall baseline output of 3,861,030 Mt. The size of this loss has been estimated on a corresponding crop value of USD 349 million which corresponds to 7% of Mozambique GDP. The loss is predicted to deplete national food supply, increasing the need to import staple foods to meet domestic demand.

title: Slovenia - Severe weather  (ECHO 27 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms affected several parts of Slovenia on 20 July, resulting in evacuations and damage in Kokra village, northern Slovenia, due to a landslide.Several landslides have been recorded also in Logar Valley, municipality of Solcava.On 22-23 July, more rainfall is expected in Slovenia.

title: France - Severe weather  (ECHO 27 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms have been affecting north-western France, in particular, the Haute-Marne department since 20 July, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 22 July, according to local authorities and media, eight people have been injured, 34 people have been displaced, 60 homes have been affected by power outages, and six roads have been blocked across Bologne, Meures, and Sexfontaines communes in Haute-Marne department in Grand Est region.On 22-23 July, drier conditions are expected across the affected area.

title: Guatemala - Rainy season  (ECHO 27 Jul 2024)
description: The civil protection authority in Guatemala (CONRED) reports 6,671 people and 1,062 houses currently at risk in Guatemala due to the ongoing rainy season.As of 21 July, since the beginning of the 2024 rainy season, 7,812 people have been affected and 20,886 people evacuated with 732 people housed in shelters, 366 houses severely affected and 6,714 houses moderately affected by rains.CONRED reports 18 people dead and 13 injured during the rainy season so far; 42 schools have been affected by the rains.The Guatemalan congress rejected the declaration of a state of calamity by the government of president Arévalo on 11 July, which was called to obtain the necessary resources to deal with the emergency caused by the rainy season in the Central American country.

title: Bulgaria - Wildfires (ECHO 24 Jul 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been burning in eastern Bulgaria since 13 July. The most recent wildfires have been burning in Harmanli and Otets Paisievo municipalities in Haskovo and Plovdiv provinces, and Voden and Gorska Polyana municipality in Yambol province, in southeastern Bulgaria. According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS) approximately 260 and 950 ha have been burnt in Harmanli and Otets Paisievo. In Gorska Polyana municipality the wildfire has burnt an area of 5,050 ha.According to media, as of 19 July, two firefighters have been injured in Harmanli municipality and the village of Voden has been evacuated. More than  980 firefighters and 332 fire trucks have been involved in Bulgaria to handle 95 wildfires.Following Bulgaria’s request for assistance, the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) deployed two helicopters from Czechia, out of which one from the rescEU reserve, in addition UCPM will deploy two rescEU planes from Spain to help the firefighting operation.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service  was activated in rapid mapping mode on 18 July to provide damage assessment, one map has been produced so far.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to extreme across the affected area.

title: Italy - Wildfire (ECHO 24 Jul 2024)
description: On 17 July, a wildfire broke out in Nova Siri Municipality located in Matera province, Basilicata region, southern Italy and resulted in casualties.According to media, two firefighters died in the operations. The fire has been contained.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is extreme across the affected area.

title: Slovenia - Wildfire (ECHO 24 Jul 2024)
description: On 18 July, a wildfire was reported near Mount Trstelj between Goriška and Karst regions in western Slovenia. The JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS) recorded a burnt area of about 150 ha.According to media, there are no reports of any casualties. The authorities deployed over 400 firefighters and other civil protection members, 2 air tractors, 1 firefighting helicopter and 1 military helicopter in the firefighting activities and to monitor the situation. Due to the firefighting intervention, some roads are completely closed. The fire has been localised.The Copernicus Emergency Management System  was activated on 18 July to provide a damage assessment and two maps have been produced so far.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is from low to moderate across the affected area.

title: South Korea - Flood (ECHO 24 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting South Korea, in particular Seoul city and the surrounding metropolitan area, over the last two days, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage.As of 19 July, according to media reports, at least 901 people have been evacuated from 628 flooded houses in 36 municipalities and districts in the area. Flood warnings along along the Imjin and Hantan rivers have been issued.Over the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over most of South Korea, with locally very heavy rainfall in the northern part.

title: Chile – Earthquake (ECHO 24 Jul 2024)
description: An earthquake of 7.4 M at a depth of 117 km occurred in the Antofagasta region in north-eastern Chile on 19 July at 1:50 UTC (18 July at 21:50 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 45 km east-south-east of San Pedro de Atacama municipality in the El Loa province in Antofagasta region. At least two aftershocks of 5.0 and 4.7 M have been recorded in the area.According to USGS PAGER, up to 184,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and 161,000 to strong shaking.As of 19 July, the National System for Disaster Prevention, Mitigation and Attention (SENAPRED) report that the seismic event was felt across Arica and Parinacota and Coquimbo regions and that disruption of electricity has been reported and already restored and that one road and one bridge have been damaged. No tsunami threat was triggered.Assessment of people and infrastructure is still ongoing.

title: Indonesia - Landslide (ECHO 24 Jul 2024)
description: On 14 July, a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in Mimika Regency, Central Papua Province, eastern Indonesia and resulted in casualties.The National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB) reports seven fatalities due to this event.On 19-20 July, cloudy skies with drier conditions are expected over the affected regency.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 23 Jul 2024)
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 17 July, five major ongoing active fires across north-western USA, in particular Utah, Oregon, Montana and Idaho, and western USA (Nevada). The wildfires have caused casualties, prompted evacuations and created damage.The Silver King Fire, Piute county, Utah, has burnt so far an area of nearly 7,150 ha, resulting in four injured people and 60 evacuated people. The Larch Creek Fire, Wasco county, Oregon, has burnt so far an area of over 7,500 ha, resulting in three injured people and 3,135 evacuated people. The Horse Gulch Fire, Lewis and Clark and Broadwater county, Montana, has burnt so far an area of around 5,400 ha, resulting in one fatality, two injured people and 200 evacuated people. Two other ongoing active fires were reported across Nevada and Idaho, resulting in 1,300 evacuated people.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to very extreme across north-western and western USA.

title: Guatemala - Rainy season (ECHO 23 Jul 2024)
description: Following the heavy rainfall due to the rainy season that has been affecting several departments of Guatemala since June, the humanitarian impact is increasing.As of 18 July, the National Coordination for Disaster Reduction of Guatemala (CONRED) reports 18 fatalities across eight departments, including three in San Marcos, three in Jutiapa and three in Sacatepéquez, 13 injured people, 18,269 evacuated people, of whom 713 in evacuation centres. In addition, 6,897 houses have been damaged, 358 houses have been severely damaged, five bridges have been destroyed and 40 have been affected.On 18-19 July, light or moderate rainfall is expected in central and southern Guatemala.

title: India - Monsoon rains (ECHO 23 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorms and lighting have been affecting north-western India, in particular the Uttar Pradesh state since 9 July, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 15 July, the National Coalition of Humanitarian, Development and Resilience Actors in India report 54 fatalities, 250,000 displaced people and 1.8 million affected people across 923 villages in 16 districts. In addition, media report that the water levels of the Rapti River in Gorakhpur, Budhi Rapti River in Siddharth Nagar, and Quono River in Gonda are above the danger threshold.On 18-19 July, very heavy rainfall is forecasted over western and north-eastern India, red warnings have been issued for extremely heavy rainfall for 12 districts in western India.

title: China - Floods and landslides (ECHO 23 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central and north-eastern China, particularly the Henan, Hubei, Sichuan, Shaanxi and Gansu provinces, since 14 July, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 18 July, four fatalities across the area of Suizhou city, Hubei province, due to floods. In addition, media also report nearly 6,500 evacuated people in the Henan province and an uncertain number of evacuated people across the Gansu province. Moreover, approximately 2,500 evacuated people and two injured persons were reported across the Shaanxi province.Over the next 24 hours, according to the China Meteorological Administration (CMA), more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecasted over central and north-eastern China.

title: Myanmar - Floods (ECHO 23 Jul 2024)
description: Monsoon season has been affecting several parts of Myanmar since the end of June, particularly the northern and north-western parts, causing floods and resulting in evacuations and damage.
