The worst-hit regions are Kachin, Magway, Mandalay and Sagaing.As of 16 July, according to UN OCHA, an estimated 118,000 people have been temporarily evacuated to safer places. Sagaing has been the hardest hit, with at least 11 townships flooded, followed by Mandalay, which had four townships affected. Kachin State has also been impacted, with 37,000 people evacuated due to flash floods.On 18-19 July, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over northern and central Myanmar, while very heavy rainfall is expected across southern Myanmar.DG ECHO’s emergency response mechanism, which is designed to respond to populations displacements within the first 72 hours, is responding with rapid needs assessments and  immediate assistance.

title: Canada - Wildfires (ECHO 22 Jul 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been affecting north-eastern Canada (in particular Newfoundland and Labrador province) since 12 July, causing population evacuations and damage. The wildfires have burnt so far an area of approximately 14,000 ha in the area of Labrador City (western Newfoundland and Labrador province, nearby Quebec province).Media report, as of 17 July, around 9,600 evacuated people and one closed hospital in Labrador City area. In addition, media also report the pre-emptive evacuation order for neighbouring Wabush town.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfires Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is expected from low to moderate across most of Newfoundland and Labrador province.

title: South Africa - Wildfires (ECHO 22 Jul 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been affecting the KwaZulu-Natal province, north-eastern South Africa since 14 July, causing casualties and damage.Media report, as of 17 July, six fatalities (firefighters) and two severely injured persons (also firefighters) across the Boston town area and the Howick town area, central KwaZulu-Natal province, both near Durban city area.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfires Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is expected from high to extreme across most of the KwaZulu-Natal province.

title: Liberia - Floods (ECHO 22 Jul 2024)
description: Since the beginning of the rainy season, Liberia has been experiencing widespread floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to UN OCHA, two people died, and 50,000 others have been displaced across the country. Several houses have been damaged, as well as schools and hospitals. According to the National Disaster Management Agency of Liberia (NDMA), an estimated 100,000 people are at risk of further flooding, windstorms, and coastal erosion during this rainy season.NDMA and the UN are working together to address the country's crisis.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecasted across western and central Liberia.

title: Kyrgyzstan - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 22 Jul 2024)
description: The number of casualties has increased following floods, including the Ak-Buura river overflow, and landslides across Osh region in southern Kyrgyzstan.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), five people died while another is still missing. In addition, 450 people have been displaced and almost 3,000 affected.National authorities are providing help for those affected by the event.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected across parts of southern and eastern Kyrgyzstan.

title: Afghanistan - Flash floods, update (ECHO 22 Jul 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact is increasing following the flash flood events that affected the eastern provinces of Nangarhar, Kunar, and Laghman.According to Save the Children and media, the death toll reached 40 people while 350 others have been injured. In addition, 1,500 children have been displaced and 400 houses have been destroyed.Infrastructure damage has been also reported to telecommunications networks and several roads have also been blocked, making it difficult to access affected areas.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected across eastern and north-eastern Afghanistan.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Jul 2024)
description: In the past few days, east and south-eastern France have been affected by heavy rain and thunderstorms that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC), as of 16 July, two people have been injured in Suarce commune, Territoire de Belfort department, due to a severe weather-related incident. In Pagny-sur-Moselle, Meurthe-et-Moselle department, a person was slightly injured due to another severe weather-related incident.The worst-hit departments are Meurthe-et-Moselle, Moselle, Haut-Rhin, Saône et-Loire and Territoire de Belfort, where 2,252 homes experienced power cuts.On 16-17 July, drier conditions are expected across the affected regions.

title: Kyrgyzstan - Floods and landslides (ECHO 21 Jul 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Kyrgyzstan since 14 July, causing floods, the  Ak-Buura river overflow and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 16 July, media reports four fatalities, 420 displaced people and 146 flooded houses in Osh city, Osh city region due to floods. In addition, 7,500 people are experiencing power outages.A state of emergency has been declared in Kyrgyzstan on 14 July.On 16-17 July, more rainfall is still forecasted over the country.

title: Afghanistan - Flash floods (ECHO 21 Jul 2024)
description: On 15 July, heavy rainfall and thunderstorms affected eastern Afghanistan, particularly Nangarhar and Kunar provinces, causing flash floods and leading to casualties and damage.According to media, at least 35 people died while 350 others were injured in Nangarhar province. In the neighbouring Kunar province, five people died following floods in Asadabad city and in Asmar district.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is forecast over parts of eastern and north-eastern Afghanistan, including the affected provinces.

title: Türkiye - Wildfire (ECHO 21 Jul 2024)
description: On 15 July, a wildfire occurred in a forested area located in the Çesme district, Izmir province, western Türkiye, resulting in casualties.According to media, three people died following this event and residents living in the villages around the affected area have been evacuated.The authorities deployed resources both on the ground and in the air to battle the fire.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme across the affected area.

title: Bulgaria - Wildfires (ECHO 21 Jul 2024)
description: Wildfires have been burning in eastern Bulgaria since 13 July. The most severe wildfires have been burning in Sakar Mountain near Topolovgrad and Ivaylovgrad in Haskovo province in southeastern Bulgaria. Another wildfire is 3 km west of Stara Zagora city in Stara Zagora province. According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS) the Sakar Mountain wildfires have an extension of 6,500 ha, while the Stara Zagora wildfire has an extension of 312 ha.According to media, as of 16 July, several houses have been damaged in the village of Gornoselci and the town of Ivajlovgrad in Haskovo province by the Sakar mountain wildfires,  there are no immediate reports of humanitarian impact. In the village of Srem – approximately 10 uninhabited houses have been damaged. The Stara Zagora wildfire started to move close to populated areas. Media also report that the wildfires are not under control.On 15 July, Bulgaria requested assistance via the ERCC consisting of two helicopters. The Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) response includes two helicopters from Czech Republic. Offer accepted by Bulgarian authorities.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to very extreme across the affected area, particularly due to very dry and hot conditions and strong winds.

title: North Macedonia - Wildfires (ECHO 21 Jul 2024)
description: Several parts of the country are experiencing wildfires due to an exceptional heatwave and temperatures exceeding 40 degrees Celsius. Following this situation, the authorities declared a 30-day emergency.According to media, there are about 15 fires located in different parts of the country and ten of them remain active. So far the fires do not threaten inhabited areas but the authorities banned movement in forests from 6 a.m to 8 p.m.On 15 July, North Macedonia requested assistance consisting of four airplanes and four helicopters. The Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) response includes one helicopter from Serbia, two helicopters from Slovenia, two airplanes and one helicopter from Türkiye, and one rescEU airplane from Croatia.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to locally extreme across most parts of the whole country, particularly due to very dry and hot conditions and strong winds.

title: Nepal - Landslides (ECHO 20 Jul 2024)
description: In the past few days, a series of landslides triggered by heavy monsoon rainfall have occurred in parts of Nepal and resulted in casualties and damage.In particular, in Chitwan District, south-central Nepal, a major landslide swept away two passenger buses, leading to eight fatalities and 54 still missing people as reported by the Nepal Disaster Risk Reduction Portal (DRR) and media.According to the DRR portal, since 10 July, a total of 25 people died and 13 others have been injured in five different landslide events across the districts of Baglung, Chitawan, Kaski, and Myagdi.On 15-16 July, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast across most parts of the country, particularly over the eastern regions.

title: Forest fire in Albania - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR736] Wildfire in Gjirokastra and Vlora, Albania

title: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines  - Tropical Cyclone BERYL-24 (ECHO 30 Jun 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone Beryl has become a major hurricane forecast to bring life-threatening winds and storm surge to the Caribbean, according to the National Hurricane Center.The hurricane headed toward the Windward Islands (Saint Lucia, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Grenada and Martinique). On 29 June evening, Beryl was about 960 km/h east-southeast of Barbados with maximum sustained winds of near 136 km/h, moving west at around 30 km/h.Maximum sustained winds of 129 – 177 km/h or greater, rainfall accumulations of 100 to 150mm, very rough and hazardous marine conditions and storm surges are expected across St. Vincent and the Grenadines, with possible higher winds offshore. Large and destructive waves/swells are likely to cause life-threatening surf and rip currents.The government of St Vincent and the Grenadines has urged the population to gather emergency supplies. Shelters are to be accessible by 6 p.m. local time today. Volunteers are active in their various communities, checking the vulnerable population and assisting families preparing for the event.The ERCC is closely monitoring the situation.

title: Peru - Earthquake (ECHO 28 Jun 2024)
description: A strong earthquake of magnitude 7.2 at a depth of 28 km occurred on 28 June at 5:36 UTC (at 00:36 local time) in the sea at 1.5 km from the western coast of southwestern Peru. The epicentre was located approximately 8 km west of Atiquipa, in Caravelí province in Arequipa department and 54 km southwest of Yauca town, in Caraveli province.USGS PAGER estimates that 1,000 people were exposed to severe shaking, 63,000 to very strong and 95,000 to strong shaking.According to media reports, as of 28 June, the earthquake was felt in the departments of Ica and Lima in central Peru. There are no immediate reports of casualties or damage. The Directorate of Hydrography and Navigation of the Peruvian Navy reports that a tsunami was not generated on the Peruvian coast.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 28 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Ecuador, in particular the Tungurahua province over the last days, causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Ecuadorian Government reports, as of 26 June, 14 fatalities, 27 injured people, more than 1,100 affected people, 24 destroyed houses, 18 damaged houses and two damaged bridges across the Baños de Agua Santa Canton, southern Tungurahua province.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over central Ecuador.

title: USA - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 28 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central-northern USA, in particular South Dakota, Minnesota and Iowa in the Upper Midwest region over the last 10-days, causing floods, rivers overflow and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) report, as of 26 June, approximately 1,000 evacuated people and over 2,000 flooded houses across eight counties throughout the Iowa. In addition, FEMA reports a number of evacuated people across the Minnesota and a partially collapsed bridge in the South Dakota.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecasted over the whole aforementioned affected states.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 28 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia, in particular the Sulawesi Island since 25 June, causing floods and rivers overfow that have resulted in population displacement and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 28 June, approximately 440 displaced people, nearly 9,500 affected people, more than 2,400 affected houses  and three damaged bridges across the Gorontalo province, northern Sulawesi Island. In addition, ADINet also reports over 700 affected people in the neighbouring North Sulawesi province.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Sulawesi Island.

title: India - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting New Delhi in northern India, since 27 June, causing severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 28 June, media report one fatality, and six injured people due to a severe weather-related incident in the Delhi airport, one damaged structure has been reported and domestic flights have been temporarily suspended.Rescue operations are still ongoing.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are still forecast over northern and western India.

title: Pakistan – Heatwave (ECHO 28 Jun 2024)
description: Heatwave in Pakistan’s largest city, Karachi, and other districts of southern Sindh province has killed over 500 people over the last six days, 141 of whom died on 25 June alone with peak temperature of 49 °C (120 °F).The Provincial Disaster Management Authority (PDMA) reported only nine deaths in Karachi on 27 June with total of 6,193 heatstroke cases were admitted to the hospitals.The provincial government has declared a state of emergency across all hospitals, halting leave for doctors and other medical personnel while bolstering stocks of medical supplies.In Karachi, residents are enduring power outages lasting between 12 to 14 hours, significantly affecting their ability to remain cool and safe during this crisis.

title: New Zealand - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge have been affecting northern New Zealand, in particular the North Island, one of the two main islands of the country, since 25 June, causing floods, rivers overflow and a number of  severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in population evacuations and damage.Media report, as of 27 June, several evacuated people, approximately 400 damaged houses and further 200 houses under evacuation notice across the Hawke's Bay and Tairawhiti regions, eastern North Island where the worst affected is the Wairoa town area.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over the eastern North Island.

title: Philippines - Floods, update (ECHO 27 Jun 2024)
description: The number of impacted populations increased following the heavy rainfall and floods of 18-19 June that hit Maguindanao del Sur province in Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao, Mindanao island, southern Philippines.According to the DSWD Disaster Response Management of the Philippines, as of 26 June, more than 50,000 people living in 19 districts of Datu Montawal, Papagawan and Pagalungan Municipality have been affected.For the next 24 hours, partly cloudy to cloudy skies with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms are expected across Mindanao island.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Jun 2024)
description: On 24-25 June, heavy rainfall and strong winds hit central-northern and central Italy, particularly the Emilia Romagna, Veneto and Tuscany regions, causing floods, landslides and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties, evacuations and damage.According to media, one person died in Parma Province due to the overflow of the Termina River while some families have been evacuated in the municipality of Lesignao Bagni, Parma province following widespread floods in the area. Damage to houses and infrastructures due to severe weather floods and landslides has been recorded in other parts of Tuscany, Emilia Romagna and Veneto.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall over northern Italy, including Lombardy, Veneto, Emilia Romagna and Friuli Venezia Giulia, and some parts of central Italy, Marche and Abruzzo region. On 26 June, an orange alert for hydrological risk is in effect in some places in Emilia Romagna.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 26 Jun 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been burning across the western United States, in particular in Butte County in northern California and La Pine city in Oregon, since 24 June, prompting evacuations and causing damage. According to national authorities the wildfire in Butte County in California has burnt an area of approximately 280 ha, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the La Pine wildfire in Oregon has burnt an area of 214 ha.As of 26 June, media reports in Butte County, California one injured person, an evacuation order for several areas but for an unknown number of people, and two destroyed structures. In La Pine city, Oregon, the same source reports approximately 60 sheltered people in an evacuation centre in La Pine and an evacuation order in place for 1,100 houses.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to extreme in Oregon-affected areas and from very high to very extreme in California- affected areas.

title: Ecuador - Flood and Landslide (ECHO 26 Jun 2024)
description: Following the heavy rainfall that has been affecting 15 provinces in western Ecuador since 14 June, causing floods and landslides, the number of casualties and damage has increased.As of 24 June, according to national authorities and the Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO), at least 19 people died, including 14 in Tungurahua, four in Chimborazo and one in Cotopaxi province, 143 have been sheltered in four evacuation centres, and 3,602 people have been affected, of whom 180 directly impacted. In addition, 39 houses have been destroyed, and 101 houses and 18 bridges have been affected.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over western and central Ecuador.

title: Afghanistan - Landslides (ECHO 26 Jun 2024)
description: On 23 June, two landslides occurred in Paktia province in eastern Afghanistan, one in Orgor village in Saskani district and another in Wazi Zadran, causing casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 25 June, a total of 12 people died, of whom seven in Orgor village and five in Wazi Zadran district.On 26-27 June, drier conditions are forecasted over the whole country.

title: Switzerland - Floods and landslides (ECHO 25 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms have been affecting south-eastern Switzerland since 21 June causing floods, landslides and river overflow that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 24 June, one person died, two people are missing and dozens of people have been evacuated from Misox village in Grison Canton, in south-eastern Switzerland, due to floods and mudslides. In addition, three houses have been destroyed, and several landslides have been recorded in Misox and Sorte villages. Zermatt village in the Valais Canton has been isolated due to floods.Search and rescue operations are still ongoing.On 25-26 June, more rainfall is expected in southern Switzerland and the affected areas.

title: USA - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 25 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting the Upper Midwest region of the United States, including South Dakota, Minnesota and Iowa States, causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.Media reports, as of 24 June, one fatality in South Dakota, approximately 4,000 evacuated people in the Dakota Dunes community in Union County, south-eastern South Dakota and several blocked roads due to floods. According to The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of the same day, 770 people have been evacuated from Sioux and Clay counties in north-western Iowa, 478 people are displaced in shelters, more than 2,000 houses have been affected, one road is blocked in Sioux City and several others have been flooded. In Minnesota a dam breach has been recorded for the Rapidan dam in Blue Earth County, southern Minnesota, causing an evacuation order for nearby residents, and several roads have been closed.Minnesota State declared a state of emergency, and Iowa issued a major disaster declaration.On 25-26 June, severe thunderstorms and heavy rainfall are forecasted over western Iowa, western Minnesota and Wisconsin states.

title: Canada - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Jun 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been affecting the eastern Quebec province, eastern Canada, since 21 June, causing evacuations and damage.According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the wildfires have burnt so far an area of more than 2,500 ha just north to the Port-Cartier city, eastern Quebec province. The wildfires are currently not fully contained.Media report, as of 24 June, 1,225 preventively evacuated people. The mayor of Port-Cartier declared the state of emergency.Over the next 24 hours, according to JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is expected from moderate to high across the eastern Quebec province.

title: Ivory Coast - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 25 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall continued to affect southern Ivory Coast, in particular the coastal city of Abidjan, the main city of the country, since 13 June, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in more casualties and damage.Media report, as of 25 June, 24 fatalities and two persons still missing across the Abidjan city area, mainly due to floods.Over the next 48 hours, moderate rainfall is still forecast over the already affected area.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 25 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and very strong winds have been affecting western and central Indonesia, in particular the Sumatra Island and the Sulawesi Island, since 20 June, causing floods, rivers overflow and a number of strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of 25 June, three fatalities, some displaced people and 120 affected families across the Parigi Moutong regency, Central Sulawesi province, due to floods. In addition, the same source reports two fatalities, one injured person, 24 displaced people and approximately 80 affected people in the Deli Serdang Regency, North Sumatra province, due to the strong wind.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over the North Sumatra province while moderate rainfall is forecast over the Central Sulawesi province.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 24 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, stong winds and heavy hailstorms affected northern and north-eastern Italy (mainly Trentino-South Tyrol, Veneto and the neighbouring Lombardy regions) over 22-23 June, causing flooding of streets and basements, severe weather-related incidents and triggering several landslides that have resulted in population evacuation and damage.Media report, as of 24 June, a number of evacuated people across Vicenza and Belluno provinces (Veneto region) and Trento province (Trentino-South Tyrol region) mainly due to landslides and dozens of rescued people in Como and Brescia provinces (Lombardy region), mainly due to floods.Over the next 24 hours, no more heavy rainfall is forecast over eastern Lombardy, Veneto and Trentino-South Tyrol regions.

title: France - Floods and landslides (ECHO 24 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-eastern France, in particular the Isère department since 21 June, causing floods, river overflow and mudslides, that have resulted in population evacuation and damage.According to the Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC), as of 22 June, approximately 114 people have been evacuated from a Bérarde village, in the commune of Saint-Christophe-en-Oisans, and from Saint-Christophe-en-Oisans, in the northern Department of Isère, to the commune of Les Deux Alpes, Isère department and one bridge have been destroyed due to the overflow of the Vénéon River. Media reports, as of 24 June, that the commune of Vénosc in Les Deux Alpesin is blocked due to some flooded roads.Over the next 48 hours, drier conditions are forecast over the affected areas.

title: Greece - Wildfires (ECHO 24 Jun 2024)
description: Wildfires have been burning across central-western Greece, in particular in the north-western Peloponnese region since the afternoon (UTC) of 21 June, causing casualties and damage.The wildfires have burnt so far nearly 3,500 ha in the area of towns and villages of Latas, Mastradonis, Apidoula and Alpochori (between Patras and Pyrgos cities, Achaia and Ilia regional units, north-western Peloponnese region). There are currently no active wildfires.Media report, as of 24 June, one fatality and a number of preventively evacuated people across the affected area.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode ( and ) on 21 June and two maps were produced so far.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is expected from high to extreme across most of the Peloponnese region.

title: Central America - Tropical storm ALBERTO, update (ECHO 24 Jun 2024)
description: Tropical storm ALBERTO made landfall over the area of northern Veracruz state (central Mexico) on 20 June in the morning (UTC) and passed over central Mexico on 20 June as a tropical depression.On 21-22 June, heavy rainfall and strong winds associated to its remnants caused floods, landslides and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage across a wider area in Central America.Media report, as of 24 June, up to 34 fatalities, of which 19 across El Salvador, ten in Guatemala, one more in Honduras and four in the Nuevo León state (Mexico). Media also report more than 15,000 displaced people across the aforementioned affected countries.Over the 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and southern Mexico and most of El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras.

title: Azerbaijan - Severe weather (ECHO 24 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting western Azerbaijan since 20 June, causing severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 23 June, one person died in Mingahir city in Tashkent region, eight people have been injured, of whom five in Mingahir and three in Agsatafa city. In addition, several structures have been damaged.For the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecasted over the affected areas.

title: China - Severe weather, landslides and floods (ECHO 24 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central China since 23 June, particularly Hunan, Jiangxi and Guizhou provinces, causing floods and landslides that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 24 June, ten people died, including eight people in Douxi village of Xinhuang Dong Autonomous County in south-western Hunan Province due to a landslide, and two in Jiujiang city in Jiangxi province due to a severe weather-related incident. Approximately 30,000 people have been evacuated, more than 4,000 have been rescued in Hunan province, 7,000 people have been evacuated and 213,300 people have been affected in Guizhou province.For the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecasted across most of south-eastern China, including the affected provinces.

title: Yemen – Floods  (ECHO 24 Jun 2024)
description: In response to the floods that hit Yemen at the end of April 2024, DG ECHO has secured EUR 200,000 for the Disaster Response Emergency Fund (DREF) of the International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC) to respond to the immediate humanitarian needs. The operation is supporting the Yemeni Red Crescent Society (YRCS) to assist 21,175 flood-affected people (3,025 households) in Abyan, Taiz, Al Jawf, Hadramwat, Shabwah, Sa'dah, Ma’rib, Al Maharah, Ad-Dali’ Governorates with shelter and hygiene household items.According to initial estimates by the YRCS 39,123 individuals (5,589 households) were affected by the April floods. Extensive damage was caused, with entire villages submerged, agricultural lands destroyed, and critical transport links cut off.Internally Displaced People's (IDP) camps and households in the affected governorates were particularly hit, suffering in some instances the impact of several climatic shocks in addition to the floods.Water contamination from the floods is of particular concern at a moment when Acute Watery Diarrhoea (AWD)/Cholera cases continue to raise (42,220 suspected cases and 200 associated deaths since March 2024).

title: El Salvador - Severe weather, update (ECHO 21 Jun 2024)
description: Following the heavy rainfall that has been affecting El Salvador since 15 June, causing floods, landslides and river overflowing, the number of casualties and damage has increased.According to UN OCHA, as of 20 June, at least 12 fatalities have been reported and 2,389 people have been evacuated in 76 active shelters, another 100 shelters are pre-equipped and available. In addition, 79 homes and 74 roads have been affected, 76 landslides have been recorded, and classes and public activities have been suspended.A national state of emergency was declared on 16 June and the red alert has been issued at the national level.On 21-22 June, more very heavy rainfall is forecasted for the whole country.Heavy rains have also affected Honduras, Guatemala, and Nicaragua.

title: USA - Wildfires  (ECHO 21 Jun 2024)
description: Two big wildfires have been affecting Otero and Lincoln Counties in New Mexico and are causing casualties and damage as reported by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).The South Fork fire has an extension of more than 6,600 ha and has led to two fatalities, 8,000 people under mandatory evacuation orders and 600 destroyed houses. The Salt fire is burning an area of almost 3,000 ha and resulted in 1,000 people under a mandatory evacuation order.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from very low to extreme in the affected counties.

title: Mexico, USA - Tropical storm ALBERTO, update (ECHO 21 Jun 2024)
description: Tropical storm ALBERTO made landfall in the morning of 20 June close to the city of Tampico, south-eastern Tamaulipas state, eastern Mexico and resulted in casualties and disruptions.According to media, four people died and public transportation has been temporarily suspended in Nuevo León state, north-eastern Mexico. In addition, widespread damage was recorded in Nuevo Leon and Veracruz.After its landfall, ALBERTO weakened and its remnants are forecasted to affect north-eastern Mexico , particularly Coahuila, Nuevo Leon and Tamaulipas and southern USA, including south Texas, in the next few days.

title: Comoros - Landslides and floods (ECHO 21 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Comoros since 18 June, triggering landslides and causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 21 June, a landslide occurred in Mutsamudu city on the Anjouan Island in central Comoros on 18 June, and at least three people died and two have been injured. In addition, on the island of Grande Comore, north-western Comoros, several houses have been affected by floods and landslides, and the Misudjé village is isolated.On 21-22 June, drier conditions are expected over Comoros.

title: Niger - Floods, update (ECHO 21 Jun 2024)
description: The rainy season continues to affect most parts of the country, causing widespread floods, and severe weather related incidents and resulting in an increasing number of casualties and damage.According to media, as of 20 June, 21 people died (14 of them in the Maradi region - central-southern Niger), 23 have been injured, almost 6,000 others have been affected and 4,000 livestock were reported dead.For the next 48 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast across southern and south-eastern Niger.

title: Philippines - Floods (ECHO 21 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms affected southern Philippines, in particular the Mindanao Island on 18-19 June, causing floods that resulted in damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) report, as of 21 June, 24,548 affected people across Maguindanao del Sur and Lanao del Sur provinces in Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) in western Mindanao Island.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall and thunderstorms are expected over the affected areas.

title: Bangladesh, India - Flash floods and landslides  (ECHO 21 Jun 2024)
description: On 18 and 19 June, heavy monsoon rainfall impacted northeastern region of Bangladesh as well as adjoining northeastern Indian states of Assam and Meghalaya. The flood situation has been deteriorating with rivers inundating vast tracks of land. The number of people affected by the floods rose to 2.1 million, and over 51,000 moved to 1,685 shelters.Continuous heavy rainfall inside the country over the past three days and onrushing water from upstream have flooded the northeast Haor region of Bangladesh. Sylhet and Sunamganj districts have experienced 242 mm and 223 mm of rainfall respectively already exceeded monthly average.Almost 75% of Sylhet district is now flooded, with more than half of the crops and paddy fields in the region submerged under water, likely to have lasting impacts on people’s food security.According to humanitarian partners, as of 19 June, 15 people died due to landslides.

title: Greece - Wildfires (ECHO 20 Jun 2024)
description: Wildfires have been burning across central Greece, in particular in the Attica region, south of the area of the capital Athens since the late morning (UTC) of 19 June, causing population evacuations and damage. The most significant wildfires - Attica-Koropi & Kranidi of Argolis - have been operationally under control.Media report, as of 20 June, a number of preventively evacuated people across the towns and villages of Koropi, Vari, Lambrika and Kitsi, southern Attica region and the Greek Civil Protection reports as of 11:00 (local time) of 20 June that there are no active wildfires.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () for the Koropi town area on 19 June, to provide the damage assessment.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is expected from very high to very extreme across the whole Attica region.

title: Mexico, USA, Central America - Tropical storm ALBERTO (ECHO 20 Jun 2024)
description: Tropical storm ALBERTO is approaching the north-eastern coast of Veracruz state and on 20 June at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 185 km east-southeast of Tampico city, south-eastern Tamaulipas state, eastern Mexico with maximum sustained winds of 85 km/h.ALBERTO is forecasted to move westwards,  making landfall over the eastern coast of central Mexico on 20 June, then weakening by moving inland, and dissipating over central Mexico on 20-21 June.According to UN OCHA, heavy rainfall and strong winds associated with ALBERTO have impacted Guatemala, Nicaragua, Honduras and El Salvador. In addition, media report three fatalities in Nuevo León state, north-eastern Mexico due to the tropical storm.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecasted over the Mexican states of Coahuila, Nuevo León, and Tamaulipas, and south Texas (USA). Moreover, moderate to heavy rainfall is also expected across most of Central America.A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for the Texas coast and for the northeastern coast of Mexico.

title: Kenya - Floods, update (ECHO 20 Jun 2024)
description: While the March-April-May (MAM) 2024 rainfall period has ceased over most parts of the country, some heavy rainfall continues to affect parts of Kenya.Since the beginning of the long rainy season in March above average rains have caused rivers overflow - particularly the Tana river - and floods that have resulted in casualties and severe damage to infrastructure.UN OCHA reports, as of 19 June, 315 fatalities, 38 persons still missing, 188 injured people and more than 293,200 displaced people, of which approximately 54,000 are still in 81 accommodation centres. A total of over 306,500 affected people across the country, where the worst affected are Tana River, Migori and Garissa counties.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecasted over central and southern Kenya. According to the Kenya Meteorological Department, the forecast for June-July-August suggests that the Highlands West of the Rift Valley, the Lake Victoria Basin, the Rift Valley, parts of the Highlands East of the Rift Valley, and northwestern regions are likely to receive above-average rainfall which might lead to flooding and subsequent populations displacements.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 20 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia, in particular the Sulawesi Island over the past 48 hours, causing floods and river overflows.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports that, as of 20 June, there are nearly 1,500 affected people and approximately 340 affected houses across the Boalemo and the Bone Bolango regencies, Gorontalo province, northern Sulawesi Island.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecasted over most of the Sulawesi Island.

title: Bangladesh - Flash floods and landslides (ECHO 20 Jun 2024)
description: On 18 and 19 June, heavy monsoon rainfall impacted the refugee camps in Cox’s Bazar, southeastern Bangladesh causing flash floods and 773 landslides incidents, resulting in casualties and damage.According to humanitarian partners, as of 19 June, 10 people died, including at least seven Rohingya refugees, almost 8,000 people have been affected across 33 camps in Cox’s Bazar and also around 1,200 shelters. Rising water and mudslides have damaged learning centers, health facilities, mosques, latrines, water points and bathing cubicles.Flooding from heavy rains has also affected 1.6 million people in other parts of the country. Nearly 30,000 people moved to shelter centres while many families were seen wandering in northeastern Bangladesh. Only in Sylhet district, almost 75 percent of areas, including 23 wards of the city and 1,548 villages in 13 Upazilas, have been flooded, directly affecting over 825,000 people. In Sunamganj district, flooding affected 560,000 people.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally very heavy rainfall is forecasted over most of the country.

title: Mexico, USA - Potential tropical cyclone ONE (ECHO 19 Jun 2024)
description: A low-pressure system named potential tropical cyclone ONE is tracking northwestward in the southwestern Gulf of Mexico, and on 19 June at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 450 km east of Tampico city (Tamaulipas state, eastern Mexico) with maximum.ONE is forecasted to turn toward the west with an increase in forward speed on 19 June, and the system is expected to reach the coast of northeastern Mexico by 19-20 June.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecasted over northeast Mexico and south Texas.A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for the Texas coast from San Luis Pass southward to the mouth of the Rio Grande and for the northeastern coast of Mexico from the south of the mouth of the Rio Grande to Puerto de Altamira.

title: El Salvador - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting El Salvador since 15 June, causing floods, landslides and severe weather-related incidents, that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) and media reports, as of 17 June, at least 14 fatalities have been reported, including five in Tacuba district in Ahuachapán Department (western El Salvador) due to a landslide, two due to a severe weather-related incident, and four due to flooding. At least 744 people have been displaced in 30 active shelters, another 100 shelters are pre-equipped and available, and 26 homes have been destroyed.A national state of emergency was declared on 16 June.On 19-20 June, more very heavy rainfall is forecasted for the whole country.

title: Kyrgyzstan - Floods and landslides (ECHO 19 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected western Kyrgyzstan causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 18 June, the Red Cross and Red Crescent (IFRC) reports one fatality due to a landslide, five affected people and 300 assisted people in the villages of Boston and Eski Kochkor-Ata in the Nooken district, southern Jalal-Abad region, western Kyrgyzstan. In addition, a section of the Osh-Bishkek Road has been damaged and closed due to a landslide.The Ministry of Emergency Situations has deployed about 300 people and more than 40 pieces of special equipment to eliminate the consequences of the debris flows. The Ministry is also currently assessing the damage.On 19-20 June, more rainfall is still forecasted over western and south-western Kyrgyzstan.

title: Vietnam - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Jun 2024)
description: On 17-18 June, the provinces of Bac Kan, Ha Giang, Tuyen Quang, Cao Bang, Thai Nguyen, and Binh Duong in the northern and southern regions were affected by heavy rainfall with thunderstorms, strong winds causing severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports five fatalities - four in Bac Kan and one in Ha Giang province - and one injured person in Binh Duong province. Moreover, 156 people have been affected as well as 39 houses and one road due to landslides.For the next 24 hours, moderate to local heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are forecasted over most parts of Vietnam.

title: Iran - Earthquake (ECHO 19 Jun 2024)
description: An earthquake of 4.9 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Razavi Khorasan province, north-eastern Iran, on 18 June at 9:54 UTC (13:24 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 2 km north-northwestern of Kashmar city in the Central District of Kashmar county, Razavi Khorasan.USGS PAGER reported that severe shaking was felt in the affected area.According to media, as of 18 June, four people died, 120 have been injured, including 35 hospitalized people, and several buildings in Kashmar.

title: Indonesia - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 19 Jun 2024)
description: Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano, located in East Flores regency, East Nusa Tenggara province, increased its activity on 18 June at 2.18 UTC (10.18 local time) following a volcanic explosion; the ash column it produced reached up to 600 m above the summit of the volcano, heading towards the southwest and west directions.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), almost 9,800 people have been affected while media report two impacted airports by the ash fall on Flores Island, namely Frans Seda Airport in Maumere, Sikka District, and Haji Hasan Aroeboesman Airport in Ende District.The alert level of the volcano is at level 3 (standby), all activities within a radius of 3 km from the crater and sectorally 4 km in the north-northeast direction and 5 km in the northeast sector are forbidden.

title: Niger - Floods (ECHO 19 Jun 2024)
description: As of 11 June, 26 communes across Niger have been affected by heavy rainfall and floods. The worst affected communes include 15 in Maradi in the south-central part of the country, five in Tahoua in the west, three in Tillabéri in the southwestern, two in Zinder in the south-centre, and one in Agadez in the north.According to UN OCHA, 18 people died, almost 4,000 people were affected, 329 houses were damaged and eight schools were destroyed.On 19-20 June, drier conditions are expected while on 21-22 June moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecasted across south-western Niger.

title: Peru - Earthquake (ECHO 18 Jun 2024)
description: A 5.5 M earthquake at a depth of 99 km occurred on 18 June at 2:22 UTC in Loreto department, the northernmost part of Peru. The epicentre was located approximately 20 km south-southwest of Puerto Madres village, in Andoas District in Loreto Department.USGS PAGER estimates that 133,000 people were exposed to light shaking.According to media reports, as of 17 June, some educational structures have been damaged and several landslides have been triggered by the earthquake affecting several parts of the Pan American Highway.

title: USA - Wildfire (ECHO 17 Jun 2024)
description: A wildfire has been burning across the Gorman community in Los Angeles county, eastern California, western United States, since 15 June, prompting evacuations and causing damage. According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the wildfire has burnt an area of 5,300 ha.As of 17 June, media report approximately 1,200 evacuated people and two damaged structures in the Gorman area, near Hungry Valley State Park. According to the county fire officials, the wildfire is just 2% contained as of the evening of 16 June.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to very extreme in the affected areas.

title: Ecuador - Landslide (ECHO 17 Jun 2024)
description: A landslide, triggered by heavy rainfall, occurred in central Ecuador on 16 June, leading to casualties.According to media, the event occurred in the city of Baños de Agua Santa, Tungurahua province and resulted in six fatalities and at least 30 missing people due to heavy rains; floods and landslides have been affecting the country during the past week.On 17-18 June moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecasted across central and western Ecuador.

title: Ivory Coast - Floods and landslides (ECHO 17 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected Abidjan city area in Abidjan district, southern Ivory Coast, on 13-14 June causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 17 June, eight people died, 18 have been evacuated to hospitals, and at least 227 people have been affected in Abidjan city due to floods and landslides. In addition, several roads have been cut off in several parts of Abidjan city.On 17-18 June, more heavy rainfall is still forecasted over the Abidjan city area and western Ivory Coast.

title: India - Landslide and severe weather (ECHO 17 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall in north-eastern India since 13 June has caused a landslide that has resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Indian National Disaster Management Authority (NDMI), as of 14 June, six people have died in Mangan district in Sikkim, one person has been injured, 33 people have been evacuated in three evacuation centres, and 3,070 people have been affected by a landslide. A total of 52 houses have been damaged, of which 25 have been fully damaged, and the national highway has been blocked.Over the next 24 hours, light to moderate rainfall is forecasted over Sikkim State, while a red warning for heavy rain has been issued for Mangan district for 17 June.

title: China - Severe weather, landslides and floods (ECHO 17 Jun 2024)
description: In the past few days, heavy rain has been impacting south-eastern China, particularly Fujian and Guangxi provinces, causing landslides, floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and displacement.According to media, one person died in Guilin City, Guangxi province while 36,000 people have been displaced across Fujian province. In addition, several houses have been flooded in several villages, particularly across Guangxi province.For the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecasted across most of southern and south-eastern China, including the affected provinces.

title: Vietnam - Severe weather and landslides (ECHO 17 Jun 2024)
description: On 15-16 June, heavy rainfall, strong winds and tornados hit the provinces of Bac Kan, Tuyen Quang, Kien Giang and Can Tho, causing severe weather-related incidents and landslides that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), two people died in severe weather-related incidents - one in Kien Giang and another in Can Tho province - 324 people have been affected and more than 80 buildings have been damaged or destroyed due to landslides or severe weather events.For the next 24 hours, moderate to local heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are forecasted over most parts of Vietnam.

title: Chile - Severe weather, update (ECHO 14 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms continued to affect central and central-southern Chile, in particular O'Higgins, Maule, Ñuble, Biobío, Araucanía, Los Rios and Santiago regions, over the past few days, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in more casualties and damage.The Chilean National Disaster Prevention and Response Service (SENAPRED) reports, as of 14 June, one fatality in the Maule region and two injured persons, one in Ñuble and one more in Santiago. In addition, SENAPRED also reports, across all the affected regions, 510 evacuated people - of which 321 in the Santiago region, the worst affected - 575 isolated people and a total of 6,392 affected people. Moreover, three destroyed and 2,567 damaged houses were reported.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecasted over central and central-southern Chile.

title: United States - Wildfire, update (ECHO 14 Jun 2024)
description: A wildfire has been burning since 12 June in Pinal County, in southern Arizona, south-western United States, causing evacuations and damage. According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the wildfire has burnt an area of 268 ha.As of 13 June, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reported 450 evacuated people and 450 voluntary evacuations in the Wickenburg and Morristown communities of Maricopa city, Pinal County. FEMA also reports that an evacuation assistance center has been established at the Wickenburg Community Center. In addition, a least 300 structures have been threatened and one road has been closed.On 14-15 June, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from extreme to very extreme in southern Arizona.

title: South Korea - Earthquake  (ECHO 14 Jun 2024)
description: A 4.3 M earthquake at a depth of 10 km occurred on 11 June at 23.26 UTC in Buan county, North Jeolla province (Jeonbuk), south-western South Korea. The epicentre was located approximately 7 km north-northwest of Buan city, in Buan county, North Jeolla province.According to media reports, as of 14 June, a total of 277 damaged buildings have been reported, of which 239 in Buan city, 19 in Jeongeup, and five in Gochang county.The earthquake was mainly felt in North Joella province but also in North Chungcheong province, in central South Korea.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 14 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia, in particular the Sulawesi Island since 13 June, causing floods and rivers overfow that have resulted in population displacement and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 14 June, 40 displaced people, a total of approximately 330 affected people and around 80 flooded buildings - included one school - across the Donggala Regency, Central Sulawesi province.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecasted over the whole Sulawesi Island.

title: Ethiopia - Floods (ECHO 14 Jun 2024)
description: Following severe floods across the country, which have affected 590,000 people and displaced nearly 100,000, DG ECHO has mobilised EUR 400,000 to address urgent humanitarian needs in the most affected regions:DG ECHO allocated EUR 200,000 to the Ethiopian Red Cross Society via the Disaster Relief Emergency Fund (DREF) to address the most urgent needs stemming from devastating floods in the Guji’s area of Oromia; this action will target 62,775 people with preventive health and hygiene activities, while 10,500 displaced people will benefit from direct assistance.An additional fund of EUR 200,000 has been provided to Save the Children in the Somali region, where nearly 90,000 people have been directly affected by the floods, with over 37,000 individuals internally displaced. The most vulnerable will receive multi-purpose cash grants, while the action will provide water and sanitation, as well as resources directed towards cholera prevention and response.

title: Cyprus - Wildfires, update (ECHO 13 Jun 2024)
description: According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the wildfire that has been burning in the Paphos district, in western Cyprus, since 11 June and has been causing population evacuations and damage, has burnt an area of more than 1,409 ha as of 13 June.The national authorities report on 13 June, that at least 49 displaced people from the villages of Psathi, Choulou and Lemona have been sheltered in an evacuation centre in Paphos. In addition, at least two houses have been destroyed, and 14-15 others have been damaged. The villages of Giolou, Thinia, Ayios Dimitrianos, Drymou and Polemi were also affected.The same source also reports that the active fires are under control.On 11 June, Cyprus activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), two firefighting aircraft offered by Greece took an active role in the operation in Cyprus.On 13-14 June, according to the JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from very high to extreme in the affected areas.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 13 Jun 2024)
description: Wildfires have been burning across the Spokane county, eastern Washington, north-western USA since the afternoon (local time) of 11 June, prompting evacuations and causing damage. There are currently three active wildfires across the county.Media report, as of 13 June, approximately 50 evacuated people and some pre-emptively evacuated schools across the affected area, in particular due to a wildfire located south-west of the Spokane city.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to very extreme across eastern Washington.

title: Chile - Severe weather (ECHO 13 Jun 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting central and central-southern Chile, in particular Maule, Ñuble, Biobío, Araucanía and Los Rios regions, over the past few days, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Chilean National Disaster Prevention and Response Service (SENAPRED) reports, as of 13 June, one fatality and one injured person in the Maule and Ñuble regions respectively. In addition, SENAPRED also reports 49 evacuated people (44 in the Biobío region and five more in the Araucanía region), 482 isolated people (307 in Biobío and 175 in Araucanía) and a 1,245 affected people (1,222 in Biobío, 21 in Araucanía and two in Los Rios). Moreover, three destroyed houses and 2,272 damaged houses were reported across all the aforementioned affected regions.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecasted over central and central-southern Chile.

title: El Salvador - Landslide (ECHO 13 Jun 2024)
description: On 10 June, a landslide, triggered by heavy rainfall, occurred in Meanguera del Golfo island in south-eastern El Salvador, causing casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least two people died in the Meanguera del Golfo district, in La Unión Sur municipality of the La Unión department. In addition, one house has been severely damaged and several buildings have been partially damaged by the landslide in the same municipality.On 13-14 June, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecasted over the whole El Salvador.

title: USA - Wildfires, update (ECHO 31 May 2024)
description: Two wildfires are burning in southwestern United States, one in southern New Mexico and one in southern Arizona, causing evacuations and damage.The largest has been burning since 17 May in Ruidoso village, Lincoln County, southern New Mexico, and according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the total burnt area is approximately 8,800 ha.  As of 30 May, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reported six injured people and at least 750 displaced people, with approximately 4,800 people ready to evacuate.According to the same source, in Kearny village, Pinal County, southern Arizona, a burnt area of approximately 202 ha has been reported since 29 May, with a total of 180 displaced people and approximately 540 people ready to evacuate. In addition, three houses have also been destroyed.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast is very high to extreme for both affected areas in New Mexico and Arizona.

title: China - Tropical depression (ECHO 31 May 2024)
description: A tropical depression, formed in the South China Sea on 29 May, is moving north towards south-eastern China.The weather system will strengthen slightly and it will approach the south-central coast of the Guangdong Province as a tropical depression on 31 May late morning (UTC). After that, it will continue north-east, dissipating towards the Jiangxi Province.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected over Hainan Island - under a blue typhoon warning - Fujian, Guangdong, southern and eastern Jiangxi, and central and southern Zhejiang provinces.

title: India, Bangladesh - Tropical Cyclone REMAL, update (ECHO 31 May 2024)
description: Tropical storm REMAL struck northeastern India and Bangladesh from May 26-28, causing severe flooding and landslides.In India's northeast, 39 people were reported dead, with the highest fatalities in Mizoram. Dozens remain missing, over 500 were injured, and significant displacement has occurred, with nearly 21,000 affected and 175 homes damaged across Nagaland, Meghalaya, and Tripura. In Manipur, the storm impacted around 188,143 people and damaged over 24,000 houses. West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district saw 1.9 million people affected, thousands of homes damaged, and over 150,000 people evacuated to relief camps. Further assessments are pending.In Bangladesh, the cyclone's aftermath left 16 dead and affected 3.75 million people, according to Save the Children. Approximately 150,000 homes were hit, affecting 639,000 people, including many children. The region is bracing for more moderate to heavy rainfall, with red warnings for heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in Assam and Meghalaya on 31 May.

title: Philippines, Japan - Tropical Cyclone EWINIAR, update (ECHO 30 May 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone EWINIAR ("Aghon" in the Philippines) is still moving north-east over the north-eastern Philippine Sea and on 30 May at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 520 km south-east of Kyushu Island, southern Japan, with maximum sustained winds of 93 km/h (tropical storm).After its passage over central and central-northern Philippines on 23-27 May, the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council reported six fatalities, five in Calabarzon and one in Northern Mindanao, eight injured people, 21,225 displaced and almost 52,000 affected people across seven regions of the country.EWINIAR is forecast to continue north-east, weakening and remaining well off the coast of southern and central Japan on 30 May - 1 June.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the Philippines and over parts of southern and central Japan.

title: Bangladesh, India - Tropical Cyclone REMAL, update (ECHO 30 May 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact is increasing after the passage of tropical storm REMAL which made landfall near the Bangladesh-India border and crossed north-eastern India on 26-28 May.According to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), as of 29 May, in Bangladesh 16 people died, 807,023 people have been evacuated to 9,424 evacuation centres and almost 3.5 million people have been affected.In addition, 40,246 houses were completely damaged, and 131,678 others were partially damaged. The rain and high tides damaged some embankments and flooded coastal areas in the Sundarbans. Rain brought by the cyclone, flooded roads also in the capital Dhaka.In India, media report at least 37 fatalities, most of them in Mizoram State, dozens missing people, and hundreds of evacuated. The worst affected states are Mizoram, West Bengal, Assam, and Meghalaya.On 30-31 May, moderate to very heavy rainfall is forecast over north-eastern Bangladesh and north-eastern India, mostly in Assam and Meghalaya where red warnings for heavy rain are in effect on 30 May.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather (ECHO 30 May 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms have been affecting almost 24 districts of Sri Lanka since 15 May, resulting in casualties and damage.The National Disaster Relief Services Centre (NDRSC) report, as of 29 May, ten fatalities, of whom four in Puttalam, two in Galle, two in Ratnapura, one in Batulla and one in Nuwara Eliya districts in western and southern Sri Lanka. Three people are still missing, 26 have been injured, and a total of 66,787 people have been affected by severe weather. In addition, 37 houses have been destroyed and 5,556 have been partially damaged.On 30-31 May, more heavy rainfall is expected over the southwestern and southern parts of Sri Lanka.

title: Mozambique – Drought (ECHO 30 May 2024)
description: The food security situation in Mozambique continues to deteriorate, due to the compounded effects of El Niño, above-average temperatures, and extreme weather events that are affecting the southern Africa region.The 2023-2024 El Niño has been one of the strongest on record to strike southern and central Mozambique. Between November 2023 and February 2024, these areas experienced an unusual dry season and received only half of the average rainfall, strongly impacting agriculture and rural livelihoods.Around 20 million people reside in areas that have now been hit by drought, 2.7 million of whom were already struggling with food insecurity (IPC3+) before the onset of El Niño.DG ECHO contributed EUR 200,000 to the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) Emergency Appeal, aiming to support the Mozambique Red Cross in its response to the drought and food insecurity in the country.

title: Philippines, Japan - Tropical storm EWINIAR, update (ECHO 29 May 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone EWINIAR ("Aghon" in the Philippines) continued northeastward over the northern Philippine Sea, east of the Ryukyu Islands, southern Japan on 28 May, with maximum sustained winds of 139 km/h. On 29 May at 6.00 UTC, EWINIAR's centre was located over the sea approximately 600 km south of the Kyushu Island, southern Japan, with maximum sustained winds of 120 km/h.Its passage over central and central-northern Philippines resulted in casualties and damage. Media reports, as of 29 May, seven fatalities, of which six in Quezon, Calabarzon region and one more in Misamis Oriental, Northern Mindanao region. In addition, the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) Disaster Response Operations and Monitoring Information Centre (DROMIC) reports approximately 19,500 displaced people (of which 15,175 in 192 evacuation centres) and more than 51,000 affected people across nine regions.EWINIAR is expected to dwindle into a tropical storm on 29-31 May, remaining well off the coast of southern and central Japan.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds and are still forecasted over central and northern Philippines, and the Ryukyu Islands and Kyushu Island in Japan.

title: India, Bangladesh - Tropical storm REMAL, update (ECHO 29 May 2024)
description: The passage of the tropical storm REMAL between eastern and north-eastern India and Bangladesh on 26-28 May has left very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges associated. These events have caused floods, landslides and several severe weather-related incidents - mainly due to the strong wind - that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 29 May, a total of 54 fatalities, of which 44 in India and 10 across Bangladesh. In India, 27 fatalities and seven missing people were reported across the Mizoram state, seven fatalities in West Bengal, four fatalities and 18 injured people in Assam, four fatalities in Nagaland and two fatalities and four injured people in Meghalaya. More than 37,000 damaged houses were reported across the affected states.In Bangladesh, around 807,000 people have been evacuated in nearly 9,500 shelters and around 70,285 houses have been completely destroyed, 107,176 of which partially damaged.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall and strong winds are still forecasted over most of Bangladesh and north-eastern India.

title: Armenia - Floods, update (ECHO 29 May 2024)
description: Following heavy rainfall and consequent floods that hit northern Armenia, particularly Lori and Tavush Provinces, on 26 May, the number of casualties increased. In addition, the two aforementioned provinces have been also impacted by the overflow of the Debed, Tashir and Aghstev rivers.According to media, at least four people died and 429 people have been evacuated across the affected areas. In addition, hundreds of people experienced power cuts, and almost 17 bridges have been destroyed.On 29-30 May, moderate rain is expected across northern, central and southern Armenia.

title: Indonesia - Flash floods  (ECHO 29 May 2024)
description: Since 23 May, heavy rainfall has been affecting South Sumatra province, western Indonesia, causing flash floods that resulted in casualties, displacements and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), six people died, almost 13,000 people have been displaced and 55,900 others have been affected in the Ogan Komering Ulu regency area, South Sumatra province. Moreover, in the same area, 12,909 houses have been impacted, of which 110 were seriously damaged and 12 to some extent.For the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall with localized thunderstorms are forecasted across most of the affected province, where authorities have issued warnings for heavy rain, thunderstorms and strong winds.

title: Namibia - Drought (ECHO 29 May 2024)
description: On 22 May, the Government of Namibia declared the State of Emergency following the worst drought that the country has experienced in 100 years.According to media reports, every one in five Namibians is considered food insecure. Against the backdrop of scarce rains, over 331,000 households have already registered for the government-funded drought relief programme to assist the affected communities. This programme amounts to EUR 40 million but it currently has a funding gap of EUR 25 million.At the extraordinary summit held on 20 May by the Southern African Development Community (SADC) to discuss the El Niño-induced drought and floods affecting member states, the Namibian President called for assistance from SADC countries and the International Community at large to bridge the abovementioned funding gap.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 28 May 2024)
description: Following heavy rainfall, strong wind, hail and thunderstorms that have affected central and eastern United States in the last few days, causing tornados and severe weather-related incidents, the death toll is increasing.According to media, as of 28 May, at least 23 people died, including eight people in Arkansas, seven in northern Texas, two in eastern Oklahoma, five in Kentucky, one in Alabama and one in Colorado, and more than 80 injured people, including 67 in Texas and six in Arkansas.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 27 May, at least 102 people displaced in shelters. Several buildings have been damaged by weather-related incidents, and more than 500,000 people have been affected by power outages across the affected states.A state of emergency has been declared for Kentucky.On 28-29 May, more heavy rainfall and severe thunderstorms are expected in the central and eastern parts of the United States, with locally very heavy rainfall and severe thunderstorms over Texas and Oklahoma.

title: Indonesia - Landslide, update (ECHO 28 May 2024)
description: The death toll due to a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall that affected Arfak Mountain Regency, West Papua Province on 26 May, eastern Indonesia, has increased.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), as of 28 May, four people died and one has been injured in Minyambouw District.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecasted over the West Papua province.

title: Philippines - Tropical cyclone EWINIAR, update (ECHO 28 May 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone EWINIAR, "Aghon" in the Philippines, continued northeastward over the Philippine Sea on 27 May, with maximum sustained winds up to 176 km/h. On 28 May at 0.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea approximately 275 km east of the far northern Luzon, with maximum sustained winds of 139 km/h.Its passage over central and central-northern Philippines resulted in casualties and damage. Media reports, as of 28 May, seven fatalities, of which six in Quezon province, Calabarzon region and one more in Misamis Oriental province, Northern Mindanao region. The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports, eight injured people, approximately 22,100 displaced people - of which a number in 161 evacuation centres - nearly 36,150 affected people and 22 damaged houses across the affected area.EWINIAR is expected to continue northeastward offshore on 29 May, weakening into tropical storm on 30-31 May, remaining far off the coast of Japan.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds and are still forecasted over most of Luzon Island.

title: Papua New Guinea - Landslide, update (ECHO 28 May 2024)
description: Following the huge landslide that covered approximately 9 ha, triggered by heavy rainfall that occurred in Yambali village, in Lagaip-Porgera district of the Enga province, in central-northern Papua New Guinea at 3:00 local time of 24 May, the death toll is increasing.According to media, as of 27 May, at least 2,000 people are still buried under the debris and more than 7,900 people have been forced to leave the villages near the landslide. In addition, 18 buildings have been destroyed, more than 634 have been potentially damaged, and the main highway has been blocked.Rescue operations are still ongoing.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecasted over the whole of Papua New Guinea.

title: India, Bangladesh - Tropical storm REMAL, update (ECHO 28 May 2024)
description: Tropical storm REMAL made landfall over the border area between India and Bangladesh on 26 May, with maximum sustained winds of 111 km/h. On 27-28 May, it passed over the Kolkata city area (India) and Patuakhali city area (Bangladesh) and continued moving over southern, central and north-eastern Bangladesh, further weakening and dissipating.Very heavy rainfall, strong winds, storm surges and floods affected the area, causing casualties and damage. As of 28 May, ten casualties are reported across southern Bangladesh and six more in the West Bengal state (India). Around 800,000 are displaced across Bangladesh and 150,000 in India. Approximately 3.75 million of affected people in both countries. Around 115,000 houses were reported damaged and 35,000 destroyed in Bangladesh, fostering high risk of protracted displacement. Severe impacts on livelihood and community infrastructure facilities continue to be reported.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall and strong winds are still forecasted over the whole Bangladesh and the whole north-eastern India. Needs assessment are ongoing in the affected districts, while emergency items are being distributed.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 27 May 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind and thunderstorms have been affecting Texas, Oklahoma, Kansas, Arkansas, and Missouri in the central-eastern United States since 25 May, causing 24 tornados and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), as of 26 May, four people died, two people in Arkansas and two in Oklahoma, and several people have been injured across the two federal states. Several buildings have been damaged by weather-related incidents, at least 237,000 people have been affected by power outages across Arkansas, Oklahoma Kansas and Missouri; the Highway 340 is closed due to landslides.On 27-28 May, more heavy rainfall and severe thunderstorms are expected in the central and eastern parts of the United States.

title: Philippines - Tropical storm EWINIAR (ECHO 27 May 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named EWINIAR ("Aghon" in the Philippines) formed over the southern Philippine Sea on 24 May and started moving north-west toward central Philippines. It passed over Visayas Islands and southern Luzon Island on 25-26 May as a tropical cyclone. On 27 May at 0.00 UTC its centre was located over the Philippine Sea, just east of the coast of central Luzon, with maximum sustained winds of 167 km/h.ADINET reports, as of 27 May, more than 5,300 displaced people and a total of 19,373 affected people across the Philippines. On the forecast track it is expected to continue moving northeastward offshore on 28-31 May, strenghtening, toward southern Japan, but remaining far off the coast of Japan.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecasted over Visayas Islands and Luzon Island.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods (ECHO 27 May 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central and eastern Indonesia, in particular Sumatra island and West Papua province since 25 May, triggering landslides and causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as 27 May, four fatalities, one person still missing, more than 350 damaged houses, one damaged bridge and a total of approximately 3,600 affected people across the Tanggamus regency, Lampung province, southern Sumatra island mainly due to landslides.In addition, the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of the same date, two fatalities, two missing people, one injured person, and six damaged houses in the Arfak Mountains regency, West Papua province, also in this case due to a landslide occurred in the area of the Mitiede village on 26 May.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecasted over the West Papua province while moderate rainfall is forecasted over Sumatra.

title: Türkiye - Severe weather (ECHO 27 May 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorms and lightning affected northeastern Türkiye on 22 May, causing several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media reports, as of 23 May, on fatality due to lighting in Davul village in Kars province.On 27-28 May, more rainfall is forecasted over most of central and eastern Türkiye.

title: Armenia - Floods (ECHO 27 May 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Armenia since 26 May, in particular in the Lori and Tavush provinces, causing floods and river overflow that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 27 May, three fatalities of whom one person in Ptghavan, Tavush Province, one in Shnogh village, Lori province and two missing people. More than 232 people have been evacuated and at least 265 people have been affected due to flooding and river overflow of the Debed, Aghstev and Tashir rivers. In addition, 138 buildings and six bridges have been destroyed, 70 buildings have been affected, and several sections of two main highways and the national railway have been closed due to floods and landslides.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is still forecasted over the affected areas.

title: India, Bangladesh - Tropical storm REMAL (ECHO 27 May 2024)
description: A tropical storm named REMAL formed over the northern Bay of Bengal on 25 May. It made landfall over the border area between India, West Bengal state and Bangladesh, Khulna division on 26 May around 18.00 UTC. Tidal surges as high as 12 feet, heavy rainfall, and wind speeds of up to 120 km/h have led to inundation of many southwestern coastal areas of Bangladesh.In Bangladesh, over 800,000 people have been evacuated to safer areas in 16 coastal districts ahead of the cyclone in 9,000 shelters. Tens of thousands of volunteers had been mobilized by the Ministry of Disaster Management and Relief (MoDMR) to quicken the evacuation efforts and relief has already been transported to remote areas.10,599 houses are so far reported fully destroyed, while 18,605 are reported partially destroyed, and 9 people are reported dead. Millions are without power.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected over West Bengal and most of Bangladesh.

title: Ethiopia - Floods (ECHO 27 May 2024)
