The epicentre was located 111 km north of Paciran sub-district, in Lamongan Regency in East Java Province.An aftershock with a magnitude of 5.4 M have been recorded in the area.USGS PAGER estimated that up to 2,000 people were exposed to severe shaking and up to 26,000 people to very strong shaking.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB) and the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 25 March, two people have been injured, 33,535 people have been displaced in East Java Province and a total of 144,520 people have been affected. In addition, almost 4,679 houses and 183 public buildings have been damaged, the most affected is Gresik Regency.BNPB also reports weather-related events occurred on 24 March in West Java Province: one person died due to a landslide in Sentul Village, Bogor Regency, West Java Province and nine people are still missing due to a flash flood and a landslide in West Bandung Regency.

title: Papua New Guinea - Earthquake (ECHO 25 Mar 2024)
description: An earthquake of 6.9 M at a depth of 40 km occurred in Papua New Guinea on 23 March at 20.22 UTC (24 March at 6.22 local time). The epicentre was located 38 km north of Ambunti Town, in East Sepik Province, western Papua New Guinea.USGS PAGER estimated that up to 200,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 200,000 people to very strong shaking.According to media reports, as of 25 March, five people died and at least 1,000 houses have been destroyed. Dozens of villages hit by the earthquake in the northern Papua New Guinea area have already been affected by the flooding of the Sepik River.National authorities are conducting monitoring, assessment, and data collection.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 22 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Indonesia, in particular the Central Java Province since 20 March, causing floods that have resulted in damage.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of 21 March, a total of approximately 16,100 affected people and around 4,100 flooded buildings, including 15 schools and one health facility, across the Tegal City, Central Java Province.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the whole already affected Java Island.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 22 Mar 2024)
description: Several wildfires have been burning across western USA, in particular Virginia, West Virginia, the worst affected, Maryland and North Carolina since 20 March, prompting evacuations and causing damage.The major ongoing active fires are across the Rockingham, Page and Shenandoah Counties, Virginia, nearby the border with West Virginia and according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), these wildfires have burnt an area of approximately 8,000 ha.Media report, as of 22 March, some evacuated people, several evacuation orders issued by local authorities, one evacuation shelter opened, five destroyed houses, a number of closed schools and several closed roads across the three affected counties in Virginia.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast remains moderate across the already affected states.

title: Uruguay - Floods and landslides (ECHO 22 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect several parts of Uruguay, with Florida, San Jose and Colonia as the most affected Departments, causing floods and landslides that resulted in evacuations and damage.According to media reports, as of 21 March, more than 4,722 people have been displaced, of whom 1,995 in Florida and 1,298 in San Jose Departments, 600 in Rosario and 150 in Nueva Helvecia Cities , Colonia Departement, at least 116,000 have been affected by power outages, more than 12 roads have been closed, including two major roads near Colonia del Sacramento and San Ramon Cities. In addition classes have been suspended in most parts of the country.For the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is expected across most the whole Uruguay.

title: Afghanistan - Flash floods (ECHO 22 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has affected western Afghanistan, since 20 March, causing floods, flash floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 21 March, three people died, of whom two due to flash floods and one due to a severe weather-related incident, and one person have been injured  in Qala-e-Naw Town, in Qala e Naw District, in Badghis Province. In addition, several houses have been damaged due to floods.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over northern Afghanistan, with locally very heavy rainfall.

title: Argentina - Floods (ECHO 21 Mar 2024)
description: On 19-20 March, heavy rainfall affected Buenos Aires Province, north-eastern Argentina, particularly La Plata City area, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the International Federation of Red Cross And Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), one person died, six people were injured, 300 others were displaced and 400,000 were affected across La Plata area.Local authorities are providing emergency assistance for those affected.For the next three days, drier conditions are expected across the affected area.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting the central Democratic Republic of the Congo, in particular the Maniema Province, since 16 March, causing floods, landslides and a number of severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage. Maniema is also experiencing record temperatures, with an average of 40°C recorded this week in Kindu, the province’s administrative centre.Media report, as of 21 March, two fatalities, 27 injured people and approximately 100 damaged houses across the Pangi Territory (central Maniema Province), where the worst affected are the villages of Binumbi and Chabangwa.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the Maniema Province.

title: Papua New Guinea - Landslides and floods (ECHO 21 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting central Papua New Guinea, in particular the Highlands Region since 18 March, causing floods and triggering a number of landslides that have resulted in casualties and severe damage.According to media, as of 21 March, 23 people died across the Chimbu Province, central Highlands Region due to three landslide events that occurred on 18 March. In addition, media also report the severe flooding of the coastal village of Lese Kavora, in the neighbouring Gulf Province due to storm surges.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall is forecasted over the whole country.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Mar 2024)
description: Storms and strong winds were reported on 19 March over seven Provinces of northern Thailand (Nan, Lampang, Chiang Mai, Phetchabun, Loei, Udon Thani, and Maha Sarakham) resulting in damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), 415 people have been affected as well as 83 houses.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast across most of north-western Thailand.

title: Iraq - Floods and flash floods, update (ECHO 21 Mar 2024)
description: The amount of humanitarian impact is increasing in Iraq following floods and flash floods triggered by heavy rainfall that have been affecting the whole country since 18 March.According to the International Federation of Red Cross And Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), three people died, 11 others were injured and 627 people have been evacuated in at least ten localities of the northern Duhok Governorate, Kurdistan region. In Erbil Governorate, Kurdistan region, 516 people have been affected by floods in areas like Terawa, Badawa, Koyistan, and Dara Tow.Furthermore, also the Governorates of Diyala and Maysan, eastern Iraq experienced heavy rain and floods where 12 individuals were affected.For the next 48 hours, light to moderate rain is expected across northern Iraq, close to the border with Türkiye.

title: France - Snow avalanches (ECHO 20 Mar 2024)
description: Three avalanches occurred in the Alps on 19 March, resulting in one dead and one injured person.According to the French Civil Protection Authorities, the first avalanche occurred in Chamonix and affected three people of whom one died.For the next 24 hours, no precipitation is forecast over the Hautes-Alpes Department where yellow warnings for avalanches have been issued.

title: Brazil - Strong wind (ECHO 20 Mar 2024)
description: Strong wind has been affecting south-eastern Brazil, in particular the Paraná State over the past few days, causing some severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 20 March, three fatalities, one person still missing and eight injured people across the Paranavai City, north-western Paraná State due to a strong wind event occurred on 17 March.Over the next 24 hours, strong winds and heavy rainfall are forecast over the whole already affected Paraná State.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 20 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central, in particular the Central Java Province and north-eastern Indonesia, mainly the Maluku Province since 14 March, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), as of 20 March, seven people died, 4,188 people were sheltered in 25 refugee camps and almost 40,000 were affected across the Kudus Regency, Central Java Province. In addition, 6,523 houses were flooded.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) also reports, as of the same date, approximately 100 displaced people, nearly 650 affected people and around 160 flooded houses throughout the Seram Bagian Barat Regency, Maluku Province.Over the next 72 hours, moderate rainfall is still forecast over the Java Island and the Maluku Islands.

title: Iraq - Floods (ECHO 20 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting north-eastern Iraq, in particular the Kurdistan region since 18 March, causing floods and flash floods and that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 20 March, two fatalities, at least ten injured people, approximately 30 destroyed houses and around 100 damaged houses across the Duhok City area , Duhok Governorate. Floods were also reported across Erbil, the main city of the Kurdistan region.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the already affected Kurdistan region.

title: Afghanistan, Pakistan - Earthquakes (ECHO 20 Mar 2024)
description: Another earthquake of 5.4 M at a depth of 10 km struck southern Kandahar Province in southern Afghanistan on 19 March at 21.27 UTC (1.57 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 2.5 km north-west of the 5.5 M main event that occurred on the same day at 0.35 UTC (5.05 local time) and 67 km west-northwest of Nushki City in Pakistan.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 21,000 people were exposed to moderate shaking.As of 20 March, according to media, there are no reports of any casualties or damage.

title: Iceland - Volcanic eruption, update (ECHO 19 Mar 2024)
description: According to the Icelandic Meteorological Office (IMO), as of 18 March at 18:30 UTC, the volcanic eruption that started on 16 March on the Reykjanes Peninsula, in southern Iceland, is relatively stable.The estimated lava extent was approximately 6 km² as of 17 March at 14:56 UTC. The lava flow from the southern crater, that was approximately 330 m from the temporary closed Suðurstrandarvegur road, has not significantly advanced.In the opening fissure zone the volcanic hazard is still very high.

title: Fiji - Floods (ECHO 19 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall have been affecting Fiji Islands since 16 March, causing floods, flash floods and river overflow that resulted in population displacements and damage.As of 19 March, according to media reports, the most affected are Vanua Levu and Viti Levu Islands, where Ba Town is completely flooded due to the overflow of Elevuka Creek. In these Islands at least 230 people have been displaced in 12 evacuation centres, schools have been closed, disruption to traffic transportation and power and water cuts have been reported.For the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is expected over Fiji.

title: Uruguay - Floods (ECHO 19 Mar 2024)
description: In the past few days, central and southern Uruguay have been affected by heavy rainfall causing floods, and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in evacuations and damage.According to the national authorities, 19,000 people have been affected by power outages and at least 200 people have been displaced in the Departments of Canelones, Colonia, Florida, Río Negro and San José. In addition, almost 20 houses have been flooded in Flores and Lavalleja Departments.For the next 48 hours, moderate rain is expected across most of Uruguay.

title: Afghanistan - Earthquake (ECHO 19 Mar 2024)
description: An earthquake of 5.5 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in southern Kandahar Province in southern Afghanistan, near the border with Pakistan, on 19 March at 0.35 UTC (5.05 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 64 km west-northwest of Nushki City in Pakistan and 187 km south of Kandahar City.USGS PAGER reports that up to 10,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and 15,000 to moderate shaking.As of 19 March, according to media, there are no reports of any casualties or damage.

title: Iceland - Volcanic eruption  (ECHO 18 Mar 2024)
description: A volcanic eruption began on 16 March at 20.23 UTC between Mt. Hagafell and Mt. Stóra Skógfell on the Reykjanes Peninsula in southern Iceland. There are three eruptive opening fissures approximately 2,900 m long in the same location of the 8 February 2024 eruption.According to Icelandic Met Offic, as of 17 March at 18.40 UTC, the lava is propagating at an average speed of 12 m/h in the southern and south-eastern part of the Grindavik area.According to the Icelandic Civil Protection and to media, as of 17 March, the town of Grindavik and the Blue Lagoon Centre have been evacuated, several road in the area have been closed, the lava was about 700-800 metres from the Grindavíkurvegur main road at 22.00 local time.On 16 March, the Civil Protection Emergency Level was declared due to the eruption.On 18 March, the activity of the eruption has significantly slowed down. For now, the lava flow has nearly stopped and at the moment it is not threatening any infrastructure. This might though change depending on the eruption activity and possible change in lava flow.

title: Australia - Tropical cyclone MEGAN (ECHO 18 Mar 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named MEGAN formed over the Gulf of Carpentaria on 15 March and started moving south toward the north-eastern Northern Territory, Australia.MEGAN made landfall over the area of Port McArthur City, Northern Territory on 18 March around 5.30 UTC, with maximum sustained winds up to 159 km/h (tropical cyclone).Tropical cyclone MEGAN is expected to continue southwestward inland over Northern Territory on 19-20 March, weakening into a tropical storm.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over northern and central Northern Territory and over north-western Queensland.

title: China - Wildfires (ECHO 18 Mar 2024)
description: A number of wildfires have been affecting southern China, in particular the Sichuan and Yunnan Provinces since 15 March, causing casualties and widespread damage.Media report, as of 18 March, four fatalities in the Yunnan Province, of whom three in the Lincang City area and one more in the Wenshan City. Media also report one injured person in the Lincang City area. In addition, approximately 4,900 evacuated people were reported across the Yajiang County, Sichuan Province.As of 18 March, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the total burnt area across the aforementioned Yajiang County is more than 10,000 ha.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast is from high to very extreme over the Yunnan Province while better conditions are forecast over the Sichuan Province.

title: Peru - Severe weather (ECHO 15 Mar 2024)
description: On 10-11 March, heavy rainfall affected central Peru, causing floods and the overflow of Molinos River that resulted in damage.According to the National Institute of Civil Defense (INDECI), more than 220 people have been affected, three houses have been destroyed, 18 heavily damaged and 54 others affected in Molinos District, Juja Province, Junín Department following floods. Moreover, in San Juan District, Sihuas Province, Ancash Department, 42 people have been affected as well as 15 houses due to heavy rainfall.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected across the affected Departments.

title: Chile - Wildfires (ECHO 15 Mar 2024)
description: Wildfires have been affecting central Chile, in particular the Valparaíso Region since 13 March, causing population evacuation and damage.As of 15 March, according to the National System for Disaster Prevention, Mitigation and Attention (SENAPRED), there are currently three active wildfires across the Valparaíso Municipality, Valparaíso  Region, in Cerro Cordillera, Curauma and La Caldera areas.SENAPRED reports, as of the same date, some evacuated people and approximately 40 damaged houses in the Valparaiso Municipality.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme over the Valparaiso Region.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Landslide and floods (ECHO 15 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), in particular the South Kivu Province, bordering with western Rwanda, since 11 March, triggering a landslide and causing floods and rivers overflow, particularly the Ruzizi River that have resulted in damage.Media report, as of 15 March, an unconfirmed number of affected people and dozens of damaged houses across the Bukavu City, eastern South Kivu Province mainly due to a huge landslide occurred on 11 March.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo and the neighbouring whole Rwanda and Burundi.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslide, update (ECHO 15 Mar 2024)
description: In recent days, heavy rainfall has been affecting parts of Indonesia, causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.In Palangkaraya City, central Kalimantan Province, widespread floods resulted in four fatalities, one missing person, 644 displaced people and almost 20,400 affected people. In addition, media report a landslide occurred in Bali Island on 14 March that caused two fatalities.For the next 48 hours, heavy rain with localised thunderstorms is expected across the affected areas.

title: Montenegro - Earthquake (ECHO 14 Mar 2024)
description: An earthquake of 5.4 M at a depth of 7.5 km occurred in northern Montenegro, near the border with Bosnia and Herzegovina, on 14 March at 3.06 UTC (4.06 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 21 km south-west of Plužine Municipality, in Montenegro.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 3,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and 67,000 to moderate shaking.According to media, there are no immediate reports of casualties or property damage.

title: Ecuador - Floods, update (ECHO 14 Mar 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect most of Ecuador since 29 January, causing floods and landslides, resulting in increasing numbers of population displacement and damage.As of 13 March, the Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) reported that 447 people have been sheltered across 11 shelters. The Secretariat of Risk Management of Ecuador (SGR) reported 134,107 people affected, 1,230 people directly impacted and at least 29,737 affected houses, with 638 that have been completely destroyed.For the next 72 hours more rainfall, with locally very heavy rainfall, is expected over most of Ecuador.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 14 Mar 2024)
description: According to the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) and UN OCHA, the amounts of fatalities reached 32 people following floods and landslides that affected 39,000 people of 12 districts/cities in West Sumatra Province on 7-8 March. National and local authorities are providing emergency assistance for those affected.In addition, also West and Central Kalimantan Provinces are experiencing widespread floods that resulted in casualties and damage. In Melawi Regency, West Kalimantan Province, two people died and almost 29,000 have been affected while in Palangkaraya City, Central Kalimantan Province more than 500 people have been evacuated, and almost 10,400 others have been affected.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with localised thunderstorms is expected across the Central Kalimantan Province.

title: Italy - Snow avalanches and severe weather  (ECHO 29 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, snow and strong winds have been affecting northern Italy since 26 February, causing snow avalanches, flooding, landslides, and resulting in casualties and damage.As of 29 February, according to media reports, a snow avalanche occurred on 28 February in Racines Municipality, in Bolzano Province (Trentino Alto-Adige Region)  and resulted in one fatality and two injured people. A moderate avalanche risk is in effect for Bolzano Province for the next 24 hours.As of the same date, a total of four people have been evacuated due to floods in Vicenza Province in Veneto Region. In addition, several landslides triggered by heavy rainfall occurred across Liguria, Piemonte and Veneto Region and blocked several main roads.For the next 24 hours, more snowfall is expected across northern Italy, while moderate to heavy rain is forecast over the whole country. A red alert for hydro and hydrogeological risk is still in effect for parts of the Veneto Region.

title: Peru - Landslide (ECHO 29 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Peru, in particular the Machupicchu District, Urubamba Province over the last few days, causing a huge landslide that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 29 February, two people still missing and 12 injured people due to the mentioned landslide occurred in the Machu Picchu mountain ridge and neighbouring areas on 26 February.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Brazil - Floods, update (ECHO 29 Feb 2024)
description: The number of casualties is increasing following the heavy rainfall that has been affecting western Brazil, in particular the Acre State, bordering with Peru and Bolivia, since 25 February, causing flooding and rivers overflow.According to media, as of 28 February, one person is missing due to floods and approximately 12,000 people have been sheltered in the 46 available evacuation centers.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole already affected areas.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 29 Feb 2024)
description: Wildfires have been burning across southern USA, in particular northern Texas, and the neighbouring western Oklahoma over the past few days, prompting evacuations and causing casualties and widespread damage.National authorities report three major ongoing active fires. The Smokehouse Creek Fire, across the Canadian, Glazier, Pampa and Miami Communities (Texas) and the neighbouring area in Oklahoma, has burnt an area of nearly 344,000 ha and is currently not contained. The nearby Windy Deuce Fire has burnt an area of more than 57,000 ha and is currently partially contained. Finally, the Grape Vine Creek Fire in the same area has burnt over 12,000 ha and is currently partially contained.Media report, as of 29 February, one fatality in the Hutchinson County and around 100 burned houses across the Hutchinson and the Moore Counties (Texas). In addition, media report 13 burned houses across Oklahoma. The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports mandatory evacuation orders for 6,500 people across the affected area.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to very high over northern Texas and western Oklahoma.

title: Pakistan – Floods  (ECHO 29 Feb 2024)
description: On 27 February, torrential downpours were recorded in Gwadar, submerging several areas, including Gwadar city and Sarabandan. Gwadar district has declared a state of emergency while rescue operations are underway.The Meteorological Department recorded rain across various locations in Balochistan, with Gwadar receiving the highest amount at 58 mm. So far, no casualty has been reported.Continued rain was seen in northern Balochistan and coastal areas until 28 February, which was followed by strong winds and rains, triggering province-wide heavy rains until 2 March.National Disaster Management Authority also issued a forecast of widespread heavy rainfall from 29 February until 2 March in various areas of Punjab, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Gilgit-Baltistan, Murree, and Galiyat.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall, snow and strong winds have been affecting most parts of northern and central Italy, causing floods, triggering landslides, and resulting in damage.Issues related to the landslide occurred in Pieve Ligure Municipality, which affected the main road leading to the isolation of 1,000 residents, are currently being overcome.The city of Vicenza and its surroundings have been severely affected by the flooding. Schools remained closed on 27-28 February. There are no evacuations currently taking place.Floods and landslides have been also recorded in the Tuscany and Emilia Romagna Regions, where the situation is severe due to the high water level of the rivers. Some of the areas had been already affected in November 2023.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy snowfall is expected across north-western Italy, while moderate to heavy rain is forecast over most parts of Italy, including Sardinia and Sicily. A red alert for hydro and hydrogeological risk is in effect for parts of the Veneto Region.

title: Brazil - Floods (ECHO 28 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Brazil, in particular the Acre State, bordering with Peru and Bolivia since 25 February, causing floods and rivers overflow, that have resulted in population evacuation and damage.17 municipalities (out of 22) across the Acre State have been affected, where the state of emergency was declared by the Governor of Acre.The WHO/PAHO and the Government of Acre report, as of 28 February, a total of approximately 11,300 evacuated people, many of these to 46 shelters throughout nine of the affected municipalities.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole already affected Acre State.

title: Bolivia - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting a number of Departments of Bolivia, in particular the La Paz and Pando Departments since November 2023, causing floods, rivers overflow and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.WHO/PAHO and the National Civil Defense reports, as of 28 February, 40 fatalities, a total of approximately 12,000 affected families and more than 450 destroyed houses across the country.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over western and central Bolivia.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslide, update (ECHO 28 Feb 2024)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall has been affecting Java, Sumatra and Kalimantan Islands, causing floods and resulting in displacement and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 25 February, 800 people have been displaced and 1,350 others affected in Tegal Regency, Central Java Province. In East Kotawaringin Regency, Central Kalimantan Province, 12 people have been displaced and more than 1,600 affected while more than 3,000 people have been affected in Muara Enim Regency, South Sumatra Province.Furthermore, the number of fatalities has increased to five due to the landslide occurred in Jalan Poros Bonglo Village, Luwu Regency, South Sulawesi Province on 26 February.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with localised thunderstorms are forecast over the affected provinces.

title: Mexico - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 28 Feb 2024)
description: Popocatépetl volcano, located in the States of Puebla, Morelos, and Mexico, central Mexico erupted on 27 February and the ash plume reached up to 2,000 m above the crater.According to Mexico's National Center for Prevention of Disasters (CENAPRED), a tiny ash fall has been reported across several Municipalities in the States of Morelos, Tlaxcala, Mexico City, and Mexico. In addition, media report the cancellation of more than 20 domestic and international flights.The authorities raised the alert level to phase 2, and recommended to respect the exclusion radius of 12 km around the crater, being within this area is not safe.

title: Australia - Bushfire, update (ECHO 27 Feb 2024)
description: The extent of burnt areas due to the Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire reached 21,379 ha in south-western Victoria State as recorded by the Forest Fire Management Victoria.According to media reports, about 30,000 people have been urged to evacuate in the zone between Ballarat and Ararat Cities, including the Towns of Amphitheatre, Beaufort, Clunes, Elmhurst, Lexton, Glenbrae and Learmonth. Hundreds of schools are closed on 27 and 28 February. Two relief centres have been set up in Ararat and Maryborough for people planning to leave. The fire is not yet under control, and 102 vehicles have been mobilised to fight the fire.The Bureau of Meteorology of Australia has issued a Fire Weather Warning for the Regions of Mallee, Wimmera, Northern Country, North Central, South West and Central.For the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to very extreme over the interested area.

title: Bolivia - Dam break and floods (ECHO 27 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Bolivia, particularly the Cochabamba Department since 25 February, causing a dam break and consequent floods, mud flows and landslides that have resulted in population displacement and damage.Media report, as of 27 February, 40 displaced families and 30 destroyed houses due to a dam break occurred in the area of Laquina Community, Sacaba Municipality, central Cochabamba Department in the morning (UTC) on 25 February. The dam break also caused floods, mud flows and landslides also downstream across the Catachila Alta and Chinata Communities, central Cochabamba Department.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country, including the already affected Cochabamba Department.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting southern Brazil, in particular the Santa Catarina State since 25 February, causing floods, landslides and other incidents that have resulted in population displacement and damage.Media report, as of 27 February, approximately 100 displaced people and several damaged buildings and roads across the Joinville City, the main City of the Santa Catarina State, mainly due to floods.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the Santa Catarina State.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather, update (ECHO 27 Feb 2024)
description: Since 29 January, heavy rainfall- due to the rainy season- is still affecting most of the country, causing floods, and landslides that resulted in casualties and widespread damage.According to the Secretariat of Risk Management of Ecuador (SGR), six people died, seven others have been injured, and more than 102,000 affected, of whom almost 60,000 in Manabi, 22,000 in Guayas and more than 10,000 in Los Rios. Furthermore, more than 23,600 houses and almost 500 buildings, most of them schools have been damaged.For the next 24 hours moderate to heavy rainfall is expected over most of Ecuador, particularly in the western regions.

title: Indonesia - Landslide (ECHO 27 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern Indonesia, particularly the South Sulawesi Province since 25 February, causing a huge landslide that has resulted in casualties and damage.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of 27 February, four fatalities, ten injured people, a total of 20 affected people and some damaged roads due to a landslide that occurred in the Jalan Poros Bonglo Village, Luwu Regency, South Sulawesi Province in the morning (UTC) on 26 February.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Sulawesi Island.

title: France - Snow avalanche  (ECHO 26 Feb 2024)
description: On 25 February, a snow avalanche occurred in Mont-Dore Municipality, in Puy-de-Dôme Department in Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Region, central France, resulting in casualties.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) reports, as of 26 February, four fatalities and three injured people, two other people were involved in the slide by they have not been injured.Over the next 24 hours, sunny conditions are expected in the affected area.

title: Australia - Bushfire (ECHO 26 Feb 2024)
description: Over the past few days, a huge bushfire, Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire has been affecting south-western Victoria State, resulting in evacuations. The Forest Fire Management Victoria reported that the fire started on 22 February and has reached the extension of 20,000 ha as of 25 February at 18.46 UTC.According to media, more than 2,000 people have been evacuated in towns close to the City of Ballarat, schools have been closed and 5,000 houses experienced power cuts.Around 1,000 firefighters supported by more than 50 aircraft are battling the fires in the affected area. The localities of Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Glenpatrick, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, and Raglan are under watch for bushfires.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast remains from high to very high over the already affected area.

title: Indonesia - Flood (ECHO 26 Feb 2024)
description: Since the last week, heavy rainfall has been affecting Sumatra and Kalimantan Islands, causing floods and resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), almost 600 people have been affected as well as 180 houses by floods in Sintang Regency, West Kalimantan Province. In addition, more than 600 households have been affected and 29 people evacuated due to widespread floods in South Lampung Regency, Lampung Province.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with localised thunderstorms are forecast over the affected provinces.

title: Peru - Flood (ECHO 26 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-eastern Peru since 21 February, causing floods and river overflow that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 25 February, the most affected area is Iñapari City in Tahuamanu Province, bordering region with Brazil and Bolivia. Media reports that at least 2,800 people have been affected, several people have been injured, some people have been evacuated and 600 houses have been flooded by the overflow of the Acre and Yaverija Rivers. Power outages and a lack of drinking water have also been reported in the area.For the next 72 hours, more rainfall, with locally heavy rainfall, is expected across the whole country.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 23 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting northern France since 22 February, causing flooding and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC), as of 23 February, one person died in Deux-Sèvres Departement due to flood, and 11 have been injured across Seine-et-Marne, Val-d'Oise and Seine-Saint-Denis Departments.In addition, approximately 3,000 people were evacuated in Rosny-sous-Bois Municipality, in Seine-Saint-Denis Department due to a severe weather-related incidents. Media reports, as of the same date, at least 95,000 affected people by power outages and traffic disruptions in the Hauts-de-France, Brittany, Normandy and Nouvelle-Aquitaine Regions.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over western France.

title: Australia - Tropical storm LINCOLN, update (ECHO 23 Feb 2024)
description: On 22 February, tropical storm LINCOLN continued southwestward along the coast of western Pilbara region, Western Australia. On 23 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 355 km north of the coastal town of Exmounth, northern Gascoyne region, Western Australia, with maximum sustained winds of 63 km/h (tropical storm).LINCOLN is expected to strenghten and to pass very close over the area of Exmounth Town in the very early morning (UTC) on 24 February, with maximum sustained winds of 83 km/h.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over western Pilbara and northern Gascoyne regions. The Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) has issued a warning for gales over this latter region.

title: Mongolia - Severe weather (ECHO 23 Feb 2024)
description: Snowfall and severe cold conditions have hit several parts of Mongolia this winter, causing casualties and damage.As of 22 February, media report one fatality and more than 1,5 million livestock losses across the country. Essential aids have been provided since 19 February.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the whole country.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides (ECHO 23 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Brazil, in particular the Rio Grande Do Sul State and the Rio de Janeiro State since 21 February, causing floods, flash floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 23 February, nine fatalities, of which four in Barra do Piraí Municipality, Rio de Janeiro State, two in Japeri Municipality and three more across the Nova Iguaçu Municipality, Rio Grande Do Sul State. In addition, media also report nearly 550 displaced people across Nova Iguaçu and Japeri Municipalities.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Rio de Janeiro State while no more rainfall is forecast over most of the Rio Grande Do Sul State.
geo_cities: ['Nova Iguaçu', 'Rio Grande', 'Barra do Piraí', 'Rio de Janeiro']

title: Australia - Tropical storm LINCOLN, update (ECHO 22 Feb 2024)
description: After the passage of its remnants over the Kimberley region, northern Western Australia on 19-21 February, LINCOLN continued westward, strenghtening and reforming over the Indian Ocean. On 22 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 410 km north of the coastal town of Port Hedland, western Pilbara region, with maximum sustained winds of 63 km/h (tropical storm).LINCOLN is expected to continue south-west over the Ocean, further strenghtening and it is forecast to make landfall over Exmouth Town, northern Gascoyne region, Western Australia on 24 February very early in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 93 km/h (tropical storm).Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over western Pilbara and Gascoyne regions on 23-25 February. The Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) has issued a warning for gales over the area.

title: Bolivia - Landslide and severe weather (ECHO 22 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Bolivia since 19 February causing landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 22 February, one person died and a house has been destroyed due to a landslide that occurred in San Antonio District of La Paz City.The Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) reported, as of 20 February, a total of 33 fatalities, 11,509 affected families and 446 destroyed houses by severe weather in eight Departments of the country since November.Red alerts for river overflow have been issued for La Paz and Irpavi River in La Paz Department.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over most of central and western Bolivia, with locally very heavy rainfall.

title: Mauritius, Reunion - Tropical cyclone ELEANOR, update (ECHO 22 Feb 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone ELEANOR continued south over the southern Indian Ocean toward Mauritius, as a tropical storm. On 22 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 85 km north-east of Mauritius main island and 480 km west of the Rodrigues Island (Mauritius), with maximum sustained winds of 108 km/h (tropical storm).ELEANOR is expected to pass very close to the eastern coast of Mauritius on 22 February in the afternoon (UTC), slightly strenghtening. After that, on 23-25 February, it is forecast to turn westward, remaining well south of Reunion, as a tropical storm.Over the next 24, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over Mauritius and Reunion, while heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over the Rodrigues Island for the next 48 hours. The Mauritius Meteorological Services has issued a Class 3 Warning for cyclone over the Mauritius main island and a warning for heavy rainfall and strong wind over Rodrigues.

title: Indonesia - Strong winds (ECHO 22 Feb 2024)
description: Strong winds have affected West Java Province in Indonesia, on 21 February, causing casualties and damage.According to the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) and to media reports, at least 22 people were injured, of whom 20 in Cicalengka and Rancaekek Districts in Bandung Regency and two in Jatinangor and Cimanggung in Sumedang Regency. In addition, more than 60 houses have been damaged by strong winds.More severe weather is still forecast over the whole Java Island over the next 72 hours.

title: Peru - Floods (ECHO 21 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Peru since 19 February, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the National Institute of Civil Defense (INDECI) of Peru, the most affected are Contralmirante Villar and Tumbes Provinces in Tumbes Region. The same source reports that a total of 346 people have been affected and at least 112 buildings have been damaged by flood and the overflow of the Tumbes River. In addition, 41,800 urban roads have been affected.At the same time, Peru’s Ministry of Health (MINSA) reports over 13,000 dengue cases so far in 2024, marking a 53.4% increase from 2023. This surge coincides with prolonged El Niño-induced heatwaves.For the next 24 hours, more rainfall, with locally heavy rainfall, is expected across the affected departments.

title: Mauritius, Reunion - Tropical cyclone ELEANOR, update (ECHO 21 Feb 2024)
description: Tropical cyclone ELEANOR is moving south over the Indian Ocean on 21 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 590 km north-north-east of the northern coast of Mauritius, with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h (tropical storm).ELEANOR is expected to continue southward over the Ocean strengthening on 21 February. After that, it is forecast to move over the Ocean between Mauritius and Rodrigues Islands on 22-23 February, with maximum sustained winds up to 137 km/h (tropical cyclone). Furthermore, it will weaken and dissipate on 24-25 February 200 km south of Mauritius.On 21-23 February, very heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over Mauritius, Rodrigues and Reunion. The Mauritius Meteorological Services has raised to 2 the Class Warning for cyclone over the whole Island.

title: Pakistan - Severe weather and landslide  (ECHO 21 Feb 2024)
description: Very heavy rainfall affected Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province, north-eastern Pakistan on 18-20 February triggering a landslide and causing severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Provincial Disaster Management Authority (PDMA), three people died, of whom two in Peshawar District due to a severe weather-related incident and another in Upper Dir after a landslide. In addition, six people have been injured, and 11 houses have been damaged or destroyed.For the next 24 hours hours, drier conditions are expected over the affected Province.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods (ECHO 21 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several parts of Indonesia since 16 February, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 19 February, two fatalities and two injured people have been reported due to a landslide that occurred in Bogor Town, West Java Province on 18 February.As of 21 February, UN OCHA reports, at least 25,500 displaced people, of whom 24,000 in Demak Regency in Central Java, and tens of thousands of affected people due to floods across Jambi, West Nusa Tenggara, South Sulawesi and East Java Provinces.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over most of Indonesia, with locally very heavy rainfall over Java and Sumatra islands.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 20 Feb 2024)
description: Strong winds have been affecting central and north-eastern Thailand in particular the Kamphaeng Phet, Nong Bua Lamphu and Nakhon Sawan Provinces since 17 February, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in  floods that have resulted in damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 30 January, a total of more than 1,400 affected people and over 280 damaged houses across the aforementioned provinces.Over the next 72 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over the whole Thailand.

title: Mauritius, Reunion - Tropical cyclone ELEANOR (ECHO 20 Feb 2024)
description: A new tropical storm named ELEANOR formed over the southern Indian Ocean, east of north-eastern Madagascar, on 19 February and started moving eastward, slightly strenghtening. On 20 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore very far of northern coast of Mauritius, with maximum sustained winds of 85 km/h (tropical storm).ELEANOR is expected to turn south over the Ocean on 20-21 February, strenghtening. After that it is forecast to pass very close to the eastern coast of Mauritius on the afternoon of 22 February, with maximum sustained winds up to 137 km/h (tropical cyclone).Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over Mauritius starting from 21 February and over Reunion from 22 February. The Mauritius Meteorological Services has issued a Class 1 Warning for cyclone over the whole Island.

title: Ecuador - Floods and landslides (ECHO 20 Feb 2024)
description: Since 29 January, heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Ecuador causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in an increasing amount of casualties and damage.According to national authorities, four people died, six others were injured. In addition, more than 21,000 people have been affected, 40 houses have been destroyed, and moer than 4,500 damaged.The authorities of Ecuador are providing humanitarian assistance for those affected.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with localized thunderstorms is expected over most parts of western and central Ecuador.

title: Afghanistan - Landslide  (ECHO 20 Feb 2024)
description: A landslide triggered by heavy snowfall and rain occurred in the village of Teten, in Noorgram district (Nuristan Province) on 18 February, resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least 25 people died while eight have been injured. More than 30 houses were damaged.Rescue efforts have been activated but were hampered due to heavy snowfall. A mobile health team by the Department of Public Health is intervening and an assessment team is deployed.On 20 February more precipitations are expected across eastern Afghanistan, while on 21 February drier conditions are expected.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 19 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern Malaysia, the Malaysian part of the Borneo Island, in particular the western State of Sarawak, since 16 February, causing floods that have resulted in population evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 19 February, more than 410 evacuated people (of which a part of these in three evacuation centres) across the Kuching City area, the capital of Sarawak State.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of eastern Malaysia.

title: Australia - Tropical cyclone FOURTEEN (ECHO 16 Feb 2024)
description: A new tropical cyclone named FOURTEEN (Lincoln in Australia) is crossing the southern Gulf of Carpentaria coast between Port McArthur and the Northern Territory and Queensland border. On 16 February at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located on the north-eastern coast of Northern Territory State 105 km east of Borroloola Town, with maximum sustained winds of 100 km/h (tropical storm).Tropical Cyclone FOURTEEN will continue to move inland after it crosses the coast and it is forecast to weaken during 16 February. FOURTEEN will then move west across the central Northern Territory during the 17-18 February.For the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are expected across the southern Gulf of Carpentaria, the Districts of Carpentaria and Barkly (Northern Territory) and the north-western areas of Queensland close to the border with the Northern Territory. Severe weather warnings are in effect over the aforementioned areas.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Amapá State in northern Brazil since 13 February, causing floods that have resulted in population displacement and damage.According to Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) reports, as of 16 February, at least 97 families have been evacuated in a shelter in Macapá Municipality in eastern Amapá State and several houses have been damaged due to floods.On 14 February a state of emergency was issued in the Macapá Municipality.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall and isolated thunderstorms are expected over the southern Amapá State.

title: Philippines - Landslide, update (ECHO 16 Feb 2024)
description: Following the landslide that occurred in Masara village (Maco Municipality, Davao de Oro Province, southern Philippines) on 6 February, the death toll has risen.As of 15 February, media report at least 92 fatalities, 36 missing people and 32 injured people due to a landslide that hit three passenger buses.Rescue operations are still ongoing.For the next 24 hours, rain showers and thunderstorms are forecast over the affected area.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Ecuador since 29 January causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.According to national authorities, two people died in Azuay Province, and four others were injured (two in Chimborazo and two others in Loja). In addition, more than 16,600 people have been affected (most of them in Los Ríos, Manabí, Esmeraldas and Guayas), 36 houses have been destroyed, and 3,180 damaged.The authorities of Ecuador are providing humanitarian assistance for those affected.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with localized thunderstorms is expected over most parts of the country.

title: Bulgaria, Snow avalanche (ECHO 15 Feb 2024)
description: On February 12, an eyewitness reported an avalanche in the area of Markujik 3 (M3) above Borovets. The signal was immediately transmitted to the mountain rescuers at the Borovets Mountain Rescue Service, and after about 10 minutes the first rescuers arrived at the scene.16 mountain rescuers, 10 employees of the resort, as well as many volunteers - skiers and boarders located near the accident - took part in the search. After a long and difficult search, a skier's body was located.For this day, the Bulgarian Avalanche Association issues a high (4th) level warning for the alpine zone (above 2400 meters above sea level) and a significant (3rd) level warning for the transition zone (2000 – 2400 above 2400 meters above sea level).Over the next 48 hours, sunny conditions are expected over the affected area.

title: Türkiye, Cyprus - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 15 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting the eastern Mediterranean coastal area, in particular the coastal Province of Antalya (southern Türkiye) and Cyprus, since 12 February, causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 15 February, one fatality, a number of flooded houses and some closed schools across the Antalya Province (southern Türkiye).In addition, media also report one injured person, around 156 damaged houses (of which five severely damaged), 24 vehicles and approximately 20 closed roads in the Germasogeia Municipality (Limassol District, southern Cyprus) due to the strong wind and tornado.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong winds are still forecast over the already affected southern Türkiye and the whole Cyprus.

title: New Zealand - Wildfires, update (ECHO 15 Feb 2024)
description: A number of wildfires continue to affect the Christchurch City area (Canterbury Region, eastern South Island, New Zealand) since the last 48 hours, causing population evacuation and damage.The affected area are the Port Hill range and the Banks Peninsula (just south of Christchurch City) and the Selwyn District (north-west of Christchurch). A state of emergency is in place for the Christchurch City Council and the Selwyn District. As of 15 February, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the burnt area in the region around the Christchurch City reached nearly 1,500 ha.Media reports, as of the same date, more than 110 evacuated families (of which some of these in two evacuation centre), one destroyed house and some damaged schools across the affected area.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast remains from moderate to high over the already affected area.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 15 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Sulawesi Island in central Indonesia since 12 February, causing floods and resulting in population displacement and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 15 February, several residents have been evacuated and a total of 2,149 people have been affected by floods in Bolaang Mongondow Utara Regency, in North Sulawesi Province. In addition, 535 houses have been damaged.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over Sulawesi Island.

title: New Zealand - Wildfire (ECHO 14 Feb 2024)
description: A huge wildfire has been affecting the Christchurch City area (Canterbury Region, eastern South Island, New Zealand) over the last 24 hours, causing population evacuation and damage.As of 14 February, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the burnt area in the Port Hill range (just south of Christchurch City) reached nearly 500 ha.Media reports, as of the same date, several evacuated people (of which a number in two evacuation centre), one evacuated hospital, closed roads and approximately 55,000 power outages across the affected suburbs of the Christchurch City area. The Christchurch mayor declared a state of local emergency.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast is from moderate to high over the already affected area.

title: Australia - Severe weather and bushfires (ECHO 14 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have affected Victoria State, in southern Australia, on 13 February causing severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 14 February, media report one fatality in Mirboo North,  South Gippsland Shire, in the southeastern Victoria State, due to a severe weather-related incident, and more than 530,000 homes affected by power outages due to strong winds.Strong winds are also causing widespread bushfires in Victoria State, the most severe is in Pormonal Town in western Victoria, where residents have been evacuated and several houses have been damaged.Over the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over eastern Victoria State.

title: Oman - Floods, update (ECHO 14 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Oman (in particular northern Governorates) since 11 February, causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 14 February, six people died, of which three in the Rustaq Town (Al Batinah South Governorate), two more in the Yanqul Town (Ad Dhahirah Governorate) and one in the Izki Town (Ad Dakhiliyah Governorate) due to floods. Media also report one person still missing, one injured person, an unconfirmed number of evacuated people (a number of these across 229 shelters), 190 rescued people and several flooded buildings throughout the affected Governorates.Over the next 48 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Türkiye - Floods and landslides (ECHO 14 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern and eastern Türkiye, since 13 February, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 14 February, one person died, at least 900 people have been rescued and several bridges and roads have been destroyed due to floods in Antalya City in central Antalya Province.In addition, media report nine missing people due to a landslide that occurred at 11.30 UTC on 13 February in Iliç Town, Erzincan Province in Eastern Türkiye.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over Türkiye with locally very heavy rainfall over the southern and eastern parts of the Country.

title: Oman - Floods (ECHO 13 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rain has been affecting most of Oman, particularly the north of the country, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least three people died due to floods in the Rustaq Town area (Al Batinah South Governorate, northern Oman), 118 others have been evacuated in Al Batinah North Governorate and 108 people have been rescued in Ad Dhahirah Governorate.For the next 24 hours, heavy rain, hail, and strong winds are forecast over north-eastern Oman.

title: Tanzania - Severe weather (ECHO 13 Feb 2024)
description: A sequence of lightnings and thunderstorms affected south-eastern Tanzania (in particular the Lindi Region) over the past few days, causing severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties.Media report, as of 13 February, three fatalities and 18 injured people in the Lindi Region due to a lightning event occurred on 9 February in the afternoon (UTC).Over the next 72 hours, more severe weather, including very heavy rainfall and thunderstorms, is still forecast over most of the country.

title: Indonesia - Floods, update (ECHO 13 Feb 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Indonesia (in particular the Java Island) since 6 February, causing floods, flash floods and rivers overflow and resulting in population evacuation and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) and the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) report, as of 13 February, a total of approximately 21,000 displaced people (of which a number of these across 59 evacuation points) and a damaged highway in the Demak Regency (Central Java Province), due to flash floods. In addition, nearly 1,500 affected people and 365 flooded houses were reported across the Gresik Regency (East Java Province).Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Java Island.

title: Philippines - Landslide, severe weather and flood in Mindanao Island, update (ECHO 13 Feb 2024)
description: The humanitarian impact is increasing following the landslide which occurred in the village of Masara in Davao de Oro Province (Davao Region, northern Mindanao, southern Philippines) on 6 February and the severe weather and flood events that hit several parts of Mindanao since early February.According to media, the death toll due to the landslide in Masara has climbed to 68, while 51 people are still missing. In addition, more than 321,000 people have been displaced and almost 1,4 million others affected across five regions of Mindanao Island.Humanitarian partners and national authorities are providing assistance for those affected.For the next 24 hours, partly cloudy to cloudy skies with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms are forecast over most of the Island.

title: South Africa - Wildfires, update (ECHO 31 Jan 2024)
description: Wildfires continue to affect the southern coastal areas close to Cape Town City, Western Cape Province resulting in ongoing evacuations. The JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS) registered nearly 3,500 ha of burnt areas in the nearby of  Cape Town, as of 30 January.According to media all the residents living in Pringle Bay Town, where the burnt area is approximately of 500 ha, have been evacuated while residents in the nearby town of Betty's Bay have been partially evacuated.According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), on 31 January - 1 February the fire danger forecast is from moderate to high in the affected area.

title: Brazil - Floods (ECHO 31 Jan 2024)
description: Since 26 January, heavy rainfall has been affecting Bahia State, in north-eastern Brazil, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to local authorities and to the Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO), as of 30 January, four people died, of whom two in Castro Alves Municipality, other two in Aporá and Wanderley Municipalities respectively. At least 7,197 people have been displaced, the most affected Municipalities are Mutuípe, Medeiros Neto, Ilhéus, Muquém do São Francisco, Wanderley, and Cotegipe.A state of emergency has been declared for 14 Municipalities: Dário Meira, Cotegipe, Ilhéus, Medeiros Neto, Ibicuí, Anagé, Muquém de São Francisco, Iguaí, Quijingue, Wanderley, Jaguaquara, Ubaíra, Saubara and Milagres.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast over the Bahia State.

title: Philippines - Severe weather, update (ECHO 31 Jan 2024)
description: The amount of casualties and damage is still increasing following the effects of the Shear Line that caused widespread landslides and floods in Mindanao Island since 15 January.According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council, 18 people died and eight were injured in Davao Region. In addition, more than 975,000 people have been affected, of whom 908,654 in Caraga and 66,652 in Davao and more than 500 are still evacuated.For the next 24 hours, cloudy skies with scattered rain showers and thunderstorms are expected across most of Mindanao. Severe flood advisories are in effect over Davao and Caraga.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 31 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall have been affecting parts of Sumatra and Java Islands since 24 January, causing floods and resulting displacement and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 31 January, 500 people have been displaced and 42,556 others have been affected by the overflow of the Batang Tebo River in Bungo Regency, Jambi Province, Sumatra Island. Moreover, six houses have been completely destroyed and more than 11,200 houses, three bridges, 14 schools and five public buildings have been damaged. On the same island, in Pidie Regency, Aceh Province, and in Kampar Regency, Riau Province, a total of 7,643 people have been affected by floods due to heavy rainfall.Flooding has also affected Java Island, particularly Probolinggo Regency in East Java Province where 2,400 people and at least 600 houses have been affected.Over the next 48 hours, moderate to heavy rain is expected across Sumatra and Java Island.

title: Argentina - Wildfire (ECHO 30 Jan 2024)
description: Since 25 January a wildfire has been burning more than 1,000 ha affecting a Unesco World Heritage site in the Los Alerces National Park, Chubut Province, southern-central Argentina.According to media, the fire is still ongoing and was triggered by an unusual heatwave in the area.National authorities are providing the firefighting activities and deployed 200 firefighters and four aerial means.For the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to very high over the affected area.

title: La Reunion (France) - Floods (ECHO 30 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Reunion, in particular southern areas of the Island since 28 January, causing floods and some severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 30 January, three fatalities and a number of evacuated people across Saint-Pierre, Les Avirons, Saint-Joseph, L’Étang-Salé and Saint-Louis (with some people sheltered in these three last places). A number of flooded roads and closed schools were also reported throughout the Island.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole La Reunion. Meteo France has issued an orange alert for heavy rainfall and thunderstorms over most of the Island.

title: Thailand - Floods (ECHO 30 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern peninsular Thailand, in particular the Narathiwat Province over the last week, causing floods that have resulted in damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 30 January, a total of approximately 2,960 displaced people across the Waeng and Rangae Districts, Narathiwat Province. One school was also reported damaged across the affected area.Over the next 72 hours, drier conditions are expected over southern peninsular Thailand.

title: China - Earthquake  (ECHO 30 Jan 2024)
description: An earthquake of 5.7 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Aheqi county, Kirgiz Autonomous Prefecture, Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, north-western China, on 29 January at 22.27 UTC (30 January at 6.27 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 122 km west-northwest of Aykol City, Xinjiang Province.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 7,000 people were exposed to strong shaking.According to media there are no immediate reports of any impact. However, a 7.0 M earthquake hit the same area on 22 January and resulted in six fatalities and more than 100 damaged/collapsed houses.

title: Peru - Severe weather, floods and landslides (ECHO 29 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall is affecting Cusco and San Martìn Departments since 25 January, causing landslides and floods that have resulted in damage.As of 28 January, the National Institute of Civil Defense (INDECI) of Peru reports that a total of 50 families have been affected and that at least 57 buildings and a bridge have been damaged by a landslide and the overflow of the Chaychapampa River in the Velille District, Chumbivilcas Province, southern Cusco Department.  In addition, 99 people and 29 houses have been affected by the overflow of the Chontayacu and Tomás Rivers in Uchiza District, in Tocache Province, southern San Martín Department.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rainfall is expected across the affected departments.

title: Colombia - Wildfires (ECHO 29 Jan 2024)
description: Since early January several wildfires have been burning in central and north-eastern Colombia, bordering with Venezuela. UN OCHA reports 449 wildfires, 232 affected municipalities and a total burn area of 17,782 ha since the beginning of January.According to the National Disaster Risk Management Unit (UNGRD), as of 28 January, there were 13 active wildfires and 14 wildfires under control in the Boyacá, Huila, Cordoba, Magdalena, Vichada and Santander Departments. The UNGRD has mobilised 3,850 personnel and 170 fire extinguishing machines to the affected areas.A national state of emergency was declared and international assistance was required by the authorities.For the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to extreme over central and north-eastern Colombia.The Colombian government has issued a generic request for assistance through the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), the list of needs is yet to be finalised.

title: South Africa - Wildfire (ECHO 29 Jan 2024)
description: A wildfire is burning across the Table Mountain area, south of Cape Town City resulting in evacuations.According to media reports, evacuations are still ongoing in the affected area, and some roads have been closed to facilitate the fire response.On 29 January, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme in the burned area while on 30 January it is from low to moderate.

title: Philippines - Heavy rainfall and strong winds (ECHO 29 Jan 2024)
description: The number of affected people is still increasing in Mindanao Island, southern Philippines, following the heavy rainfall and strong winds brought by the effects of the Shear Line since 15 January.According to the national authorities, 551 people are still displaced and more than 912,000 people have been affected across Northern Mindanao, Davao and Caraga. Moreover, almost 800 houses have been damaged in the affected regions.For the next 24 hours, cloudy skies with scattered rain showers and thunderstorms are forecast over most parts of the affected areas.

title: Indonesia - Floods and strong winds (ECHO 29 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting parts of Sumatra and Java Islands, causing floods and resulting in widespread damage.Tornadoes have been reported in Sleman Regency, Yogyakarta Special Administrative Region, Java Island leading to one fatality, 10 displaced people and almost 300 affected.In Sumatra Island, almost 1,200 people have been displaced, and more than 13,800 are affected in Bireun Regency, Aceh Province due to floods. In South Sumatra Province, more than 3,300 people have been affected by floods across the Regencies of Musi Banyuasin and Lahat. Furthermore, about 2,000 people have been affected by floods in the Regency of Kampar, Riau Province, central Sumatra Province.On 29-30 January, moderate to heavy rain is expected across Yogyakarta and South Sumatra Province while light rain is expected across Aceh Province.

title: Tanzania - Flash floods (ECHO 26 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting eastern Tanzania since 20 January, causing flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 26 January, four fatalities and two injured people have been recorded in Morogoro Municipality, in Morogoro Region, due to the overflow of the Ngerengere River. In addition, one house has been destroyed and several roads and buildings have been affected in the same Municipality.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall, with locally heavy rainfall, is still forecast over most of the country.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting eastern and southern Indonesia, since 21 January, causing floods and a number of strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB) reported, as of 23 January, one fatality, 471 affected people and 69 buildings damaged by floods in South Halmahera Regency in North Maluku Province in eastern Indonesia.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reported, as of 24 January, four injured people, a total of 163 people and 34 houses affected by strong winds in the Alor Regency, East Nusa Tenggara Province.According to media reports, as of 24 January, one person have been injured and 67 houses have been damaged due to strong winds in Indramayu Regency in West Java Province.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong winds are still forecast over affected provinces.

title: Colombia - Wildfires (ECHO 26 Jan 2024)
description: Several wildfires continue to burn across central and north-eastern Colombia (bordering with Venezuela) since early January, causing casualties and damage. The worst affected Departments are Huila, Sucre, Boyaca´, La Guajira, Cundinamarca, Santander and the Capital City Bogota. All are in a state of emergency, with the exception of Santander Department.According to the National Unit for Disaster Risk Management (UNGRD), as of 25 January, there are currently 20 active wildfires and 12 wildfires under control. Since 1 January, 245 wildfires were fully extinguished. The total burnt area over the aforementioned period is more than 7,000 ha.Media report, as of 26 January, two injured firefighters across the rural area of Cerro El Cable, just east of the Bogota City area.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme over central and north-eastern Colombia.The Colombian government has issued a generic request for assistance through the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), the list of needs is yet to be finalised.

title: Australia - Tropical storm KIRRILY (ECHO 24 Jan 2024)
description: A new tropical storm named KIRRILY formed over the Coral Sea, south of the Solomon Islands, on  23 January and started moving south-west toward eastern Queensland State, north-eastern Australia. On 24 January at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 615 km north-east of Townsville City, coastal central Queensland, with maximum sustained winds of 85 km/h.KIRRILY is expected to make landfall over the area between Townsville and Ayr Cities on the late afternoon (UTC) of 25 January, with maximum sustained winds up to 100 km/h.Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over the area between Sarina Town north to Innisfail Town, coastal central Queensland over 25-27 January. The Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) has issed a gale warning zone and a gale watch zone over this area.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 24 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall affected Socorro Municipality and 15 of its neighbourhoods in São Paulo State in south-eastern Brazil on 20 January, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) reports, as of 22 January, at least 200 families have been affected by the Peixe River floods and its tributaries. Several bridges and roads have been damaged and a highway has been blocked.On 21 January a state of emergency was issued in the Socorro Municipality.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Sao Paulo State.

title: Tanzania - Floods (ECHO 24 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall has affected eastern Tanzania, in particular the Dar es Salaam City area, the main city of the country, since 20 January, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 24 January, one fatality, one person still missing, dozens of collapsed houses, a number of damaged roads and at least one destroyed bridge across the coastal area of the Dar es Salaam City.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the country, including the already affected area.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 24 Jan 2024)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting eastern and southern Indonesia, in particular the Sulawesi Island and the Lesser Sunda Islands, respectively since 22 January, causing a number of strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 24 January, one injured person and a total of more than 100 affected people in the Flores Timur Regency, East Nusa Tenggara Province due to the strong wind. In addition, ADINet reports around 20 displaced people and over 100 affected people across the Konawe Regency, Southeast Sulawesi Province, also due to the strong wind.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong winds are still forecast over the Sulawesi Island and the Lesser Sunda Islands.

title: China - Earthquake and landslide, update (ECHO 24 Jan 2024)
description: Following the earthquake of 7.0 M that occurred in Wushi County, Aksu Prefecture, in western Xinjiang Province, north-western China on 22 January at 18.09 UTC (23 January at 2.09 local time), the number of casualties and damage is increasing.According to media reports, at least three people died, five have been injured across Akqi and Wushi Counties, and 12,426 people have been displaced. In addition, dozens of houses have been destroyed in Ahetch County in Kizilsu Kirgiz Autonomous Prefecture.More than 70 aftershocks with magnitude higher than 3 M have been registered in the area.In the meanwhile, the number of fatalities, due to the landslide that occurred in the Zhaotong City area, northeastern Yunnan Province on 22 January, increased to 31 fatalities and 16 people are still missing.

title: United Kingdom, Ireland - Severe weather  (ECHO 23 Jan 2024)
description: Over the past few days, severe weather, characterised by strong winds and heavy rainfall, has been affecting northern part of the United Kingdom and Ireland, causing severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, as of 23 January, three people died in the United Kingdom, of whom one in Bradford City in England, one in Grangemouth Town in Scotland, one in Londonderry County in Northern Ireland.In Ireland, two fatalities have been reported, one in Louth and one in Mayo Counties. Several injuries have have been reported in both countries as a result of severe weather-related incidents.In addition, more than 230,000 people in Ireland and 53,000 people in the United Kingdom have been affected by power outages and hundreds of flights have been cancelled.More rainfall is expected over United Kingdom and Ireland, with heavy showers and very strong winds.

title: France - Snow avalanche (ECHO 23 Jan 2024)
