The operation is supporting the Yemeni Red Crescent to respond to the needs of 14,000 people (2,000 households) in Al Maharah, Hadramawt and Socotra Governorates with shelter and hygiene items.Over 18,000 households are estimated to be affected by the landfall of tropical cyclone Tej in Eastern Yemen. The extremely heavy rains and floods have caused damage to civilian homes and public infrastructure, including healthcare facilities and water networks, across Al Maharah, Hadramawt and Socotra governorates.Prior to the cyclone, local authorities, community leaders and volunteers, supported by partners, launched a campaign urging people to stay home. This had a significant impact on reducing human and material loss.The DREF operation complements the assistance already mobilized by the humanitarian community.

title: The Philippines – Earthquake  (ECHO 18 Nov 2023)
description: On 17 November 2023, 08:16 h UTC, a magnitude 6.8 earthquake occurred in northwerstern Sarangani Island, province of Davao Occidental in Mindanao with a 72km depth of focus and tectonic origin. R reported intensities of VII in Glan in Sarangani, General Santos City in South Cotobato and VI in Kiamba in Sarangani, Polompok in South Cotobato.According to the Philippines Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS), there is no destructive tsunami threat.Three people were killed in General Santos City, according to the Philippine Police and 296 injured. A total of 12 houses were partially and fully damaged in Sarangani and 7 infrastructure such as malls, buildings and schools were reported partially damaged according to the Department of Public Works and Highway.Concerned local government units begun the damage assessment of public infrastructure and DG ECHO partners have deployed on 18 November for rapid assessment.

title: Bangladesh, India - Tropical storm MIDHILI (ECHO 17 Nov 2023)
description: A new tropical storm named MIDHILI formed over the central Bay of Bengal on 14 November in the evening (UTC) and started moving north-east toward eastern India and the neighbouring southern Bangladesh. On 17 November at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea close to the coast of the Barisal Division, southern Bangladesh approximately 40 km south-west of the Kuakata City, with maximum sustained winds of 74 km/h (tropical storm).MIDHILI is forecast to make landfall over the area of Kuakata City on the late morning (UTC) of 17 November, with maximum sustained winds up to 70 km/h. On 17-18 November, it is forecast to continue northeastward inland over the Barisal and Chittagong Division, as a tropical depression.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over the eastern West Bengal State of India and over southern, central and eastern Bangladesh.

title: Myanmar - Earthquake (ECHO 17 Nov 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.7 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Shan State, eastern Myanmar, on 17 November at 01.37 UTC (08.07 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 25 km south-west of Kengtung City and 85 km west-southwest of the China border, Yunnan Province.Four aftershocks have occured after the main earthquake. Tremors were felt across Vietnam and Thailand.USGS PAGER estimates that 3,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and 17,000 to strong shaking.According to media, no relevant reports of any casualty or damage have been recorded, stability checks are currently being carried out.

title: Uruguay - Severe weather (ECHO 17 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has affected north-western Uruguay, since 12 November, causing floods that resulted in displacement and damage.According to WHO / PAHO and to media, as of 14 November, 3,412 people have been displaced, of whom 318 were evacuated and 3,094 self-evacuated across Artigas, Paysandú, and Salto Departments due to the overflow of the Tacuarembó Chico River, Sandú, Sauce del Conventos and Convento streams.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over southern Uruguay, with locally very heavy rainfall.

title: Guatemala - Severe weather, update (ECHO 17 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting most of the country since the beginning of the rainy season (May 2023) causing floods, landslides and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED) and WHO PAHO report, as of 16 November, 67 fatalities, where the worst affected Departments are Guatemala with 17 fatalities, Alta Verapaz with eight fatalities, San Marcos with six fatalities and Suchitepequez, Quiché and Quetzaltenango each with five fatalities.In addition, CONRED reports 13 persons missing, seven injured, nearly 42,000 evacuated people and a total of approximately 4.6 million affected people. More than 24,000 damaged buildings were also reported.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the country.

title: France - Floods and landslides (ECHO 17 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-eastern France, in particular Haute-Savoie Department and Savoie Department, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Region, bordering with Switzerland and Italy over the last 48 hours, causing floods, rivers overflow and landslides that have resulted in evacuations and damage.Media report, as of 17 November, several evacuated persons from the Notre-Dame-des-Millières Municipality and the Esserts-Blay Municipality, Savoie Department. In addition, 110  people had been rescued, five bridges and several roads have been closed across both the aforementioned Departments.Over the next 48 hours, drier conditions are expected over western France.

title: Philippines - Floods and landslides (ECHO 16 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the southern Luzon Island in central Philippines over the past 24 hours, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 16 November, nearly 340 evacuated people in five evacuation centres and suspended classes across three Municipalities in the Quezon Province, Calabarzon Region, southern Luzon Island.Over the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over the Luzon Island.

title: Indonesia - Floods, update (ECHO 16 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia, in particular the northern Sumatra Island since 13 November, causing floods and the overflow of the Nenassiam River that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) and the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) report, as of 16 November, one person still missing, approximately 620 displaced people, 12 damaged buildings and four damaged bridges across the Samosir Regency, North Sumatra Province. In addition, more than 720 people have been affected as well as over 180 houses across the nearby Batu Bara Regency in the same province.Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Sumatra Island.

title: Tanzania - Floods (ECHO 16 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Tanazania, in particular the Arusha Region, bordering with southern Kenya since late October, causing floods, flash floods and rivers overflow that have resulted casualties and damage.Media report, as of 16 November, ten fatalities, approximately 90 displaced families and a number of damaged houses and bridges across the Arusha District, Arusha Region. The worst affected villages and neighbourhoods in Arusha District are Muriet, Terrat, Elerai, Morombo, Lolovono and Ngarenaro.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 15 Nov 2023)
description: Since 13 November, heavy rainfall and river overflow have been affecting Sumatra Island in Indonesia, in particular the Aceh and North Sumatra Province, causing flooding that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 13 November, the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports one fatality, 102 two injured people, of whom 100 in Samosir Regency, North Sumatra and two in Aceh Tenggara Regency in Aceh Province, and one missing person in Samosir Regency.In Aceh Province, 840 people have been affected, two bridges and 210 houses have been damaged across Aceh Tenggara and Subulussalam Regencies. In North Sumatra Province, 3,393 people and 832 houses have been affected by flooding and river overflow across Samosir, Tapanuli Selatan, Deli Serdang and Langkat regencies. In addition, five bridges have been destroyed.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over northern Sumatra Islands with locally very heavy rainfall.

title: Vietnam - Severe weather, floods and landslides (ECHO 15 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorms and strong winds affected several parts of Vietnam on 13-14 November, causing floods and landslides that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 13 November, three people are missing in Quang Tri Province. At least 525 people are displaced in shelters and a total of 6,820 people have been affected by floods across Quang Tri, Thua Thien Hue and Ha Tinh Provinces in central Vietnam. Moreover, 1,364 houses have been damaged, at least 69 ha of inundated crops and more than 1,000 livestock losses have been reported.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over central and southern Vietnam, with very heavy rainfall and thunderstorm in the affected areas.

title: Kenya - Floods, update (ECHO 15 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to impact 19 of the 47 counties of Kenya, causing floods and the overflow of some rivers, particularly the Tana River, that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, at least 46 people have died, and 58,000 have been displaced. Moreover, some communities have been isolated because they experienced huge damage to roads and bridges. Several houses, schools and public buildings have been affected. Crops and large numbers of livestock have been lost.For the next five days, isolated storms are likely to occur in some parts of the Highlands East and West of the Rift Valley, the Southeastern lowlands, the coast and northeastern Kenya.

title: Somalia - Floods, update (ECHO 15 Nov 2023)
description: The humanitarian impact is still increasing following the Deyr Rainy Season, impacted by the El Nino effect, and related widespread floods that have been affecting Somalia since October.According to UN OCHA, as of 14 November, at least 32 people died, almost 457,000 were displaced and over 1.24 million were affected. Most of the affected people are in the Bay region, South West State (454,320 people) followed by Gedo (291,765 people) and Mudug (213,356 people). The overflow of the Juba River was registered along its entire path, while along the Shabelle River, flooding is recorded at Belet Weyne and at Balcad. Furthermore, 19 schools with 48,000 students have been hit by floods.National authorities with the the assistance of humanitarian partners are scaling up assistance to those affected.For the next 48 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected over the whole of Somalia, particularly across the central regions.

title: Iceland - Volcanic unrest, update (ECHO 14 Nov 2023)
description: Following the intense seismic activity that started in the Reykjanes peninsula in south-western Iceland on 25 October, the number of damages is increasing.In the past 24 hours, around 900 earthquakes have been detected. The activity is mainly concentrated between Sundhnúkur and Grindavík Towns, in Reykjanes peninsula, due to a magma intrusion at a depth of about 2–5 km. Satellite data shows a graben-like formation cutting part of Grindavik.According to national authorities,  as of 14 November, at least 3,700 people living in Grindavík Towns have been preventively evacuated, boats are being evacuated from the harbour, several roads have been damaged as well as several water and power infrastructures and sewage. A State of emergency was declared on 10 November and it is not allowed to enter in Grindavík.National authorities are continuously monitoring the area and a large-scale coordination is ongoing.

title: Ireland and United Kingdom - Severe weather (ECHO 14 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting Ireland and Northern Ireland since 13 November, causing floods and power outages, that resulted in damage.According to media, as of 14 November, at least 100,000 homes and businesses are without power across Galway, Longford Counties and the Midland Region, in Ireland.In Northern Ireland, about 2,000 people are suffering power outages across Craigavon, Newry and Downpatrick, northern County Down and Armagh. Moreover, some roads have been closed due to severe weather-related incidents and some have been flooded.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over western Ireland and western Northern Ireland.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 14 Nov 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, thunderstorms and storm surges have been affecting southern Brazil, in particular the Rio Grande do Sul and Santa Catarina States since 11 November, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents, particularly due to the strong wind that have resulted in evacuations and damage.Media report, as of 14 November, several displaced families, more than 100 damaged buildings and some closed schools across the Greater Porto Alegre area, the capital of Rio Grande do Sul State. In addition, media also reports some damaged buildings in the Laguna Municipality.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Rio Grande do Sul and Santa Catarina States.

title: Fiji - Tropical cyclone MAL (ECHO 14 Nov 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named MAL formed over the South Pacific Ocean, near the Solomon Islands, on 10 November and started moving south-east over the Ocean toward the Fiji Islands. On 14 November at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 270 km north-west of Viti Levu Island, the main Island of Fiji, with maximum sustained winds of 111 km/h (tropical storm).Media report, as of 14 November, a number of evacuation centres already preventively opened across the Viti Levu Island by national authorities.MAL is expected to continue south-southeast over the Ocean, slightly strenghtening, and to pass close to the eastern coast of Viti Levu Island on late afternoon (UTC) of 14 November, with maximum sustained winds up to 120 km/h  (tropical cyclone). After that, it is forceast to continue southeastward over the Ocean on 15-17 November, further weakening and dissipating.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over most of Viti Levu Island. The Fiji Meteorological Service has issued an orange warning for gales over the whole Island.

title: Iceland - Volcanic unrest (ECHO 13 Nov 2023)
description: Since 25 October, intense seismic activity related to a magma intrusion has started in the Reykjanes peninsula in south-western Iceland.As of 12 November around 1,000 earthquakes - all below 3.0 M - have been recorded in the area of unrest. Most of the earthquakes are located in the region north of Grindavik Town, Reykjanes peninsula. The earthquakes are at a depth of 3-5 km corresponding to the lower part of the dyke intrusion. In addition, superficial deformation associated with the magma intrusion has been recorded in the area, this can be an indication that magma is moving closer to the surface.Following this kind of activity, the civil protection has preventively evacuated all the people living in Grindavik Town, almost 3,700 residents and closed all the routes to the town. Moreover, the quakes and ground deformation caused by the magma intrusion resulted in damage to roads and buildings in Grindavik and its surroundings.National authorities are continuously monitoring the area.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 13 Nov 2023)
description: The humanitarian impact is still increasing following heavy rainfall and strong winds that caused floods, landslides and severe weather-related incidents across most parts of the country since the beginning of the month.According to the National Disaster Relief Centre (NDRSC), eight people have died, of whom three in Kurunegala, two in Kandy, one in Puttalam, one in Ratnapura and another in Anuradhapura District, nine have been injured, almost 34,800 have been affected, and almost 960 houses have been damaged.On 13-14 November, showers or thundershowers will occur at times over the coastal areas of Northern, North-Western, Western and Southern provinces of Sri Lanka.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 13 Nov 2023)
description: In the last few days, heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting central and northern Indonesia, in particular the Aceh Province in northern Sumatra Island and the Bogor Province in western Java Island, causing flooding and a landslide that have resulted in displacement and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 12 November, 20 people have been displaced in Aceh Tengah Regency due to floods, where a total of 120 people have been affected. Moreover, 118 people have been affected by floods and landslides in Aceh Tenggara Regency (Aceh Province).In Bogor Regency  the overflow of the Cikumpa River affected 235 people and 60 houses, while in Sukabumi Regency strong winds damaged 126 houses and affected 504 people (West Java Province).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecats over northern Sumatra and Java Islands with locally very heavy rainfall over northern Sumatra Island.

title: Southern Africa - El Niño event (ECHO 13 Nov 2023)
description: The Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET) has issued an alert for Southern Africa; deficit-producing areas of Zimbabwe, southern Malawi, southern and central Mozambique, and southern Madagascar are of highest concern.El Niño is expected to result in a below-average October-March rainy season in many areas across the region, which will likely cause harvests to underperform in 2024. Grazing conditions are expected to deteriorate atypically early in 2024, and higher-than-average livestock deaths are projected in the second half of 2024.An erratic start to the rainy season is also expected to reduce agricultural labor opportunities, and above-average staple food prices will make it difficult for poor households to purchase enough food to meet their daily needs.Governments, donors, humanitarian partners, and other stakeholders should prepare for considerable food assistance needs in Southern Africa through early 2025.

title: LOLA-23 - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR702] Tropical Cyclone LOLA in Vanuatu and Solomon Islands

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 31 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting parts of northern and central Italy, particularly the Regions of Emilia Romagna, Liguria and Tuscany and the city of Milan, causing the overflow of some rivers (in particular the Taro River). Some people have been precautionarily evacuated in Piacenza Province, and roads and bridges have been closed for a few hours.The situation is improving everywhere and no significant damage has been reported.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain is expected over parts of north-east Italy, and parts of central Italy.

title: OTIS-23 - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR703] Tropical cyclone OTIS-23 in Acapulco, Mexico

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 30 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the northern Peninsular Malaysia, particularly the Kedah State, bordering with southern Thailand, since 27 October, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 30 October, nearly 160 evacuated people across four evacuation centres and more than 130 damaged houses across the Baling District and the Bandar Baharu District, southern Kedah State.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Peninsular Malaysia.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 30 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting central and northern Indonesia, in particular the Banten Province in western Java Island and the Aceh Province in northern Sumatra Island, since 26 October, causing a number of strong wind-related incidents and a landslide that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of 30 October, two fatalities across the Pandeglang Regency, Banten Province due to the strong wind. In addition, BNPB also reports three persons still missing and two rescued people in the Subulussalam City, Aceh Province due to a landslide occurred on 27 October.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and northern Sumatra Island, while moderate rainfall is forecast over western Java Island.

title: Philippines - Landslides (ECHO 30 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Luzon Island, central-northern Philippines, and in particular the Calabarzon Region over the past week, causing a landslide that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 30 October, five fatalities and five collapsed houses due to a landslide that occurred on 24-25 October across the Sierra Madre mountain range, in the area of General Nakar Municipality of Quezon Province, Calabarzon Region.Over the next 48 hours, modearate rainfall is forecast over the southern Luzon Island.

title: Mexico - Tropical cyclone OTIS, update (ECHO 30 Oct 2023)
description: OTIS made landfall over the area of the coastal City of Acapulco, central Guerrero State, southern Mexico on 25 October very early in the morning (UTC) as a Cat. 5 Hurricane, with maximum sustained winds up to 270 km/h.Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges associated to its passage on 25-26 October over the Guerrero State caused floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and severe damage.Media report, as of 30 October, 48 fatalities, of which 43 in the area of the Acapulco City and five more in the area of the nearby Coyuca de Benitez Town. In addition, media also report 36 still missing persons across the affected area.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode to provide the damage assessment and 11 maps were produced so far. Over the 48 hours, moderate rainfall is still forecast over the southern western coast of Mexico.DG ECHO field officers and partners are involved in ongoing needs assessments.

title: Australia - Wildfires (ECHO 27 Oct 2023)
description: More than 100 wildfires have been burning across Australia, affecting particularly the States of Queensland and New South Wales.According to media, at least two people died on 25 October, about 350 people have been evacuated, 16 houses have been destroyed, and 11,000 ha of land burned following wildfires near the Town of Tara, Western Downs Region, Queensland. In addition, two people died in New South Wales last week.For the next 48 hours, according to GWIS, the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme over the affected area of Tara Town.

title: Mexico - Tropical cyclone OTIS, update (ECHO 27 Oct 2023)
description: On 25 October around 6.25 UTC, OTIS made landfall over the area of the coastal City of Acapulco (approximately 825,000 inhabitants) in central Guerrero State, southern Mexico, with maximum sustained winds of 270 km/h (Cat. 5 Hurricane). According to UN OCHA, OTIS is the first Cat. 5 Hurricane on record that made landfall over the Mexican Pacific region.Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges associated to the passage of OTIS on 25-26 October over the Guerrero State, caused floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and severe daamge.UN OCHA reports, as of 27 October, 27 fatalities, four persons still missing, an undetermined number of injured people, an uncertain number of displaced people and severe damaged to infrastructures across 29 Municipalites, where the worst affected area is the Acapulco City (first estimates report damage to 80% of the hotels of the city).The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode on 26 October to provide the damage assessment.Over the 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and southern Mexico, including the already affected area.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Earthquake (ECHO 27 Oct 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.4 M at a depth of 15 km occurred in Tanganyika Province, south-eastern DRC on 26 October at 19:00 UTC (21:00 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 178 km south-east of Kabalo Town, Tanganyika Province.USGS PAGER estimates that more than 7,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and up to 7,200 people to light shaking.According to media, there are no immediate reports of any casualties or damage.

title: Vanuatu, New Caledonia (France) - Tropical Cyclone LOLA, update (ECHO 27 Oct 2023)
description: Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges caused by the passage of the tropical cyclone LOLA (with maximum sustained winds up to 222 km/h) on 24-25 October (UTC) over central and northern Vanuatu caused widespread and severe damage.The International Federation of Red Cross (IFRC) and media report that as of 27 October, approximately 10,000 houses have been damaged and a number of schools and bridges destroyed. There has also been damage to the road network across Penama, Malampa, Sanma and Torba Provinces (central-northern Vanuatu). The Pentecost Island (Penama Province) is the worst affected area.On 25 October, Vanuatu requested support from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), consisting of a surveillance flight, shelter kits, tarpaulins. France responded offering two airplane surveillance flights and eight surveillance and transportation helicopter flights.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode to provide the damage assessment, two maps were produced so far.More rainfall is forecast over the whole Vanuatu and New Caledonia over the next 24 hours.

title: Mexico - Tropical cyclone OTIS, update (ECHO 26 Oct 2023)
description: OTIS made landfall over the area of the coastal City of Acapulco, central Guerrero State, southern Mexico on 25 October around 6.25 UTC, with maximum sustained winds of 270 km/h (Cat. 5 Hurricane). According to NOAA, there are no hurricanes on record even close to this intensity for this part of Mexico.After the landfall, OTIS continued northwestward over the central-western Guerrero State on 25 October, weakening and becoming a tropical storm. After that, it became a tropical depression and dissipated over eastern Michoacan State on 25 October in the evening (UTC).Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges associated with the passage of OTIS, caused floods and landslides that have resulted in evacuations and severe damage. WHO PAHO and national authorities report, as of 26 October, 34,522 evacuated families in 631 temporary shelters across the affected area.Over the 24 hours, due to the remnants of OTIS, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over Guerrero, Mexico, Morelos, Puebla, eastern Michoacan and western Oaxaca States. Heavy rainfall is also forecast over the area of the capital Mexico City.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 26 Oct 2023)
description: Since 22 October, heavy rainfall has affected the peninsular states of Kedah, Negeri Sembilan, Selangor and Perak, causing floods and resulting in damage and displacement.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports 277 displaced people in Perak State as well as 173 in Kedah, Negeri Sembilan, and Selangor States, who have been relocated to seven evacuation centres.On 26-27 October, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole of peninsular Malaysia, particularly over the northern regions.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Oct 2023)
description: Over the past few days, strong winds and tornadoes have affected parts of Sumatra and Java Island, resulting in widespread damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), in Java Island, more than 1,100 people have been affected across the regencies of Bandung, West Java Province, Sragen, Central Java Province and Sukabumi, West Java Province due to strong winds and tornadoes. 109 people have also been impacted by a tornado in Bangka Island, Bangka Belitung Province.For the next 24 hours, light rain is expected over parts of the affected provinces.

title: Nepal - Earthquake  (ECHO 26 Oct 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.2 M (6.1 M as reported by the authorities of Nepal) at a depth of 25 km occurred in Dhading District, central Nepal, close to the capital Kathmandu, on 22 October at 1:54 UTC (7:39 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 2 km south-west of Darbhung Town, Gorkha District.The National Earthquake Monitoring and Research Center of Nepal (SeismoNepal) recorded at least six aftershocks of magnitude between 4.1 M and 5.1 M.According to the national authorities, one person has been injured in Gorkha District while 24 families have been impacted and more than 20 houses have been damaged in the neighbouring District of Dhading.

title: Vanuatu, New Caledonia (France) - Tropical Cyclone LOLA, update (ECHO 26 Oct 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone LOLA passed over Malekula Island, Malampa Province, central Vanuatu on very early in the morning (UTC) of 25 October as a tropical cyclone and continued south-west over the Pacific Ocean. 26 October at 0.00 (UTC) its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 350 km north of the north-eastern New Caledonia (France), with maximum sustained winds of 46 km/h (tropical depression).As of 26 October, media report damage to infrastructure, schools, some destroyed houses and a number of blocked roads across Penama and Malampa Provinces.LOLA is forecast to continue southwestward over the Ocean, further weakening and dissipating in the afternoon (UTC) of 26 October, well off the coast of northern New Caledonia. Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are forecast over the whole Vanuatu and New Caledonia.On 25 October, Vanuatu requested support from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), consisting of a surveillance flight, shelter kits, tarpaulins. France responded offering two surveillance flights.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode on 24 October to provide damage assessment.

title: Mexico - Tropical cyclone OTIS (ECHO 25 Oct 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named OTIS formed over the eastern North Pacific Ocean on 22 October and started moving north toward southern Mexico as a tropical storm, strengthening and becoming a hurricane on 24 October in the evening (UTC).OTIS made landfall over the area of the coastal City of Acapulco, central Guerrero State, southern Mexico on 25 October around 6.25 UTC, with maximum sustained winds of 270 km/h (Cat. 5 Hurricane).OTIS is forecast to continue northwestward inland over the central-western Guerrero State on 25-26 October, weakening and becoming a tropical storm.Over the 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over Guerrero and Oaxaca States, while heavy rainfall is forecast over Veracruz, México, Morelos, Puebla, Tlaxcala and eastern Michoacán States. Over the next 24 hours, strong wind and storm surges are also forecast over the coastal area of Guerrero and western Oaxaca. NOAA has issued a hurricane warning over the whole coast of Guerrero.

title: Philippines - Severe weather (ECHO 25 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms have affected southern Philippines, in particular Sultan Kudarat and South Cotabato Province, on 21 October, causing flash floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD), as of 24 October, approximately 5,900 people are affected in five districts across Sultan Kudarat and South Cotabato and 1,360 people are shelterd in two evacuation centers. Moreover, a total of 47 houses have been damaged in Sultan Kudarat.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Bangladesh - Tropical cyclone HAMOON in South-eastern Region, update (ECHO 25 Oct 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone HAMOON made landfall over the southeastern coast of Bangladesh on the night of 24-25 October as tropical storm. On 25 October at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located about 40 km east-southeast of Chittagong City, with maximum sustained winds of 110 km/h.According to media, as of 25 October, three fatalities and at least six injured people have been reported in Cox's Bazar City, with 1.5 million people impacted. Nearly 273,000 people have been evacuated.Cox’s Bazar District is experiencing serious communication disruption, preventing access to real-time information, particularly in rural areas and refugees’ camps. In refugees’ camps and adjacent host communities, Disaster Management Committees and Cyclone Preparedness Programme have been activated.Contingency stocks have been made available, volunteer first responders are on standby, preparedness messages have been disseminated. In collaboration with local authorities, some relocations inside camps have taken place and landslides incidents have already been reported.

title: Yemen, Oman - Tropical cyclone TEJ, update (ECHO 25 Oct 2023)
description: The passage of tropical cyclone TEJ which made landfall over the southern coast of Al Mahrah Governorate, eastern Yemen on 24 October, resulted in casualties and displacement.According to media reports, at least seven people have died while more than 1,000 people have been displaced. The same source report also that a state of emergency was declared by the Internationally Recognised Government of Yemen, and suspended schools.On 25 October, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected over eastern Yemen and western Oman while on 26 October, moderate rain is forecast across eastern and north-eastern Yemen and southern Saudi Arabia.DG ECHO partners are monitoring the situation and are ready to respond. The Rapid Response Mechanism (RRM) cluster launched a life-saving response in the affected areas in Al Mahrah Governorate. More than 4 100 emergency kits have been already dispatched.

title: Vanuatu - Tropical cyclone LOLA, update (ECHO 25 Oct 2023)
description: Severe Tropical Cyclone LOLA (category 3) has moved in a southwest direction and is expected to affect the Islands of Penama, Malampa and Shefa in the next 24 hours. Power and communication networks have been cut, making it difficult to report the impact on those islands at this stage.Vanuatu's National Disaster Management Office (NDMO) has activated offices in six provinces, ready to carry out a rapid assessment after the cyclone. 300 evacuation centres with many located in schools and churches were set up throughout Vanuatu. Port Vila, the capital, is on red alert and all government offices, markets, and banks are closed until further notice.Heavy rainfalls with flash flooding are expected over low-lying areas and areas close to river banks, including coastal flooding. Very rough seas with heavy to phenomenal swells are expected over all Vanuatu waters.On 25 October, Vanuatu requested support from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), consisting of a surveillance flight, shelter kits, tarpaulins.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode on 24 October to provide damage assessment.

title: Somalia - Flash floods (ECHO 24 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Somalia in the last few weeks, particularly Banadir, Galmuduug, Hirshabelle, Jubaland and South West States, causing flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to UN OCHA, as of 23 October, four fatalities have been reported, of whom three in Baidoa District and one in Ceel huur Village in Galmudug State, one person has been injured and four people are missing. Moreover, at least 122,000 people have been affected by flash floods and heavy rains since 4 October, including 92,000 internally displaced people (IDPs) living in 178 settlements in Baidoa District.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the western and northern parts of the country.

title: South Africa - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 24 Oct 2023)
description: On 21-22 October heavy rainfall, severe thunderstorms and strong winds have affected KwaZulu-Natal Region, eastern South Africa, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.Media reports five fatalities in Mtubatuba Town in northeastern KwaZulu-Natal due to a thunderstorm. More than 70 houses have been destroyed, several roads and bridges have been damaged across Mtubatuba Town, Greater Kokstad and Umzimkhulu Municipalities.On 24-25 October drier conditions are expected over the whole South Africa.

title: Yemen, Oman - Tropical cyclone TEJ, update (ECHO 24 Oct 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone TEJ made landfall over the southern coast of Al Mahrah Governorate on the night of 23 October and continued to move northwestward. On 24 October at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located about 20 km south of Al Ghaidah (Yemen) and 240 km west-southwest of Salalah (Oman).According to media, some houses have been severely impacted as well as roads and crops in Al-Mahra Governorate. In addition, interruptions of the communications and electricity network have been reported.The authorities of Al-Mahra Governorate asked the citizens living in the affected areas and to go to nearby shelters.TEJ is forecast to move further north-westward weakening and dissipating on 25 October. For the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the Al-Mahra, Hadramout and Shabwa Governorates of Yemen and over the Dhofar governorate in Oman.DG ECHO partners are monitoring the situation and are ready to respond.

title: Vanuatu, New Caledonia (France) - Tropical cyclone LOLA, update (ECHO 24 Oct 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone LOLA is moving towards northern Vanuatu, strengthening. On 24 October at 4.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 175 km east southeast of Sola City (Vanua Lava Island) and 100 km northeast of Maewo Island, with maximum sustained winds up to 215 km/h.LOLA is expected to continue southwestward and to cross northern Vanuatu, and it could affect the Provinces of Torba, Sanma, Penama, Malampa and Shaefa in the next 24 hours where a severe Tropical Cyclone Warning is in effect.Vanuatu’s government has convened an inter-agency briefing with officials from the National Disaster Management Authority to plan an emergency response. Santo Island was experiencing strong winds, and evacuations have begun for residents across the north of the country, according to Vanuatu Red Cross. DG ECHO partners in the field are on preparedness mode.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are forecast over most of Vanuatu.

title: India, Bangladesh, Myanmar - Tropical cyclone HAMOON (ECHO 24 Oct 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named HAMOON formed in the Bay of Bengal is moving northeastwards. On 24 October at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Sea, 240 km south-southeast of Digha (West Bengal), 280 km south-southwest of Khepupara (Bangladesh) and 410 km southwest of Chittagong (Bangladesh), with maximum sustained winds of 130 km/h.HAMOON is forecast to continue moving northeast and it could make landfall over the coast of Bangladesh between Khepupara and Chittagong on 25 October in the late morning as a tropical storm.For the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over north-eastern India, south-eastern Bangladesh and western Myanmar.

title: United Kingdom - Severe weather (ECHO 23 Oct 2023)
description: On 19-20 October, heavy rain and strong winds affected the northern UK, resulting in casualties.According to media, three people died, of whom two in Scotland due to severe weather-related incidents, at Bradford Airport in Leeds a plane was evacuated due to strong winds, several trains across the country have been cancelled and many severe-weather-related incidents were reported.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast over Scotland and northern England. More rain is expected over most of England, Wales and Northern Ireland.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 23 Oct 2023)
description: In the last few days, heavy rain and strong winds affected southeastern France, causing floods and triggering landslides and resulting in casualties.According to media, 243 people were evacuated in the Alpes-Maritimes Department, Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur Region. A landslide was reported in Saint-Martin-Vésubie in Alpes-Maritimes Department, two bridges have been destroyed and several roads have been damaged.Over the next 24 hours, more rain is expected over southeastern France.

title: Vanuatu, New Caledonia (France) - Tropical Cyclone LOLA (ECHO 23 Oct 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named LOLA formed over the South Pacific Ocean on 21 October and started moving south toward Vanuatu, strengthening. On 23 October at 5.00 UTC its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 230 km north-east of the Vanua Lava Island (Torba Province, northern Vanuatu) and 385 km north-east of Luganville City (Espiritu Santo Island, Sanma Province, central Vanuatu), with maximum sustained winds up to 140 km/hOn the forecast track, LOLA is expected to continue southwestward and to pass between the Espiritu Santo Island and the Malekula Islands in the afternoon (UTC) of 24 October, with maximum sustained winds of 130-145 km/h. After that, it could reach the southern New Caledonia (France) on 27-28 October, as a tropical storm.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are forecast over the whole Vanuatu.

title: Meteoalarm, as of 20 October at 7:00 UTC (ECHO 20 Oct 2023)
description: On 20 October: red alert for coastal event overDenmark, northernPortugaland northernSpain; for rain flood over south-westernFrance; for heavy rain overBosnia and Herzegovina,  north-westernItaly, southernSwitzerlandand northernUK; for strong wind overGermany.On 21 October: red alert for coastal event overDenmark; for heavy rain overBosnia and Herzegovina; for strong wind overGermany.

title: Lesser Antilles, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico - Tropical cyclone TAMMY (ECHO 20 Oct 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named TAMMY formed over the Atlantic Ocean on 18 October and started moving north-west toward the Leeward Islands, the northern part of the Lesser Antilles, streghtening. On 20 October at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 420 km south-east of the Guadeloupe Island, with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h (tropical storm).TAMMY is forecast to continue northwestward over the Ocean, strenghtening, and to pass very close to Guadeloupe and Antigua and Barbuda on 21 October in the afternoon and 22 October very early in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 130 km/h (Cat. 1 Hurricane).Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over the Leeward Islands, the northern Windward Islands, the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico. NOAA has issued a hurricane watch over the northern Leeward Islands.

title: South Africa - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 20 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Eastern Cape Province, causing floods, rivers overflow and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage. The worst-hit areas are located in the OR Tambo District in north-eastern Eastern Cape Province.According to media reports, at least three people died, of whom one in Maqebevu Village and two others in Rainy Village, and two people are feared missing following floods and severe weather-related incidents.On 20-21 October drier conditions are expected while on 22 October heavy rain could affect the Eastern Cape Province.

title: Philippines - Earthquake (ECHO 20 Oct 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.9 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Batawan district in Davao Oriental Province, Davao Region, southern Philippines, on 19 October at 18:58 UTC (2:58 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 23 km northeast of Maragusan Town, Davao de Oro Province and 27 km south-east of New Bataan Town, Davao de Oro Province.The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVLCS) registered more than 20 minor earthquakes in the area. USGS PAGER estimates that up to 5,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 54,000 people to strong shaking.According to media, no relevant reports of any casualty or damage have been recorded. Classes at all levels in public and private schools in New Bataan have been suspended.

title: China, Vietnam - Tropical storm SANBA, update (ECHO 19 Oct 2023)
description: Tropical storm SANBA continued northward over the Gulf of Tonkin and passed very close to the coast of western Hainan Island in southern China on 18 October, as a tropical storm. On 19 October at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 35 km north-west of northern coast of Hainan Island, with maximum sustained winds of 72 km/h.SANBA is forecast to turn south-west over the Gulf and toward northern Vietnam on 20-22 October, remaining a tropical storm.Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over Hainan Island, south-western China and northern Vietnam.

title: Mexico - Tropical cyclone NORMA (ECHO 19 Oct 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named NORMA formed over the eastern North Pacific Ocean on 17 October and started moving toward central-western Mexico as a tropical storm, streghtening. On 19 October at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 740 km south of Cabo San Lucas City, the southernmost tip of the California Peninsula, Baja California Sur State, with maximum sustained winds of 150 km/h (Cat. 1 Hurricane.NORMA is forecast to continue northward ant to make landfall in the southernmost area of Baja California Sur State in the evening (UTC) of 21 October, with maximum sustained winds up to 120-130 km/h (Cat. 1 Hurricane).On 20-22 October, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over the southern California Peninsula and the coastal area of western Mexico, in particular northern Nayarit and Sinaloa States.

title: Brazil - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 19 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorms and strong winds continue to affect Santa Catarina State in southern Brazil, causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in an increasing amount of displacement and damage.According to the Civil Defence of Santa Catarina, 26,509 people have been displaced, 133 municipalities are in an emergency situation and two of them (Taió and Rio do Sul) are in a State of Public Calamity.On 19-20 October, more heavy rain is expected over most parts of the affected State. High hydrological risk is in effect over the western regions of Santa Catarina.

title: Nigeria - Floods (ECHO 19 Oct 2023)
description: Since 5 October, heavy rainfall has been affecting Adamawa State in Northeast Nigeria, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage. The flood events were also compounded by the release of water from the Lagdo Dam in neighbouring Cameroon.According to the International Organization for Migration (IOM), 275 people died, almost 30,000 people have been affected in 114 locations and 120 houses have been damaged.The most severely affected local government areas (LGAs) included Fufore, Demsa, Shelleng, and several others.Emergency response to priority needs in food, shelter, household and hygiene items is ongoing.

title: Ghana - Floods, update (ECHO 19 Oct 2023)
description: Following the floods that have been affecting south-eastern Ghana since 13 October due to water released from the Akosombo Dam into the Volta River, the number of displacements is increasing.According to UN OCHA and media, as of 18 October, more than 26,000 people have been forced to leave their homes in the Volta Region, where the most affected are South, Central, and North Tongu Districts. In addition, the number of injured people still stands at 7. Dozens of communities are isolated due to flooded roads and several essential services are disrupted.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over central and southern Ghana.

title: Australia - Wildfire (ECHO 18 Oct 2023)
description: A bushfires have been affecting Western Australia, in particular Central Wheatbelt Region, since 17 October.According to JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), as of 17 October, the bushfire is 932 ha in Corrigin and it is under control.According to media reports, as of 17 October, a hospital in Corrigin Town, Central Wheatbelt Region has been evacuated and several main roads have been affected. An evacuation centre have been established in Quairading Town and facilities and roads have been closed in the area.Over the next 24 hours, according to GWIS, the fire danger forecast is from high to very high over the affected area.

title: Mexico - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 18 Oct 2023)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall and strong winds have affected parts of Veracruz State in eastern Mexico, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents, triggering landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.According to local authorities, one person died in Coatzacoalcos City in a severe weather-related incident due to strong winds. More than 700 houses have been hit by floods and nine municipalities have been affected by severe weather events.Moreover, a new tropical cyclone, named NORMA, could approach the western coastal areas of Mexico, particularly the Baja California Sur, on 22-23 October, and it could bring heavy rainfall and strong winds over the area.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected over the affected state while heavy rainfall is forecast over Jalisco, Colima, Michoacán and Guerrero.

title: India - Glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF)  and flash floods in Sikkim, update (ECHO 18 Oct 2023)
description: The number of casualties continued to increase following the flash flood triggered by the GLOF event that occurred at South Lhonak Lake in North Sikkim District, Sikkim State, north-eastern India. After this event, there was a sudden surge in the flow of the Teesta River, which washed away several bridges, damaged parts of NH-10, Chungthang Dam and impacted several small towns in the upper reaches of the Teesta River valley.According to the National Emergency Response Centre of India (NDMI), 102 people have died, 76 are still missing, 4,418 have been evacuated and 88,400 others have been affected. In addition, a total of 2,002 houses have been damaged, out of which 1,423 are fully damaged and 579 are partially damaged.For the next 24 hours, light rain is expected over the affected area.

title: China - Tropical cyclone SIXTEEN (ECHO 18 Oct 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named SIXTEEN formed over the western South China Sea, is moving northwest over south-eastern China. On 18 October at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 172 km south of southern Hainan Island, with maximum sustained winds of 56 km/h (tropical depression).SIXTEEN will continue north-west and it will approach the south-west coast of Hainan Island on 19 October, strengthening. After that, it will change direction moving south-west on 20 October and it will dissipate over the Gulf of Tonkin on 23 October.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over Hainan Island, south-eastern China and north-eastern Vietnam.

title: Iran - Earthquake (ECHO 17 Oct 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.5 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Bandar Abbas County, Hormozgan Province in southern Iran on 17 October at 5:10 UTC (8:40 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 62 km north-northwest of Bandar Abbas City.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 1,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 4,000 people to strong shaking.According to the Islamic Republic News Agency (IRNA), there are no immediate reports of any casualty or damage, but national authorities are investigating the damage assessment.

title: Cambodia - Floods (ECHO 17 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rain has been affecting north-western Cambodia, particularly Banteay Meanchey Province, over the last few days, causing floods that have resulted in damage and displacement.According to media, as of 16 October, approximately 14,800 people have been displaced from 3,563 families, of whom 199 families have been relocated in shelters across Serei Sophorn and MongkulBorei District, in Banteay Meanchey Province. Moreover, 11 schools, 144 roads and several houses have been damaged due to floods. Approximately 2,850 ha of crops have been damaged and the loss of more than 100 livestock have been reported.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rain is forecast over most of the country.

title: Vietnam - Floods (ECHO 17 Oct 2023)
description: Since 10 October, heavy rain and floods have affected cenral-northern Vietnam resulting in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 14 October, in Quang Tri, Thua Thien-Hue and Quang Nam Provinces in central Vietnam,  two people died, 7,820 people have been affected and 3,910 have been internally displaced, of whom 3,763 from Da Nang City and 147 from Hue City. In addition, 1,564 houses have been damaged, of which 1,432 in Da Nang City.For the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall and thunderstorm are forecast across the affected area.

title: Ghana - Floods (ECHO 16 Oct 2023)
description: Floods have been affecting south-eastern Ghana since 13 October, caused by the Akosombo Dam overflow in the River Volta, resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 13 October, seven people have been injured and more than 4,000 people have been displaced in the downstream of the Akosombo Dam, in particular in Volta Region. In addition, media report that essential services such as access to water and electricuty are disrupted.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over southern Ghana.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 16 Oct 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia, in particular the northern and central Sumatra Island, since 14 October, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 16 October, one injured person, more than 260 damaged houses and a total of nearly 1,100 affected people across the Pasaman Regency (West Sumatra Province) and Aceh Singkil Regency (Aceh Province).Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and northern Sumatra Island.

title: India - Flash floods, update (ECHO 16 Oct 2023)
description: Following the heavy rainfall, flash floods and the Glacial Lake Outburst Floods (GLOF) that have been affecting the Sikkim State and the West Bengal State in north-eastern India along the Teesta River since 4 October, the number of casualties is increasing.According to the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports, as of 15 October, the death tool has reached 100 fatalities, of whom 38 in Sikkim and 62 in West Bengal, where Namchi, Gangtok, Mangan and Pakyong are the most affected Districts. In addition, 76 people are still missing and 30 are the injured people so far. 2,321 people have been displaced in 20 relief camps, a total of 88,400 affected people have been recorded and more than 2,002 houses have been damaged.Over the next 24 hours, light rainfall is still forecast over Sikkim State, while no more rainfall is forecast over the West Bengal State.

title: Afghanistan - Earthquakes, update (ECHO 16 Oct 2023)
description: A new strong earthquake of 6.3 M occurred at a depth of 6.3 km in Herat Province, Afghanistan, on 15 October at 03:36 UTC (08:06 local time). The epicentre was located in the Zinda Jan District, 28 km north-northwest of Herat City. The event was followed by an aftershock of 5.4 M at a depth of 10 km at 3:56 UTC (8:26 local time), with the epicentre located approximately 4 km south-east from the main earthquake.According to USGS, approximately 4,000 people were exposed to severe shaking and 373,000 to very strong shaking. Media report as of 16 October four fatalities, 153 injured people and an uncertain number of collapsed buildings across the affected area. Assessments by ECHO partners are ongoing.Both earthquakes occurred in close proximity to the previous earthquakes of 7 and 11 October that caused more than 1,384 fatalities and 1,853 injuries, affected over 19,250 people and damaged approximately 21,300 buildings in the area.

title: M6.3 in Afghanistan - Copernicus EMS activation
description: [EMSR700] Earthquake in Afghanistan

title: Argentina - Wildfires, update (ECHO 13 Oct 2023)
description: A number of wildfires have been burning across central and northern Argentina since 10 October, resulting in evacuations and damage.The Ministry of the Environment and Sustainable Development (MADS) and WHO PAHO reports, as of 12 October, seven active wildfires, of which two in each in Catamarca and Jujuy Provinces, and one each in Córdoba, Tucumán and San Luis Provinces. According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the burnt area across the Provinces of San Luis and Córdoba is more than 20,000 ha.WHO PAHO reports approximately 800 evacuated people across the Córdoba Province, where the worst affected area is the Punilla Department and particularly the Cabalango Municipality.Over the next 24 hours, according to JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast remains from high to extreme across central and northern Argentina.

title: Mexico - Tropical cyclone LIDIA, update (ECHO 13 Oct 2023)
description: After passing over the coastal City of Puerto Vallarta, western Jalisco State, bordering with southern Nayarit State on 11 October as Cat. 3 Hurricane, the remnants of LIDIA caused heavy rainfall across western and central Mexico on 11-12 October.Media report, as of 13 October, five fatalities across Jalisco State and Nayarit State. A number of landslides were also reported in the area of Puerto Vallarta.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over the coastal area of western Mexico.

title: India - Monsoon rains and flash floods, update (ECHO 13 Oct 2023)
description: The number of casualties and evacuated people continues to increase due to the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several States of India, resulting in severe floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents.Over the last 24 hours, the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports four fatalities across two states, of which three in Himachal Pradesh and one in Nagaland. During the same period, NDMI also reports more than 400 evacuated people and over 1,000 affected people across 13 districts throughout four states.In addition, the severe flash floods caused by heavy rainfall and a Glacial Lake Outburst Floods (GLOF) event occurred in northern Sikkim State since 4 October, resulted in an increased number of fatalities. NDMI reports 99 fatalities, of which 37 in Sikkim and 62 across the downstream State of West Bengal.Since 1 April, 2,496 fatalities, 290 missing people, 1,994 injured people, nearly 114,000 damaged houses were reported by the same source across across 362 districts throughout all states of the country.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over the Sikkim State and over south-western India.

title: Greater Horn of Africa - Impact of El Nino  (ECHO 13 Oct 2023)
description: Communities in Eastern Africa, some of which are already dealing with conflict, displacement or recovery from recent disasters, are now facing the challenge of El Niño. Above-average rainfall is now expected in eastern parts of the region while below-average rainfall is expected in western areas.In flood-prone and riverine areas, there is a substantial risk of flooding, which is expected to destroy critical infrastructure and assets, cause crop damage and livestock deaths, contribute to disease outbreaks, displace populations, limit humanitarian access, and lead to localised increases in food insecurity.The impact of damaged infrastructure, contaminated water sources, and population displacements caused by El Niño could be extremely severe. Displaced populations are particularly vulnerable to food and nutrition insecurity, water-borne diseases, protection and gender-based violence (GBV) risks, and other humanitarian challenges, while persons with disabilities are disproportionately at risk of losing access to life-saving services.

title: India - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 29 Sep 2023)
description: The number of casualties and evacuated people continues to increase due to the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several States of India,  resulting in severe floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents.Over the last 24 hours, the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports six fatalities across four States, of which two each in Gujarat and Maharashtra and one each in Assam and Karnataka. During the same period, NDMI also reports more than 4,500 damaged houses across ten districts throughout four states, where the worst affected is Gujarat with 735 fully damaged houses.Since 1 April there have been a reported 2,416 fatalities, 116 missing people, 1,889 injured people, and close to 110,000 damaged houses across 362 districts throughout all states of the country.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the southern, eastern and western states of India.

title: Greece - Severe weather and floods, update (ECHO 28 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting parts of central Greece since 26 September, causing floods and disruptions.As of 28 September 266 people have been evacuated due to severe weather. In the western part of Evia Island landslides isolated several villages. In Rovies Village (north-western Evia), more than 40 houses have been affected by river overflowing. In Thessaly Region, a bridge collapsed isolating five villages near Trikala City, and in Larissa City evacuation orders are still ongoing. Moreover, in Patras City, the highway to Athens has been closed due to a landslide. The city of Volos was affected by power outages, the schools have been closed and the traffic banned in a wide area.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode on 26 September () to monitor and provide damage assessment.On 28 September,  locally heavy rains and thunderstorms are forecast in the Sporades, Magnesia, Evia (mainly northern), Fthiotida and Viotia. On the afternoon of 29 September the phenomena will dissipate.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 28 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the Peninsular Malaysia, particularly the Kedah and Perlis States northwestern Malaysia, since 26 September, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations.According to ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 27 September, nearly 352 people have been evacuated in six evacuation centres across the Kota Setar and Kubang Pasu Districts in northern Kedah State (317 people) and in Arau City in Perlis State (35 people).Over the next 24 hours, more isolated rainfall and thunderstorms are forecast over Kedah State and Perlis State.

title: South Africa - Floods and severe weather, update (ECHO 28 Sep 2023)
description: After the severe weather that affected South Africa (in particular Western Cape Province and the Cape Town area) on 23-26 September, causing floods, mudslides, rivers overflow and a number of severe weather-related incidents, the number of casualties has increased.Media report, as of 28 September, 11 fatalities (of which at least eight across informal settlements in the Cape Town area). Media also report approximately 1,000 damaged houses, around 270 isolated people and more than 80 closed roads across the affected area.Over the next 72 hours, no more rainfall is still forecast over the whole Western Cape Province.

title: Pakistan - Severe weather, update (ECHO 28 Sep 2023)
description: The number of casualties and evacuated people is still increasing due to the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several provinces of Pakistan causing severe floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents.Over the last 24 hours, the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) reports two fatalities across the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province and seven injured people, of which three in this latter Province and four more in Punjab Province. In addition, four damaged houses were reported across both provinces.Since 25 June, 226 fatalities, 349 injured people, more than 547,400 evacuated and rescued people and nearly 5,800 damaged houses were reported by the same source across the country. NDMA assisted the population also with 349 relief camps and 249 medical camps.As of 25 September, the EU released an additional EUR 1 million to address most pressing needs of vulnerable people in the Provinces of Balochistan, Sindh, Punjab and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The allocation will provide multi-sectoral humanitarian assistance (multi-purpose cash assistance, shelters and non-food items).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over northern Pakistan.

title: Sweden - Landslide (ECHO 27 Sep 2023)
description: On 23 September, a landslide affected a road between Gothenburg (Sweden) and Oslo (Norway), resulting in casualties.According to media, the event occurred in the Swedish town of Stenungsund and three people have been injured.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the affected locality.

title: Greece - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rains and thunderstorms, accompanied by hailstorms and lightning have been affecting parts of central Greece, causing floods and disruptions.According to media reports some roads in mountainous areas have been flooded and schools remain closed in some Municipalities of Thessaly, Peloponnese, Central Greece and Attica Regions.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode on 26 September () to monitor and provide damage assessment.On 27 September,  locally heavy rains and thunderstorms are forecast in the central and southern mainland, in the Sporades, Evia, western Crete and western Cyclades. On 28 September, locally heavy rains and thunderstorms are forecast in the Sporades, Magnesia, Evia (mainly northern), Fthiotida and Viotia. Gradually the phenomena will dissipate.

title: Guatemala - Floods and severe weather, update (ECHO 27 Sep 2023)
description: After the heavy rainfall that affected the Guatemala City area on 24-25 September, causing the overflow of the El Naranjo River and severe floods, the number of casualties increased.The National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED)  reports, as of 26 September, six fatalities, 12 people stil missing, several evacuated families to a number of emergency accomodations and 11 destroyed houses.Since beginning of the rainy season, in late May, WHO PAHO and CONRED report, as of 26 September, 35 fatalities, 13 missing people, five injured people, nearly 10,500 evacuated people and a total of more than 2.1 million affected people across the country.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Guatemala.

title: Mexico - Floods, update (ECHO 27 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Mexico, in particular the Jalisco State since 25 September, causing floods and rivers overflow that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media reports, as of 27 September, eight fatalities, three persons still missing, three rescued people, five severely damaged buildings and severe damage to a number of roads. The worst affected area is the Autlán de Navarro Municipality.Over the next 72 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the whole Jalisco State.

title: South Africa - Floods and severe weather, update (ECHO 27 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong wind have affected South Africa, in particular Western Cape Province and the Cape Town area on 23-26 September, causing floods, mudslides, rivers overflow, and some severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 26 September, four fatalities, of which three in Cape Town City and one more in the nearby Mfuleni village. Media also report 21 injured people, approximately 2,000 evacuated families and dozens of roads closures across the affected area.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is still forecast over eastern Western Cape Province.

title: Italy - Landslide (ECHO 26 Sep 2023)
description: A landslide occurred in Formazza Municipality (Verbano-Cusio-Ossola Province in Piemonte Region) on 24 September, resulting in casualties.According to media reports, as of 24 September, two people died due to a rockfall, several pathways in the area are now closed.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast over the affected municipality.

title: Guatemala - Floods (ECHO 26 Sep 2023)
description: On 25 September, heavy rain affected the Guatemala City area causing the overflow of the El Naranjo River and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the Coordinadora Nacional para la Reducción de Desastres, three people died, 15 others are still missing and six houses have been severely damaged by the flood event.National authorities are conducting the search and rescue operations.On 26-27 September, scattered thunderstorms are forecast over the affected area.

title: Mexico - Floods (ECHO 26 Sep 2023)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall and consequent widespread floods hit Jalisco State in western Mexico resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least seven people died, nine were still missing, and roads and homes were flooded.National authorities and the Red Cross are conducting the emergency operations and three people have been rescued.For the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is expected over the States of Jalisco, Chihuahua, Durango, Sinaloa, and Nayarit while heavy rainfall is forecast across Chiapas, Campeche, Yucatán and Quintana Roo.

title: Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, Thailand - Tropical depression THIRTEEN (ECHO 26 Sep 2023)
description: Tropical depression THIRTEEN, formed over the South China Sea tracked northwestward and made landfall over Thua Thien Hue Province (central-eastern Vietnam) on 25 September bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds.THIRTEEN is forecast to cross central Vietnam and Laos and dissipate across eastern Cambodia.The national authority of Vietnam has issued necessary preparedness and mitigation measures directives to provinces in Quang Binh and Phu Yen. The Vietnam Red Cross Society has activated its National Disaster Response Team (NDRT) for deployment to at-risk regions to support local communities and reduce disaster risks.Heavy rainfall and strong winds brought by THIRTEEN in combination with the Southwest Monsoon are expected across most parts of south-eastern Asia, particularly over Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, and Thailand.

title: South Africa - Floods (ECHO 26 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong wind have affected South Africa, in particular Western Cape Province, on 24-25 September, causing floods and some severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 26 September, one fatality due to a severe weather-related incident in Mfuleni village, Cape Town City. Moreover, two people are missing and six children have been displaced due to floods in Cape Town City. Road closure and mudslides have also been reported.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is forecast over Western Cape Province.

title: Iran - Dust storm (ECHO 26 Sep 2023)
description: Very strong winds have been affecting south-eastern Iran, in particular the Sistan and Baluchestan Province, on 20-22 September, causing a severe dust storm that has resulted in casualties.According to media, as of 25 September, three people died and 2,017 have been injured and 130 people are still hospitalised across five cities in Sistan and Baluchestan Province, close to the Afghanistan border.Over the next 24 hours, strong winds are still forecast over Sistan and Baluchestan Province.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 22 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Malaysia, particularly the Sarawak State on northwest Borneo Island, Melaka State, on southern Malaysia, Perak, Pulau Pinang, and Kedah  on northwest Malaysia and Pahang State on eastern Malaysia, since 20 September, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage. The Public Works Department (JKR) has announced the closure of Pengkalan Hulu-Thailand Border Road in Hulu Perak due to a landslide.ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 22 September, over 500 evacuated people due to flooding.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over the affected states.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 22 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several provinces of Indonesia over the past few days, causing floods and resulting in damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 20 September, the most affected areas are Nunukan Regency in North Kalimantan Province(northern Indonesia), where 7,874 people and 1,682 houses have been affected by flooding, and Aceh Selatan Regency in Aceh Province in western Indonesia, where 931 people and 263 houses have been affected. Another affected province is West Sumatra, in particular Pariaman and Padang Pariaman Cities, in western Sumatra,  with 160 and 152 affected people respectively.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over western and northern Indonesia.

title: India - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 22 Sep 2023)
description: The number of casualties and evacuated people is still increasing following the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several states of India causing severe floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents.Over the last 24 hours, the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports 13 fatalities across five states, of which nine across Gujarat and one each in Himachal Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Assam and Punjab. During the same period, NDMI also reports almost 1,500 evacuated people and over 1,330 damaged across 13 districts throughout eight states.Since April, 2,366 fatalities, 116 persons still missing and 1,842 injured people were reported by the same source across the country.Earlier in September, DG ECHO allocated EUR 100,000 to provide emergency humanitarian assistance to 40,000 people affected by the floods in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the Country, except over the north-western States.

title: Libya - Floods, update (ECHO 22 Sep 2023)
description: According to UNHCR and UN OCHA, as of 21 September, the death toll reached more than 4,000 people, over 9,000 people remain currently still missing (in Derna) and 43,059 displaced (of which 24,500 in Derna, 3,000 in Al Bayda, 2,780 in Benghazi and 1,500 in Al Marj). In addition, IOM DTM reports over 900 relocated families from the affected area in eastern Libya and Derna toward western Libya, including in the Capital Tripoli. The reported figures are likely to increase as emergency interventions are ongoing.Over the next 48 hours, drier conditions are still forecast over the whole country.The EU Civil Protection Mechanism was activated on 12 September, so far various Member States delivered Search and Rescue Teams, Emergency Medical Teams, shelter and medical items, water tanks, generators and other items.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated and eight maps have been produced.

title: Australia - Wildfire (ECHO 21 Sep 2023)
description: Bushfires have been affecting New South Wales State, eastern Australia State with more than 61 wildfires.According to media reports, as of 21 September, several schools along the New South Wales State coast were closed. Moreover, more than 100 people evacuated their houses in Tasmania Island State.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from high to extreme over the affected area.

title: Nigeria - Floods (ECHO 21 Sep 2023)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall and strong winds have affected the Emirates of Dukku and Nafada in Gombe State, eastern Nigeria, causing floods and resulting in displacements and damage.According to the National Emergency Management Agency of Nigeria, more than 1,336 persons are displaced, and several houses and farmlands have been destroyed.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with localized thunderstorms is forecast over the affected area.

title: Libya - Floods, update (ECHO 21 Sep 2023)
description: Following the floods in north-eastern Libya, an accurate assessment of the actual number of fatalities and scale of the damage remains challenging across the affected areas.Urgent needs of displaced people – according to the International Organisation for Migration, IOM is estimated to be around 43, 000 individuals - include flood, drinking water, mental health and psychosocial support.According to UNOSAT, the flooded area caused by the collapse of two dams in Derna City is approximately 500 ha, with almost 2,217 buildings that have been affected, among them 5 destroyed bridges, 284 educational and 128 health facilities.The EU Civil Protection Mechanism was activated on 12 September, so far 10 EU Member States offered assistance (AT, BE, BG, DE, FI, FR, IT, NL, RO, SK).The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated and eight maps have been produced.

title: New Zealand - Earthquake (ECHO 20 Sep 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.6 M at a depth of 12 km occurred in the central part of the Southern Island, on 19 September at 21.14 UTC ( 19 September 09:14 local time). The epicentre was located in the mountains approximately nearly 40 km west of Methven and 45 km north of Geraldine (southern Canterbury Region).USGS PAGER estimates that up to 3,000 people were exposed to moderate shaking and up to 478,000 people to light shaking.According to media, thousands of people felt strong shaking. This earthquake is the one with the highest magnitude this year.As of 20 September, there were no reports of damage by this earthquake.

title: Chile - Landslide (ECHO 20 Sep 2023)
