description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central-southern Chile, in particular the Araucanía Region, over the last 48 hours, causing a landslide that has resulted in casualties and damage.The WHO PAHO and media report, as of 20 September, three fatalities, one person still missing, a total of approximately 11,000 isolated people, and many other affected people, and two destroyed houses in the Curarrehue Municipality (Cautín Province, southern Araucanía Region).Over the next 24 hours, no more rainfall is forecast in the Araucanía Region.

title: Mexico - Severe weather (ECHO 20 Sep 2023)
description: Severe weather characterised by strong lightning affected the beaches of Aquila Municipality in Michoacán State, south-western Mexico, on 18 September, causing weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties.According to media, as of 19 September, two people died due to lightning while they were on the beach.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are forecast over western Mexico, including the already affected Michoacán State State.

title: Libya - Floods, update (ECHO 20 Sep 2023)
description: Ten days following Storm Daniel almost 4,000 (3,958) deaths are recorded according to WHO, while approximately 10,000 others remain missing in Derna City following the floods caused by the collapse of two dams.The International Organisation for Migration (IOM) reports at least 30,000 people displaced in Derna and an additional 3,000 in Albayda with about 40,000 people displaced across north-eastern region of Libya. These numbers are subject to further adjustment as access is challenging, information is fragmented and assessments continue.The EU Civil Protection Mechanism was activated on 12 September and  so far 10 EU Member States offered assistance (BG, DE, FI, FR, IT, NL, RO, BE, AT, SE), consisting of an emergency medical team, search and rescue teams and equipment, heavy machinery, technical expertise, experts and in-kind assistance (shelter, food and non-food items, power generators).The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated and eight maps have been produced.Over the next 72 hours, drier conditions are still forecast over the whole country.

title: Italy - Earthquake (ECHO 19 Sep 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.1 M (4.9 as registered by the National Institute of Geophysics and Volcanology, INGV) at a depth of 8 km occurred in Tuscany Region (central Italy) on 18 September at 3.10 UTC (5.10 local time). The epicentre was located 3 km south-west of Marradi village (Metropolitan City of Florence).A foreshock of 3.4 M and several aftershocks up to 3.0 M have been recorded by the INGV in the area.Media and local authority report, as of 18 September, 30 evacuated people in Marradi village, light damage to some buildings and school closures in the localities close to the epicentre. According to the Civil Protection of the Metropolitan City of Florence, schools  will be closed on 19 September in the villages of Palazzuolo sul Senio and Marradi.Numerous stability checks are currently being carried out by firefighters.

title: Guatemala - Severe weather, update (ECHO 19 Sep 2023)
description: The humanitarian impact continues to increase in most parts of Guatemala following the rainy season that has been affecting the country since May 2023.As of 19 September, according to the National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED), 25 people died in ten departments, one is still missing, and five people have been injured. In addition, 6,324 people have been evacuated and almost 2,048,839 others affected. Moreover, more than 4,600 homes have been damaged.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the whole Guatemala.

title: Niger - Floods, update (ECHO 19 Sep 2023)
description: The rainy season, which started at the beginning of July, continues to affect the whole Niger causing widespread floods and the overflows of Niger and Komadougou Rivers that resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.According to UN OCHA, 41 people have died, 53 have been injured, almost 138,000 people have been affected and more than 12,000 houses have been destroyed. The Maradi Region in southern Niger is the worst hit with 48,027 affected people followed by Tillabéri (31,806 people) Agadez (6,154 people), Dosso (2,579 people) and Niamey (94 people).National authorities and humanitarian partners are providing assistance for the affected people.On 19-20 September, light to moderate rain is expected across southern Niger.

title: Philippines - Flash floods (ECHO 19 Sep 2023)
description: On 16 September, heavy rainfall affected several districts in Tantangan area in South Cotabato Province in southern Mindanao Island, causing flash floods and resulting in displacement and damage.According to national authorities, 1,150 persons have been sheltered and almost 7,300 people have been affected in the area.For the next 24 hours, partly cloudy to cloudy skies with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms are forecast across Mindanao.

title: Libya - Floods, update (ECHO 19 Sep 2023)
description: Since 18 September, citizens have taken to the streets in the flood-struck city of Derna demanding authorities for accountability for the collapse of the dams that led to the devastating flash floods.According to media, as of 18 September, more than 5,300 people died, while more than 10,000 are still missing and nearly 40,000 people have been displaced. Moreover, according to UN OCHA, at least 844,000 need humanitarian assistance, of whom 300,000 are children and 24,000 are pregnant women. These numbers are subject to further adjustment as assessments continue.Following the activation of the EU Civil Protection Mechanism on 12 September, 9 EU Member States (DE, FI, FR, IT, NL, RO, BE, AT, SE) have offered assistance consisting of an emergency medical team, search and rescue teams and equipment, heavy machinery, technical expertise, experts and in-kind assistance (shelter, food and non-food items, power generators).The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMSR696) was activated in rapid mapping mode on 12 September and seven maps have been produced so far.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over Libya.

title: United States, Canada - Tropical cyclone LEE, update (ECHO 18 Sep 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone LEE passed close to the north-eastern coast of USA and made landfall on 16 September over Nova Scotia Province (eastern Canada), moved north-east and crossed Newfoundland Island on 18 September. After that, it moved across the North Atlantic Ocean, weakening and dissipating.According to media reports, one person died in Maine State, north-eastern USA, due to a severe weather-related incident, around 120,000 people were without power on 16 September in Nova Scotia as well as 50,000 others in Maine as winds knocked down trees and power lines.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over the north-eastern USA and eastern Canada.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 18 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Sumatra Islands over the past few days, causing floods and resulting in damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), more than 1,600 people have been affected by floods as well as 412 houses in Medan City in North Sumatra Province. In addition, almost 500 people have been affected in Simeulue Island, Aceh Province due to another flood event.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with localised thunderstorms is forecast over most of Sumatra Island.

title: India - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 18 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect parts of India, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to national authorities, more than 16,000 people have been evacuated, and 178,048 people have been affected across eight states. At least 15 people have died, including ten in Madhya Pradesh due to floods and severe weather-related incidents, as well as casualties in Maharashtra, Assam, and Rajasthan.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across most parts of the country, particularly over Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh in western India, where a red warning for heavy rainfall and strong wind is in effect.

title: United States, Canada - Tropical cyclone LEE (ECHO 15 Sep 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named LEE formed over the Atlantic Ocean on 5 September and started moving north-west toward north-eastern USA and the neighbouring suth-eastern Canada. On 15 September at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 750 km east of North Carolina coast and 1,150 km south of the Maine coast, with maximum sustained winds of 140 km/h (hurricane).LEE is forecast to continue northward over the Ocean, slightly weakening, and it is expected to make landfall in the area between Maine (USA) and Nova Scotia Province (Canada) on the very early morning of 17 September (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 110 km/h (tropical storm).Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over Maine and Nova Scotia on 16-17 September. NOAA has issued an hurriane watch over this area. Preparedness activities are already ongoing by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).

title: Uganda – Landslide injuries and destruction  (ECHO 15 Sep 2023)
description: A landslide occurred on 12 September in the evening affecting 5 parishes in Bungati, in the Mount Elgon sub-region of eastern Uganda close to the Kenyan border.Three people were injured. A total of 109 households were affected, but only 26 household were directly hit by the landslide with house partly buried or damaged, while 83 households were affected with crops destroyed.Other cracks on the slopes of Mount Elgon have been observed indicating that further landslides may happen. This is further exacerbated by the El Nino conditions currently affecting eastern Africa and signals that the period for landslides has tragically started.The DG ECHO funded Oxfam consortia for Disaster Preparedness and Response, through the Uganda Red Cross, has assessed the situation and made recommendations for locally led response.

title: India - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 15 Sep 2023)
description: The number of casualties and evacuated people is still increasing following the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several States of India causing severe floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents , particularly due to lightning.Over the last 24 hours, the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports 13 fatalities across seven States, of which fours across Uttar Pradesh and two each in Chhattisgarh, Himachal Pradesh and Odisha. During the same period, NDMI also reports over 200 damaged houses and a total of nearly 22,400 affected people across 29 Districts throughout 12 states.Since April, 2,265 fatalities, 108 persons still missing and 1,766 injured people were reported by the NDMI across the country.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over western, northern, central and eastern India.The EU has allocated EUR 100,000 to provide emergency humanitarian assistance to 40,000 people affected by the floods in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

title: Morocco - Earthquake, update (ECHO 15 Sep 2023)
description: After the 6.8 M earthquake of 8 September in Al Haouz Province, the damages are still being assessed.According to the Government of Morocco, the death toll stands at 2,946 (of which 1,684 in Al Haouz Province and 980 more in Taroudant Province) and 5,674 injured people were reported. The same source reports, as of 14 September, approximately 50,000 fully or partially collapsed houses across five affected provinces.The Government of Morocco is managing the emergency response with limited presence of international actors.DG ECHO experts, deployed since 11 September report main needs in the sectors of shelter (adapted tents), winterisation items, WASH, psycho-social support and cash.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode on 9 September and 16 maps have been produced so far.

title: Libya - Floods, update (ECHO 15 Sep 2023)
description: Following the flood and flash flood events that hit north-eastern Libya, according to WHO sources as of 14 September, over 5,000 are presumed dead, with a total of 3,922 deaths having been registered in hospitals. Over 10,000 people are still missing, so the numbers are likely an underestimation given the limited data available.Humanitarian partners are requesting  USD 71.4 million to respond to the most urgent needs of 250,000 people targeted out of the 884,000 people estimated to be in need, over the next three months.Following the activation of the EU Civil Protection Mechanism on 12 September, 7 EU Member States (DE, FI, FR, IT, NL, RO, BE) have offered assistance consisting of an emergency medical team, search and rescue teams and equipment, heavy machinery, technical expertise and in-kind assistance (shelter, food and non-food items, power generators).In addition to EUR 500 000 released earlier this week to respond to urgent wash and health needs, DG ECHO has mobilised another EUR 5,2 million to address needs resulting from the floods, bringing the total funding to 5,7 million.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode on 12 September and 6 maps have been produced so far.

title: Philippines - Earthquake, update (ECHO 14 Sep 2023)
description: After the earthquake of 6.3 M at a depth of 41 km occurred offshore in the Luzon Strait, close to the Calayan Island, southern Babuyan Islands, far northern Philippines, on 12 September at 11.03 UTC, casualties and damage were reported across the northern Cagayan Valley Region and the northern Ilocos Region.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 14 September, five injured people, three damaged houses, 42 damaged schools and a total of around 175 affected people across the aforementioned regions, where the most affected area is the Cagayan Province in the northernmost Province of the Cagayan Valley Region.

title: Thailand - Flash floods (ECHO 14 Sep 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several parts of Thailand, in particular the Northeastern, Central, Eastern, and Souther Regions) since 9 September, causing flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 14 September, two fatalities - one in Mae Hong Son Province and another in Phitsanulok Province -, two damaged buildings and a total of approximately 26,500 affected people across 11 provinces throughout the aforementioned regions.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the country, except over the southern Thailand peninsula.

title: Vietnam - Severe weather, floods and landslides (ECHO 14 Sep 2023)
description: On 12 September, heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms occurred in Lao Cai Province, northern Vietnam, causing flash floods, and landslides that resulted in casualties.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), at least nine people died while four others are still missing across the affected province. The media reports damage to 21 homes, 61 fishing farms, and 180 ha of standing crops in the provinces of Lao Cai, Ha Giang, and Yen Bai.Local authorities mobilised about 300 people to participate in search and rescue activities.For the next 24 hours, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast across north-east and north-west Vietnam, including the affected province.

title: Morocco - Earthquake, update (ECHO 14 Sep 2023)
description: After the 6.8 M earthquake of 8 September in Al Haouz Province, the number of casualties is increasing.According to the national authorities, 2,946 people died while the amount of injured people reached 5,674.The Government of Morocco is conducting the emergency response, in addition, the UN continues close communication with the national authorities.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMSR695) was activated in rapid mapping mode on 9 September and 16 maps have been produced so far.

title: Libya - Floods, update (ECHO 14 Sep 2023)
description: The humanitarian impact continues to increase following the flood and flash flood events that hit north-eastern Libya, particularly the Derna City area.According to UN OCHA and local media, at least 5,300 people died, 10,000 others are missing in Derna City after floods triggered by the collapse of two dams. The International Organisation for Migration, IOM reports at least 30,000 displaced people in Derna and 3,000 others in Albayda. These figures are likely to change, as assessments progress.For the next 24 hours, no rain is expected across the whole of Libya.Following the activation of the EU Civil Protection Mechanism on 12 September, 6 EU Member States (DE, FI, FR,IT, NL, RO) have offered assistance consisting of an emergency medical team, search and rescue teams and equipment, heavy machinery, technical expertise and in-kind assistance (shelter, food and non-food items, power generators).In addition, EUR 500 000 in humanitarian aid funding was also mobilised to provide immediate lifesaving support to affected people in the area of Derna and other affected areas.

title: Philippines - Earthquake (ECHO 13 Sep 2023)
description: An earthquake of 6.3 M at a depth of 41 km  occurred in the Luzon Strait (between northern Philippines and southern Taiwan) on 12 September at 11.03 UTC (19.03 local time). The epicentre was located offshore close to the coast, approximately 18 km west of Calayan Island (southern Babuyan Islands) and 70 km north of the Claveria City (Cagayan Valley Region, far northern Phiippines).USGS PAGER estimates that up to 14,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and up to 21,000 to moderate shaking.According to media, the earthquake has been felt across the Babuyan Islands, the southern Batanes Islands and the far northern Luzon. As of 13 September, there are no reports of casualties and damage.

title: Canada - Wildfires, update (ECHO 13 Sep 2023)
description: Several wildfires continued to affect most of the British Columbia Province in western Canada, over the past weeks, resulting in further evacuations and damage.The British Columbia Wildfire Service reports, as of 13 September, 397 active wildfires, of which 14 declared wildfires of note and several out of control.The worst affected areas are the Fraser-Fort George, the Central Okanagan and the Bulkley-Nechako Districts in northern British Columbia Province. Media report hundreds of people and hundreds of structures under evacuation orders and more than 20,000 people under evacuation alerts across the Province.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfires Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast remains from moderate to very high across the northern British Columbia Province.

title: Morocco - Earthquake, update (ECHO 13 Sep 2023)
description: According to the latest report from authorities of Morocco, nearly 3,000 people have lost their lives after the 6.8 M earthquake of 8 September that struck Al Haouz Province.More than 5,500 people have been injured, thousands have been displaced and are sheltering outdoors. Moreover, 530 schools and 55 boarding schools have been damaged, particularly in Chichaoua and Taroudant provinces. The rubble on the roads is being removed and several roads are gradually being lifted and rescuers are reaching more towns.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service () was activated in rapid mapping mode on 9 September and nine maps have been produced so far.

title: Libya - Floods, update (ECHO 13 Sep 2023)
description: Torrential rainfall and strong winds hit north-eastern Libya, particularly the Cyrenaica Region over the past few days, causing floods and flash floods that resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.According to UN OCHA, at least 5,000 people died, 10,000 others are still missing and 20,000 have been displaced. The worst-affected city is Derna where the death toll reached 2,300 people after floods triggered by two dams collapse, as reported by media.Local authorities have launched search-and-rescue operations, while authorities and national organizations have sent medical teams and aid convoys to the affected area. The UN in Libya has deployed emergency response staff and has mobilized assistance to people affected by the floods.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast across the whole of Libya.The EU Civil Protection Mechanism, UCPM was activated following the request for international assistance by the Permanent Mission of the State of Libya to the United Nations office in Geneva. So far, three Member States, Germany, Romania and Finland offered substantial assistance in a form of shelter and food items, generators as well as hospital tents and water tanks via the Mechanism.EUR 500 000 in humanitarian aid funding was also mobilised to provide immediate lifesaving support to affected people in the area of Derna and other affected areas.

title: Somalia drought (ECHO 31 Aug 2023)
description: The recent drought has led to 90% of the country being under extreme drought conditions. 5 consecutive rainy seasons have failed, impacting over 8 million people. Since 2021, more than 1.4 million have been displaced by the drought.In 2023, over 8.25 million people, nearly half of Somalia’s population, require immediate life-saving humanitarian and protection assistance.In 2023, the EU allocated €72.5 million for humanitarian projects in Somalia, mainly responding to the ongoing drought.

title: United States - Tropical cyclone IDALIA, update (ECHO 31 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone IDALIA made landfall over north-western Florida as a category 3 hurricane on 30 August in the morning, and crossed north-east over Georgia and southern South Carolina, weakening as a tropical storm. On 31 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located inland approximately 30 km south-west of Myrtle Beach in South Carolina, with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h.Media reported two deaths in Florida and one in Georgia. Some 470,000 people in Georgia and Florida were without power, and several flights have been cancelled. According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency, as of 30 August, almost 5,000 people have been sheltered in Florida.IDALIA will move close to the coast of South Carolina and then just offshore from North Carolina on 31 August, after which it will move over the western Atlantic on 1-2 September, dissipating.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected over central Florida, South Carolina and eastern North Carolina. A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for parts of North Carolina close to the Virginia border.

title: Indonesia - Floods  (ECHO 31 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has affected northern Indonesia, in particular Langkat Regency in North Sumatra Province on 30 August, causing floods that have resulted in damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 31 August, 4,464 affected people and nearly 1,116 damaged houses across the Batang Serangandue and the Padang Tualang District, in northern Langkat Regency, due to the overflow of the Batang Serangan River.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the affected North Sumatra Province.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical cyclone SAOLA, update (ECHO 31 Aug 2023)
description: Typhoon SAOLA crossed the Luzon Strait on 29-30 August and continued moving west-northwest over the north-eastern South China Sea. On 31 August at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 295 km southeast of Shantou City, eastern Guangdong Province, south-eastern China, with maximum sustained winds of 250 km/h.Following the passage of SAOLA over the northern Philippines, one person is still missing, almost 69,000 people have been displaced (of whom over 38,000 evacuated) and more than 305,000 affected across seven regions of the country.SAOLA is forecast to continue moving west-northwest and it could approach the coast of Hong Kong, Macao, southern Guangdong Province and Hainan Island during the period of 1-4 September.Until 2 September, heavy rain, strong winds and storm surge are forecast for the northern Philippines, southern Taiwan and south-eastern China. Red warnings for heavy rainfall are still in effect for southern and eastern Taiwan. China has issued the highest tropical storm warning (IV) in Guangdong and Fujian provinces. Trains to Guangdong have been halted, as have ferry services. On Friday, Hong Kong is set to issue its second-highest storm signal, T8.

title: Tajikistan - Flash floods and landslides, updates (ECHO 31 Aug 2023)
description: The number of casualties increased after the floods, flash floods, and landslides triggered by the heavy rainfall of 27 August that hit central-western Tajikistan. The most affected localities are the cities of Dushanbe, Vahdat and Gissar, as well as the Districts of Rudaki, Varzob, Devashtich, Rasht, Sangvor and Tajikabad.According to media reports, at least 21 people died, of whom 17 in the city of Vahdat, two in  Rohati village, Rudaki District, west of the capital, Dushanbe, and two others in the Varzob District area, north of Dushanbe.On 31 August - 1 September, drier conditions are expected across the affected areas.

title: Niger - Floods, update (ECHO 31 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall of the rainy season has been affecting parts of Niger since June, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to humanitarian actors, as of 28 August, 32 fatalities have been recorded and 30 people have been injured. Approximately 110,000 individuals have been affected. The most impacted areas include Tahoua, Maradi and Tillaberi Regions in central Niger, which report the high number of fatalities, respectively 12 in Tahoua, 10 in Maradi and 2 in Tillaberi.Heavy rainfall caused the destruction of more than 9.000 houses and almost 3,000 cattles were also decimated.On 31 August-1 September, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over central-western Niger.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical cyclone SAOLA, update (ECHO 30 Aug 2023)
description: Typhoon SAOLA crossed the Luzon Strait moving west-northwest over the north-eastern South China Sea. On 30 August at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 125 km west-southwest of Basco Municipality (northern Philippines) and 185 km south of Taiwan, with maximum sustained winds of 250 km/h.In the Philippines, almost 49,000 people have been displaced (of whom over 35,000 evacuated) and more than 196,000 affected across seven regions of the country.In Taiwan, media report suspended classes and work in some southern and eastern areas.SAOLA is forecast to continue moving towards south-eastern China, and it could approach the southern Guangdong Province coast on 2-4 August.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over far northern Luzon and the Batanes Islands in the Philippines, and most of Taiwan. Tropical cyclone and flood advisories are in effect over northern Luzon and the Batanes Islands. The Central Weather Bureau of Taiwan issued red warnings for strong winds and heavy rains over southern and south-eastern Taiwan.

title: Pakistan - Floods (ECHO 30 Aug 2023)
description: Since 17 August, weeks of heavy monsoon rain flooded Sutlej River in Pakistan. The high flood destroyed levees and villages at several places, displacing more than 162,257 people and submerging 153,231 acres of land with standing crops. Rescue operations evacuated more than 10,500 villagers and 1,809 cattle heads to safety.According to media, the Provincial Disaster Management Authority (PDMA) of Punjab has set up 178 relief camps and 95 medical camps in the affected districts. Reports raise concern of assistance provided so far to the affected communities.The water level in Sutlej River has reached "extremely high level" in Bahawalnagar that entered in 90 villages along the riverbank.The meteorological department has also warned of “a fresh rain spell of moderate intensity is likely to start in the upper catchments areas of all the major rivers from 2 September”.

title: Forest fire in Greece - JRC emergency report
description: A new JRC Emergency report is now available

title: Italy, France- Severe weather (ECHO 29 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, thunderstorms and snowfall have been affecting northern Italy and the neighbouring eastern France over the past 48 hours, triggering landslides, causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in evacuations and damage.In Italy, as of 29 August, 10 evacuated people in Sondrio Province (Lombardy Region) due to floods and 35 evacuated people were reported in Cortina d'Ampezzo Municipality (Belluno Province, Veneto Region) due to a landslide.In France, a significant landslide occurred on 27 August late in the afternoon (UTC) in the Maurienne Valley (Savoie Department, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Region), close to the border with Italy, without casulties but causing the total closure of railroads and roads.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over cental-northern and northeastern Italy, while better conditions are forecast over northwestern Italy and the neighbouring eastern France. The Italian Civil Protection has issued an red alert for hydrogeological risk over northern Lombardy Region, which is valid until 15:00, 29 August 2023.

title: United States, Cuba - Tropical cyclone IDALIA, update (ECHO 29 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone IDALIA continued moving over the northern Caribbean Sea on 28 August, towards the far western Cuba, and entered into the Gulf of Mexico. On 29 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 50 km west of the westernmost part of Cuba, with maximum sustained winds of 110 km/h (tropical storm).On the forecast track, IDALIA is expected to continue moving north-east, strenghthening, and to make landfall over north-western Florida on 30 August early in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 195 km/h (Cat. 3 Hurricane).Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the whole Florida Gulf Coast and the westernmost part of Cuba on 29-30 August. NOAA has issued a hurricane warning for the interested coast of Florida and a tropical storm warning for the western coast of Cuba.The state of emergency declared from the Government of Florida on 27 August is still in force.

title: Indonesia – Earthquake  (ECHO 29 Aug 2023)
description: An earthquake of 7.1 M at a depth of 516 km occurred in the south-eastern Java Sea on 28 August at 19.55 UTC (29 August at 3.55 local time). The epicentre was located offshore approximately 200 km north-east of Bali Island (Lesser Sunda Islands, central-southern Indonesia).Two aftershocks with a magnitude between 5.6 M and 5.4 M have been recorded in the area, as reported by USGS.According to media, as of 29 August, there are no initial reports of casualties or damage, and no tsunami threat was triggered. The quake was felt across coastal areas of Bali and Lombok Islands.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical cyclone SAOLA, update (ECHO 29 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone SAOLA continued moving northward over the northern Philippine Sea on 28 August, toward the Luzon Strait, slightly weakening. On 29 August at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 200 km south-east of the Batanes Islands (the northernmost region of the Philippines) and 410 km south-east of the southernmost area of Taiwan, with maximum sustained winds of 185 km/h (typhoon).DSWD reports, as of 28 August, 3,349 evacuated people, 2,472 sheltered people and over 21,300 affected people across northern Luzon Island.On 29 August - 1 September, SAOLA is expected to continue moving north-west, passing the Luzon Strait and entering into the South China Sea, slightly strenghtening. After that, it is forecast to make landfall over the southern Guangdong Province (China) between 2-3 September, with maximum sustained winds up to 130 km/h.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over far northern Luzon, the Batanes Islands and most of Taiwan. PAGASA issued a tropical cyclone alert over northern Luzon and the Batanes Islands.

title: India - Floods (ECHO 29 Aug 2023)
description: Floods caused by monsoon rains have been affecting Assam State and the hills of neighbouring Arunachal Pradesh and Meghalaya in recent days, causing causalities, displacement, and damages.According to the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA), over 190,000 people are affected by floods across 17 districts in Assam. Over 400 people are taking shelter in two relief camps. One person died after drowning in flood waters. The Brahmaputra River and its tributaries were flowing over danger levels in several areas of upper Assam.The local administration and SDRF are carrying out rescue operations. 45 relief distribution centres have been activated in the affected areas.The flood situation is likely to worsen as the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasts continued heavy rains in places across Assam, hilly areas of Arunachal Pradesh and Meghalaya over the next 24 hours.

title: Tajikistan - Flash floods and landslides (ECHO 29 Aug 2023)
description: On 27 August, heavy rainfall has affected central-western Tajikistan, causing flash floods, landslides and resulkting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, 13 people died, of whom 11 in the city of Vahdat (western Tajikistan) due to floods, and two others due to a mudslide in Rohati village located west of the capital, Dushanbe. In addition, several houses, roads and crops have been flooded, particularly in the area of the capital.On 29 August, no rain is expected while on 30 August, moderate rain is forecast across western, northern and southern areas of the country.

title: Romania - Explosion, update (ECHO 28 Aug 2023)
description: On 26 August, two explosions occurred at a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) station in Crevedia, around 30km northwest of Bucharest.On 26 August, Romania requested UCPM assistance for the treatment of 8 mass burn patients. On 27 August, Romania updated the request to 18 mass burn patients.In total 9 countries (Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Norway, and Sweden) have offered to receive patients via the EU Civil Protection Mechanism.12 patients have so far arrived in Belgium, Italy, Austria, Germany, and Norway.

title: USA, Cuba - Tropical cyclone IDALIA (ECHO 28 Aug 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named IDALIA formed over the western Caribbean Sea on 26 August and started moving north toward the western Cuba and north-western Florida (USA). On 28 August at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea approximately 260 km south-west of the westernmost part of Cuba, with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h (tropical storm).Western Cuba could see 8 to 15 cm of rain, with isolated amounts up to 25 cm.On the forecast track, IDALIA is expected to continue moving north-east, strenghtening, and to make landfall over north-western Florida on 30 August late in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 175 km/h (Cat. 2 Hurricane).Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern and western Florida on 29-30 August. The Governor of Florida declared a state of emergecny over 33 Counties across the area, according to FEMA, as of 27 August.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, thunderstorms affected Michigan State, north-eastern United States of America on 25-26 August that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and to media, as of 27 August, two people died due to severe weather-related incidents, and four tornados have been reported in the area. More than 254,000 people have been affected by power outages.Over the next 24 hours, thunderstorms are expected over northern Michigan. Michigan declared a State of Emergency.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 28 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia (in particular the Sulawesi Island) since 27 August, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 28 August, one fatality, a total of more than 1,500 affected people and nearly 600 damaged houses across the  Bolaang Mongondow Selatan Regency (North Sulawesi Province).Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the already affected North Sulawesi Province.

title: Philippines, Taiwan - Tropical cyclone SAOLA, update (ECHO 28 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone SAOLA continued moving over the northern Philippine Sea on 27 August, east of the coast of northern Luzon Island, strenghtening. On 28 August at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea, approximately 190 km east of the eastern coast of the Cagayan Valley Region, with maximum sustained winds of 213 km/h (typhoon).The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) and DSWD report, as of 27 August, 2,307 evacuated people and a total of over 8,500 affected people across northern Luzon Island.On 28-30 August, SAOLA is expected to continue moving north, off the coast of Luzon and toward southern Taiwan, strenghtening. After that, it is forecast to make landfall over the southernmost area of Taiwan on 31 August, with maximum sustained winds up to 213 km/h (typhoon).Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over Luzon. Heavy rainfall is also forecast over Taiwan on 28-30 August. PAGASA issued a tropical cyclone alert over most of Luzon.

title: Pakistan - Floods (ECHO 28 Aug 2023)
description: Monsoon rains hit Pakistan and India in the last months, causing floods and leading to casualties and damage.According to media, as of 27 August, 16 people died, 36 have been injured and more than 150,000 people have been evacuated in central Punjab Province in eastern Pakistan where several hundred villages have been inundated due to floods of the Sutlej River.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the affected areas.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 27 Aug 2023)
description: As of 27 August, wildfires continue to burn across Greece, the most affected areas being Alexandroupolis, Dadia and Rodopi Municipalities in East Macedonia, Parintha in Attica Region and Viotia in Central Greece. On 26 August, the Greek Civil Protection reported that a new fire has been declared in Andros island (Northern Cyclades) required some evacuation.According to the Greek Civil Protection the number of casualties is raised to 21, after another body was collected by the fire service on 24 August in a forest road near Lefkimi, between Alexandroupolis and Dadia.10 Member and Participating States of the are contributing to operations on the ground. On 26 and 27 August, Greece requested via  additional resources consisting of five aerial forest firefighting planes (AFFF-P, 4 medium and 1 heavy firefighting airplane) and four ground forest firefighting modules using vehicles (GFFF-V). On 27 August, France offered one AFFF-P module consisting of 2 Canadair firefighting planes from the capacity. The deployed two liaison officers to Greece to support coordination of the EU assistance.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated five times with 20 maps produced so far (, , , , ).Over the next 48 hours, according to , the fire danger risk in all Greece continues decreasing, however the fire danger forecast is expected to remain high or extreme in some areas.

title: Romania - Explosion  (ECHO 27 Aug 2023)
description: On 26 August two explosions occurred at a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) station in Crevedia, around 30km northwest of Bucharest,Romania.According to Romanian Civil Protection and media reports, two people died and 56 people were injured. Severity of injuries is still in assessment. Among the injured are 41 firefighters who responded to the incident.People within a 700-metre radius have been evacuated from the area.On 26 August, Romania activated Union Civil Protection Mechanism () requesting international assistance for treatment of 8 severely burnt patients. The request was updated on 27 August for treatment to 18 severely burnt patients. So far 8 countries (Italy,Belgium,Austria,Germany,Norway,Bulgaria,SwedenandDenmark) responded to the request offering treatment for patients.

title: Forest fire in Spain - JRC emergency report
description: A new JRC Emergency report is now available

title: Philippines - Tropical cyclone SAOLA, Update (ECHO 26 Aug 2023)
description: The typhoon SAOLA ("Goring" in the Philippines) intensified further into a severe tropical storm early Saturday, 26 August with a maximum sustained wind speed of 140 km/h and gusts up to 170 km/h. At 3.00 UTC, the system was located 155 km east of Aparri, Cagayan.On 26 August, SAOLA is forecast to move southward to southeastward at 10 km/h and turn eastward to northeastward on 27 August before approaching the sea east of Taiwan the following day.Over the weekend, the eastern parts of mainland Cagayan, Isabela, and the northern part of Aurora are expected to experience heavy rainfall of up to 200 mm.  The Tropical Cyclone Wind Signal No. 3 (moderate to significant impacts) has been issued in two areas in Cagayan and Isabela. State weather forecasters warned of possible flooding and landslides in the affected areas.Around 10,000 family food packs (FFPs) have been distributed by the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) in potentially affected areas. Furthermore, DG ECHO partners have prepositioned relief goods and are ready to respond under the ECHO-funded Rapid Response Mechanism (RRM).

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 25 Aug 2023)
description: As of 25 August, wildfires continue to burn across Greece, the most affected areas being Alexandroupolis, Dadia and Rodopi Municipalities in East Macedonia, Parintha in Attica Region and Viotia in Central Greece. According to the European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the total burnt area in Alexandroupolis is 67,308 hectares, in Parintha is 5,539 hectares and in Viotia is 3,967 hectares.The Greek Civil Protection reports, as of 24 August, that Thrakomakedones, Panorama Menidi and Boskiza villages have been affected by new wildfires in the Parintha areas, and an evacuation order was issued for Agia Paraskevi Municipality (north-western Athens).9 Member and Participating States of the UCPM are contributing to operations on the ground. The ERCC deployed two liaison officers to Greece to support coordination of the EU assistance.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated five times with 11 maps produced so far.Over the next 48 hours, according to EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from high to extreme in the mentioned most affected areas.

title: Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks and Caicos, Bermuda - Tropical cyclone FRANKLIN, update (ECHO 25 Aug 2023)
description: After its passage over the central-eastern Hispaniola Island on 23 August, tropical storm FRANKLIN continued moving northward over the North Atlantic Ocean, slightly strenghtening, and passed close to Turks and Caicos on 24 August. On 25 August at 3.00 UTC its centre was located over the North Atlantic Ocean approximately 1,000 km south-southwest of Bermuda, with maximum sustained winds of 93 km/h (tropical storm).Media and WHO PAHO report, as of 25 August, one confirmed fatality, two persons still missing, two injured people, approximately 600 evacuated people (of which around 300 in 15 evacuation centres) and nearly 550 damaged houses across the Dominican Republic, where the most affected area are the Provinces of San Cristóbal, Pedernales, Barahona and Santo Domingo.On the forecast track, FRANKLIN is expected to strenghten and to pass close to Bermuda on 29 August, with maximum sustained winds up to 175 km/h (Cat. 2 Hurricane).

title: USA - Tropical storm HILARY, update (ECHO 25 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, associated to the passage of the remnants of tropical storm HILARY on 21-23 August, affected southern, central and northern Arizona (south-western USA), causing flash floods and some severe weather related incidents (due to the strong wind) that have resulted in evacuations and damage. The most affected area were Coconino, Yavapai and Yuma Counties and the Grand Canyon National Park.Media report, as of 25 August, around 170 evacuated people (of which a number of these in one shelter) across the Coconino County and the area of the Grand Canyon National Park. Several damaged houses were also reported across the Yuma County.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall with thunderstorms are forecast over most of Arizona.

title: Philippines - Tropical storm SAOLA (ECHO 25 Aug 2023)
description: A new tropical storm named SAOLA ("Goring" in the Philippines) formed over the northern Philippine Sea on 22 August and started moving west toward the northern Luzon Island and the Luzon Strait, as a tropical depression. On 25 August at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea, approximately 230 km north-east of the far north-east coast of Luzon Island, with maximum sustained winds of 105 km/h (tropical storm).On the forecast track, SAOLA is expected to turn and to continue moving southward off the coast of Luzon (approximately 150 km east) on 25-27 August, strenghtening, with maximum sustained winds up to 195 km/h (typhoon). The storm may affect areas that are still recovering from Typhoon Doksuri. The Cagayan Valley Regional Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (CVRDRRMC) activated the CHARLIE Protocol (EPR Protocol) and raised the CVRDRRM Operation Centre's alert level to RED.Over the next 72 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over northern and eastern Luzon Island. PAGASA issued a tropical cyclone alert for this area.

title: China - Flood (ECHO 25 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-southwestern China since 23 August, in particular Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Sichuan, Guizhou, Yunnan Province.According to media, as of 24 August, more than 6,000 people have been evacuated in Lingyun County in north-western Guangxi Region due to flooding risk.The China Meteorological Administration (CMA) has issued a blue alert for mountain torrents in the aforementioned Provinces. For the next 24 hours, more heavy rain is forecast over southern China with locally heavy rainfall.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 24 Aug 2023)
description: As of 24 August, wildfires continue to burn across Greece, most affected areas being Alexandroupolis, Dadia and Rodopi Municipalities in East Macedonia, Fyli Municipality in north-eastern Attica (Central Greece), Viotia (Central Greece), and Evia Island. A total of 99 forest fires, including 55 occurring in the last 24 hours.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), this is the largest wildfire in Europe since records started in 2000, with a burnt area of 73,365 hectares.The Greek Civil Protection reports, as of 23 August, that Melia, Koila, Gratini, Low, Velkio and Mesti Municipalities, in the Alexandroupolis, Dadia and Rhodope areas, have been evacuated. According to media, as of 23 August, 700 people were evacuated from a camp in the Amygdaleza region (Attica Region) and 150 people were evacuated from Menidi village in West Greece Region.Through the UCPM, 8 aircraft from the rescEU reserves have been deployed, as well as 270 firefighters and 47 vehicles from 9 Member States.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated five times with eight maps produced so far.Over the next 48 hours, according to EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from high to extreme across Greece.

title: Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks and Caicos, Bermuda - Tropical cyclone FRANKLIN, update (ECHO 24 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone FRANKLIN made landfall over the area of Barahona Town (Dominican Republic) on 23 August late in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 83 km/h (tropical storm) and continued moving northward, slightly weakening. On 24 August at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the North Atlantic Ocean, approximately 60 km east of Cockburn Town (Turks and Caicos) and 200 km north of the northern coast of Dominican Republic, with maximum sustained winds of 85 km/h (tropical storm).Media report, as of 24 August, one fatality, two persons still missing and around 200 displaced people across the Dominican Republic.FRANKLIN continues northward over the North Atlantic Ocean, strenghtening, and it is expected to pass close to Bermuda between 28-29 August, with maximum sustained winds up to 175 km/h (Cat. 2 Hurricane).Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is forecast over most of Dominican Republic and the whole Turks and Caicos. NOAA has issued a Tropical Storm Warning for most of the coast of Dominican Republic and Turks and Caicos.

title: USA - Tropical storm HILARY, update (ECHO 24 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, associated to the passage of the tropical storm HILARY and its remnants on 20-21 August, affected southern California (USA), causing floods and mudslides that have resulted in evacuations and damage. The most affected were San Bernardino, San Diego, Los Angeles, Riverside and Ventura Counties.Media report, as of 24 August, one missing person, around 800 isolated people and about 30 rescued people across the San Bernardino County. In San Diego County, media report approximately 400 evacuated people and nine rescued people. In addition, 40 rescued people were reported throughout Riverside County.Over the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall with thunderstorms are forecast over central-eastern California.

title: India - Landslide and bridge collapse (ECHO 24 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has affected the northern Himalayan States of Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand, leading to casualties and significant damage. On 23 August, a landslide in Himachal Pradesh resulted in over 10 deaths, stranding 82 and damaging 121 houses. In Kullu district, multiple buildings collapsed.Over the past month, floods and landslides in Himachal destroyed over 2,000 houses, damaged over 10,000 houses, and directly impacted 500,000 people, with 3 million affected indirectly. The Indian Meteorological Department warned of continued heavy rainfall in parts of Himachal and Uttarakhand.Meanwhile, in Mizoram State, an under-construction railway bridge platform collapsed on 23 August, killing 26 workers and injuring two. Rescue operations are ongoing, with government compensation announced for victims' families.

title: Pakistan - Floods (ECHO 24 Aug 2023)
description: Monsoon rains hit Pakistan and India in the last months, causing floods and leading to casualties and damage.As of 23 August, almost 100,000 people have been evacuated in Punjab Province in eastern Pakistan where several hundred villages have been inundated due to floods of the Sutlej River that cross both Pakistan and India.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is forecast over northern Pakistan.

title: Ghana – Imminent Floods (ECHO 24 Aug 2023)
description: As part of its overall contribution to the Disaster Relief Emergency Fund (DREF) of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), the European Union has released EUR  80,000 in humanitarian funds on floods preparedness in Ghana in response to the warning of the National Disaster Management Organisation (NADMO) and the Meteorological Agency, for increased rainfall and flooding in northern areas of the country (Northern, the Upper East, and the Upper West).Four out of the seven reported high-risk regions have already recorded incidences of flooding leading to loss of lives, property and livelihoods. More regions in the northern part are expected to experience flooding because of above normal rainfall.This EU funding aims at mitigating the impact of floods for potentially 50,000 people in Northern regions of Ghana during the peak of the season by reducing their shelter, WASH and health vulnerability, through both anticipatory actions and improved early warning.

title: Türkiye- Wildfires (ECHO 24 Aug 2023)
description: Since 22 August, a wildfire has been affecting Canakkale Province in north-western Türkiye, resulting in evacuations and damage.According to the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry, as of 23 August, the burnt area is 4,080 hectares and the wildfire is under control as of 11:05; cooling works continue to operate.As of 23 August, media report that more than 1,400 people have been evacuated from nine villages, almost 99 people have been injured and the marine traffic in the Dardanelles Strait, in front of Canakkale City, has been suspended. The Dardanelles Strait, as of 11:00 on 24 August, has been reopened for maritime traffic.Over the next 24 hours, according to EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from very high to very extreme across Canakkale Province.

title: Greece - Wildfire, update (ECHO 23 Aug 2023)
description: Several wildfires have affected Greece since 19 August, in particular near Alexandroupolis-Feres and Rodopi in East Macedonia, in Viotia (Central Greece), Parrnitha (Attica), Evia Island, and Kythnos Island.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the total burnt area of currently active fires in all regions exceeds 62,000 hectares.As of 22 August, DG ECHO reports 20 casualties, of whom 18 were in Dadia forest near the border with Türkiye. Moreover, the Alexandroupolis General Hospital has been evacuated.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated 5 times on 20, 22 and 23 August, with four maps produced so far.The ERCC has mobilised 7 firefighting planes and 1 helicopter from the rescEU reserve stationed in Cyprus, Czechia, Germany, Croatia and Sweden. In addition, Czechia, Bulgaria, France, Romania and Slovakia contributed to the response, deploying 5 ground forest fire fighting teams, with a total of around 250 fire fighters being deployed.Over the next 48 hours, according to EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from high to extreme across the East Macedonia Region and from high to very extreme in southern and north-eastern Greece.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 23 Aug 2023)
description: Wildfires have been burning across the Washington State, north-western USA, since 18 August, prompting evacuations and causing casualties and widespread damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 22 August, two major ongoing active fires across the Spokane County, eastern Washington State, bordering with western Montana: the Gray fire and the Oregon fire. These two fires have burnt so far an area of nearly 8,500 hectares and they are currently not contained. In addition, seven more minor wildfires are affecting the same County.According to FEMA, two fatalities, one injured person, around 5,000 evacuated people, 240 destroyed structures and 27 damaged structures were reported due to the Gray and Oregon fires.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from moderate to very high over the eastern Washington State.

title: Chile - Floods (ECHO 22 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central-southern Chile, particularly Valparaíso, Santiago Metropolitan, O’Higgins, Maule, Ñuble, Biobío Regions since 19 August, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the National Disaster Prevention and Response Service (SENAPRED), as of 21 August, three people died, of whom two in Biobío Region and one in Ñuble Region, 32,728 have been evacuated and 33,456 resulted isolated. Furthermore, more than 270 houses were affected by major damage.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the already affected area.

title: Dominican Republic, Haiti - Tropical cyclone FRANKLIN (ECHO 22 Aug 2023)
description: A new Tropical cyclone named FRANKLIN formed over the eastern Caribbean Sea on 20 August and started moving toward the Hispaniola Island. On 22 August at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea approximately 380 km south of the Bani Town (just west of Santo Domingo Capital City, Dominican Republic), with maximum sustained winds of 85 km/h (tropical storm).On the forecast track, FRANKLIN is forecast to continue moving northward over the Caribbean Sea, strenghtening, and it is expected to make landfall west of the greater Santo Domingo area on 23 August in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 102 km/h (tropical storm).Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over central and eastern Hispaniola Island. NOAA has issued a Tropical Storm Warning over this area.

title: USA - Tropical storm HILARY, update (ECHO 22 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, associated to the passage of the tropical storm HILARY and its remnants on 21 August, affected southern California (USA), causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage. The most affected were San Diego, Sacramento, San Bernardino, Orange, Los Angeles, Riverside and Ventura Counties.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 21 August, approximately 9,000 avacuated people, including in three evacuation centres across the affected area. In addition, media report around 1,000 canceled flights and up to 57,000 power outages.Over the next 24 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over central and southern California.

title: Philippines - Floods (ECHO 22 Aug 2023)
description: Since 18 August, heavy rains and strong winds have affected Davao Province, south-eastern Mindanao, southern Philippines, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), as of 20 August, two people have died, two have been injured across Tagum City, New Corella and Braulio E. Dujali Municipalities (central Davao Province), and almost 9,300 people have been affected by floods. In addition, seven houses have been destroyed and two damaged.For the next 24 hours, cloudy skies with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms are forecast across Mindanao.

title: Algeria - Floods (ECHO 22 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Algeria, in particular the Bordj Bou Arreridj Province, and southern Algeria (Tamanrasset Province) over the past week, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Algerian Civil Protection (DGPCDZ) and media report three fatalities, of which two across the Bou Arreridj Province and one in the Tamanrasset Province. In addition, one person was reported missing across Tamanrasset.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast over most of the country.

title: Spain - Wildfire, update (ECHO 21 Aug 2023)
description: As of 21 Agust, the wildfire continues to burn across central and northern Tenerife Island (central Canary Islands, Spain) since 15 August in the evening (UTC) affecting 11 municipalities across the island. The wildfire is not under control, but partially stabilised in some areas.According to the Government of the Canary Islands, as 21 August, the burnt area is more than 12,800 hectares and approximately 13,000 people were evacuated (of which around 1,000 in evacuation centres) across the affected Municipalities. At this time, the return to the Municipalities of Arafo and Candelaria is being organised.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode (EMSR685) on 16 August and one map was produced so far.Over the next 48 hours, according to the JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from moderate to very high over the whole Tenerife Island.

title: Greece - Wildfire (ECHO 21 Aug 2023)
description: A huge wildfire has been burning across the area of Alexandroupolis Municipality, East Macedonia Region, north-eastern Greece. The wildfire started on 19 August and is currently not contained. According to the JRC's European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the burnt area is of at least 4,600 hectares.According to media reports, as of 21 August, ten villages have been evacuted around Alexandroupolis, among them Avantas, Amfitriti, Maistros, Monastiraki, Loutros, Doriskos, Nipsa, Pefka, Aetochori, Agnanti and Aristinos area, and several houses have been damaged.On 19 August, Greece activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (EUPCM) to request aerial and terrestrial firefighting modules. The Emergency Response Coordination Centre mobilised two air tractors stationed in Cyprus, and Romania offered a ground forest firefighting module including 10 vehicles and 56 firefighters via the EUCPM.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode (EMSR686) on 20 August to provide damage assessment.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from extreme to very extreme across the Alexandroupolis area.

title: Mexico, USA - Tropical cyclone HILARY, update (ECHO 21 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone HILARY made landfall over the Baja California State (northern Mexico, bordering with California State, USA), near San Quintin City, on 20 August in the afternoon (UTC), as a tropical storm. On 21 August at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located inland over the greater Los Angeles area (southern California), with maximum sustained winds of 74 km/h (tropical storm).In Mexico, media report, as of 21 August, two fatalities, of which one in Santa Rosalía in Mulegé Municipality (Baja California Sur) and one more in Culiacán City (Sinaloa). In the USA, FEMA reports approximately 4,500 voluntary evacuations orders across the Los Angeles County.On the forecast track, HILARY is forecast to continue moving northward inland over southern California, further weakening and dissipating on 21 August.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the northern Baja California State (Mexico) and southern California (USA). NOAA has issued a Tropical Storm Warning over this area.

title: Canada - Wildfires (ECHO 21 Aug 2023)
description: Since 18 August, wildfires have been affecting the British Columbia Province in Canada, in particular West Kelowna City in Central Okanagan District in southern British Columbia Province, resulting in evacuations and damage.More than 300 wildfires have been reported across British Columbia, as of 21 August. According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the burnt area is more than 14,000 hectares.As of 18 August, media report that an evacuation order is active for more than 35,000 people and British Columbia declared a state of emergency.Over the next 24 hours, according to GWIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from extreme to very extreme across Kelowna City.

title: Spain - Wildfire, update  (ECHO 19 Aug 2023)
description: As of 19 August, the wildfires affecting northern Tenerife Island since 15 August continue to spread with more people forced to evacuate their homes, reaching more than 4 500 in the absence of a definitive count, while evacuations continue.Media report that eleven municipalities of the Island are currently affected by the wildfires, as the fires spread to the municipality of Gúimar and Los Realejos on 18-19 August in addition to the already affected municipalities of Arafo, Candelaria, Tacoronte, La Orotava, El Rosario, Santa Ursula, La Victoria, La Matanza and El Sauzal municipalities. The confinement has been lifted and there are currently no locations under this measure.According to the Government of Canary Islands, as of 18 August, the affected area was nearly 5,000 hectares in a more than 50 km perimeter. As of 19 August, according to the European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the burnt area is estimated at 11,015 hectares.The wildfire is currently not contained and 19 aircrafts are planned to operate in the area today to battle the wildfires.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 16 August to provide the damage assessment of the affected area. One delineation map has been produced so far.

title: Spain - Wildfire, update (ECHO 18 Aug 2023)
description: As of 18 August, the wildfire continue to burn across northern Tenerife Island, central Canary Islands, since 15 August in the evening (UTC) and currently it is affecting Arafo, Candelaria, Tacoronte, La Orotava, El Rosario, Santa Ursula, La Victoria, La Matanza and El Sauzal Municipalities. The wildfire is currently not contained.According to the Government of the Canary Islands, as of 17 August, the burnt area is nearly 3,300 hectares. As of 18 August, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the burnt area is already much higher and it estimates approximately 7,800 hectares.Local authorities report more than 3,000 evacuated people across the aforementioned affected Municipalities and 3,820 confined people in La Esperanza Town (El Rosario Municipality).The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode (EMSR685) on 16 August to provide the damage assessment of the affected area.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected from moderate to extreme over the whole Tenerife Island.

title: Colombia - Earthquakes (ECHO 18 Aug 2023)
description: A strong earthquake of 6.3M at a depth of 10 km occurred in central Colombia on 17 August at 17:04 UTC (12:04 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 33 km north-east of Villavicencio City (Meta Department, central Colombia) and 65 km north-east of Bogota City.A strong aftershock of 5.7M and two more aftershocks have been recorded in several municipalities in Meta Department.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 404,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and 194,000 people to strong shacking.According to National Authorities and media reports, El Calvario Municipality (Meta Department) have been initially evacuated and a landslide has been reported in Villavicencio. The National Infrastructure Agency (ANI) ordered the closure of Villavicencio - Bogota road. Minor damages have been reported to buildings an no impact to people.

title: Mexico, USA - Hurricane HILARY (ECHO 18 Aug 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named HILARY formed over the Eastern Pacific Ocean far off the coast of southern Mexico on 16 August and started moving north-west toward the Baja California Peninsula. On 18 August at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 650 km south of Cabo San Lucas City (far southern Baja California Peninsula), with maximum sustained winds of 220 km/h (Category 3 Hurricane).On the forecast track, HILARY is forecast to continue moving northwestward over the Ocean and it is expected to pass very close to the northern Baja California Sur State (near Puerto Escondido City) on 20 August in the morning (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 130 km/h (Category 1 Hurricane).On 19-21 August, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the Baja California Peninsula and southern California (USA). NOAA has issued a Hurricane Watch for most of the Baja California Sur State and a Tropical Storm Warning for the rest of the peninsula.

title: Canada - Wildfires (ECHO 18 Aug 2023)
description: Wildfires have been affecting the Northwest Territories Province in Canada, in particular the Capital Yellowknife in south-eastern Northwest Territories, resulting in evacuations and damage.Two main wildfires have been reported close to Yellowknife. According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the closest is burning through over 35,000 hectares, and the wildfire on the western area of the city is burning at least 15,000 hectares.As of 18 August, media report that an evacuation order is valid for more than 20,000 people in Yellowknife.Over the next 24 hours, according to GWIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from moderate to high across the affected areas.

title: Indonesia: Floods and landslides, update  (ECHO 18 Aug 2023)
description: Floods occuring in northern Indonesia, particularly Sumatra Island, on 14 August continue to cause damage and displacement. Heavy rains in Pesisir Selatan Regency on 17 August triggered further flooding and landslides in two sub-districts.According to the National Disaster Mitigation Agency (BNPB), the floods have affected 2,852 people (713 families) across 10 villages in Pesisir Selatan District, West Sumatra. On 16 August, 100 families reported being displaced by floodwaters. There are no reports of casualties.The Regional Disaster Mitigation Agency (BPBD) of Pesisir Selatan Regency is delivering food, blankets, and mattress support in collaboration with local authorities. National highways connecting the Painan area to Padang City were cleared of landslip debris.BMKG forecasts moderate to heavy rain, lightning, and high winds in west Sumatra until 20 August.

title: Spain - Wildfire (ECHO 17 Aug 2023)
description: A huge wildfire has been burning across northern Tenerife Island, central Canary Islands, Spain. The wildfire started between 15 August in the evening and 16 August in the morning (UTC) and currently it is affecting Arafo and Candelaria Municipalities, Santa Cruz de Tenerife Province. According to official data from the local authorities of the Canary Islands, as of 17 August, the burnt area is more than 1,600 hectares and the wildfire is currently not fully contained.Media report, as of the same date, approximately 150 evacuated people from four municipalities (Arafo, Candelaria, El Rosario and Santa Ursula).The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 16 August to provide the damage assessment of the affected area.Over the next 24 hours, according to EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected from moderate to very high over the whole Tenerife Island.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 17 Aug 2023)
description: In recent days, heavy storms and strong winds have been affecting central and northern Thailand, in particular Phetchaburi, Chiang Mai, Surat Thani, Satun, and Rayong Provinces, resulting in casualties and damage.As of 16 August, media report one fatality, one person missing and five rescued people due to a severe weather related incident occurred on 12 August in Ban Laem District, northeastern Phetchaburi Province.Moreover, according to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), 200 people and almost 400 houses have been affected by flooding on 16 August across Chiang Mai, Surat Thani, Satun, Rayong Provinces.For the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are forecast over most parts of the country, with locally very heavy rainfall over northern Thailand.

title: Japan - Tropical Cyclone LAN, update (ECHO 17 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone LAN continued moving north-northeastward over the Sea of Japan, well off the coast of northern Honshu Island (the main island of Japan) on 16 August, further weakening. On 17 August at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Sea of Japan approximately 215 km north-west of Sapporo City, northern Japan, with maximum sustained winds of 74 km/h (tropical storm).Media report, as of 17 August, 64 injured people across nine Prefectures in central Honshu (where the worst affected Prefectures are Hyogo and Osaka) and up to 305 000 power outages across the affected area in central Honshu Island.On the forecast track, LAN is forecast to continue moving northeastward over the northern Sea of Japan, further weakening and dissipating on 17-18 August.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the whole Honshu Island and most of the Hokkaido Island.

title: China - Severe weather, update (ECHO 17 Aug 2023)
description: Following the severe weather characterised by heavy rainfall and strong winds that affected Jiangsu Province (eastern China) and Hunan Province (south-central China) on 13 August, the number of casualties has increased.According to media reports, as of 17 August, in Hengan County in central-eastern Hunan Province, three people died, three have been injured and seven people have been sheltered due to severe weather-related incidents.Moreover, in Yancheng village, eastern Jiangsu Province, media report two fatalities, 15 injured people and at least 283 damaged houses.Over the next 24 hours more heavy rain is forecast over the southern and eastern China.

title: France - Wildfire (ECHO 16 Aug 2023)
description: A forest fire broke out in the towns of Saint-André and Argelès-sur-Mer (south of the Pyrénées-Orientales department, south-east of France, border with Spain) on 14 August in the afternoon (UTC), causing evacuations and damage. According to the Interministerial Operational Center for Crisis Management (COGIC), as of 15 August, the forest fire has burnt an area of 508 hectares.COGIC reported 51 injured or slightly injured (including 20 firefighters), 8 houses and 20 mobile homes destroyed, and 30 buildings damaged. Media also report around 3,000 people evacuated from several campsites and two housing estates.A total of 75 drops were made by water bomber planes and helicopters. 185 firefighters are still mobilised to prevent any resumption of fire.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC's European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the forecast fire danger remains moderate to very high across the entire Pyrénées-Orientales department.

title: USA - Wildfire, update (ECHO 16 Aug 2023)
description: The severe wildfires that have been affecting Maui Island, Hawaii, particularly the area of Lahaina City and Kula City, in the western and central part of the island, over the past few days, resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.According to Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), as of 15 August, at least 105 fatalities and 20 injured people have been reported, and hundreds of people are still missing. Over 8,000 people have been evacuated, including 7,500 in Lahaina City, and 570 people still in evacuation centres.Media report that over 2,200 structures have been destroyed by the fires. In addition, hundreds of power outages are still reported and an unsafe water advisory has been issued in the western part of Maui Island.National authorities are still involved in the firefighting operations. According to the JRC Global Wildfire Information (GWIS), the burnt areas have an extension of over 5,000 hectares.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast is high over affected areas in Maui.

title: India - Floods and landslides (ECHO 16 Aug 2023)
description: Very heavy rainfall has been affecting the northern Himalayan States of India between 13-14 August, causing flash floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and severe damage.60 fatalities have been reported in the last three days according to Himachal state authorities as of 15 August, with the worst affected Districts being Mandi, Solan and the Capital City Shimla. Eight fatalities have been reported in Uttarakhand (with the Rishikesh City representing the worst affected area). Media also report 20 persons still missing throughout Himachal Pradesh.In addition, 139 houses have been fully damaged and 639 houses partially damaged since 12 August in Himachal while 11 fully damaged and 49 partially damaged houses reported in Uttarakhand since 12 August according to the Ministry of Home Affairs. Over 800 roads including National Highways have been shut down across the state with a significant impact on over 2,000 bus routes. All educational institutes across Himachal remain closed until 16 August.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

title: Myanmar - Landslide (ECHO 16 Aug 2023)
description: On 13 August, a landslide occurred in a jade mine in Hpakant village, Kachin State in northern Myanmar, resulting in casualties.According to media reports, as of 16 August, at least 31 people died while almost eight are still missing. Search and rescue teams have been immediately deployed in the area, but heavy rains are making rescue activities difficult.More rain is forecast over the affected area in the next 24 hours.

title: Japan - Tropical Cyclone LAN (ECHO 16 Aug 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone LAN passed over central-western Honshu Island (Japan’s largest island) on 14 August and continuing in the morning of 15 August (UTC) as a tropical storm, moving northward over the Sea of Japan. On 16 August at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located approximately 260 km north of the coast of Kyoto Prefecture (central Honshu), with maximum sustained winds of 83 km/h (tropical storm).According to the Japan Fire and Disaster Management Agency, 49 people were injured and 37 houses damaged across western Japan. Around 182,000 people were advised to evacuate or seek shelter. On Tuesday, all flights from Chubu, Kansai, and Nagoya airports were cancelled. Train services between Nagoya and Okayama have been halted.LAN is forecast to continue moving north-eastward over the Sea of Japan and it is expected to pass close to northern Hokkaido Island, northern Japan, on 17 August in the morning (UTC), as a tropical storm.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over central and western Honshu Island.

title: China - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Aug 2023)
description: On 13 August, heavy rain and strong winds were reported in Jiangsu Province, eastern China, leading to casualties.According to media, as of 15 August, two people died, 15 people have been injured and at least 283 homes were damaged in Yancheng Village, eastern Jiangsu Province.Over the next 24 hours more heavy rain is forecast over Jiangsu Province.

title: Syria - Water crisis  (ECHO 16 Aug 2023)
description: The water level of the Euphrates river decreased dramatically over the past three weeks and is reported to be at its historical low at Tabqa Dam.The Alouk water station remains non-operational since 23 June, negatively affecting nearly one million people in Hassakeh governorate, including as concerns health, agricultural- and electricity production, as well as protection.Limited access to water also leads to a significant increase in the number of waterborne diseases, including cases of scabies in IDP camps.

title: Italy - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 14 Aug 2023)
description: A new paroxysmal event of Mount Etna volcano, southern Italy, has been reported on 13 August at 16.40 UTC by the National Institute of Geophysics and Volcanology (INGV).
