This phase was characterised by explosive activity at the Southeast Crater that has gradually switched to a lava fountain.The personnel of INGV on the field observed ashfall in Nicolosi Municipality, southern Mount Etna, as of 13 August and report that the ash plume is moving south-southwestward.According to media reports, as of 14 August, the international airport of Catania has been temporarily closed due to the ash column.The Volcanic Ash Advisory Centre (VAAC), in the early morning has revised the aviation colour code to orange since the reduction of risk of volcanic ash.

title: USA - Wildfire, update (ECHO 14 Aug 2023)
description: The severe wildfires that hit Maui Island, Hawaii, particularly the area of Lahaina City and Kula City, in the western and central part of the island, resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.According to Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), at least 93 died, 26 people have been injured, hundreds of people are still missing, and over 8,700 people have been evacuated, of whom more than 1,400 are in evacuation shelters. More than 2,200 structures have been destroyed by the fires across the Island. In addition, an evacuation order is still active for west Maui and an unsafe water advisory has been issued in Kula and Lahaina Cities.National authorities are still involved in the firefighting operations. According to FEMA and to the JRC Global Wildfire Information GWIS, the burn areas have an extension of almost 5,000 hectares and the fires on Maui are not 100% contained.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC GWIS, the fire danger forecast is moderate to extreme over northern and central Maui.

title: Indonesia: Floods and landslides (ECHO 14 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia (in particular Sumatra Island) since 13 August, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in damage.According to ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 13 August, nearly 2,000 people and over 500 affected houses have been affected by floods and landslides in Pesisir Selatan Regency, West Sumatra Province.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Sumatra Island.

title: China - Landslides and flash floods (ECHO 14 Aug 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting north-central China, particularly the Shaanxi Province since 11 August, triggering landslides and mudslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 13 August, 21 fatalities and six missing people in Weiziping, Xi'an City, southern Shaanxi Province due to a mudslide that occurred on 11 August. In addition, two houses have been destroyed, several roads have been damaged and more than 900 people are without power.Over the next 24 hours, according to the China Meteorological Administration (CMA), drier conditions are forecast over Shaanxi Province.

title: Russia - Floods (ECHO 14 Aug 2023)
description: The remnants of tropical cyclone KHANUN, which made landfall over the south-eastern coast of South Korea on 11 August, have caused floods in Primorye Region, southern Far Eastern Federal District (eastern Russia).According to media, as of 14 August, more than 2,500 people have been evacuated and more than 4,600 buildings have been affected by flooding.For the next 24 hours, more rain is expected across the Far Eastern Federal District.

title: Vietnam - Severe weather  (ECHO 31 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central and southern Vietnam causing landslides and floods in Lam Dong Province (central Vietnam), Binh Thuan Province (south-eastern Vietnam) and Bac Lieu Province (sothern Vietnam)  that resulted in casualties and damage.As of 31 July, media reports that three people died on 30 July in Bao Loc Pass nearby Da Lat City (north-eastern Dong Province) due to a landslide and one is still missing. In addition, one person died in Binh Thuan Province due to floods and  one in Mekong Delta due to severe weather-related incident.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over most of the country with locally heavy rainfall in western Vietnam.

title: Russia - Severe weather (ECHO 31 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds hit central Russia on 30 July, resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, the severe weather event occurred close to Lake Yalchik in the Mari-El Region where at least ten people died, 76 others have been injured and thousands remained without power.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain is expected across the affected area.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical cyclone DOKSURI, update (ECHO 31 Jul 2023)
description: The remnants of tropical cyclone DOKSURI reached Beijing City after it made landfall on 28 July over Fujian Province where more than 354,000 people living in the coastal area have been evacuated and 880,000 affected.Following heavy rainfall and strong winds in the capital of China, more than 30,000 people have been displaced as well as another 20,000 in Shijiazhuang, Hebei Province.In the Philippines, the passage of DOKSURI on 25-26 July resulted in at least 25 fatalities, 20 missing people, 52 injured, almost 313,000 displaced and a total of approximately 2,400,000 affected people.DG ECHO has allocated EUR 500,000 in immediate relief assistance to provide shelter assistance with water and sanitation services to most vulnerable families in northern Luzon.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over Hebei, Beijing, Tianjin, and eastern Shanxi in eastern China. All are under red warnings for rainstorms. Moderate rainfall with scattered thunderstorms is expected over most parts of the northern Philippines where extreme flood advisories are in effect.

title: India - Monsoon rains and floods, update (ECHO 31 Jul 2023)
description: In the past three days, the number of casualties increased following the heavy rainfall that has been affecting the central part of India, in particular Telangana.According the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) and to media, as of 30 July, 23 people died due to flooding in Mulugu District, western Telangana, of whom eight in Kondai Village, which was completely inundated, the other in the Malyala and Dodla Villages. The Mulungu District received the heaviest 24-hour rainfall recorded in India during this monsoon season with 616.5 mm on 27 July.In the past 24 hours 2 fatalities were registered in Gujarat and one in Rajasthan due to severe weather related incident.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over central and northern India, with locally heavy rain in eastern-northern India.

title: Japan - Tropical Cyclone KHANUN (ECHO 31 Jul 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named KHANUN, formed over the central Philippine Sea, is moving north-west over the Okinawa Islands. On 31 July at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 630 km south-east of the south-eastern coast of Okinawa Island, southern Japan, with maximum sustained winds of 194 km/h.KHANUN is forecast to continue north-west strengthening and it could cross the southern Ryukyu Islands on 1-2 August bringing heavy rain, strong winds and storm surges.For the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall with thunderstorms, strong winds and high gusts, and storm surge are forecast particularly over Okinawa Island (under red warning) and southern Ryukyu Islands.

title: Pakistan - violence, monsoon floods  (ECHO 31 Jul 2023)
description: The death toll from rain and flood related incidents reached 179, with over 264 people injured, mostly in Punjab (67) and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP;51). Similarly, 1,594 houses were damaged, mostly in Balochistan (445).In Sindh, 183 villages of district Dadu were affected as access roads are flooded; 70 villages of Pir Jo Goth and Gambat were severed after the Indus river inundated Katcha area of Khairpur district; 324 houses were damaged in Jacobabad and Sukkur districts.In Balochistan, the government has declared Jafferabad, Sohbatpur, Kharan, Jhal Magsi, Punjgoor, and Washuk districts as calamity hit and requested humanitarian assistance. In Washuk and Kharan districts, 2,800 houses were damaged due to flash floods after the Panjgur-Newan dam has been broken by recent monsoon.In Gilgit-Baltistan region, flash floods and mudslides blocked Karakoram Highway; 80 houses have been damaged and 250 km of roads have been affected.A bomb blast at a political rally has killed over 46 people and injured 200 on 30 July, in Bajur tribal district of KP. Emergency has been declared in hospitals of neighboring districts.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 28 Jul 2023)
description: Wildfires continue to affect the country, especially close to Volos City where an area of 7,000 ha is burning.According to the Greek Civil Protection and the Hellenic Broadcasting Corporation, two people died and the settlements of Melissatika, Golden Beach Panagia, Velanidia, Marathos and Kritharia have been evacuated following the fires in the Volos area.In Rhodes, ground forces are operating in order to contain the front in an area between the settlements of Vati, Profylia and the Holy Monastery of Tharri. The fire in Corfu is under control.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated 8 times in rapid mapping mode ().Over 500 firefighters and 9 planes have been deployed via the EU Civil Protection Mechanism, as well as a Liaison Officer from the Emergency Response Coordination Centre.Over the next 24 hours the weather forecast is expected to be at a high level risk.

title: Guatemala - Severe weather, update (ECHO 28 Jul 2023)
description: Since the beginning of the rainy season in May 2023, heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting most of Guatemala, causing floods, landslides and a number of severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.As of 27 July, according to the the National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED), 16 people died (across eight Departments), four have been injured, 3,084 people have been evacuated and more than 916,000 people affected.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall with locally heavy rain is forecast over southern and south-western Guatemala.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical cyclone DOKSURI, update (ECHO 28 Jul 2023)
description: Typhoon DOKSURI passed very close to the southern coast of Taiwan on 27 July and is making landfall over the south-eastern coast of Fujian Province, China.Doksuri is forecast to weaken into a tropical storm as it continues north-northwestward across Fujian and Jiangxi Provinces on 29 July before weakening to a tropical depression and dissipating late on 29 July.The Chinese Ministry of Emergency Management has mobilised emergency forces of over 4,000 personnel and five helicopters to address the immediate needs. Three coastal cities in Fujian Province, China, shut schools, businesses and factories.In the Philippines the passage of DOKSURI on 25-26 July, resulted in at least 13 fatalities, 20 missing people, 12 injured people, over 42,000 displaced people and more than 500,000 affected, though information is still being collected. Many homes have been destroyed, and raining and flooding continue in the Philippines.On 28-29 July heavy to very heavy rain, strong winds, and storm surges are expected for southern Jiangsu, southern Anhui, Zhejiang, Fujian, eastern Jiangxi, and southwestern Taiwan; these areas are all under a red warning for the typhoon.

title: India - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 28 Jul 2023)
description: In the past several days, the number of casualties and of evacuated people is increasing following the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several parts of India.Over 26-27 July, the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports 52 fatalities (11 in Himachal Pradesh, 11 in Maharastra, five in Kerala, five in Haryana, five in Gujarat, five in Karnataka, three in Madhya Pradesh, three in Jammu and Kashmir, two in Chhattisgarh, one in Assam and one in Punjab), over 6,000 evacuated people and about 58,000 affected people. In addition, 1,520 damaged houses are reported across 16 States. Since April, NDMI reports 1,612 fatalities, 39 missing persons, 770 injured people and more than 61,800 damaged houses throughout the Country.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over central and western India, with very heavy rain in central India, particularly in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Pakistan- Landslides and monsoon rainfall (ECHO 28 Jul 2023)
description: On 27 July, deadly landslides triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in the Districts of Mansehra, Abbottabad, and Mardan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province, northern Pakistan, resulting in casualties and damage.Following these events, six people died (four in Mansehra, one in Abbottabad and another in Mardan), and four people have been injured.According to the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), in this monsoon season, the number of fatalities continues to increase, and, as of 27 July, 168 people died, 254 have been injured, and more than 1 270 houses have been damaged across the country.For the next 48 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over most parts of central and northern Pakistan, including Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

title: Italy - Wildfires, update (ECHO 27 Jul 2023)
description: According to the Italian Civil Protection, as of 26 July, in the past 24 hours 22 new wildfires have affected southern and central Italy (in particular Sicily, Calabria, Sardinia, Puglia, Abruzzo and Lazio Regions) resulting in further evacuations and damage. Among these wildfires, 12 were contained or fully extinguished. The Italian Civil Protection received 24 requests of intervention of the national fleet, of which 5 remain active.In Sicily Island, a number of new wildfires started on 25 July across the Catania Province (eastern Sicily). According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the total burnt area is more than 1,000 hectares. 30 people were evacuated in Nicolosi Municipality (very close to the Catania City area). In Calabria Region, a bakery and three buildings were destroyed by fire and 15 people were evacuated people in the area of Strongoli Municipality (Crotone Province, eastern Calabria).Over the next 24 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected from high to extreme across the already affected Sicily, Calabria and Puglia Regions.On 27 July, the Italian CP authorities have informed that there is no further need for UCPM support.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 27 Jul 2023)
description: 61 forest fires occurred in the last 24 hours, with the most concerning still in Rhodes, Corfu and Evia islands.10 countries are contributing to the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) response to the wildfires in Greece. In total, over 500 firefighters and 9 planes from the European Civil Protection Pool (ECPP) and from rescEU have been deployed.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated 7 times in rapid mapping mode ().

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical cyclone DOKSURI, update (ECHO 27 Jul 2023)
description: Typhoon DOKSURI is moving towards south-eastern China after making landfall twice in the northern Philippines, killing five people, affecting more than 328,000 and displacing about 27,000 people. On 27 July at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 175 km south-west of Hengchun City, far southern Taiwan, and approximately 400 km south-east of the Zhangzhou City area, south-west Fujian Province, China, with maximum sustained winds of 139 km/h and gusts of up to 215 km/h.China's national observatory has issued a red alert for Typhoon Doksuri, the most severe warning in its four-tier warning system, with gale-force winds expected. Taiwan's weather bureau issued wind and rain warnings. Over 5,700 people have been evacuated from flood- and landslide-prone areas in Taiwan's south and east. Fujian, eastern Guangdong, and Zhejiang coastal areas, as well as some parts of Taiwan, expect to see heavy downpours of 250 to 400 mm.DG ECHO partners continue to monitor the situation and assess the emerging needs of the affected people.

title: Tunisia - Wildfires (ECHO 27 Jul 2023)
description: Several simultaneous wildfires have recorded near the town of Tabarka in the North West of Tunisia, since 24 July.On 24 July, Tunisia requested assistance from the EU Civil Protection Mechanism in the form of 4 Canadair.The rescEU capacity hosted by Spain was mobilised in response to the request, providing 2 Canadair which arrived on 26 July. The mission is expected to conclude today, 27 July.The Tunisian Ministry of Interior communicated on 26 July that the fires were contained.

title: Philippines - Volcanic activity, update  (ECHO 26 Jul 2023)
description: Local authorities ordered an additional 7,000 people to be evacuated from the area around Mayon Volcano, as effusion of lava at the volcano site was reported over the past 24 hours.According to the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) as of 25 July, a total of 9,876 families (38,396 people) are affected, including 5,790 families (20,234 people) displaced since the volcano eruption reported on 7 July. There have been 184 volcanic earthquakes, 156 rockfall events, and four dome-collapse pyroclastic density current occurrences reported so far.The local authority is providing food and non-food supplies to the victims. The Philippine Red Cross has been providing safe water to IDPs at evacuation Centers. DG ECHO is supporting the Red Cross through the IFRC with EUR 50,000.The Department of Science and Technology (DOST) recommends that the 6-kilometre-radius Permanent Danger Zone (PDZ) remain evacuated due to the danger of PDCs, lava flows, rockfalls, and other volcanic hazards.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical cyclone DOKSURI, update (ECHO 26 Jul 2023)
description: Typhoon DOKSURI (named "Egay" in the Philippines) has made landfall twice in the northern tip of the country, in Fuga Island and Dalapuri Island of Cagayan Province at around 03:00 and 11:00 (UTC+8), respectively.  On 26 July at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 50 km north of the far northern Ilocos Region, northern Philippines, with maximum sustained winds of 204 km/h and gusts of up to 240 km/h.Heavy rainfall already caused by the passage of DOKSURI resulted in casualties across northern and central Philippines. Heavy flooding and landslides are also reported to have affected the people. The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports 180,500 affected people across 21 provinces. Displacement and impact information is still being collected.On 26-27 July, DOKSURI is forecast to enter into the South China Sea and to continue moving northwestward, weakening and reaching Zhangzhou City on 28 July as a tropical storm.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over central and northern Philippines, all of Taiwan, and Guangdong, Fujian and Zhejiang Provinces, eastern China.

title: Türkiye – Earthquake (ECHO 26 Jul 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.5 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in the Adana Province, south-eastern Türkiye, on 25 July at 07:44 UTC (08.44 local time). The epicentre was located in the Kozan City, approximately 65 km nort-eastern of Adana City.Several aftershocks with magnitude between 3 M and 3.2 M have been recorded in the area in the following 15 minutes.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 1,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and 128,000 to moderate shaking.According to the Health Disaster and Coordination Centre (SAKOM), five people have been injured and some buildings were damaged.The seismic event was felt also in the Kahramanmaras and Gaziantep Provinces, Southeastern Anatolia Region, which were the epicenter of the severe earthquakes occured on 6 Frebruary that caused more than 57,000 fatalities across Türkiye an Syria.

title: Tunisia - Wildfires (ECHO 26 Jul 2023)
description: Several simultaneous wildfires were recorded near the town of Tabarka in the North West of Tunisia, prompting the evacuation of around 2,500 people in the village of Melloula, Jendouba province.On 24 July, Tunisia requested assistance from the EU Civil Protection Mechanism in the form of 4 Canadair.The rescEU capacity hosted by Spain was mobilised in response to the request, providing 2 Canadair which are due to arrive on 26 July.

title: Italy - Wildfires (ECHO 26 Jul 2023)
description: According to the Italian Civil Protection, as of 25 July, in the past 24 hours 35 new wildfires have affected southern and central Italy, in particular Sicily, Calabria, Sardinia, Puglia and Abruzzo Regions, resulting in casualties and widespread damage. Among these wildfires, 16 were contained or fully extinguished.In Sicily Island, a number of major wildfires started on 25 July across the Palermo Province, north-west Sicily. According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the total burnt area is more than 10,000 hectares. Media report, as of 26 July, two fatalities and around 2,000 evacuated people across the Province.In Calabria Region, one person died and two were injured across the Reggio Calabria Province, southern Calabria, also in this case due to a number of wildfires.In Puglia Region, approximately 1,200 people were evacuated in the Foggia Province, northern Puglia, and some houses have been damaged by wildfires were across the Lecce Province, southern Puglia.On 25 July, Italy requested 2 Canadairs through the EU Civil Protection Mechanism.Over the next 24 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected from high to very extreme across the already affected Sicily, Calabria and Puglia Regions.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update  (ECHO 26 Jul 2023)
description: As of 25 July, 46 new fires occurred and the most challenging are still on Rhodes, Evia and Corfu islands.10 countries are contributing to the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) response to the wildfires in Greece. In total, over 490 firefighters and 7 planes from the European Civil Protection Pool (ECPP) and from rescEU have been deployed.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated 7 times in rapid mapping mode, for all the three mentioned wildfires (EMSR673 through to 678).Greece updated their request for assistance on 25 July, reporting a need for two additional scooping planes.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 25 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, heavy hailstorms, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting northern Italy, in particular the Lombardy Region, over the last 24 hours, causing several severe weather-related incident, particularly due to strong winds, that have resulted in casualties and damage. The worst affected are the Provinces of Milano, Varese, Monza-Brianza, Brescia and Bergamo, northern Lombardy.Media report, as of 25 July, one fatality and one rescued person in the Monza Province, while one more fatality occurred in the Corteno Golgi Municipality, Brescia Province, in both cases due to the strong winds. A number of damaged buildings and blocked roads were also reported across all the aforementioned affected Provinces.Over the next 48 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over Lombardy Region. However, the orange alert for storms issued by the Italian Civil Protection over the Region is still in force.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 25 Jul 2023)
description: According to the Greek Civil Protection, as of 24 July, more than 500 wildfires occurred in the country since 12 July, resulting in evacuations and widespread damage. The major wildfires not fully contained are currently three.The first, across central Rhodes Island (Dodecanese Islands, south-eastern Greece), started on 18 July. According to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the burnt area is more than 14,600 hectares. The second, in the Corfu Island (Ionian Island, north-western Greece), started on 23 July. According EFFIS, the burnt area is approximately 1,100 hectares. The third, in the Evia Island (central Greece), started on 23 July. According EFFIS, the burnt area is around 1,500 hectares.The Greek Civil Protection reports around 20,000 evacuted people across the Rhodes Island and nearly 2,500 evacuated people in the Corfu Island.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode for all the three mentioned wildfires (EMSR675, 677 and 678 respectively).10 countries are contributing to the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) response to the wildfires in Greece. In total, over 480 firefighters and 7 planes from the European Civil Protection Pool (ECPP) and from rescEU have been deployed.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected from very high to very extreme across Rhodes, from very high to extreme in Evia and high in Corfu.

title: Philippines, Taiwan, China - Tropical Ccclone DOKSURI (ECHO 25 Jul 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone DOKSURI ("Egay" in the Philippines) has intensified into a super typhoon and is moving northwest towards Luzon Strait, expected to make landfall on 25-26 July. On 25 July at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the eastern Philippine Sea approximately 270km south-east of Santa Ana Municipality, Cagayan Province, northern Philippines, with maximum sustained winds of 241 km/h. It is projected to move north-northwest over the South-China Sea, passing south of Taiwan, and it could make landfall on 28 July over the coast of Guangdong Province.Following heavy rainfall brought by EGAY in combination with the Southwest Monsoon, national authorities report one injured person, 100 displaced people and almost 17,000 affected people across five Regions. Up to 3.9 million people could be affected.Over the next 72 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over parts of northern Philippines, particularly Batanes and Babuyan Islands, and most of Taiwan.DG ECHO partners have initiated anticipatory actions in areas most at risk in the Philippines.

title: Cameroon - Floods and landslide (ECHO 25 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect parts of Cameroon, triggering landslides and causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, 5 people died and many others have been injured after a landslide occurred in Limbe, Fako Division, Southwest region of Cameroon on 19-21 July. In addition, in the same period, several households, public infrastructures and one hospital were flooded.More rains are expected over western and northern Cameroon.

title: Algeria - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Jul 2023)
description: Over the past few days, northern and north-eastern Algeria have been experiencing wildfires that resulted in casualties and evacuations. A total of 97 fires have been recorded across 16 prefectures and the worst affected are Béjaïa, Bouira and Jijel.According to national authorities, at least 34 people died, 26 have been injured, and 1,500 others have been evacuated.National authorities deployed 8,000 personnel and 529 trucks to battle the fires.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be high to very extreme across northern Algeria.

title: Tunisia - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Jul 2023)
description: Several simultaneous wildfires were recorded near the town of Tabarka in the North West of Tunisia, prompting the evacuation of around 2,500 people in the village of Melloula, Jendouba province.On 24 July, Tunisia requested assistance from the EU Civil Protection Mechanism in the form of 4 Canadairs.

title: Afghanistan - Flash floods (ECHO 24 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central and eastern Afghanistan, in particular the Maidan Wardak Province, the Khost Province and the Kabul area, since 22 July, causing flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 24 July, 31 fatalities, 41 persons still missing and 74 injured people are reported across Jalrez, Saydabad, Chaki Wardak and Maidan Shahr Districts, Maidan Wardak Province. Around 600 houses were reported damaged or destroyed across the same Province. In addition, media also reports four fatalities in the Kabul Capital City area and one more in the Khost Province, also in these cases due to flash floods.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over eastern Afghanistan.

title: Balkans - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Jul 2023)
description: In the past few days, several parts of Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia and Slovenia have been affected by heavy rainfall and strong winds that resulted in severe weather-related casualties.In Croatia, at least three people died as a consequence of the storm, of whom two in the area of Zagreb and one in the area of Brod-Posavina County. One firefighter died during the intervention from natural causes, in Vukovar-Srijem County. Over 100 people have been injured and 2,000 buildings damaged.In Slovenia, one person died in Bled Town, at least three people have been severely injured, over 300 people evacuated and 1000 buildings damaged. Additionnally, widespread damage (forest, infrastructure) has been recorded across the country.In Bosnia, another person died in Brcko District while more than 20 people have been injured.Furthermore, in Serbia, 20 people have been evacuated on 19 July.For the next 24 hours moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is expected across central-northern Croatia, most of Slovenia, northern Bosnia and Herzegovina, and northern Serbia.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update  (ECHO 21 Jul 2023)
description: In the last 24 hours, 62 forest fires occurred across the country resulting in further evacuations.According to the Greek Civil Protection, the main fires are located in Western Attica, Laconia (southern Peloponnese) and Rhodes.In Western Attica, people living in the areas of Agia Sotira, Palaiokoundoura, Panorama and Palaiochori, Oinoi, and Erythrae have been asked to evacuate.For the next coming days, high-temperature conditions are still forecast across the country. On 21 July, the risk of fire will be very high in Attica, Boeotia, Evia, Corinthia, Argolis, Rhodes, Samos and Ikaria, as reported by the national civil protection.On 18 July, Greece sent a request for UCPM support, updated on 20 and 21 July. Greece request has been responded to by 8 Member States. France sent 2 canadaires from the European Civil Protection Pool. Italy sent 2 Canadairs, Croatia 1 Canadair and Cyprus 2 air tractors from rescEU. In total, Poland, Slovakia, and Romania sent more than 220 firefighters and 79 vehicles, while 50 firefighters and 10 vehicles from Bulgaria are on their way. An ERCC Liaison Officer is supporting coordination efforts.The Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping (EMSR672, EMSR673, EMSR674, EMSR675) has been activated.

title: Colombia - Landslide, update (ECHO 21 Jul 2023)
description: Following the landslide of 17 July in the Municipality of Quetame, Cundinamarca Department (central Colombia), the number of casualties and damage increased.According to media, as of 21 July, 20 people died, nine others are still missing and 6 people were injured. Several homes and a key trade route, including a bridge on the Bogotá-Villavicencio Highway, have been destroyed.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is expected over the central-northern Colombia, with locally heavy rainfall in the noth-western part of the country.

title: India - Landslide (ECHO 21 Jul 2023)
description: A massive landslide triggered by three days of heavy rainfall occurred on 19 July in Irshalwadi Village (Raigad District, western Maharashtra State, central-eastern India) causing casualties and damage.National authorities and media report, as of 21 July, 16 fatalities, dozens of missing people and almost 100 rescued people, between 80 to 100 people remain trapped under the debris of the landslide. In addition, more than 40 homes in the Irshalwadi tribal village are buried by the debris. Over 500 rescuers are still on site, two helicopters are assisting the rescue operation.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole eastern Maharashtra State. Red warnigs for heavy rainfall have been issued for July 21 over Raigad, Valsad and Pune Districts (western Maharashtra State).

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 20 Jul 2023)
description: A heatwave is ongoing in Greece from today until 23 July. Temperatures are expected to reach 41- 43°C and locally 44 - 45°C in the mainland and 38 - 41°C in the islands. Moderate west winds are expected from today until 22 July.  The forest fire risk is expected to reach moderate to very high levels and possibly extreme levels, especially during weekend and early next week.There are four significant forest fires: two in Attica region, one in municipality of Saronikou and one in municipality of Mandra, one in Peloponnese region in municipality of Loutraki and one in the island of Rhodes.On 18 July, Greece sent a request for UCPM support, which has been responded to by 5 Member States as well as the rescEU reserve. France and Italy sent 2 Canadairs each, respectively from the European Civil Protection Pool and from rescEU. In total Poland, Slovakia and Romania sent more than 200 firefighters and 65 vehicles. An ERCC Liaison Officer is supporting coordination efforts.In addition, Israel is also supporting with 2 air tractors in response to Greece’s bilateral request.The Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping (EMSR672, EMSR673, EMSR674, EMSR675) has been activated.

title: Papua New Guinea - Volcanic activity (ECHO 20 Jul 2023)
description: Since the evening of 7 July, Mount Bagana located in the centre of the island of Bougainville, eastern Papua New Guinea, is experiencing several eruptions, causing a significant amount of ash emission and lava flow.According to the Autonomous Bougainville Government, the communities living in Torokina and Wakunai Towns area have been asked to evacuate following a huge amount of recorded ashfall that has also contaminated most of the water sources and crops, particularly in the Wakunai area. media reported more than 8,000 people are displaced.National authorities are providing help for the affected people with food, water and shelter supplies.The alert level of the volcano is at stage 3 of a four-tier scale.

title: India, Pakistan - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 20 Jul 2023)
description: The number of casualties and of the evacuated people is increasing following the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several parts of India and Pakistan.In India, only during the last 24 hours, the National Emergency Response Centre (NDMI) reports as of 19 July, four fatalities and over 5,000 evacuated people and 589 damaged houses across 13 States. Since April, NDMI reports 747 fatalities, 23 missing persons, 614 injured people and more than 51,600 damaged houses throughout the Country. Additionally, 8 people in Jammu and Kashmir and 10 people in Maharashtra are reported to have died since yesterday due to landslides.In Pakistan, the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) reports, as of 18 July, 99 fatalities, 175 injured people and 130 damaged houses across the Country since 25 June. Media also report, as of 19 July, 11 more fatalities occurred in the area of Islamabad, due to a house collapsing caused by the heavy rainfall.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is still forecast over central, western and northern India and over central and northern Pakistan.

title: Niger - Floods (ECHO 20 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Niger, in particular Maradi, Tahoua and Tillabéri Regions, since early July, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.UN OCHA report, as of 19 July, seven fatalities, more than 660 collapsed houses and a total of nearly 5,700 affected people across the three aforementioned regions.Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the far south-western Niger, including the already affected Tillabéri Region.

title: Greece - Wildfires, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2023)
description: According to the Greek Civil Protection, in the past 24 hours, 47 fires have affected the country resulting in evacuations and widespread damage.There are two main wildfires, one in north-eastern Peloponnese, the Kallithea wildfire with 928 ha of burnt area, and another one, the Dervenochoria wildfire, in western Attica with 6,056 ha of burnt area as of 18 July. The Greek Civil Protection and media report evacuations and widespread damage due to the Dervenochoria wildfire while almost 1,200 people have been evacuated following the Kallithea wildfire.On 18 July, Greece sent a request for UCPM support, which has been responded to by 5 Member States as well as the rescEU reserve.France and Italy sent 2 Canadairs each, respectively from the European Civil Protection Pool and from rescEU. Poland, Slovakia and Romania have also sent ground forest firefighting modules with vehicles.The Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping (EMSR672, EMSR673, EMSR674) has been activated.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from high to extreme across the affected areas.

title: Colombia - Landslide (ECHO 19 Jul 2023)
description: A landslide event was triggered by heavy rainfall on 18 July in the Municipality of Quetame, Cundinamarca Department (central Colombia) and resulted in casualties and damage.As of 19 July, media reports that 15 people died, more than 12 people are still missing and six have been injured. In addition, 20 homes have been destroyed and a major highway has been blocked.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over most of the country with locally very heavy rainfall in the north-western Colombia.

title: El Salvador - Earthquake (ECHO 19 Jul 2023)
description: An earthquake of 6.5M at a depth of 70 km occurred offshore in the Pacific Ocean, very close to the western coast of El Salvador on 19 July at 00:22 UTC (18 July at 18:22 local time). The epicentre was located 43 km south of Intipucá  (La Unión Department).USGS PAGER estimated that up to 446,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and more than 1,500,000 to moderate shaking among El Salvador, Nicaragua and Honduras.According to media, as of 19 July, there are no initial reports of casualties or damage and no tsunami warning was triggered.

title: Canada - Wildfires, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2023)
description: Wildfires continue to affect Canada, particularly the Province of British Columbia (western Canada), resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least two people died and 391 wildfires are currently active across the Province with over half of them out of control.In addition, almost 10 million ha have burned across the whole country with nearly 900 fires that are burning, including 590 out of control.The Government of Canada issued a special air quality statement for most of British Columbia due to the widespread smoke caused by the fires.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is expected to be from moderate to high over eastern Canada, including southern Quebec, and from moderate to high across parts of western Canada.

title: China, Philippines, Vietnam, Laos - Tropical cyclone TALIM, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone TALIM made landfall on 17 July over the southern Guangdong Province area (south-eastern China) and crossed north-western Vietnam on 18 July, resulting in displacement and damage.According to media reports, at least 230,000 people have been displaced in China while in Vietnam, 30,000 people have been preventively evacuated from the areas forecast to be hardest hit in Quang Ninh and Hai Phong Provinces (north-eastern Vietnam). Moreover, the passage of TALIM over northern Luzon on 13-14 July resulted in almost 10,400 displaced people and more than 95,000 affected.On 19-20 July hours moderate to very heavy rainfall is expected over south-eastern China, most of northern Vietnam and north-eastern Laos. Moderate rain is forecast over most of Luzon (Philippines).

title: USA - Flash floods (ECHO 18 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rain has been affecting eastern United States (particularly Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York, Vermont and New Hampshire States) over the past few days, triggering flash floods and floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 17 July, seven people died and ten people were rescued in Upper Makefield Township (Bucks County, Pennsylvania).Over the next 48 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over the eastern United States, in particular over the States of New York and Pennsylvania.

title: Indonesia, Malaysia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 18 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia (in particular Sumatra Island) and neighbouring Peninsular Malaysia (particularly the southern States of Melaka and Johor) since 13 July, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.In Indonesia, the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 18 July, three fatalities across the West Sumatra Province, of which one in Padang Pariaman Regency, one in Agam Regency and one more in Pesisir Selatan Regency. In addition, ADINet reports two missing persons, 370 displaced people, a total of nearly 24,000 affected people and over 5,600 affected houses by floods and landslides.In Malaysia,  approximately 65 people resulted displaced across the Tangkak District (Johor State) and the nearby Jasin District (Melaka State).Over the next 48 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the whole Peninsular Malaysia and most of the Sumatra Island.

title: Vietnam - Severe weather (ECHO 18 Jul 2023)
description: On 13 July, heavy rainfall with thunderstorms and strong winds affected Hong Thai, Phan Thanh, and Luong In Son Communes (Bình Thuan Province) in south-eastern Vietnam, resulting in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) one person died and another one have been injured in Thai Hiep Village (Hong Thai Commune). In addition, 43 buildings have been damaged in Hong Thai, Tam Thanhas and in Cho Moi district (An Giang province).Over the next 24 hours, more rain is expected over southeast Vietnam.

title: China, Philippines, Vietnam - Tropical cyclone TALIM, update (ECHO 18 Jul 2023)
description: The Tropical Cyclone named TALIM continued moving north-west over the western South China Sea and made landfall over the Zhanjiang City area (southern Guagdong Province) on 17 July early in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 120 km/h. On 18 July at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located inland approximately 15 km east of the Qinzhou City (southern Guangxi Province), with maximum sustained winds of 111 km/h (tropical storm).The early passage og TALIM (as a tropical depression) on 13-14 July over norther Luzon Island (northern Philippines) caused heavy rainfall tha resulted in approximately 1,800 displaced people across the area.TALIM is forecast to continue northwestward over the southern and western Guangxi Province and over the far north-eastern Vietnam on 18-19 July, further weakening and dissipating.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the Hainan Island, Guagdong and Guangxi Provinces and northern Vietnam.

title: India - Flood updates  (ECHO 18 Jul 2023)
description: India's northern states were devastated by constant rain, which led to extensive flooding and landslides. Rivers spilling above the danger mark have caused considerable infrastructure and property damage in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana and Delhi, which have been the worst hit states.Over 208 people have lost their lives, 621 houses are completely damaged and over 4,200 houses were partially damaged with damage centered in Himachal.Search and rescue operations are still underway by the National Disaster response Force including relief work by state government. Central Government released the second instalment of the State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) amounting to INR 180,40 crore (around EUR 20 Million) to the Himachal state. The Delhi Government announced INR 10,000 (Around EUR 111.5) for the flood affected families.Assam recorded 111,258 people affected by floods in 17 districts with one human life lost. River Brahmaputra and Disang continue to flow above danger level. The situation may worsen in coming days.

title: South Korea - Floods and landslides update  (ECHO 18 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting South Korea since 9 July, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage. As of 18 July, media reports indicate 49 deaths, with the highest number of 19 people dead in North Chungcheong Province.About 6,200 households (10,500 individuals) have been evacuated from the affected areas. Initial estimation indicates damage to 628 public facilities and 317 other private properties, with 146 roads washed away by floods.The country’s military is engaged in the relief, rescue, and recovery operations. Korean Red Cross (KNRC) has launched emergency response for the floods and landslides.The weather agency forecast heavy rains (up to 200 mm) in Chungcheong and the southern region today.

title: Greece - Wildfire (ECHO 18 Jul 2023)
description: A huge wildfire has been burning across the area of the Neo Kouvaras village (central East Attica Region, central Greece). The wildfire started on 17 July in the afternoon and is currently not fully contained. According to the JRC's European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the burnt area is of at least 3,500 hectares.The Greek Civil Protection authorities report, as of 18 July, a total of 120 evacuted people across the area of Neo Kouvaras.On 18 July, Greece requested two aerial firefighting modules through the UCPM. The ERCC invited France to mobilise one European Civil Protection Pool module (two Canadairs) and Italy to mobilise one rescEU module (two Canadairs). The teams and the aircraft are planned to arrive this evening in Greece.One Ground Forest Fire Fighting teams from Romania pre-positioned in the Attica region as part of the UCPM fire season preparedness plan is also supporting operations.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 17 July to provide damage assessment.Over the next 48 hours, according to JRC EFFIS, the fire danger forecast is expected to be from very high to very extreme across the East Attica Region.

title: Spain - Wildfire (ECHO 17 Jul 2023)
description: A huge wildfire has been burning across north-western La Palma Island, the north-westernmost island of the Canary Islands, Spain. The wildfires started on 15 July around 1:00 UTC and currently it is affecting Puntagorda, Tijarafe and Garafía Municipalities.According to the National Civil Defense (DSN), as of 17 July, the burnt area is approximately of 4,000 hectares and the wildfire is currently not fully contained.As of 16 July, a total of 4,565 evacuted people across Puntagorda and Tijarafe Municipalities, with a number of these in evacuation centres in Tazacorte and Los Llanos Municipalities.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode (EMSR671) on 15 July to provide the damage assessment and two maps of the affected area were produced so far.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is expected to be moderate to high over most of La Palma Island.

title: USA - Earthquake (ECHO 17 Jul 2023)
description: A strong earthquake of 7.2M at a depth of 32.5 km occurred offshore of South Alaska Peninsula on 16 July at 06:48 UTC (15 July at 19:48 local time). The epicentre was located 99 km south of Sand Point (Popof Island, Aleutian Islands).USGS PAGER estimated that up to 2,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and 1,000 to moderate shaking.A tsunami warning was issued immediately after the earthquake but the National Tsunami Warning Center downgraded it to advisory level and finally cancelled. A very small tsunami of about 15 cm was observed in King Cove and Sand Point (Aleutians East Borough, Alaska) at 8:18 UTC.As of 16 July, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reported that there were no impact on people.

title: India - Flooding  (ECHO 17 Jul 2023)
description: The northeastern state of Assam is facing a second wave of floods as the Brahmaputra river’s water level increased and is flowing above danger levels due to release of water from Bhutan. Around 98,800 people have been affected in 371 villages of 13 districts according to the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA). Parts of the Kaziranga National Park and Tiger reserve has been submerged since last two days.At least 62 people lost their lives in rain-related incidents in Punjab and Haryana during the recent spell of torrential downpour that battered parts of northern India as the relief and rescue work continued in these states.The Indian Meteorological Department issued flash flood warning in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, coastal Karnataka and Goa for next 24 hours with heavy to very heavy rainfall in parts of Himachal, Uttarakhand, East Rajasthan, East MP, Konkan and Goa.

title: China - Tropical cyclone TALIM (ECHO 17 Jul 2023)
description: A new tropical cyclone named TALIM formed over the northern South China Sea on 14 July and started moving north-west toward northern Hainan Island and southern Guagdong Province (southern China). On 17 July at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea approximately 290 km east of Haikou City (northern Hainan) and 300 km south-east of the Zhanjiang City area (southern Guagdong), with maximum sustained winds of 130 km/h.TALIM is forecast to continue northwestward over the South China Sea, slightly weakening. On the forecast track, it is expected to make landfall just south of the Zhanjiang City area on 17 July in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 120 km/h. Afterthat it will pass over southern Guangxi on 18 July, as a tropical storm.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the Hainan Island and Guagdong and Guangxi Provinces.

title: South Korea - Floods and landslides (ECHO 17 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting South Korea since 9 July, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.As of 17 July, media report that 40 people have died, of whom 13 in North Chungcheong Province, four in South Chungcheong Province and one in Sejong City. Eight people are still missing in North Gyeongsang Province, one person is missing in Busan, and 34 are injured.About 6,200 households (10,500 individuals) have been evacuated from the affected areas. The extensive damage to rail, roads, power, and communication networks have affected the emergency response. The country’s military is engaged in the rescue and recovery operation.According to the Korea Meteorological Administration more heavy rain is forecast over the next 24 hours with locally very heavy rainfall on 19 July, particularly over central and southern South Korea.

title: Floods and flood warnings during the last 24 hours reported by national services (ECHO 14 Jul 2023)
description: Romania:warning levels 2/3 for Viseu, Iza and Somesul Mare river basins.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 14 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, heavy hailstorms, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting north-eastern Italy (in particular Veneto, Friuli-Venezia Giulia and eastern Lombardy Regions and the Trento Province) over the last 36 hours, causing several severe weather-related incident (particularly due to strong winds and hailstorms) and some landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Across the Friuli-Venezia Giulia Region, media reports as of 14 July, one fatality in the Cervignano Municipality (Udine Province) due to a heavy rainfall-related incident, and 40 evacuated people in the Torviscosa Municipality (Udine Province). Several damaged houses were also reported throughout the Region.In Veneto Region, a number of houses have been damaged in Vicenza, Treviso and Venezia Provinces, while some damaged houses and blocked roads (mainly due to localised landslides) were reported across the Trento Province. In Lombardy region, two injuries have been reported due to lightning in Colico (Lecco province).Over the next 48 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over north-eastern Italy.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 14 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and heavy hailstorms have been affecting the southernmost States of Brazil, particularly the Rio Grande do Sul and the neighbouring Santa Catarina State, over the last 48 hours, causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents, in particular due to strong winds and hailstorms, that have resulted in population displacement and severe damage.In the Rio Grande do Sul State, media report as of 14 July an uncertain number of displaced people, mainly in Greater Porto Alegre area, the capital of the State, thousands of damaged buildings including a number of schools, three damaged bridges and up to 2 millions power outages due to severe weather-related incidents. In addition, an unconfirmed number of people were affected by floods across the Santa Catarina State.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over both the already affected States of Rio Grande do Sul and Santa Catarina.

title: Guatemala - Severe weather, update (ECHO 14 Jul 2023)
description: Since the beginning of the rainy season in May 2023, heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting most of Guatemala, causing floods, landslides and a number of severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.As of 13 July, according to the the National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED), 15 people died (across eight Departments), four have been injured, 2,248 people have been evacuated and almost 801,000 people affected.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over central, southern and south-western Guatemala.

title: India - Delhi Flood Situation (ECHO 14 Jul 2023)
description: Delhi has seen unprecedented flooding in its Northeast, East, and North districts due to the continuous rise in the Yamuna River since 12 July, which has flowed above the highest flood level. On 14 July, the water level has slightly lowered, but is still flowing above the high flood level.25% of the city’s water supply is impacted due to the closure of three major water treatment plants. Flooding at the interstate bus terminal disrupts public transportation to and from other states.About 23,600 people have been relocated to safer locations in Delhi. People have also moved to upper floors with concerns for their supplies of food, clean drinking water and other essential items. Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) is providing relief support to people evacuated in relief camps.Non-essential government offices, schools, and colleges are closed until 16 July, people are advised to work from home.Yellow alert with moderate rain is predicted for 15 July.

title: India, Pakistan - Monsoon, update (ECHO 14 Jul 2023)
description: The number of casualties is increasing following the monsoon rainfall that has been affecting several parts of India and Pakistan.In India, in the past 24 hours, 13 people died (five in Haryana, four in Punjab, two in Madhya Pradesh, one in Assam and another in Himachal Pradesh) while 11,543 people have been evacuated and 126,305 affected (most of them in Assam and Uttar Pradesh). Since April, a total of 600 people died in floods, landslides and severe weather-related incidents.In Pakistan, since 25 June, a total of 91 people died, (most of them due to severe weather-related incidents and landslides), 167 have been injured and 101 houses have been damaged.For the next 48 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across the northern, western, central, eastern and north-eastern States of India and over the central and northern Provinces of Pakistan.Red warnings for heavy rain and thunderstorms are in effect for parts of West Bengal and Sikkim (northern India) while warnings for floods and landslides have been issued for the northern and northern-central Provinces of Pakistan.

title: Mongolia - Floods (ECHO 14 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rain continues to affect Mongolia since 3 July 2023. The situation was exacerbated by the collapse of the Selbe River Dam, increasing the flooding in Ulaanbaatar. According to IFRC, 128,000 people from 31,600 households have been affected, while media reports indicate that more than 20,000 people are now in safe shelters.The government declared a ‘high alert’ in Ulaanbaatar on 5 July as rains are forecasted to continue until 15 July 2023. In addition, media quoted the government experts that it is heaviest in the last 50 years.Mongolia is increasingly facing climate change-related risks. Most vulnerable to these changes are traditional settlements, known as 'ger districts', often established on lowlands and mountain slopes, prone to flooding and mudslides.

title: Brazil - Severe weather, update (ECHO 13 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continued to affect north-eastern Brazil, in particular the Pernambuco State and the neighbouring Alagoas State, over the last week, triggering landslides, causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in an increased number of fatalities and widespread damage.In the Alagoas State, media report as of 13 July one fatality in the Joaquim Gomes Town, while the total number of displaced people remains at approximately 24,000 across 37 municipalities throughout the State.In the Pernambuco State, 14 fatalities and three rescued people were reported in the Recife Capital City due to a building collapse, partially caused by the heavy rainfall. Around 3,000 people have been displaced across 25 municipalities of the State.Over the next 24 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over north-eastern Brazil.

title: China - Flood  (ECHO 13 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and consequent flooding since 10 July have forced thousands of people to evacuate in China’s southwestern province of Sichuan.According to state media, more than 120,000 people have been affected, and over 40,000 people are displaced. Nine people have also been reported missing due to floods and landslides.The State Flood Control and Drought Relief Authority of China has declared a level-IV emergency in four provinces: Jiangsu, Shandong, Sichuan, and Gansu, where weather experts forecast heavy falls between 12-14 July. As a result, flood response forces and resources have been deployed to respond to and mitigate the crisis.

title: Japan - Severe weather, update (ECHO 13 Jul 2023)
description: The number of casualties has increased following heavy rainfall, floods and landslides in south-western Honshu and northern Kyushu Islands since early July.According to the Fire and Disaster Management Agency (FDMA), as of 13 July, ten people died (of whom five in Fukuoka, two in Saga, one in Yamaguchi, one in Shimane and one in Oita), three others are still missing and 27 persons have been injured. In addition, a total of 396,800 people are still under evacuation orders across the Prefectures of Toyama, Ishikawa, Fukui, Fukuoka, Saga and Oita, and more than 1,400 buildings have been damaged.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over northern Kyushu.

title: Russia - Floods (ECHO 13 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-western Russia, in particular the Krasnodar Krai Region, since 9 July, causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 13 July, four missing people, approximately 240 evacuated people (a number of these across some temporary accomodation centres) and around 200 damaged houses throughout the aforementioned Region, where Sochi and Adlersky Cities were the most affected. In addition, several destroyed bridges and damaged roads were reported across the Region.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is still forecast over the the Krasnodar Krai Region.

title: Türkiye - Floods (ECHO 13 Jul 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting the Black Sea region, northern Türkiye, since 9 July, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency (AFAD) and media, as of 12 July, three fatalities are confirmed, of whom one in Zonguldak Province and another in the Ordu Province. Almost 70 people have been evacuated and hundreds have been displaced. In addition, media report that more than 1,000 landslides occurred in Sakarya, Düzce, Bolu, Zonguldak, Bartin, Karabük, Kastamonu, Ordu, Giresun and Samsun Provinces.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the Black Sea region.

title: Pakistan - Floods, update (ECHO 13 Jul 2023)
description: NDMA issued a warning on 11 July about the possibility of medium to high level flooding in the Sutlej River near village Ganda Singhwala, Kasur district of Punjab.  The rising water levels are expected to result in flood in Ganda Singhwala area within the next 24 to 48 hours that caused panic among villagers.  The district administration has evacuated about 900 villagers who are sheltered in government schools in Sahjra and Sheikhpura Nau in district Kasur.The meteorological department predicted intense monsoon rains from 13-17 July, in the different parts of the Country including Azad Jammu Kashmir and Punjab (12-17 July); Gilgit-Baltistan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, and Punjab (13-17 July); and Baloshistan, Sindh and Punjab (14-16 July).

title: Chile - Floods, update (ECHO 30 Jun 2023)
description: According to the National Disaster Prevention and Response Service (SENAPRED), as of 27 June, the number of affected people reached almost 19,500 people following the recent floods in central-southern Chile.Moreover, two people died, two remain missing, and more than 5,500 houses have been damaged or destroyed.For the next 24 hours, cloudy skies and moderate rain are forecast over southern Chile.

title: Pakistan - Severe weather (ECHO 29 Jun 2023)
description: Pre-monsoon rain has been affecting most of Pakistan in the recent days, causing flash floods, and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in causalties and damage. The worst affected Provinces are Balochistan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, and Punjab.According to the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), a total of 21 people died, of whom 15 in Punjab, four in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and two in Balochistan. In addition, 38 people have been injured, and eight houses have been damaged.On 29-30 June,  moderate rain with thunderstorms and strong winds are expected at isolated places in upper Punjab, Islamabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Gilgit-Baltistan and Kashmir. Heavy rainfall is also forecast at isolated places in east Punjab, Potohar region and upper Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

title: Iran - Dust storm (ECHO 29 Jun 2023)
description: Very strong winds have been affecting south-eastern Iran, in particular the Sistan and Baluchestan Province, over the last week, causing a severe dust storm that has resulted in casualties.Media report, as of 29 June, more than 1,050 injured and hospitalised persons across five cities of the Sistan and Baluchestan Province (Zabol, Zahak, Hamoun, Hirmand and Nimrouz).On 29 and 30 June, according to the Iran Meteorological Organization (IRIMO), strong winds are still forecast over south-eastern Iran.

title: South Africa - Severe weather (ECHO 29 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong wind have been affecting eastern South Africa, in particular the KwaZulu-Natal Province, since 27 June, causing floods and some severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 29 june, three fatalities, of which one in the Durban City area (coastal KwaZulu-Natal Province) due to the strong wind and two more in Pinetown, approximately 15 km north-west of Durban City, due to floods. In addition, one person was rescued across the Durban area.Over the next 48 hours, drier conditions are forecast over the KwaZulu-Natal Province.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 28 Jun 2023)
description: Since 27 June, two wildfires have been burning in the Counties of San Bernardino and Riverside in southern California State, leading to damage and evacuations. The wildfire in San Bernardino County (Nice Fire) has an extension of about 40 ha while the fire in Riverside County (Juniper Fire) is 22 ha wide.According to media reports, people living in almost 90 houses have been ordered to evacuate following the Juniper Fire in Riverside County.Firefighter operations are ongoing, and the Nice Fire is 10% contained while the Juniper Fire is 5% contained.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is expected to be from high to extreme over the two affected counties.

title: China - Landslides (ECHO 28 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-western China, particularly the Sichuan Province over the past 24 hours, triggering landslides and mudslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 28 June, four fatalities, three persons missing and approximately 900 evacuated people in the Wenchuan County in central-northern Sichuan Province due to some landslides occurred on 27 June across the Miansi Municipality and the Weizhou Municipality.Over the next 24 hours, according to the China Meteorological Administration (CMA), more heavy rainfall is forecast over northern Sichuan Province.China is witnessing unusual weather patterns, including heavy rainfall in the south and record-breaking temperatures in the north, including Beijing.

title: Philippines - Floods (ECHO 28 Jun 2023)
description: Widespread floods caused by heavy rainfall affected three cities in south-central Mindanao Island over the past few days, resulting in evacuations.According to media reports, more than 92,300 people have been evacuated in the cities of Kabacan and Pikit in Cotabato Province and in the City of Glan in Sarangani Province in Soccsksargen Region.For the next 24 hours, the weather conditions are forecast to be partly cloudy to cloudy with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms.

title: Romania - Floods (ECHO 27 Jun 2023)
description: On 25 June, heavy rainfall hit Arad County in western Romania, causing floods and flash floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, a person died following a flash flood event in the Buceava Soimus commune area in eastern Arad County, while a dozen families have been evacuated, 60 houses have been damaged as well as 3 km of roads.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over the affected county.

title: Chile - Floods, updates (ECHO 27 Jun 2023)
description: As of 26 June, according to the National Disaster Prevention and Response Service (SENAPRED), a total of two people died, four are missing due to the recent floods in central-southern Chile. More than 13,000 have been affacted,  with over 12,000 isolated people and approximately 1,609 resulted sheltered. In addition, a total of 2580 homes have been damaged, and more than 1 400 houses have been destroyed.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected.

title: Philippines - Volcanic unrest, update (ECHO 27 Jun 2023)
description: In the past 24 hours, explosive and effusive activity is ongoing. Lava flows of 1,600 and 1,200 meters in length have been registered in the southern and south-eastern gullies of the volcano as well as more than 100 volcanic earthquakes and an ash plume 750 metres high.Following this unrest phase of the volcano, the National Disaster Risk Reduction Management Council (NDRRMC) reports more than 20,100 displaced people, of whom 18,706 evacuated in 28 evacuation centres, and almost 41,500 affected people across 26 Barangays in Albay Province.The alert level of the volcano stands at 3 which means that the volcano is currently in a relatively high level of unrest as magma is at the crater and hazardous eruption is possible within weeks or even days.

title: Lesser Antilles, The Caribbean - Tropical storm BRET, update (ECHO 27 Jun 2023)
description: Cyclone BRET crossed Barbados, St. Lucia, Martinique, Dominica and St. Vincent and the Grenadine on 22-23 June bringing heavy rains, flooding, strong gusts and storm surge.According to UN OCHA, as of 26 June, 179 people are still sheltered in Barbados (29 people) and in St. Vincent and the Grenadines (150 people). There are no reports of damage in Dominica.Over the next 72 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over all the Lesser Antilles, Puerto Rico and the Hispaniola Island, with locally very heavy rainfall over this latter island.

title: Mexico - Floods (ECHO 27 Jun 2023)
description: On 23-24 June, heavy rainfall affected Chiapas State (southern Mexico), causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage. The most affected area was Tuxtla Gutiérrez City, the capital of the State.According to media reports, at least one person died in the Libramiento Norte area of Tuxtla Gutiérrez City while another one is missing, and the search activities are concentrated in locations along the Sabinal River. In addition, 15 people have been rescued and roads have been flooded across the capital of the State.On 27-28 June, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across the affected state.

title: India - Flash flood in Himachal Pradesh (ECHO 27 Jun 2023)
description: A landslide triggered by a heavy downpour in the Mandi district in State Himachal Pradesh trapped more than 200 tourists on National Highway 21, and a cloudburst-caused flash flood hit the districts Solan and Hamirpur at the same time in Himachal Pradesh.The State Emergency Operation Centre reported around 6 casualties and 11 houses that were damaged in various locations. Several vehicles and cattle being washed away in flash flood. Damages are estimated at INR 270 million (approximately EUR 3 million). The concerned state authorities are working on restoration operations.Red and Orange alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall and flood warning has been issued by the Indian Meteorological Department for State Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, West Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, East Rajasthan, Goa and Karnataka.

title: Kosovo - Flash floods (ECHO 26 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Kosovo, in particular the Rugova Region since 24 June, causing floods and flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 26 June, two fatalities and two injured persons across the Peja/Pec City in eastern Rugova Region, due to flash floods.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over most of Kosovo.

title: Chile - Floods (ECHO 26 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting  central-southern Chile, particularly Valparaíso, Santiago Metropolitan, O’Higgins, Maule, Ñuble, Biobío and Araucanía Regions since 23 June, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the National Disaster Prevention and Response Service (SENAPRED), as of 25 June, two people died, six are missing,  4,077 are affected and 9,814 resulted isolated. Furthermore, more than 50 houses have been destroyed and hundreds were affected by major damage.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast over the already affected area.

title: Ghana - Floods (ECHO 26 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Ghana, in particular Western, Ashanti and Greater Accra Regions since 21 June, causing floods and rivers overflow that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 26 June, eight fatalities, of which four in the Ashanti Region, three across the Western Region and one more in the Greater Accra Region. In addition, media report more than 50 damaged houses, a number of isolated Municipalities and several blocked roads throughout the three aforementioned regions.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country, except over southern regions.

title: Philippines - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting northern Philippines, in particular the Central Luzon Region over the period from 22 to 23 June, causing some strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) and media report, as of 26 June, one injured person and 32 damaged buildings across the Pampanga Province in southern Central Luzon due to the strong wind.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over most of the Country, including the Central Luzon Region.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting northern Indonesia, in particular the Riau Islands, between Sumatra, the Malay Peninsula and the Borneo Island since 24 June, causing a number of strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 26 June, seven injured persons, 83 damaged houses and a total of more than 330 affected people across the Batam City in Riau Islands due to the strong wind.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over northern Indonesia, including the already affected area.

title: France - Severe weather, update (ECHO 23 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind, thunderstorms and lightning events continued to affect eastern and central France (in particular the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Region and the Nouvelle-Aquitaine Region, respectively) over the past 24 hours, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) and media report, as of 23 June, two fatalities, of which one in the Gaillard Town (Haute-Savoie Department, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Region) and one more in the Rebeyrotte Town (Corrèze Department, Nouvelle-Aquitaine Region), both due to lightning events. Several houses were reported flooded across the Haute-Savoie Department and up to 22,500 power outages occurred in both the aforementioned Departments.Over the next 48 hours, drier and better conditions are forecast over the already affected area.

title: Lesser Antilles, The Caribbean - Tropical storm BRET, update (ECHO 23 Jun 2023)
description: Tropical storm named BRET continued moving west toward the Windward Islands (southern Lesser Antilles) and passed over the St. Vincent and the Grenadines Islands on 23 June around 3.00 UTC, with maximum sustained winds of 93 km/h. On 23 June at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Caribbean Sea approximately 70 km west of St. Vincent and the Grenadines, with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h.On the forecast track, BRET is forecast to continue moving westward over the southern Caribbean Sea on 24-25 June, well off the coast of southern Puerto Rico and the Hispaniola Island, further weakening and dissipating.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are still forecast over the the Windward Islands. A Tropical Storm Warning issued by NOAA is still in effect over Dominica, St. Lucia, Martinique, Barbados and St. Vincent and the Grenadines.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 23 Jun 2023)
description: Severe weather, including strong winds, tornadoes, thunderstorms, and heavy hailstorms, continued to affect southern and central-western USA, in particular Texas, Nebraska, Wyoming and Colorado over the last few days, causing several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and media report, as of 23 June, four fatalities, ten injured people and 15 destroyed buildings across the Matador Town (Motley County, northern Texas) due to tornadoes. In addition, nearly 100 injured people were reported in the Morrison Municipality in Jefferson County, central-northern Colorado due to heavy hailstorms.Over the next 24 hours, strong winds, thunderstorms and rainfall are forecast over the whole Nebraska and over most of Texas, Wyoming and Colorado.

title: Philippines - Floods and landslides (ECHO 23 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern and western Mindanao Island (in particular the Northern Mindanao and the Zamboanga Peninsula Regions) since 21 June, causing floods and landslides that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 23 June, more than 1,300 evacuated people and some damaged roads across the Zamboanga del Sur Province in Zamboanga Peninsula Region and the Bukidnon Province in Northern Mindanao Region.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over most of Mindanao Island.

title: India - Floods in State Assam, update (ASDMA, IMD, Media) (ECHO 23 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rains over the past two days have worsened the ongoing flood situation in India’s Assam State.According to the latest Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) report, nearly half a million people are affected across 22 of the state’s 31 districts. On 22 June, the state recorded its first flood-related death this year. Over 14,000 people are displaced in 83 relief camps.The western Assam districts of Bajali, Nalbari, and Barpeta are the worst hit, accounting for half of the affected.The state and central disaster response teams engaged in search, rescue, and relief efforts.The flood situation is expected to deteriorate as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issues 'Orange Alert' for heavy rains in the coming days.

title: France - Severe weather, update (ECHO 22 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind, thunderstorms continued to affect south-western France (in particular the Occitanie Region) over the past 24 hours, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) and media report, as of 22 June, seven injured persons and up to 7,355 power outages across the Gers Department (Occitanie Region). In the same Department, media reports 42 evacuated people in the Condom Municipality and a number of other evacuated people in the Riscle Municipality.Over the next 12 hours, more rainfall and thunderstorms are forecast over the Occitanie Region, while no more rainfall is forecast starting from 22 June in the evening (UTC). 8 more departments from Southern-east are involved in an orange vigilance for a new stormy episode from 2:00-10:00 pm.

title: Lesser Antilles, The Caribbean - Tropical storm BRET, update (ECHO 22 Jun 2023)
description: Tropical storm named BRET continued moving west toward the Lesser Antilles, further strenghtening.
