On 22 June at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 410 km east of Barbados and approximately 560 km east of Saint Lucia (Windward Islands, southern Lesser Antilles) with maximum sustained winds of 110 km/h.On the forecast track, BRET is expected to pass between Saint Lucia and Martinique (France) on 23 June around 0.00 UTC, with maximum sustained winds up to 102 km/h. After that, it is forecast to enter in the Caribbean Sea on 23-24 June, well off the coast of southern Puerto Rico and the Hispaniola Island, further weakening.Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over most of Lesser Antilles over 22-23 June. NOAA has issued a Hurricane Watch for Saint Lucia, a Tropical Storm Warning for Martinique and Dominica and a Tropical Storm Watch for St. Vincent and the Grenadines and Barbados.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 22 Jun 2023)
description: On 21 June, storms and tornadoes hit northern Texas State in southern USA, resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least three people died, and dozens of houses and buildings have been damaged in Matador Town in Motley County, northern Texas following the event.On 22 June, isolated thunderstorms are expected in parts of Texas. Tornado wathces are in effect over the central counties of the State.

title: Philippines - Floods (ECHO 22 Jun 2023)
description: On 19 June, some municipalities of Davao del Sur Province in Davao Region, Mindanao Island, southern Philippines have been impacted by heavy rainfall that caused widespread floods and resulted in displacement.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADInet), almost 400 people have been displaced and evacuated in five evacuation centres, and three houses have been damaged as well as one road.For the next 24 hours, cloudy skies with scattered rain showers and thunderstorms are expected over most of Mindanao. Moderate to severe flooding warnings are in effect across northern, western and southern Mindanao.

title: Indonesia - Landslide (ECHO 22 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Indonesia, particularly the Java Island since 19 June, causing a landslide that has resulted in population displacements and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 22 June, nearly 70 displaced people, more than 30 damaged houses and a total of 128 affected people in the Bunijaya village in West Java Province.Over the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over western Java Island.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind, thunderstorms and heavy hailstorms have been affecting south-western France, in particular the Occitanie Region and central France, particularly the Centre-Val de Loire Region, over the last 24 hours, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) and media report, as of 21 June, three injured persons, around 25 affected people and a number of damaged houses across the Gers and the neighbouring Tarn-et-Garonne Departments,  in the Occitanie Region. In addition, media reports several damaged houses throughout the Cher Department in Centre-Val de Loire Region due to the strong wind.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall and thunderstorms are forecast over most of the Country, except over north-western Departments.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Jun 2023)
description: On 17-19 June multiple tornadoes, heavy rainfall and strong winds affected several States of the south-eastern USA, particularly the Mississippi State, that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, one person died while 18 people have been injured in Louin Town, Jasper County in eastern Mississippi. In addition, more than 20 houses have been damaged or destroyed in the aforementioned county.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across the south-eastern and eastern states of the USA.

title: Lesser Antilles, The Caribbean - Tropical storm BRET (ECHO 21 Jun 2023)
description: A new tropical storm named BRET formed over the central Atlantic Ocean on 19 June and started moving west toward the Lesser Antilles, strenghtening. On 21 June at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the Ocean approximately 1,080 km east-southeast of Saint Lucia (Windward Islands, southern Lesser Antilles) with maximum sustained winds of 85 km/h.On the forecast track, BRET is expected to continue moving west, further strenghtening, and to pass between Saint Lucia and Martinique (France) on 23 June around 0.00 UTC, with maximum sustained winds up to 102 km/h.Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over most of Lesser Antilles starting from 22 June. NOAA has issued a Tropical Storm Watch over Saint Lucia, Martinique, Dominica and the Barbados.

title: India – Floods (ECHO 21 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rains under the influence of cyclone BIPARJOY caused floods in five districts of Rajasthan, namely Barmer, Jalore, Sirohi, Pali, and Rajmasand.Seven people have been reported killed in various rain-related occurrences in affected districts; around 15,000 people have been evacuated from low-lying areas and relocated to safer places.The flood situation is expected to improve as the Indian Meteorological Office predicts less rain starting on 21 June.

title: Vietnam - Landslides (ECHO 21 Jun 2023)
description: On 17 June, six landslides triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in Bao Loc City (Lam Dong Province, southern Vietnam), resulting in casualties and damage.According to national authorities, two people died, three others have been injured, and some houses have been affected by the landslide events.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over most parts of southern Vietnam.

title: Greece - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 20 Jun 2023)
description: On 17 June, heavy rainfall and strong winds affected several parts of Greece, causing floods, severe weather-related incidents and resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, two people died, of whom one in Lefkada and another in Mount Olympos due to severe weather-related incidents. At least 30 houses have been flooded in the Polichni suburb of Thessaloniki in Central Macedonia and crops have been damaged in Western Macedonia. Severe weather conditions have been also reported in Spata in Attica Region, the Island of Skyros, and Florina Town in Western Macedonia.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected across the whole country.

title: Nepal - Landslides and floods, update (ECHO 20 Jun 2023)
description: The number of casualties is increasing across Koshi Province in eastern Nepal following widespread landslides and floods triggered by heavy rainfall.According to the Nepal Disaster Risk Reduction Portal, as of 19 June, seven people died, five due to landslides and two others after floods in Shankhuwasabha District. In addition, 29 people are still missing, six have been injured and almost 300 families have been affected across the Districts of Kaski, Nuwakot, Okhaldhunga, Panchthar, Shankhuwasabha, Taplejung, Dhankuta and Ilam.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across most parts of the country, particularly over the eastern areas.

title: Papua New Guinea - Earthquake (ECHO 20 Jun 2023)
description: On 19 June at 11:18 UTC (21:18 local time) an earthquake of 5.9 M at a depth of 21 km occurred in East Sepik Province in northern Papua New Guinea.The epicentre was located approximately 99 km east-southeast of Angoram Town.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 10,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 63,000 to strong.According to media, as of 19 of June, there are no immediate reports of any casualties or damage.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind and thunderstorms have been affecting southern, western and central France (in particular the Hautes-Pyrénées, Calvados, Eure, Orne, Sarthe and Seine-Maritime Departments) over the last 36 hours, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) and media report, as of 19 June, two injured persons in the Lourdes Municipality (Hautes-Pyrénées Department, southern France) due to a strong wind-related incident. COGIC also reports five rescued people and dozens damaged houses across the Seine-Maritime Department (northern France).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall, strong wind and thunderstorms are forecast over western and south-western France.

title: Brazil - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Jun 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong wind affected southern Brazil, particularly the Rio Grande do Sul State, the southernmost State of the Country and its Capital Porto Alegre over the past few days, causing floods, landslides and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 19 June, 13 fatalities, four persons missing, around 700 evacuated people and more than 3,700 damaged houses across a number of municipalities of the State, where the worst affected area is the Greater Porto Alegre area and the nearby Caraa City.Over the next 24 hours, no more rainfall is forecast over the whole Rio Grande do Sul State.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Jun 2023)
description: Severe weather, including strong winds, tornadoes, thunderstorms, lightning events and heavy hailstorms, have been affecting south-eastern USA, in particular the Lower Mississippi Valley and the Southeast Region over the last 24 hours, causing several severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The most affected States are Texas, Alabama, Georgia, Mississippi and Florida. A total of ten tornadoes, of which five in Georgia, three in Texas and two in Alabama, were recorded by NOAA over the aforementioned period.Media report, as of 16 June, three fatalities in the Perryton Town in northern Texas. According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), dozens of people were injured and a number of houses were damaged across the three States affected by tornadoes. In addition, FEMA reports nearly 110,000 power outages throughout all the affected States.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms are forecast over parts of Lower Mississippi Valley. NOAA has issued a severe thunderstorm warning over north-eastern Texas.

title: Philippines - Severe weather and flash floods (ECHO 16 Jun 2023)
description: On 13-15 June, heavy rainfall and strong winds affected parts of Mindanao Island, causing flash floods, and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in evacuations and damage.According to national authorities, 286 people have been displaced (92 evacuated), almost 6,000 people have been affected and 19 houses have been damaged in South Cotabato and Sultan Kudarat Provinces of Soccsksargen Region following flash flood events. In addition, almost 460 people have been affected and four houses were damaged in Davao City (Davao del Sur Province, Davao Region) due to strong winds.For the next 24 hours, cloudy skies with scattered rain showers and thunderstorms are expected over the affected areas and the whole Mindanao where moderate to severe flood advisories are in effect.

title: India, Pakistan - Tropical cyclone BIPARJOY, update (ECHO 16 Jun 2023)
description: The intensity of the cyclone BIPARJOY has been reduced from 'very severe' category to 'severe' after the storm made landfall near Jakhau port, Gujarat, around 1.30 p.m. UTC on 15 June with maximum sustained winds of 102 km/h (tropical storm). The system is expected to weaken further into a cyclonic storm and then a deep depression as it moves to northern Gujarat and southern Rajasthan during the day.In India, the initial reports estimate two deaths and 22 injuries due to the cyclone. Road, telecommunication, and electricity supply systems are badly interrupted in Gujarat. In Pakistan, one person died and several were injured.More than 180,000 people were evacuated across both countries. Among these, UN OCHA report 81,000 evacuated people in 64 relief camps in Sindh Province (Pakistan).Access to food, water, and hygiene items remains limited in many relief camps in India.In Pakistan, DG ECHO partners are responding to the urgent needs in relief camps. Needs are expected to evolve as access to remote villages is restored.

title: Guatemala - Severe weather (ECHO 15 Jun 2023)
description: Since the start of the rainy season (from May 2023), more than 165,000 people have been affected across the country as reported by The National Coordination for Disaster Reduction (CONRED).In addition, according to CONRED, eight people died, three have been injured, almost 1,000 evacuated, and more than 400 houses damaged.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected across southern Guatemala.

title: Philippines - Volcanic unrest, update (ECHO 15 Jun 2023)
description: The state of unrest of the Mayon volcano in the central Philippines is still ongoing. In the past 24 hours, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) recorded two volcanic earthquakes, a very slow effusion of lava from the summit of the crater and steam-laden plumes that rose 700 m.According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction Management Council (NDRRMC), almost 18,000 have been displaced (17,216 evacuated in 25 evacuation centres), and 37,682 people have been affected across 26 Barangays of the Albay Province in Bicol Region.The alert level of the volcano stands at 3 which means that the volcano is currently in a relatively high level of unrest as magma is at the crater and hazardous eruption is possible within weeks or even days.

title: Pakistan - Severe weather, update (ECHO 15 Jun 2023)
description: The humanitarian impact increased following the heavy rainfall and strong winds that affected several Dostricts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Punjab Provinces in north-western Pakistan since 10 June.According to UN OCHA, at least 33 people died, 150 others have been injured, and 160 houses damaged after severe weather-related incidents.On 15-16 June, light to moderate rain is forecast over the affected provinces.

title: India, Pakistan - Tropical Cyclone BIPARJOY, update (ECHO 15 Jun 2023)
description: The Very Severe Cyclonic Storm (VSCS) BIPARJOY is set to make landfall near the Jakhau port in Gujarat's Kutch district late evening of 15 June, with winds up to 150 km/h, according to the Indian Meteorological Department. Landfall is forecast to bring the region a triple threat of heavy rain, strong winds, and coastal storm surges.So far, six people have died and around 75,000 people have been relocated to 193 temporary relief camps in Gujarat , India. In Pakistan, 81,925 people are sheltered in 75 relief camps in six districts of Sindh Province.In India, 27 national and state Disaster Response teams and over 400 road and communication restoration teams have been stationed in different coastal districts in Gujarat. In Pakistan, the provincial Disaster Management Authority Sindh has dispatched relief and rescue items and human resources to vulnerable districts.National Red Cross Societies in both India and Pakistan have activated 24/7 emergency operation rooms and dispatched Non Food Items (NFIs) with trained staff to field.DG ECHO partners have started relief activities in camps. WHO has activated the Incident Management System (IMS) and has augmented supplies and mobile health teams in Thatta and Karachi.

title: Cuba - Floods, update (ECHO 14 Jun 2023)
description: The number of casualties and the amount of damage is increasing following heavy rainfall and widespread floods that have been affecting central and eastern Cuba over the past few days.According to media, at least six people died (of whom four in the eastern Provinces of Granma, Las Tunas and Santiago de Cuba, and two others in central Camaguey Province) and more than 18,500 people have been affected across the country. Bridges, roads and sanitation systems were damaged as well as thousands of homes. Furthermore, thousands of hectares of crops were destroyed.For the next 24, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across the eastern and central-eastern Provinces.

title: India, Pakistan - Tropical cyclone BIPARJOY, update (ECHO 14 Jun 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone BIPARJOY is moving northeastward over the northern Arabian Sea, with maximum sustained winds of 155 kmph. BIPARJOY is expected to make landfall over an area between Mandvi Town (Gujarat, India) and Karachi City (Pakistan) by the evening of 15th June as a very severe cyclonic storm with maximum sustained wind speed of 125-135 kmph gusting to 150 kmph.The BIPARJOY is likely to affect 1.67 million people across eight coastal districts in Gujarat (India) and 15 districts in Sindh province, Pakistan.Over 37,000 people living in vulnerable areas in India and 60,000 in Pakistan have been evacuated and sheltered in ca. 200 and 61 temporary relief camps, respectively.The local authorities and humanitarian agencies in both countries have activated their crisis response mechanisms, including mobilisation of relief and rescue teams, stockpiling of essential items, management of relief camps.In India, the state level Inter Agency Group (IAG) has initiated its emergency response coordination mechanism on 12 June. UN OCHA in Pakistan has mapped aid stocks in Sindh and Baluchistan and confirmed that sufficient stocks are available in the country, except for a few items.

title: India - Earthquake (ECHO 14 Jun 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.0 M (5.4 M as reported by the National Center of Seismology of India - SEISMO) at a depth of 10 km occurred in Doda District (north-western India, Jammu and Kashmir Union Territory) on 13 June at 8.03 UTC (13.33 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 32 km east-southeast of Doda Town.SEISMO registered four aftershocks in the area with magnitudes between 2.8 M and 4.3 M.According to media, at least five people have been injured and several buildings have been damaged across the towns of Doda, Bhaderwah and Gandoh (located in Doda District) following the seismic event. In addition, the earthquake has been felt also in neighbouring Pakistan.

title: Cuba - Floods (ECHO 13 Jun 2023)
description: Since the past week, eastern Cuba is experiencing heavy rainfall and floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to UN OCHA and media, one person died, more than 11,000 people have been evacuated and more than 10,000 houses impacted in Granma Province. Other provinces affected are Las Tunas, Santiago de Cuba and Camagüey.On 13 June, light rain is expected over eastern Cuba and on 14 June, light to moderate rain is forecast across the central-western provinces of the country.

title: India, Pakistan - Tropical cyclone BIPARJOY (ECHO 13 Jun 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone BIPARJOY is moving north over the northern Arabian Sea towards western India and neighbouring south-eastern Pakistan, with maximum sustained winds of 167 km/h (tropical cyclone). BIPARJOY will turn north-east and will make landfall over an area between Mandvi Town (Gujarat, India) and Karachi City (Pakistan) on 15 June.For the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over most of western Gujarat State and south-eastern Sindh Province. Red warnings for heavy rain, thunderstorms and strong winds are in effect over western Gujarat State. The majority of ports in Gujarat have raised the great danger signal, while railway services have activated disaster management set-ups.About 15,000 people have been evacuated from coastal areas of Kuch and Sourashtra to safer places as of morning 13 June. A total of 15 teams each of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) have been deployed in the possible affected districts.

title: Côte d’Ivoire - Landslides and floods (ECHO 13 Jun 2023)
description: Since 11 June, heavy rainfall has been affecting Abidjan City area in southern Ivory Coast causing floods and landslides.According to media, five people died in Yopougon suburb due to a landslide and several buildings were damaged. In Yopougon and Songonin suburbs, some communities are isolated while in Sikensi Town, floods damaged roads and bridges.Over the next 24 hours, heavy to moderate rainfall is still forecast over the Abidjan City area.

title: Kazakhstan - Forest fires (ECHO 13 Jun 2023)
description: Forest fires have been burning in the eastern Abai region (northeastern Kazakhstan), burning an area of approximately 60,000 ha of land and resulting in casualties and evacuations.According to media reports, at least 14 people died and more than 300 people have been evacuated across the affected region.As of 12 June, 14 helicopters, approximately 1,500 people, and more than 300 equipment units are involved in the firefighting operations.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS) the fire danger forecast is expected to be from very high to extreme across the affected area.

title: Philippines - Volcanic activity, update (ECHO 13 Jun 2023)
description: In the past 24 hours, the activity of Mayon volcano (located in Albay Province, Bicol Region, central Philippines) was characterized by very slow lava flows moving approximately 1 km from the crater, one volcanic earthquake and moderate ash emission drifting northeast as reported by the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS).The National Disaster Risk Reduction Management Council (NDRRMC) holds full-council emergency meeting in the morning of 13 June with DG ECHO partners observing. Seven (7) Local Government Units (LGUs), Tobaco, Malilipot, Daraga, Camalig, Guinobatoan, Ligao, and Santo Domingo have evacuated 14,865 individuals (4,159 families) in 22 evacuation centres as of 13 June.DG ECHO field offices and partners closely monitor the situation and coordinate with the national authorities for any need of immediate relief assistance.

title: Yemen - Floods (ECHO 13 Jun 2023)
description: Severe flooding has affected over 165,000 individuals in over 70 districts across Yemen, causing loss of life and damages to shelters, crops, and infrastructure. Displaced populations are particularly affected. Flooding has reportedly washed away shelters and belongings at Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) sites, leading to further displacements.In June, above-average rainfall has continued in the western half and moderate rainfall in central and eastern areas of Yemen, with flooding widely reported. More severe weather and flooding are expected in the coming weeks.DG ECHO has secured a total of EUR 150,000 for the Disaster Response Emergency Fund (DREF) of the International Federation of Red Cross (IFRC) to respond to the immediate humanitarian needs. The operation targets 24,500 flood-affected people (3,500 households) with shelter and WASH-related household items in Hajjah, Marib, Hodeidah, Al Bayda, Al Jawf, Sana'a, Amran, Sa’ada, Ibb, Taiz, Dhamar, Shabwa and Al Mahwit governorates.

title: New Zealand - Floods (ECHO 31 May 2023)
description: On 30 May, torrential rain hit Waihi Beach Town (North Island, northern New Zealand) causing floods and resulting in evacuations and damage.According to media reports, at least 50 people have been evacuated in the affected town.On 31 May, light rain is expected while drier conditions are forecast over parts of North Island.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 31 May 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting northern Indonesia (in particular the Sumatra Island) over the period 24 - 28 May, causing a number of strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 31 May, one injured person, ten displaced people and 93 damaged houses (of which 33 totally damaged) in the North Sumatra Province. In addition, approximately 370 damaged houses (of which more than 50 totally damaged) were reported across South Sumatra and Lampung Provinces (both in southern Sumatra Island).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong wind is forecast over most of the Sumatra Island.

title: Phillippines, Taiwan, Japan, Guam - Tropical Cyclone MAWAR, update (ECHO 31 May 2023)
description: On 30 May, tropical cyclone MAWAR (named "Betty" in the Phillippines) continued northward over the northern Philippine Sea, off the coast of eastern Taiwan, further weakening. On 31 May at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea, approximately 230 km south of Yaeyama Islands and Miyako Islands in southern Japan, with maximum sustained winds of 119 km/h (tropical storm.After its passage east of the Philippines, the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports, as of 31 May, 1,379 evacuated people across northern Visayas, northern Mimaropa and Luzon and a total of nearly 15,000 affected people.In Guam, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 30 May, 757 evacuated people in four shelters.On 1-3 June, MAWAR is forecast to continue northeastward along the Ryukyu Islands and well off the coast of southern Kyushu Island, further weakening but remaining a tropical storm.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over the far northern Luzon, eastern Taiwan and the Ryukyu Islands.

title: Jordan - Severe weather and flash floods (ECHO 31 May 2023)
description: On 30 May, several parts of Jordan experienced heavy rainfall and hailstorms that caused flash floods and resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, one person died in Aqaba City in southern Jordan, while another is still missing in Zarqa City in northern Jordan, both due to flash flood events. In addition, hailstorms were reported across the capital Amman, the nearby cities of Salt and Madaba, and the northern governorate of Irbid which resulted in widespread damage to properties.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected across the country.

title: Uganda - Landslide (ECHO 31 May 2023)
description: A landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in Bulambuli District on the slopes of Mount Elgon (Eastern Region, eastern Uganda), leading to casualties and damages to houses and infrastructure.According to Ministry of Health reports, five people died, two remain missing, two others have been injured, and 200 were displaced following the event. A total of nine houses were destroyed and access to four health centres restricted or blocked.From 31 May to 1 June, moderate rain is forecast mostly over the eastern and south-eastern areas but also over some parts of central and western Uganda.

title: Canada - Wildfires (ECHO 30 May 2023)
description: Wildfires have been affecting the Province of Nova Scotia in eastern Canada, resulting in evacuations and damage.Two main wildfires have been reported by the Government of Nova Scotia, one in Barrington Lake (Shelburne County) that is burning almost 10,000 ha and another in Tantallon Municipality (close to Halifax City) with 788 ha of burned are out of control.Media report, more than 16,000 evacuated people and at least 200 houses or structures have been destroyed in the areas of Hammonds Plains, Upper Tantallon and Pockwock, close to Halifax City.  Forest fires also impacted the Province of New Brunswick (west of Nova Scotia Province) over the past few days and led to evacuations of about 400 homes.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS) the fire danger forecast is expected to be from low to moderate across the affected areas.

title: Algeria - Floods (ECHO 30 May 2023)
description: Since 24 May, heavy rainfall as been hitting nine Provinces of Algeria (Algiers, Blida, Tébessa, Oum El Bouaghi, Tipaza, Boumerdes, El Tarf, Batna and Guelma) causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, two three people died, of whom one in Guelma Province (north-eastern Algeria) due to a flood event, second another in Tipaza Province (northern Algeria) and the third in Tissemssilt following a severe weather-related incident.Several people have been evacuated and dozens have been rescued across the affected Province; houses were damaged or destroyed, roads flooded and transport severely disrupted.For the next 14 hours, moderate rain is forecast over most parts of northern and north-eastern Algeria.

title: Phillippines, Taiwan, Japan - Tropical Cyclone MAWAR, update (ECHO 30 May 2023)
description: On 29 May, tropical cyclone MAWAR continued north-west over the northern Philippine Sea, weakening. On 30 May at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea, approximately 450 km east-southeast of the far south of Taiwan, with maximum sustained winds of 148 km/h.After heavy rainfalls due to its passage east of the Philippines, the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports, as of 30 May, 3,864 evacuated people (of which 3,483 in 21 evacuation centres) across northern Visayas and Luzon.In Guam, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) recorded, as of 29 May, 760 still evacuated people in four shelters.MAWAR is forecast to continue northward, far of the coast of eastern Taiwan on 30-31 May, further weakening. After that, on 1-3 June, it is expected to continue northeastward along the Ryukyu Islands (southern Japan), as a tropical storm.Over the next 48 hours, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern Luzon, far eastern Taiwan and southern Ryukyu Islands.

title: Pakistan - Snow avalanche (ECHO 30 May 2023)
description: On 27 May, an avalanche occurred in a mountainous pass that connects the Astore district of the Gilgit-Baltistan region to the bordering Kashmir valley (northern Pakistan).According to media reports, at least 11 people died, and 25 others have been injured following the event.On 30-31 May, heavy rain with localized thunderstorms and strong winds are forecast over the affected area.

title: Italy - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update  (ECHO 28 May 2023)
description: According to the Italian Civil Protection, as of 27 May, 20,500 people has been displaced, out of which 1,554 individuals are being accommodated in hotels and facilities established by the municipalities. 12 nationwide roads are still affected, some of them in multiple sections.There are 6,337 personnel involved in the activities, including 1,790 national volunteers actively engaged in the affected area, utilizing a total of 179 dewatering pumps.The EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) high capacity pumping modules from  France, Belgium, Slovakia, and Slovenia are operating with 118 personnel involved, and have already pumped out 1 157,260 cubic meter of water.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping  for the affected area and 12 maps had been produced so far.

title: Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Philippines - Tropical Cyclone MAWAR, update (ECHO 28 May 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone MAWAR is moving west-northwest in open waters, away from Guam, as a violent typhoon (10-min wind speed close to 210km/h). The cyclone will not likely pose a threat to land areas during the weekend.On Monday 29 May, the cyclone will reach closer to the Luzon strait, north of the Philippines, although the probability of making landfall in the Philippines is currently low.The winds will progressively weaken in the next days although the cyclone could bring important amounts of rainfall to northern Philippines and other neighboring islands when approaching.While winds are not expected to cause major damage, the intense rains could lead to flash flooding and mudslides.

title: Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Phillippines - Tropical Cyclone MAWAR, update (ECHO 26 May 2023)
description: On 25 May, tropical cyclone MAWAR continued north-west over the eastern Philippine Sea, strengthening. On 26 May at 3.00 UTC, its centre was located over the sea, approximately 1,750 km east-southeast of northern Luzon (Philippines), with maximum sustained winds of 298 km/h.After its passage over Guam, the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 25 May, 2,062 evacuated people in 34 shelters across Guam and Rota Islands. Furthermore, ten injured people were reported across both Islands.MAWAR is forecast to enter in the Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR) in early morning (UTC) of 27 May early. It is expected to reach the area of the Luzon Strait (between northern Philippines and southern Taiwan) between 30-31 May, with maximum sustained winds of 165 km/h.There are no Warnings are in force over Guam and Rota Islands. In addition, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern Luzon over 29-30 May.

title: Bangladesh - Severe weather (ECHO 26 May 2023)
description: A sequence of lightning strikes and thunderstorms affected several Districts of Bangladesh on 23-24 May causing a number of severe weather-related incidents, particularly due to lightning that have resulted in casualties.Media report, as of 26 May, 18 fatalities and several injured people across different Districts. The most affected ones by lightning events are: Cox's Bazar, Brahmanbaria, Chandpur (Chittagong Division), Patuakhali (Barisal Division) in the south; Narsingdi (Dhaka Division) in central Bangladesh; Sunamganj (Sylhet Division) in the east; Naogaon and Pabna (Rajshahi Division), Kurigram (Rangpur Division) and Netrakona (Mymensing Division) in the north.Over the next 24 hours, more severe weather, including heavy rainfall and thunderstorms, is forecast over the whole country.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 26 May 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and heavy hailstorms have been affecting southern Italy (in particular the Campania Region) over the last 24 hours, causing floods that have resulted in one casualty and damage.Media reports, as of 26 May, one fatality in the Forino Municipality (Avellino Province, eastern Campania Region) due to flooding.Over the next 24 hours, dryer conditions are forecast over the the Campania Region.

title: Colombia, Panama - Earthquake (ECHO 25 May 2023)
description: An earthquake of 6.6 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in the southern Caribbean Sea close to the coasts of north-western Colombia and south-eastern Panama. The epicentre was located approximately 36 km north-east of Capurganá village (Choco Department, north-western Colombia) which is very close to the border with Panama.An aftershock of 4.9 M has been recorded in the area. According to the National Unit for Disaster Risk Management (UNGRD), there was no tsunami threat for the Colombian Caribbean Coast after the seismic event.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 12,000 people were exposed to strong shaking.According to media reports, there have been no initial reports of damage or casualties as a result of the earthquake.

title: Afghanistan - Floods (ECHO 25 May 2023)
description: In the last few days, central Afghanistan has been affected by heavy rainfall that caused floods and resulted in casualties and damage.According to media and GDACS, four people died in the Town of Firozkoh (Ghor Province) while in Pasaband District, located in the same province, two others died and a person is reported missing following flood events. Furthermore, more than 100 houses have been destroyed as well as 200 ha of crops.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected across the affected province while light to moderate rain is forecast over north-western Afghanistan.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 25 May 2023)
description: Severe weather, including strong winds, thunderstorms and heavy hailstorms, have been affecting eastern Texas (in particular the Montgomery County) since 23 May, causing some severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of  25 May, two fatalities and seven injured people in the Conroe City (Montgomery County) to the collapse (caused by the strong wind) of an under-costruction building. According to same sources, one building as been damaged and up to 16,000 power outages have been recorded across the same County.Over the next 48 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over eastern Texas, including the already affected area.

title: Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Phillippines - Tropical Cyclone MAWAR, update (ECHO 25 May 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone MAWAR passed north of the Guam Island during mid-morning (UTC) of 24 May with maximum sustained winds of 222 km/h. On 25 May around 3.00 (UTC), its centre was located over the Philippine Sea, approximately 200 km north-west of Guam and 2,250 km south-east of northern Luzon (Philippines), with maximum sustained winds of 249 km/h.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 24 May, 927 evacuated people in 17 shelters across Guam and Rota Islands. Furthermore, schools and government offices are closed on both Islands.MAWAR is forecast to continue north-west over the Philippine Sea and to enter in the Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR) in the late evening (UTC) of 26 May. It is expected to reach the area of the Luzon Strait (between northern Philippines and southern Taiwan) on 30 May.Strong winds are forecast over Guam and the southern Northern Mariana Islands on 25 May. The Typhoon Warning over Guam and Rota issued by NOAA is in force.In addition, heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges are forecast over northern Luzon on 28-30 May.

title: Spain - Floods (ECHO 24 May 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern and south-eastern Spain (in particular Andalusia, Murcia and Valencia Regions) over the last 48 hours causing floods and flash floods, that have resulted in evacuations, injuries and damage.Media report, as of 24 May, three injured people across the Almeria City (Almeria Province, Andalusia Region) and a number of evacuated people in the coastal Municipality of Vera (eastern Almeria Province). In addition, several schools have been closed as well as a number of roads throughout all three affected Regions of Andalusia, Murcia and Valencia. Moreover, the main hospital of Cartagena City (Murcia Region) was flooded.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over southern and eastern Spain.

title: Italy - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 24 May 2023)
description: According to the Italian Civil Protection, as of 23 May, the number of evacuated stands at 23,000 people (most of them in Ravenna Province) following the severe weather that hit the Emilia Romagna Region in the past week. In addition, a total of 14 people died, of whom seven were in Ravenna Province, six in Forlì-Cesena Province and another in Bologna Province.As of 23 May, Italy has deployed 8449 rescuers, 1809 vehicles, 98 rescue boats and 24 helicopters in the emergency response. On the field are still operating more than 800 volunteers.On 20 May, Italy requested assistance from the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) for high capacity pumping modules with equipment. As a response, Austria, Belgium, France, Germany, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, and Slovenia offered High Capacity Pumping (HCP) modules from the European Civil Protection Pool (ECPP) and Bulgaria offered one HCP module from its own national capacity. High Capacity Pumping teams from Slovenia, Slovakia and France are already working in Italy, and the Belgium team is expected to join soon.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping EMSR664 for the affected area and 12 maps had been produced so far.

title: Guam, Northern Mariana Islands - Tropical Cyclone MAWAR, update (ECHO 24 May 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone MAWAR continued north-west over the North Pacific Ocean towards Guam Island and the southern Northern Mariana Islands (USA), slightly weakening. On 24 May around 3.30 UTC, its centre was located over the ocean very close to Guam, approximately 65 km east, with maximum sustained winds of 225 km/h.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 23 May, 567 preventively evacuated people in 19 shelters across the Guam Islands.MAWAR is forecast to make landfall over central Guam on 24 May during the mid-morning (UTC) with maximum sustained winds around 220 km/h. After that, it is forecast to continue north-west over the Philippine Sea and it is expected to reach the area of the Luzon Strait (between northern Philippines and southern Taiwan) on 29 May, as a tropical cyclone.Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over Guam and southern Northern Mariana Islands (in particular the Rota Island) over 24-25 May. The Typhoon Warning over Guam and Rota and the Tropical Storm Warning over Tinian and Saipan Islands (Northern Mariana Islands) issued by NOAA are still in force. A new Flash Flood Warning over Guam was issued by NOAA.The American Red Cross is working with both local emergency management officials as well as other humanitarian agencies, to meet the needs of the communities affected.
loc_countries: ['Taiwan, Province of China', 'Guam', 'Philippines', 'United States', 'China', 'Northern Mariana Islands']

title: Mexico - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 23 May 2023)
description: The activity of Popocatépetl volcano, located in the States of Puebla, Morelos, and Mexico (central Mexico) is still ongoing and the authorities raised the yellow alert from Phase 2 to Phase 3.On 22 May, two moderate volcanic explosions have been recorded by Mexico's National Center for Prevention of Disasters (CENAPRED). Ash fall has been reported across more than 15 Municipalities in Puebla State, one in Mexico State and another in Tlaxcala State.According to UN OCHA, following the increase in the activity of the volcano, the Puebla Civil Protection authorities have prepared 35 shelters with the capacity for 22,000 people in case of evacuations since 17 May. In addition, classes have been suspended in 40 municipalities of the State.The Civil Protection of Puebla State reports that on 22 May at 22.51 UTC, the Puebla International Airport suspended the flights due to ash-fall presence in the airstrips.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 23 May 2023)
description: On 22 May, heavy rainfall and strong winds occurred in Sam Ngam District in Phichit Province, central Thailand causing severe weather-related incidents and damage.According to the Department of Disaster Prevention and Mitigation of Thailand (DDPM), the storm affected and damaged the Wat Noen Po School in Noen Po Subdistrict where several people took shelter, resulting in six fatalities and 18 injured people.National authorities assisted the affected people.On 23-24 May, strong winds and possible thunderstorms are expected across central Thailand.

title: Myanmar - Tropical cyclone MOCHA, update (ECHO 23 May 2023)
description: The passage of the tropical cyclone MOCHA on 14-15 May over western and northern Myanmar (Rakhine, Chin, Magway and Sagaing states) caused a  larger number of casualties than first reported, as well as widespread damage, especially in internally displaced person (IDP) camps.As of 22 May, the AHA Centre reports 145 confirmed fatalities, 131 injured, 912,277 evacuated people (of which around 233,000 in 454 evacuation centres) and 248,296 damaged buildings (of which over 2,000 schools and more than 320 health centres) across all the aforementioned affected states. The worst affected is western Rakhine (in particular the Sittwe City area), where initial reports indicate that some 90% of buildings were damaged.Military authorities are restricting access to the affected areas, but some humanitarian organisations are managing to conduct needs assessments.According to UN OCHA, 5.4 million people in Myanmar were in the path of the cyclone, with 3.2 million estimated as requiring humanitarian assistance.

title: Guam, Northern Mariana Islands - Tropical Cyclone MAWAR, update (ECHO 23 May 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone MAWAR continued north-northwest over the North Pacific Ocean towards Guam Island and the southern Northern Mariana Islands (USA). On 23 May around 6.00 UTC, its centre was located over the ocean approximately 255 km south-east of Guam with maximum sustained winds of 213 km/h.MAWAR is forecast to continue north-west strengthening and it is expected to make landfall over central Guam in the morning, UTC of 24 May with maximum expected winds up to 230 km/h.Heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over Guam and southern Northern Mariana Islands (in particular the Rota Island) over 23-25 May. NOAA has issued a Typhoon Warning over Guam and Rota and a Tropical Storm Warning over Tinian and Saipan Islands (Northern Mariana Islands). Lou Leon Guerrero Governor of Guam instructed residents who might be in danger from flooding to evacuate.It is expected the system to strengthen as it moves west-northwest and approaches northern Luzon, an island of the Philippines that's home to the nation's capital Manila, or the southern Ryukyu Islands of Japan early next week.

title: Italy - Volcano eruption (ECHO 22 May 2023)
description: On 18 May, a new explosive activity started at the summit of the craters of Mount Etna (eastern Sicily Region, southern Italy) as registered by the National Institute of Geophysics and Volcanology (INGV).On 21 May the personnel of INGV on the field observed ashfall across Adrano Village, a town located in the Metropolitan City of Catania.According to media, the ash fall was also reported in Biancavilla village and Catania City leading to the closure of the Catania airport until 22 May at 7.00 UTC.Following the latest bulletins of INGV, as of 22 May, a lava flow is observed from the South East Crater, and no more explosions with associated ash fall have been recorded.

title: Spain - Wildfires (ECHO 22 May 2023)
description: The wildfires situation started on 17 May across the northern Cáceres Province (Estremadura Autonomous Community, western Spain) is improving.  According to the National Civil Defense of Spain (DSN), as of 20 May, the burnt area is approximately of 8,500 hectares. As of 21 May, the wildfires was declared under control.Media and DSN reported, as of 20 May, around 700 evacuted people across the Pinofranqueado (the worst affected), Cadalso, Descargamaría and Robledillo de Gata Municipalities (northern Cáceres Province). Among these, approximately 200 people was sheltered in the Moraleja Municipality.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode (EMSR667) on 19 May to provide the damage assessment and one map on Pinofranqueado was produced so far.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is expected from moderate to high over the already affected Province.

title: Italy - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 22 May 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall affected the Emilia-Romagna Region (northern Italy) from 16 to 20 May, causing severe floods, rivers overflow and triggering several landslides (over 300, according to media) that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage.The Italian Civil Protection and media report, as of 21-22 May, 13 fatalities and 1 missing person across Forlì-Cesena and Ravenna Provinces. Same sources also reports 36,000 still evacuated people. More than 500 roads were reported closed across the Region, particularly due to landslides.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) was activated in rapid mapping (EMSR664) for the affected area, eight maps had been produced so far.On 20 May, Italy requested assistance from the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) for high capacity pumping modules with equipment. So far nine countries offered assistance.Over the next 24 hours, no more heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Emilia-Romagna Region. The red alert for hydraulic and hydrogeological risk over eastern Emilia Romagna issued by the Italian Civil Protection is still in force.

title: Guam, Northern Mariana Islands - Tropical cyclone MAWAR  (ECHO 22 May 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone MAWAR, formed over the North Pacific Ocean on 20 May and is moving north-northwest towards Guam Island (USA). On 22 May at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located over the ocean approximately 570 km south-southeast of Guam with maximum sustained winds of 157 km/h.MAWAR is forecast to continue north-northwest, to turn north-west on 23 May and to cross northern Guam Island on 24 May with maximum expected winds of 185-205 km/h.On 22-25 May heavy rainfall, flash flooding, and mudslides are forecast for Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands. A Typhoon Warning is in effect for Guam and Rota (Northern Mariana Islands). A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for Tinian and Saipan (Northern Mariana Islands).

title: Mongolia – Severe weather  (ECHO 22 May 2023)
description: Strong winds, heavy dust, and snowstorms have been affecting several parts of Mongolia since May 19, causing casualties and infrastructure damage.According to the latest International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies  (IFRC) update, at least one person has died, 16 others are missing, and 1,000 households have been affected, including infrastructure and livestock losses.Local officials issued an early warning to nomadic herders and drivers, in particular, to take extra precautions against possible disasters.The Mongolia Red Cross Society has initiated a rapid needs assessment and is distributing cash and livestock care items to the affected families. The Mongolian National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) predicts that the current stormy weather will continue in the next few days.DG ECHO is closely monitoring the situation.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina - Severe weather (ECHO 19 May 2023)
description: In the past few days, heavy rainfall has hit several parts of north-western Bosnia and Herzegovina causing widespread floods and rivers overflow (including the Una and Sana rivers) that resulted in displacement and damage.The worst-impacted Municipalities are Novi Grad, Prijedor, Kostajnica, Bihac, Bužim, Sanski Most, Cazin, Velika Kladuša, Kljuc, Bosanska Krupa, Kozarska Dubica and Srbac.According to the official authorities of Bosnia and Herzegovina, 10,000 people affected and 887 buildings have been flooded.The Copernicus EMS was activated on 17 May in rapid mapping () for the affected area.On 19-20 May light rain is forecast over parts of western and north-western Bosnia and Herzegovina.

title: Italy - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 19 May 2023)
description: More than 20 rivers overflowed and several Municipalities have been affected by floods and almost 300 landslides.The death toll increased following heavy rainfall and strong winds that affected particularly the Emilia Romagna Region (northern-central Italy) over the past few days. According to the national authorities, as of 19 May, 13 people have died (of whom six in the Forlì-Cesena Province, five in the Ravenna Province, one in the Bologna City area and another in Cesena City), 10,000 have been evacuated most of them across the Provinces of Bologna, Forlì-Cesena and Ravenna and more than 200 roads have been closed.Electric system and telephone communication interruptions have been occurred.On 19 May, red alerts for hydraulic risk and hydrogeological risk are in effect over most of the Emilia Romagna, particularly over the eastern areas of the Region.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is expected over most of Emilia Romagna.The Copernicus EMS was activated on 16 May in rapid mapping () for the affected area.

title: Mexico - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 19 May 2023)
description: Over the past couple of days, explosive eruptions have been recorded at Popocatépetl volcano, located in the States of Puebla, Morelos, and Mexico in central Mexico.Following this activity, several municipalities in Puebla State have been affected by the ash-fall and classes have been suspended on 18 May. On 17 May, the Puebla Civil Protection authorities opened four evacuation shelters for people who need them, in addition to three schools and one sports unit in San Pedro Cholula and Huejotzingo.The activity of the volcano is still ongoing. On 18 May, 154 exhalations accompanied by water vapour, volcanic gases and ash, and one minor explosion have been registered.

title: New Caledonia, Vanuatu, New Zealand - Earthquakes (ECHO 19 May 2023)
description: Seismic activity is occurring in the South Pacific Ocean 400 km east-southeast of New Caledonia. The main earthquake of 7.7 M at a depth of 38 km occurred on 19 May at 2.57 UTC (13.57 local time).A total of 14 aftershocks of magnitude between 4.8 M and 5.9 M have been recorded in the area.Small tsunami waves have been registered along the coast of New Caledonia, Vanuatu and New Zealand. The highest recorded, 0,61 m, is in Lenakel Town (Tanna Island, Vanuatu).According to initial media reports, people in Vanuatu Islands have been advised to evacuate from coastal areas to higher grounds.

title: Croatia - Floods (ECHO 17 May 2023)
description: Since 12 May, heavy rainfall has affected several counties of Croatia, causing floods and resulting in evacuations and damage. Several rivers (including the Kupa, Una ,Sava, Mrežnica, Zrmanja and Korana Rivers) are under monitoring and authorities are taking urgent measures to mitigate the situation.According to media reports, dozens of people have been evacuated and at least 59 houses have been flooded in Gracac Municipality (Zadar County, central-western Croatia) after the overflow of the Otuca River. In addition, power outages and road closures have been reported across several counties.On 17-18 May, moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast across most parts of the country, particularly over northern and eastern Croatia

title: Italy - Severe weather, floods and landslides (ECHO 17 May 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting northern and central Italy (in particular the Emilia-Romagna and the Marche Region) over the last 48 hours, causing floods, rivers overflow and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage.Media report, as of 17 May, three fatalities, of which one in the Cesena Municipality, one more in the Forlì Municipality (both in the Forlì-Cesena Province, Emilia-Romagna Region) and one in the Ravenna Province due to the floods. Across the Province of Forlì, four missing people were reported (three in Forlì and one more in Cesena). Media also reports several closed schools in Emilia-Romagna and Marche Regions.The Italian Civil Protection has issued, as of 16 May, a red alert for hydraulic and hydrogeological risk over most of the Emilia Romagna.As of the same date, the Copernicus EMS was activated in rapid mapping () for the affected area.Over the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over the already affected two Regions

title: Uganda - Floods and landslides (ECHO 17 May 2023)
description: Since the beginning of May, western and south-western Uganda experienced heavy rainfall across several Districts that caused floods, triggered landslides and resulted in casualties and damage.According to the National Environment Management Authority of Uganda (NEMA), 23 people died, and 16 have been injured after landslides and floods in the areas of Kigezi and Ntokoro Districts.The Copernicus EMS was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 15 May to provide a damage assessment caused by the River Katonga which flooded and submerged the major trans-national road.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected over northern, eastern, south-eastern, and south-eastern Uganda.

title: Indonesia - Landslides and floods (ECHO 17 May 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall hit parts of Indonesia over the past few days, triggering landslides, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), three people died, six others have been injured and 12 houses were affected following a landslide that occurred in Jayawijaya Regency (Highland Papua Province, eastern Indonesia) on 12 May. The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports more than 10,700 affected people across the Regencies of South Aceh and Aceh Singkil (Aceh Province, western Indonesia).For the next 24 hours, light rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over Aceh Province while moderate to heavy rainfall is expected over Highland Papua Province.

title: SOMALIA – Flash floods, displacement  (ECHO 17 May 2023)
description: Ongoing rains have severely affected Belet Weyne district, Hirshabelle State, and Baardheere in Jubaland State. Initial estimates indicate that the flash and riverine floods have affected at least 460,470 people, displacing nearly 219,000 and killing 22.ECHO supported partner Danish Refugee Council (DRC), reports 37,782 individuals having evacuated 26 DRC managed IDP sites affected by flooding, while 1,500 households remain in 5 DRC managed sites isolated due to the flooding. IDPs are mainly relocating to villages close to Beletweyne, while host communities moved to further away villages.5,332 individuals benefit from DRC’s emergency response, including delivery of 40,000 litres of clean water through water trucking to cover basic drinking, hygiene and cooking needs, mobilizing emergency protection teams and Camp Management Committees. UNICEF delivered 14 metric tons of nutritional supplies to Belet Weyne to sustain lifesaving nutrition services in the district.Ongoing rains could recharge surface water sources and enable vegetation growth, but will not effectively alleviate the impact of the recent drought.

title: Myanmar, Bangladesh - Tropical cyclone MOCHA, update (ECHO 17 May 2023)
description: The passage of the tropical cyclone MOCHA on 14-15 May over western and northern Myanmar (Rakhine, Chin, Magway, Sagaing and Kachin states) and south-eastern Bangladesh (Chattogram Division) has caused widespread damage, with the number of casualties being larger than initial estimations.In Myanmar, across all the aforementioned affected states, DG ECHO and UN OCHA reported 41 fatalities, around 700 injured people, approximately 100,000 evacuated and 5.4 million affected. The worst affected is western Rakhine, which includes several Rohingya Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camps, which have been significantly damaged. In Chin, over 1,200 houses were partially or fully destroyed. Approximately 50 destroyed houses were reported across Sagaing. Severe flooding has affected more than 100,000 people in villages in Magway and Sagaing.In Bangladesh, UN reports, as of 15 May, nearly 430,000 affected people, over 2,000 destroyed houses and more than 10,600 damaged houses across the Chattogram Division. Rohingya refugees camps in the Cox's Bazar area were severely affected.The Copernicus EMS was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 12 May for Myanmar and four satellite maps were produced so far.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over both countries.

title: Rwanda - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 16 May 2023)
description: After the severe floods and landslides that affected northern, western and southern Provinces of Rwanda on 2-3 May, the death toll has increased and further damage has been reported.Media reports, as of 16 May, up to 131 fatalities, and more than 5,800 displaced families  across the affected Provinces. Key assets and infrastructure were also damaged including 6,391 houses, 2 health centres, 29 bridges, many national and district roads, numerous voltage lines as well as 5 power stations. 58 schools were affected.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over western Rwanda.

title: Ethiopia - Floods (ECHO 16 May 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect southern and north-eastern Ethiopia, in particular Somali, Oromia, Southern Nations Nationalities and Peoples (SNNP), South West, Sidama and Afar Regions, since the beginning of the Belg rainy season (from March to May), causing rivers overflow (in particular the Bilate River) and floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.UN OCHA reports, as of 12 May, 91 fatalities, of which 45 across Somali, 38 in SNNP and eight more in Oromia. In addition, 35,350 displaced families were reported in Somali and 5,803 in Oromia, the worst affected Regions. Furthermore, over 24,100 people were reported displace across SNNP, Sidama and Afar.Partners have supported the government in the preparation of a Flood Response Plan for the Gu rainy season (April-June) to assist a minimum level of multi-hazard preparedness and a government-partner response strategy to the flood affected and displaced. The Plan released in April requires $86 million to assist more than 170,000 flood displaced people, currently funded at 17.44%.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over central, western and northern Ethiopia, including parts of the already affected Regions.

title: Myanmar, Bangladesh - Tropical cyclone MOCHA, update (ECHO 16 May 2023)
description: After the landfall of cyclone Mocha close to Sittwe City (Rakhine State, western Myanmar, bordering Bangladesh) on 14 May with maximum sustained winds of up to 250 km/h, on 14-15 May the cyclone passed over Chin, Magway, Sagaing and Kachin states (northern Myanmar), where it is now weakening and dissipating.Very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surges (for coastal areas) affected these states, the Cox's Bazar area (Bangladesh) and Mizoram, Tripura and Manipur States (India).In Myanmar, media report 41 fatalities, over 700 injured and approximately 100,000 evacuated. A total of 2.2 million people are estimated to be affected by the cyclone. The worst affected area is Sittwe and western Rakhine, including several Rohingya Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camps. There are unconfirmed reports of missing and injured people across a number of IDPs camps in the area. In Sittwe, most houses have been damaged.In Bangladesh, UN OCHA reports that as of 15 May, there are around 750,000 evacuated people and 2.3 million affected people.The Copernicus EMS was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 12 May for Myanmar. So far, four satellite maps were produced.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over south and eastern Bangladesh and over western and northern Myanmar, posing the threat of floods and landslides.

title: Flood in Rwanda - UNITAR-UNOSAT Activation
description: UNITAR-UNOSAT Potentially Damaged Buildings has been activated

title: Pakistan - Severe weather (ECHO 15 May 2023)
description: Gusty winds have affected the Nowshera District in central Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province (north-western Pakistan) causing severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.The Provincial Disaster Management Authority of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (PDMA) reports one fatality, four injured people and six damaged or destroyed houses.On 15-16 May, gusty winds, light rain with isolated thunderstorms are forecast across the affected Province.

title: Myanmar - Tropical cyclone MOCHA, update (ECHO 14 May 2023)
description: In Myanmar, 2.2. million people live in overall affected areas and 1.3 million in worst affected areas. According to humanitarian actors, for 687,000 vulnerable people, the impact is expected to be extreme.Humanitarian actors in Rakhine state with a reinforced coordination structure on site are on stand-by to deliver emergency response as soon as conditions allow. However, the Myanmar Humanitarian Response Plan is only funded up to 10% indicating low levels of resources to be mobilized.The Humanitarian Coordinator has announced the release of an emergency response envelop of USD 2 million through the Myanmar Humanitarian Fund (MHF) and is calling for donors to urgently release additional funds at scale. Humanitarian access remains unclear in states that are expected to be most affected, Rakhine, Chin, Magway and Sagaing states, hosting already 1.2 million IDPs living in dire conditions.

title: Myanmar, Bangladesh, India - Tropical cyclone MOCHA, update (ECHO 14 May 2023)
description: Extremely severe (Category 5) Tropical cyclone MOCHA continues to intensify in the Bay of Bengal and will likely cross the coast between Cox’s Bazar in Bangladesh and Kyaukpyu township, Myanmar’s Rakhine State during the afternoon on 14 May. GDACS issued red alert for Myanmar and Bangladesh which are affected by high winds up to 259 km/h (72 m/s or 161mph). Storm surge with height about 3-3.5 m are likely to inundate low lying areas of north Myanmar and adjoining Southeast Bangladesh coasts during the time of landfall. Tropical cyclone MOCHA has become the second-most intense cyclone to develop in the Bay of Bengal in the month since 1982.The identified impact area in Myanmar and Bangladesh are low-lying and highly prone to flooding, with IDPs and refugees living in precarious conditions. Heavy rains and strong winds are expected to hit later inland communities, also exposed to flooding and landslides.The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued rain and storm warnings for Andaman and Nicobar Islands, parts of Tripura, Mizoram, Manipur, Nagaland and Assam.

title: Myanmar, Bangladesh, India - Tropical cyclone MOCHA, update  (ECHO 13 May 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone MOCHA is likely to cross the coast between Cox’s Bazar (Bangladesh) and Sittwe (Myanmar) on 14 May with maximum sustained wind speed of 150-160 km/h with gusts up to 175 km/h. Coasts and offshore islands are expected to be inundated with 5-7 feet tidal surge.In Myanmar, 285 000 displaced people are directly exposed to the Cyclone in Rakhine and Chin. Thousands of families have been pre-evacuated. There are already about 6 million people in need of humanitarian assistance and 1.2 million people displaced in the Northwest who are already living in precarious conditions in camps, displacement sites or in forests without proper shelter.In Bangladesh, 2.8 million people in Bandarban, Chattogram, Cox’s Bazar and Rangamati are to be evacuated. Refugees’ camps hosting one million Rohingya refugees could be significantly affected. Preparedness activities are still ongoing in terms of prepositioning of stocks and resources. Flights to Cox’s Bazar are cancelled.In India, heavy to very heavy rain is predicted in the northeast states.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 28 Apr 2023)
description: The number of fatalities and impacted people continues to increase following the rainy season started at the beginning of January across most parts of the country.According to the Ecuador Risk Communication Management Department (SGR), as of 27 April, 33 people died in the rainy season (plus 49 fatalities and 39 still missing people due to the landslide in the Alausí Town area, Chimborazo Province occurred on 26 March) and 43 have been injured. More than 69,300 people have been impacted (29,907 in Guayas Province) as well as 14,809 houses (of which 121 were destroyed).For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected across most parts of the country, particularly over the north-western and central provinces.

title: Kenya - Floods (ECHO 28 Apr 2023)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall has affected Kisumu County (south-western Kenya), causing flash floods and resulting in displacement and damage.According to media report a total of 1,000 people have been displaced across several parts of the county.National authorities are providing help for those displaced.On 28-29 April, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms are forecast across the affected County.

title: Pakistan - Severe weather, floods and landslide, update (ECHO 28 Apr 2023)
description: Since the past week, heavy rainfall affected two Districts (Orakzai, and Mohmand) of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province (north-western Pakistan), causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Provincial Disaster Management Authority of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (PDMA), three people died in the Orakzai District of whom one in a severe weather-related incident and two in a flood event. In Mohmand District, two other persons died swept away by a flood. Furthermore, following the landslide that occurred in the Torkham area that affected the road of the Khyber Pass (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province, north-western Pakistan) on 18 April, the death toll reached four people.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast across several parts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province.

title: Brazil - Floods (ECHO 27 Apr 2023)
description: In recent days, the Municipalities of Ilhéus and Santa Cruz de Cabrália (Bahia State, eastern Brazil) have been affected by heavy rainfall that caused floods, triggered landslides and resulted in displacement and damage.According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), in the Municipality of Santa Cruz de Cabrália, at least 6,000 people were displaced while in the Municipality of Ilheus, 56 families were displaced and 229 people were affected.For the next 24 hours, light rain is expected across the coastal area of Bahia State.

title: Venezuela - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Apr 2023)
description: On 23-24 April, heavy rainfall and lightning affected parts of Sucre and Monagas States in northern Venezuela causing flooding and leading to damage.According to GDACS and media, one person died in the Cumaná Municipality (Sucre State) due to a severe weather-related incident while 84 people have been affected and 15 houses damaged following the overflow of San Juan River that broke its banks in Caripito City (Monagas State).For the next 24 hours, light rain is expected over parts of the affected States.

title: Ecuador - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 27 Apr 2023)
description: Since the beginning of January, heavy rainfall has been affecting most parts of the country causing severe weather-related incidents, floods, and landslides that resulted in an increasing number of casualties and affected people.The most affected Provinces are Guayas, Los Ríos, Manabí, Santa Elena, El Oro, Cotopaxi, Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas, Esmeraldas, Imbabura, and Chimborazo.According to the latest report of the Ecuador Risk Communication Management Department (SGR), 30 people died in this rainy season (plus 49 fatalities and 39 still missing people due to the landslide in the Alausí Town area, Chimborazo Province occurred on 26 March) and 37 have been injured. Almost 66,000 people have been affected (29,133 in Guayas Province) as well as 14,184 houses (of which 111 were destroyed).For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is expected over north-western Ecuador while moderate rainfall is forecast across most parts of the rest of the country.

title: Sri Lanka - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Apr 2023)
description: Localised heavy rains and thunderstorms over the past four days have affected about 1,000 people across 6 of the total 9 provinces.The Disaster Management Centre situation report published today estimates 274 families (910 people) have been affected and 256 houses were partially damaged due to high winds, heavy rains, and lightning.The Sri Lankan Meteorological Department forecasts the continuation of the thundershowers across the country over the next 24 hours. An advisory has been issued for local public to take adequate precautions to minimise damages caused by temporary localised strong winds and lightning during thundershowers.

title: Bangladesh - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Apr 2023)
description: A sequence of lightning strikes and thunderstorms affected eastern Bangladesh (in particular the Districts of Sunamganj, Moulvibazar, and Sylhet) on 23 April causing a number of severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to lightning) that have resulted in casualties. Lightning events are common in the area during the transition period from the dry season to the rainy season.Media report, as of 26 April, nine fatalities across different towns and villages throughout the three aforementioned districts.Over the next 24 hours, no more severe weather is forecast over most of the country.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Apr 2023)
description: On 23-24 April, heavy storms and strong winds affected 11 provinces of Thailand (Chiang Mai, Kamphaeng Phet, Lampang, Lamphun, Nakhon Nayok, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Nong Khai, Phayao, Phetchabun, Tak, Ubon Ratchathani ), resulting in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), one person died in Nong Khai Province while 1,254 people have been affected, and 418 houses were damaged across the aforementioned provinces.For the next 24 hours, more isolated thunderstorms with gusty winds are forecast over most parts of the country, particularly over central and northern Thailand.

title: Türkiye - Tornado (ECHO 26 Apr 2023)
description: Strong winds and a very large tornado affected the area of the Pazarcik City (southern Kahramanmaras Province, southern Türkiye) on 20 April, causing several wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage. The area was previously severely affected by the devastating seismic activity occurred on 6 February.Media report, as of 26 April, one fatality, approximately 50 injured people, and 168 damaged temporary structures (tents and containers) across an earthquake-relief camp in the area of the Pazarcik City, due to a tornado occurred on 20 April.Over the next 24 hours, no more strong wind is forecast over southern Türkiye.

title: Indonesia - Earthquake (ECHO 26 Apr 2023)
description: The seismic activity continues off the coast of West Sumatra Province. On 24 April at 20.00 UTC (25 April at 3.00 UTC local time) a 7.1 M earthquake (6.9 M as recorded by the Indonesian authorities) at a depth of 15 km occurred between the islands of Bojo (Batu Islands, North Sumatra Province) and Siberut (Mentawai Islands, West Sumatra Province). The epicentre was located approximately 205 km west-northwest of Padang City (the capital of West Sumatra Province).According to USGS, over the past seven days, at least seven earthquakes with magnitudes between 4.6 M and 7.1 M have been registered.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 7,000 people were exposed to severe shaking, 20,000 to very strong and 34,000 to strong shaking.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports 5,550 displaced people and one house heavily damaged across the most affected locations (South Nias, Padang City, Mentawai Islands, West Pasaman, Padang Pariaman, Agam, and Gunung Sitoli) located in North and West Sumatra Province.

title: Ecuador - Sangay volcano eruption (ECHO 24 Apr 2023)
description: On 21 April, Sangay volcano, located in central Ecuador, erupted an ash column 8 km high above the crater which was directed towards the west of the volcano.According to the national authorities, several cantons (particularly Montalvo, Baba, Simón Bolívar, Salitre, Bucay, Juján, Guamote) of the provinces of Guayas, Chimborazo, Los Ríos and Bolívar Provinces have been hit by the ashfall.The activity of the volcano is constantly monitored by the Geophysical Institute of Ecuador (IGEPN).

title: Myanmar - Tornado (ECHO 24 Apr 2023)
description: On 21 April, strong winds and a very large tornado hit central Myanmar (including the capital city Naypyitaw), causing several wind-related incidents resulting in casualties and severe damage.According to media reports, as of 24 April, there are eight fatalities, nearly 130 injured people and more than 230 destroyed houses across Aung Myin Kone and Tadau villages (Naypyitaw capital city greater area, central Myanmar).Moderate rainfall is forecast over the Naypyitaw region over the next 24 hours, but no more strong wind is predicted.

title: Angola - Floods (ECHO 24 Apr 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several provinces of Angola since early April, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage. The most affected provinces are Luanda (the worst affected one, including the Luanda Capital City area), Namibe, Lunda Norte, Lunda Sul, Malanje, Cuanza Norte and Moxico.Media report, as of 24 April, up to 54 fatalities (among these, more than ten occurred in the Luanda City), over 450 injured people, more than 4,380 damaged houses (of which a large number collapsed) and a total of approximately 44,000 affected people across the aforementioned provinces. National authorities declared that the impact figures are still provisional.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the western and northern provinces of the country, including the Luanda Province.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 21 Apr 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Indonesia (in particular the Sulawesi Island) over the last 24 hours, causing floods that have resulted in population displacements and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 21 April, 64 displaced people, more than 1,900 flooded houses and a total of approximately 4,750 affected people across the North Morowali Regency (Central Sulawesi Province).Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over the whole Sulawesi Island.

title: M7.8 in Türkiye - UNITAR-UNOSAT Activation
description: UNITAR-UNOSAT Potentially Damaged Buildings has been activated

title: Peru - Landslide, update (ECHO 20 Apr 2023)
description: After the landslide that occurred in the Atavillos Bajo District (Huaral Province, Lima Department) on 14 April, the number of fatalities reached three people.According to the National Institute of Civil Defense of Peru (INDECI), four people are still missing, almost 80 people have been affected, 24 houses destroyed and ten damaged.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the affected province.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Apr 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms affected the southern Democratic Republic of the Congo, in particular the Kasaï Central Province, over the period from 15 to 17 April, causing some severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to lightning) that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 19 April, eight fatalities and one heavily damaged house in the Tshimbulu Town (eastern Kasaï Central Province) due to lightning which occurred on 15-16 April.Over the next 24 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of the Country, including the already affected Kasaï Central Province.

title: China - Fire incident (ECHO 19 Apr 2023)
description: 21 people were killed after a fire broke out in the inpatient department of Changfeng Hospital in Beijing's Fengtai District on 18 April at around 12:57 p.m. local time (04:57 GMT). The fire was extinguished about half an hour later.71 people were evacuated and transferred after the rescue work.The cause of the fire is under investigation.

title: Pakistan - Landslide, update (ECHO 19 Apr 2023)
