description: After the landslide in the Torkham area that affected the road of the Khyber Pass (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province, north-western Pakistan), the number of casualties increased.The Provincial Disaster Management Authority of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (PDMA) reports, three fatalities and four injured people following the event.On 18-20 April, light rain with localized thunderstorms is expected across the area and the whole Province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

title: Peru - Landslide (ECHO 18 Apr 2023)
description: On 14 April, a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in the Atavillos Bajo District (Huaral Province, Lima Department) resulting in casualties and damage.According to the National Institute of Civil Defense of Peru (INDECI), two people have died, five resulted missing, and more than 60 people have been affected as well as 29 houses.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the affected Province.

title: Pakistan - Landslide (ECHO 18 Apr 2023)
description: On 18 April, a landslide caused by a thunderstorm affected the main road of the Khyber Pass (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province, north-western Pakistan) leading to casualties.According to media reports, at least two people died, three have been injured and at least 20 trucks have been buried.The authorities are conducting search and rescue activities.For the next 24 hours, light rain with localized thunderstorms is expected across the affected area.

title: Indonesia - Landslide (ECHO 18 Apr 2023)
description: A landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in the Parigi Moutong Regency (Central Sulawesi, central Indonesia) on 15 April resulting in casualties.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), at least five people died following the event.On 18 April, no rain is expected while on 19 April, light rain is forecast over the affected Regency.

title: France - Wildfire (ECHO 17 Apr 2023)
description: A wildfire occurred in the area of Cap Peyrefite (northern Cerbère, the southernmost Municipality of the Pyrénées-Orientales Department, south-eastern France, bordering with Spain) on 15 April, causing evacuations and damage. According to the Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC), as of 16 April, the fire burnt an area of approximately 930 ha in France and 120 ha in Spain.COGIC reports around 300 evacuated people in temporary accomodation centres across the area of Cap Peyrefite and in the Cerbère Town. COGIC also reports two damaged houses and up to 1,200 power outages throughout the affected area.Four firefighting aircrafts-Canadairs-and two more aerial means were deployed, for a total of 26 drops, in addition 593 firefighters were mobilised. As of 16 April, the fire was declared under control.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast remains from high to very high across the Pyrénées-Orientales Department.

title: Indonesia - Earthquake (ECHO 17 Apr 2023)
description: An earthquake of 7.0 M at a depth of 594 km, 6.9 M at a depth of 643 km for the Indonesian Meteorological, Climatological, and Geophysical Agency (BMKG),  occurred in the Java Sea close to northern Java Island. The epicentre was located offshore approximately 95 km north of the coastal City of Tuban (Tuban Regency, East Java Province). USGS PAGER estimates that around 44,600 people were exposed to weak shaking.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports, as of 17 April, one fatality in the Marga Village (Tabanan Regency, in the nearby Bali Island). In addition, BNPB also reports four damaged houses across West Java and East Java Provinces.

title: Tanzania - Floods (ECHO 17 Apr 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting western Tanzania (in particular the Rukwa Region, bordering with northern Zambia) since 12 April, causing river overflows (particularly the Talanda River) and floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 17 April, seven fatalities, six people still missing, and several of injured. Dozens of people were left homeless after houses and infrastructures were destroyed across the Sumbawanga District (eastern Rukwa Region).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the already affected Rukwa Region.

title: Australia - Tropical Cyclone ILSA, update (ECHO 14 Apr 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone ILSA has been downgraded to Category-3 after it crossed the Western Australian coast as a category-5 between De Grey and Pardoo at 16:00 UTC on Thursday, 13 April with a wind speed of 213 km/h.At 1:00 UTC today (14 April), the system has further weakened to Category 2 and is located near Telfer in the far eastern Pilbara, according to the Australian Bureau of Meteorology. ILSA is expected to weaken below tropical cyclone strength tonight and then move into southern parts of the Northern Territory on Saturday morning.Initial reports indicate the cyclone largely missed highly populated areas but brought down trees and caused severe damage to vegetation, along with a storm surge up to six metres high. There have so far been no reports of injuries to people or damage to infrastructure due to the cyclone.

title: Iran, Iraq - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 14 Apr 2023)
description: Heavy rain with thunderstorms has affected several parts of Iran and Iraq over the past few days, causing floods, and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.In Iran, three people died, of whom one in Bukan (West Azerbaijan Province), one in Mehran (Ilam Province) and another in Alamut (Qazvin Province) following floods. In addition, about 400 people have been evacuated, some of the evacuated are in Lorestan Province where levels of the Kamandan Dam were rising.In Iraq, three other people died in the central province of Babil, due to severe weather-related incidents, while floods have affected the Governorates of Kirkuk, Sulaymaniyah and Erbil.For the next 24 hours moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected across north-eastern Iraq and north-western and western Iran.

title: Somalia - Floods, update (ECHO 14 Apr 2023)
description: Since the beginning of the Gu Rainy Season (from April to June), heavy rainfall, floods and flash floods have affected 170,000 people (of whom 140,000 have been displaced) across several areas of Somalia as reported by UN OCHA.The worst hit areas are Baardheere District in Gedo Region, (Jubaland State), and Baidoa District in Bay Region (South West State).According to the same source, more than 21 people died after flash floods that occurred in Baardheere District (Jubaland State, southern Somalia) on 21-24 March. In the same District, four health and nutrition centres were damaged as well as six primary schools and a secondary school.Humanitarian partners are conducting the emergency response for the affected States (Galmudug State, Hirshabelle State, South West State, Jubaland State).For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected over the northern and southern areas of Somalia.

title: Russia - Volcanic eruption, update (ECHO 13 Apr 2023)
description: The activity of the Shiveluch volcano, located in the eastern Kamchatka Peninsula, continues but is decreasing.Following the latest explosion, the Kamchatka Volcanic Eruption Response Team (KVERT), registered an ash plume 5.5 km high above the sea level that extended about 400 km to the south-east from the volcano.According to media reports, the villages located about 50 km from the volcano, were covered by a 20 cm layer of dust. The area close to the volcano has been closed to aircraft and residents have been advised to stay indoors.The aviation colour code has been downgraded from RED to ORANGE.

title: Australia - Tropical Cyclone ILSA, update (ECHO 13 Apr 2023)
description: The Bureau of Meteorology upgraded cyclone Ilsa to category 4 with gusts near the centre up to 230km/h as it tracks towards the coast 290km north of Port Hedland at 00:00 UTC 13 April.Winds in Ilsa's "very destructive core" could gust up to 275 km/h with very heavy rains (up to 400 mm) and abnormally high tides on Thursday night into Friday morning local time, before the storm moves inland, over the East Pilbara Shire and the Northern Interior District (Pilbara Region), on 14 April, weakening into a tropical storm.A yellow cyclone alert is in place along more than 700km of coastline between an area south of Broome and Whim Creek, while residents in the populated mining town of Port Hedland are preparing to head into lockdown.Over the next 36 hours, very heavy rainfall, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over the western and central Pilbara Region. The Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) has issued a warning zone for gales over this area.

title: Philippines - Floods (ECHO 13 Apr 2023)
description: On 9 April, floods and flash floods triggered by heavy rainfall, have affected Davao del Sur Province (eastern Mindanao, southern Philippines) resulting in population displacements.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), five people have died, one has been injured in the Digos City area, and more than 1,500 people have been displaced and evacuated in four evacuation centres across the Province. In addition, ten houses have been destroyed (eight) or damaged (two).For the next 24 hours, cloudy skies with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms are forecast across Mindanao. In the meanwhile, the remnants of tropical depression "Amang" have been affecting with heavy rainfall central Philippines, in particular Central Luzon, Metro Manila, and CALABARZON.

title: Spain - Wildfires, update (ECHO 31 Mar 2023)
description: The Department of National Security of Spain has reported several wildfires across the country, particularly in Asturias (northern Spain) where 116 forest fires were registered in some thirty councils.The situation in Castellón Province and the neighbouring Teruel Province (eastern Spain) is improving but 1,100 people living in Montanejos, Montán, Higueras and Fuente la Reina are still evacuated.In addition, some others 130 people have been evacuated in the councils of Valdés, Villayón and Tineo following fires across the Asturias Region. Furthermore, the fire declared on 28 March in Baleira Municipality (Lugo Province, Galicia Region) has been stabilized.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is expected to be from high to extreme over eastern and south-eastern Spain, while better conditions are forecast over northern Spain including the affected regions.

title: Ecuador - Landslide, update (ECHO 31 Mar 2023)
description: The number of fatalities and missing people continues to increase following the landslide that occurred in Alausí Canton (Chimborazo Province, central Ecuador) on 26 March. Moreover, heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are still affecting most parts of the country, including the hit area.The Risk Management Secretariat of Ecuador (SGR) reports, as of 30 March, 17 deaths and 72 still missing people. In addition, 170 people have been evacuated and more than 1,000 were affected (of which 656 were severely affected).On 31 March - 1 April, moderate to heavy rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over most of the country.

title: Colombia - Floods (ECHO 31 Mar 2023)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall has affected Cauca Department (south-western Colombia), causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in damage. The most affected Municipalities are Suarez, Caloto, La Vega, Jambaló and Santander de Quilichao.According to media reports, 1,500 people have been affected, and hundreds of houses and buildings damaged or destroyed.On 31 March - 1 April, moderate to heavy rainfall with localized thunderstorms are expected for most parts of the Cauca Department.

title: Iran - Flash floods (ECHO 31 Mar 2023)
description: On 28 March, deadly flash floods triggered by heavy rainfall, have affected the southeastern Iranian province of Kerman.According to media reports, at least three people died while several villages have been flooded across the Province, particularly in Jiroft County where houses, roads and bridges have been damaged.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over north-western and northern Iran.

title: India - Severe weather (ECHO 31 Mar 2023)
description: On 29 March, severe thunderstorms accompanied by thousands of lightning have affected Bhadrak District (eastern Odisha, eastern India) resulting in casualties.According to media reports, at least five people died following lightning events.For the next 24 hours, hailstorms, thundersorms and strong winds are expected over parts of Odisha State, including the affected District where an orange alert for severe weather events is in effect.

title: Thailand - Wildfires and air pollution in the Mekong region  (ECHO 31 Mar 2023)
description: On 29 March, a fire broke out on Khao Chaphlu Mountain at noon. The steep mountain terrain prevented firefighters from reaching the blaze, which spread to the adjacent Khao Laem forested area in Nakhon Nayok province, two hours away from Bangkok.Fires have already engulfed about 112 ha of forest, authorities have deployed firefighters. The Deputy Prime Minister is due to visit the province on 31 March to discuss necessary mitigation measures, including preparing shelters in case people living near Khao Laem need to be evacuated.According to the Geo-Informatics and Space Technology Development Agency (GISTDA), 52,000 hotspots have been detected in Thailand as of 28 February. Wildfires bring high levels of fine particulate matter (PM2.5), especially in border areas most affected by fires and haze pollution from neighbouring countries.Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai provinces also hit the world’s worst air pollution record with the air quality index. In addition to Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam and Myanmar also experience localised wildfires.

title: Spain - Wildfires, update (ECHO 30 Mar 2023)
description: The wildfires situation started on 23 March in Castellón Province and the neighbouring Teruel Province (eastern Spain) is improving.The National Civil Defense of Spain (DSN) reports, as of 30 March, approximately 1,400 people still evacuated across the Villanueva de Viver, Puebla de Arenoso, Higueras and Pavías Municipalities (Castellón Province).Meanwhile other wildfires events have been affecting northern Spain, in particular in the Tineo Municiplaity (Asturias Province) and Baleira Municipality (Lugo Province). Regarding the latter, 17 evacuated people were reported.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated on 23 March to provide the damage assessment (), and four maps on Villanueva de Viver have been produced so far.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire danger forecast is expected to be from high to extreme over eastern Spain, while better condition is forecast over northern Spain.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 30 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continued to affect north-western Brazil (in particular the Acre State) since 23 March, causing floods, rivers overflow (particularly the Acre River in the south-east) and triggering landslides that have resulted in an increased number of population displacements and widespread damage. The most affected Municipalities are Rio Branco (capital of Acre), Assis Brasil, Brasileia, Epitaciolândia, and Xapuri.Media report, as of 30 March, around 11,850 displaced people (a number of these across several evacuation centres) of which 8,886 in Brasileia, 2,213 in Rio Branco, 433 in Assis Brasil and 316 in Xapuri. In addition, several damaged houses and roads and a total of approximately 15,000 affected people were reported across the State.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Acre State.

title: Ecuador - Landslide, update (ECHO 30 Mar 2023)
description: The number of fatalities reached 14 people following the huge landslide that occurred in Alausí Canton (Chimborazo Province, central Ecuador) on 26 March.In addition, 67 people are missing, 33 have been injured, 145 evacuated, and approximately 500 affected.On 30-31 March, moderate to heavy rainfall with localized thunderstorms is forecast most of Ecuador, including the Alausí Canton.

title: Ethiopia, Kenya - Floods (ECHO 30 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several parts of Kenya and Ethiopia over the last week, causing floods  and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and widespread damage.According to media reports, in Kenya, at least 12 people died, of which seven were in Gilgil Town (Nauru County), three others in West Pokot County, one in the capital Nairobi, and another in Suswa Town (Narok County). In addition, thousands of people have been displaced (including 812 households in Marsabit County, northern Kenya), and several houses damaged.In Ethiopia, seven people died, and 4,500 households were affected in Dhawa Zone (Somali Region, western Ethiopia), an area affected by drought.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over north-western Kenya, south-western, central and north-eastern Ethiopia.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 29 Mar 2023)
description: Strong winds, tornadoes, hailstorms and thunderstorms continued to affect the Lower Mississippi Valley (in particular Mississippi, Georgia and Alabama, south-eastern USA) since 24 March, causing severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to strong winds) that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 28 March, 23 fatalities (21 in Mississippi, one in Georgia, one in Alabama), 72 injured people (70 in Mississippi, two in Georgia) and 82 evacuated people (29 in Mississippi across two shelters, 53 in Georgia in three shelters). In addition, FEMA reports 313 destroyed houses in Mississippi and up to 100 damaged houses in Georgia.Over the next 24 hours, locally strong winds, hailstorms and thunderstorms are forecast over the three already affected states.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides (ECHO 29 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting north-western Brazil (in particular Acre and Amazonas States) since 24 March, causing floods, rivers overflow and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.In Acre State, WHO PAHO reports as of 27 March, 961 displaced people (a number of these in fice shelters) across Brasileia, Assis Brasil and Xapuri Municipalities (southern Acre), due to floods. In Amazonas State, 172 people have been displaced in the Manaus Municipality (eastern Amazonas) due to landslides and floods.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over both the already affected states.

title: Bolivia - Floods, update (ECHO 29 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect the country, causing floods and resulting in widespread damage.According to the Bolivia Ministry of Health (MoH), more than 800 people have been affected by recent flood events due to the overflow of the Acre river in Cobija City (Pando Department, northern Bolivia).Since January, the rainy season has been hitting 42 municipalities (12% of the total) across six departments of Bolivia, affecting at least 150,000 people and destroying 100,000 ha of crops as reported by UN OCHA.On 29-30 March, moderate to heavy rain is expected over western Bolivia.

title: Peru - Heavy rains, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 29 Mar 2023)
description: The heavy rains since January 2023 have taken a big toll on Peru. According to the National Institute of Civil Defense of Peru (INDECI), 12 people have died, 134,000 people have been affected, out of which 19,000 are severely affected / have remained homeless.11,000 people have sought refuge in 104 shelters mapped by humanitarian actors, 48,000 houses have been damaged, out of which 7,000 severely. 152 health centres have been affected, out of which 26 are out of service or destroyed.The Government of Peru has declared a state of national emergency “level 5” for the departments of Tumbes, Piura, and Lambayeque, enabling the mobilization of national resources available, if necessary with the support of international aid.

title: Ecuador - Landslide, update (ECHO 29 Mar 2023)
description: Following the deadly landslide that occurred in Alausí Canton (Chimborazo Province, central Ecuador) on 26 March, the number of casualties increased.The Risk Management Secretariat of Ecuador (SGR) reports, as of 29 March at 2.00 UTC, 12 fatalities, 67 missing, 31 injured and 32 rescued people. In addition, 500 people have been affected as well as more than 160 houses.National authorities are conducting rescue and emergency activities and are providing help for those affected.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is forecast over most parts of the country while heavy precipitation are expected over western Ecuador, including the Andean area.

title: Spain - Wildfires in Castellon and Teruel provinces, update (ECHO 28 Mar 2023)
description: Wildfires in Villanueva de Viver Municipality (Castellón Province, close to the border with Teruel Province, eastern Spain) hampered by the hot and dry wind with gusts of more than 50 km/h, are still ongoing.According to the  National Security Department of Spain (DSN), people living in the Municipalities of Torralba del Pinar, Pavías and Higueras have been evacuated, bringing the total number of evacuated people to more than 1,800.The firefighting operations conducted by regional authorities are still ongoing.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated on 23 March to provide the damage assessment (), and two maps have been produced so far.According to the  European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire risk on 28-29 March is expected to be from high to extreme over the affected area.

title: Peru - Severe weather, update (ECHO 28 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting most of Peru since January 2023, causing floods, rivers overflow and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage. The most affected departments are Piura (the worst affected one), Tumbes and Lambayeque in the north and Ayacucho and Arequipa in the south.UN OCHA and the National Center for Estimation, Prevention and Disaster Risk Reduction (CENEPRED) report, as of 27 March, 71 fatalities, nearly 131,000 people in need of humanitarian assistance, around 54,000 damaged houses and 144 destroyed bridges across the country.The Government has declared the state of emergency for 1,030 districts (54% of the total of districts across the country). Humanitarian organizations are currently responding to this emergency as well as collecting more information on needs and risks.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Ecuador  - Landslide and floods (ECHO 28 Mar 2023)
description: On 26 March, a huge landslide caused by a geological fault and the heavy rains occurred in Alausí Town (Chimborazo Province, central Ecuador) leading to casualties and widespread damage (such as water and electricity services).According to the Risk Management Secretariat of Ecuador (SGR), seven people died, 64 are still missing, 23 have been injured and 500 were affected as well as 163 houses.Since January, the country has been impacted by heavy rainfall, floods and landslides that resulted in at least 22 fatalities and more than 32,600 affected people.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is forecast over most parts of the country while heavy rain is expected over western Ecuador.

title: South Africa - Floods (ECHO 28 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting southern South Africa (in particular the Eastern Cape Province) since 23 March, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage. The worst affected municipalites are Ingquza Hill, King Sabata Dalindyebo and Port St Johns (northern Easter Cape Province).Media report, as of 28 March, three fatalities, of which two in Ingquza Hill Municipality and one more in King Sabata Dalindyebo Municipality. In addition, one person was reportd still missing across the mentioned Ingquza Hill Municipality. Moreover, 500 people have been evacuated (some of these in one temporarily accomodiation centre) and ten bridges destroyed throughout the Port St Johns Municipality.Over the next 24 hours, drier conditions are forecast over the Eastern Cape Provinces.

title: Somalia - Floods (ECHO 28 Mar 2023)
description: Several areas of Somalia have received light to moderate rains over the last week, signaling an early start of the Gu (April-May-June) rainy season. Rainfall forecasts indicate a continuation of the rains in most parts of the country through March, but with drier than normal conditions towards the end of the season – with high likelihood of the current rainy season still being below expected average.Flash floods in Baardheere District, Gedo Region, have reportedly killed 14 people, displaced thousands more and destroyed property. Thousands of households living in overcrowded internal displacement sites are affected, with partners already struggling to contain a surge in disease outbreaks, including acute watery diarrhea/cholera, and measles cases.Epidemic outbreaks are likely to increase due to the risk of people consuming contaminated water and lack of adequate sanitation and hygiene facilities and services.Partners in affected areas have identified critical needs in shelter, health, water and sanitation, and non-food items - emergency response ongoing by DG ECHO supported partners in most affected areas.

title: Spain - Wildfires in Castellon and Teruel provinces, update (ECHO 27 Mar 2023)
description: According to the National Civil Defense of Spain (DSN), the perimeter of the fire that occurred on 23 March in Villanueva de Viver Municipality (Castellón Province, close to the border with Teruel Province, eastern Spain) continues to be contained at about 40 km and the burnt area is of about 4,000 ha.Approximately 270 people living in San Agustín Municipality (Teruel Province) were authorized to return to their homes on 26 March while approxiamtely 1,840 residents of various areas of Castellón Province are still evacuated.National authorities are still battling the fires with more than 500 troops, including the UME military and air, state and regional means along the Maimona ravine in Castellón and defence lines have been established to prevent the spread of fire towards the Sierra de Espadán Natural Park.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated on 23 March to provide the damage assessment ().According to the  European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), the fire risk on 27-28 March is expected to be from high to very high over the affected area.

title: Bolivia - Floods (ECHO 27 Mar 2023)
description: Since the past week, heavy rainfall hit Santa Cruz Department (eastern Bolivia), causing the overflow of the Pirai and Rio Grande rivers and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS) and media, at least two people have died, of which one in El Torno municipality and another in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. In addition, seven people have been rescued and roads flooded.On 27-28 March, light to moderate rain is expected over most parts of the Santa Cruz Department.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Mar 2023)
description: Several tornadoes, strong winds, hailstorms and thunderstorms have been affecting the Lower Mississippi Valley (in particular Mississippi, Alabama and Tennessee, south-eastern USA) since 24 March, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to tornadoes) that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage.NOAA reports at least 12 tornadoes across the three aformentioned states over 24-25 March. In Mississippi, the worst affected counties are: Rolling Fork, Silver City, Winona, Sharkey, Smithville, Amory and Montgomery.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 26 March, 25 fatalities, 55 injured, 65 evacuated people across three shelters and a total of approximately 2,000 damaged houses throughout Mississippi. In addition, FEMA reports 5,200 power outages in Mississippi, 10,500 in Alabama and 1,800 in Tennessee.Over the next 24 hours, strong winds, hailstorms and thunderstorms are forecast over the already affected Mississippi and Alabama and over southern Texas, Louisiana, Georgia and the Carolinas.

title: Kenya - Floods (ECHO 27 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern and southern Kenya (in particular the Greater Nairobi Metropolitan area) since 22 March causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 27 March, one fatality, one injured person, more than 100 displaced families and a number of destroyed houses across the Greater Nairobi Metropolitan area. In addition, several displaced people and several destroyed houses were reported across the Moyale Town (Marsabit County, northern Kenya, bordering with southern Ethiopia).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the Country.

title: USA - Tornadoes (ECHO 24 Mar 2023)
description: Tornadoes have been affecting the Greater Los Angeles region (southern California) on 21-22 March. NOAA reports two tornadoes across the area over the considered period.Media reports, as of 24 March, one injured person and 17 damaged houses across the Montebello County due to a tornado occurred on 22 March. Moreover, 25 damaged houses were reported across the Santa Barbara County due to a previous tornado occurred on 21 March.Over the next 24 hours, no more strong winds are forecast over southern California.

title: Afghanistan, Pakistan – Earthquake, update (ECHO 24 Mar 2023)
description: The death toll from the 6.5-magnitude earthquake which struck northeast Afghanistan near the border with Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province (northwestern Pakistan) on 21 March has risen to 16. The most affected provinces are Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) province in Pakistan and Badakhshan in Afghanistan.In Afghanistan, according to UN OCHA, at least 5 people were killed and 80 were injured.  653 houses were damaged. In Pakistan, the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) reports 11 dead, 79 others injured, and 172 damaged houses, most of them in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.UN OCHA has deployed assessment and response teams to provide immediate relief to affected families, both in Afghanistan and Pakistan.Tremors were also felt in Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan, and India.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 24 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting northern and central Indonesia (in particular the Sumatra and the Java Islands) since 20 March, causing floods and strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 24 March, four injured people, 69 damaged houses (of which two totally damaged) and a total of more than 250 affected people across the Binjai City Regency (North Sumatra Province) due to the strong wind.In addition, ADINet reports 50 displaced people, approximately 50 damaged houes and a total of around 200 affected people across the Cianjur Regency (West Java Province) due to floods.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall and strong wind is forecast over the whole Sumatra Island and the whole Java Island.

title: Iran - Earthquake (ECHO 24 Mar 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.6 M at a depth of 18 km occurred in the far north-western Iran, near the border with Türkiye, on 24 March at 3:16 UTC (7:46 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 11 km south-west of the Khoy City (West Azerbaijan Province) and 45 km east of the border with far eastern Türkiye.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 196,000 people were exposed to strong shaking and up to 301,000 people to moderate shaking.Media report, as of 24 March, a number of damaged houses across villages nearby the epicentre, while there are no report of damaged houses across the Khoy City. The earthquake was felt also across the neighbouring Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic (southern Azerbaijan, bordering with northern Iran).The same area already suffered from a 5.9 magnitude earthquake on 28 January and two 5.8 magnitude earthquakes, respectively, on 18 January 2023 and in October 2022.

title: Yemen - Floods (ECHO 24 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rains and winds caused widespread damage to Internally Displaced People, IDPs-hosting sites in Marib City and Marib al Wadi in Yemen between 13 - 18 March.While figures are still being verified by humanitarian actors, it is estimated that some 50, 000 individuals are affected by the rains and winds that either completely or partially damaged their shelters.DG ECHO partners are present and providing a rapid response in the form of emergency shelter, distribution of non-food items and emergency cash distributions.

title: Malawi - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY and floods, update (ECHO 24 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, associated to the passage of the tropical cyclone FREDDY and its remnants on 12-15 March, affected southern Malawi, causing severe floods and triggering landslides.The death toll continues to increase across the country. The Department of Disaster Management Affairs of Malawi (DoDMA) reports, as of 23 March, 511 fatalities, 533 people still missing, 1,332 injured people and 563,771 displaced people (a number of these across 577 accomodation centres) throughout the Southern Region.On 23 March, Malawi requested support from the EU Civil Protection Mechanism for shelter, health, WASH, non-food, and food items.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over Northern and Central Regions, while drier conditions are expected over the already affected Southern Region.

title: M6.8 in Ecuador - UNITAR-UNOSAT Activation
description: UNITAR-UNOSAT Potentially Damaged Buildings has been activated

title: Tajikistan - Earthquake (ECHO 23 Mar 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.9 M at a depth of 6 km occurred in northern Tajikistan, close to the border with western Kyrgyzstan, on 22 March at 20.07 UTC (23 March at 1.07 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 4 km north of Paldarok Village (Kuhistoni Mastchoh District, Sughd Region).USGS PAGER estimates that up to 5,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and 4,000 to strong shaking.According to media, there are no immediate reports of casualties or damage.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 23 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting central California (in particular the San Francisco Bay Area) since 21 March, causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of  23 March, five fatalities across the San Francisco Bay Area and the neighbouring Counties of Contra Costa, San Mateo and Santa Clara, mainly due to fallen trees. In addition, media report at least one injured person, more than 700,000 temporary  power outages and around 100 cancelled flights from the San Francisco International Airport.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall, strong winds and thunderstorms are forecast over most of California. NOAA has issued a flood warning over the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 23 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continued to affect north-eastern Brazil (in particular Ceara, Maranhao, Para, Pernambuco, and Piau States) over the last week, causing floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.In Maranhão State, media report, as of 23 March, six fatalities, of which three in Açailândia City due to floods and two in Santa Luzia Municipality due to a landslide. Around 800 displaced families were reported across the State. More than 400 displaced families were also reported across Pará State. Furthermore, media report several evacuated families throughout Pernambuco State.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the already affected State, except over Pernambuco State.

title: Peru - Severe weather, update (ECHO 23 Mar 2023)
description: Peru continues to experience heavy rainfall across several Departments since January 2023, causing floods, triggering landslides and leading to casualties and damage.According to the National Institute of Civil Defense of Peru (INDECI), in Piura Department, 11 people died, two are still missing, 31 have been injured and more than 17,800 have been affected.In Huancavelica Department, two persons died five have been injured and more than 2,000 have been affected. In Lima, two people died while more than 2,500 have been affected. In Ayacucho, one person died and more than 3,000 have been affected. In Lambayeque Department, one person is still missing, four have been injured and more than 2,500 people have been affected. In Ancash, 35 people have been injured and almost 3,000 affected.Moderate rain is forecast over most parts of the country while heavy rainfall is expected across central-eastern Peru.

title: Syria - Floods, update (ECHO 22 Mar 2023)
description: On 19 March, heavy rainfall continued to affect several camps (sheltering centres and residential compounds that were established after the seismic activity started on 6 February) across the Governorates of Aleppo and Idlib, causing widespread floods and resulting in damage.In Northwest Syria, both Idlib and Northern Aleppo are affected. 54 camps for internally displaced people (IDP) were affected in the Idlib area, mainly in Harim and Idlib districts. Over 570 tents weredamaged. In northern Aleppo, 62 IDP camps and reception centres for the earthquake survivors were affected.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode (EMSR655) to provide the damage assessment.For the next 24 hours, no rain is expected for northern Syria.

title: Pakistan - Flash floods (ECHO 22 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-western Pakistan (particularly the Balochistan Province) since 17 March, causing flash floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 22 March, ten fatalities, of which eight in the Awaran District (southern Balochistan Province) and two more in the Zhob District (northern Balochistan Province). In addition, media also report several damaged houses across Awaran, Zhob and Khuzdar Districts.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the Balochistan Province.

title: Afghanistan, Pakistan - Earthquake (ECHO 22 Mar 2023)
description: The U.S. Geological Survey reported a magnitude 6.5 earthquake with epicenter 40km south-southeast of Jurm district in Afghanistan at a depth of 187km hit the region on 21 March 2023. Three aftershocks of magnitude 3.9 were recorded so far in the Hindukush region bordering Afghanistan, Pakistan and Tajikistan. 13 deaths were reported but the number of fatalities may rise as search and rescue teams reach more affected villages.In Afghanistan, at least 4 people were killed, and 75 others injured according to a Taliban spokesman.In Pakistan, the provincial Disaster Management authority (PDMA) of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) reported nine fatalities and 44 injuries across the province. 19 houses collapsed in different parts of the province, particularly in Lower Dir district. Landslides and road closures are reported. Cracks were also reported in buildings in Islamabad and Rawalpindi.In India, strong tremors were widely felt across the northern region including Jammu & Kashmir, Delhi NCR, Punjab and Himachal Pradesh and part of Northwest India, including Rajasthan (Jaipur and adjoining districts) and Gujrat. Tremors were also felt in Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and Kyrgyzstan.

title: Malawi, Mozambique - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY and floods, update (ECHO 22 Mar 2023)
description: The passage of the Tropical Cyclone FREDDY and its remnants on 11-15 March, affected southern Malawi and central-northern Mozambique (in particular Tete and Zambezia Provinces), causing severe floods and landslides that have resulted in an increased number of casualties and widespread damage.In Malawi, the Department of Disaster Management Affairs of Malawi (DoDMA) reports, as of 21 March, 507 fatalities, 437 people currently still missing, 1,332 injured people and 553,614 displaced people (a number of these across 543 accomodation centres) throughout the Southern Region.In Mozambique, the National Institute for Disaster Management (INGD) reports 165 fatalities, 511 injured people, approximately 163,456 displaced people (a number of these across 213 accomodation centres) and a total of nearly 886,487 affected people across Zambezia, Tete, Niassa, Manica and Sofala Provinces, mainly due to the second landfall of FREDDY occurred on 11 March.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is still forecast over most of Malawi, northern Mozambique and most of Madagascar.

title: Brazil - Landslides and floods (ECHO 21 Mar 2023)
description: Since the past week, heavy rain has affected several municipalities of Ceará State (north-eastern Brazil), causing floods, triggering landslides and leading to casualties and damage.According to the authorities of Ceará State, three people died, two have been injured, and two others were rescued following a landslide in Aratuba Municipality (northeastern Ceará) occurred on 16 March. In addition, 50 people have been evacuated and 15 houses damaged.In Itapipoca City, 30 families have been preventively evacuated due to floods and landslides, while several municipalities have been declared under a state of emergency after heavy rainfall.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over the affected State.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rain, strong winds hail and thunderstorms affected Chiang Mai Province (northern Thailand) on 18 March, causing floods and resulting in damage.According to media reports, at least 600 houses have been damaged and power cuts have been recorded across several districts of the province.For the next 24 hours, more isolated thundershowers with gusty winds and hail are forecast over the affected State.

title: India - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, thunderstorms and hailstorms have been affecting central India (in particular the Madhya Pradesh State) since 17 March, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to lightning) that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 21 March, 16 fatalities across several cities throughout Madhya Pradesh, namely four in Khandwa, three in Sagar, two each in Satna and Raisen, and one each respectively in Narmadapura, Dhar, Ratlam, Ashok Nagar and Damoh, mainly due to lightning and strong winds associated incidents. In addition, 14 people have been injured and several houses damaed in the aforementioned cities.Over the next 24 hours, thunderstorms accompanied by lightning and hailstorms are  forecast locally over Madhya Pradesh State.

title: Malawi - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY and floods, update (ECHO 21 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, associated to the passage of the tropical cyclone FREDDY and its remnants on 12-15 March, affected southern Malawi, causing severe floods and triggering landslides.The death toll continues to increase across the country. The Department of Disaster Management Affairs of Malawi (DoDMA) reports, as of 20 March, 499 fatalities, 427 people missing, more than 1,300 injured and nearly 508,250 displaced people (a number of these across 534 accomodation centres) throughout the Southern Region.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country, while moderate rainfall is forecast over the southern part of the Southern Region.

title: Bolivia - Severe weather (ECHO 20 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, hailstorms and thunderstorms have been affecting most of the country (particularly central and southern departments) since the beginning of the rainy season (early January) causing floods and a number of severe weather-related incidents (in particular due to hailstorms) that have resulted in casualties and damage.The National Civil Defence and WHO PAHO report, as of 16 March, five fatalities, of which three across the Chuquisaca Department and two more in La Paz Department. In addition, the Civil Defence reports more than 33,700 affected families, 17 destroyed houses and 78 damaged houses in 41 municipalites across six departments.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Malawi - Tropical cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 20 Mar 2023)
description: Very heavy rainfall, associated to the passage of the tropical cyclone FREDDY and its remnants on 12-15 March, affected southern Malawi, causing severe floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in an increased number of casualties and widespread damage.The Department of Disaster Management Affairs of Malawi (DoDMA) reports, as of 19 March, 476 fatalities, 349 people still missing, 918 injured people and nearly 491,000 displaced people (a number of these in 533 accomodation centres) across the Southern Region.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Cameroon - Floods and landslides (ECHO 20 Mar 2023)
description: On 18-19 March, Buea City (the capital of Southwest Region, southwestern Cameroon) experienced torrential rains that caused floods and landslides and resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, at least one person died, six are missing, and five have been injured. In addition, the same source reports damage to properties and flooded roads.National authorities and volunteers of the Red Cross are providing help for those most affected.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over the affected City.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 20 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms have been affecting eastern Malaysia (the Malaysian part of the Borneo Island), in particular the western State of Sarawak, over the past 48 hours, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 20 March, nearly 250 evacuated people (a part of these in two evacuation centres) and a number of affected people across the Kuching City area (the Capital of Sarawak State). Media also report several flooded roads across the city.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rinfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole eastern Malaysia.

title: Ecuador, Peru - Earthquake, update (ECHO 20 Mar 2023)
description: Following the 6.8 M earthquake (6.5 for Ecuadorean Authorities) that occurred on 18 March at 17:12 UTC that affected mostly the Provinces of Guayas, Azuay, Cañar y El Oro (central-southwestern Ecuacuor), the amount of injured people and damage has increased. In addition, the seismic event hit Tumbes Province (north-western Peru) and resulted in casualties and damage.In Ecuador, the Risk Management Secretariat of Ecuador (SGR) reports 13 fatalities (11 in El Oro Province and two in Azuay Province), 461 injured people, 89 destroyed houses and 192 damaged.In Peru, according to the National Institute of Civil Defense of Peru (INDECI), one person died, another has been injured, 140 people have been affected, and more than 50 houses have been damaged or destroyed across Tumbes Province.National authorities are still conducting the damage assessment and are providing help for those affected.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected over western Ecuador (including the affected Provinces) and north-western Peru.

title: Syria – Flash floods (ECHO 20 Mar 2023)
description: On 16 March, a heavy rainstorms swept through Northern Syria and the wider region. In Northeast Syria, the consequent floods caused significant damages, the destruction of infrastructure and loss of livelihoods, leaving bridges and agricultural land damaged.At least eight people died due to the floods in Al Hasakah, Ar-Raqqa and Kobane. The Abu Khashab camp suffered severe damages with accumulation of mud on the roads and water entering the tents, worsening the living conditions of more than 10,000 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs).In Northwest Syria, damages were reported on several IDP sites. One injury was reported, 375 tents were completely destroyed, and 531 tents were partially damaged. The urgent assistance required includes tents, NFIs, plastic sheeting and food parcels.

title: Ecuador - Earthquake (ECHO 19 Mar 2023)
description: On 18 March at 12:12 local time (17:12 UTC) an 6.8 magnitude earthquake at a depth of 66 km hit the locality of Balao, in the province of Guayas (coastal area).The earthquake was felt in the coastal provinces (Guayas, El Oro, Manabí, Los Ríos, Santa Elena and in the Andean province of Azuay).According to the latest data from the Ecuador Risk Management Secretariat, 14 people have died and 446 have been injured, 84 houses have been destroyed and 180 partially destroyed. Approximately 80 schools and 33 health centres are affected.Assessments are in progress, and the figures of the damages might increase.The National Emergency Operations Committee has been activated and is led by President Guillermo Lasso for coordinating the response. Local Emergency Operations Centres are also activated.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 17 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, heavy snowfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting central and northern California (in particular across mountainous communities) and the neghbouring western Nevada over the last days, causing floods, some strong wind-related incidents and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 16 March, five confirmed fatalities across central California, 616 currently evacuated people in 32 shelters and approximately 27,000 mandatory evacuation orders throughout northern and central California. FEMA also reports multiple road closures due to landslides and floods.In addition, heavy snowfall, strong winds and very low temperature (due to the so-termed "Nor'easter" storm) have been affecting the North East region (in particular Massachusetts, New York and New Hampshire) since 14 March. Media reports, as of 17 March, around 590,000 power outages and approximately 800 cancelled flights throughout the affected area.Over the next 48 hours, dryer conditions are forecast over California and Nevada, while heavy rainfall, heavy snowfall and strong winds are forecast over the North East region.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 17 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect several parts of Indonesia, causing floods and leading to displacements and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), in Luwu Regency (South Sulawesi), 128 people have been displaced, and almost 1,500 have been affected. At least 50 people have been evacuated in two evacuation centres, and approximately 7,400 others have been affected in Gresik Regency (East Java Province). In East and South Kalimantan, more than 6,100 people have been affected.On 17-18 March, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms are forecast over the affected Provinces.

title: Malawi - Tropical cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 17 Mar 2023)
description: As of 16 March, tropical cyclone FREDDY is completely dissipated and it is a low pressure area over the Mozambique Channel.Very heavy rainfall and strong winds, associated to its passage across southern Malawi, caused severe floods and triggered landslides that have resulted in an increased number of casualties and widespread damage.The Department of Disaster Management Affairs of Malawi (DoDMA) and World Food Programme (WFP) report, as of 16 March, 326 fatalities, 201 people missing, 796 injured, more than 183,000 displaced, about 500 rescued people and a total of approximately 501,000 affected people across the Southern Region.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Brazil - Landslide (ECHO 15 Mar 2023)
description: On 12 March, a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in the Jorge Teixeira neighbourhood of Manaus City (eastern Amazonas State, north-western Brazil) resulting in casualties and damage.According to the Civil Protection of Amazonas State, as of 13 March, eight people have died while three others have been rescued. In addition, media reported 11 destroyed houses and sheltered people in a local school following the landslide events.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast across Manaus.

title: USA - Severe weather, update (ECHO 15 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, heavy snowfall, strong winds and thunderstorms continued to affect northern and central California and the neghbouring western Nevada over the last week, causing floods, flash floods, snowmelts, rivers overflow and a number of strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage. The worst affected counties in California are Monterey, Merced and Tulare.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 14 March, two fatalities across the Monterey County (central California), 551 currently evacuated people in 26 shelters and approximately 16,000 mandatory evacuation orders in ten counties throughout northern and central California. In addition, several roads have been closed across 24 counties.The declaration of state of emergency for 21 counties in California and for 14 counties in Nevada is still in force.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall and heavy snowfall is forecast over central and northern California. Heavy rainfall is also forecast over southern California. Moderate rainfall is forecast over most of Nevada. NOAA has issued winter storm warning over several counties across northern and central California.

title: Thailand - Severe weather (ECHO 15 Mar 2023)
description: On 12-14 March, heavy rainfall, thunderstorms and strong winds have affected northern, northeast and central regions of Thailand including the Bangkok area, resulting in damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), almost 1,900 people have been affected as well as 626 houses across the Provinces of Kamphaeng Phet, Sukhotai, Phitsanulok, Phrae, Phayao, and Nan.For the next 24 hours light rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over parts of northern and central Thailand.

title: Mozambique, Malawi - Tropical cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 15 Mar 2023)
description: As of 15 March, tropical cyclone FREDDY is dissipating and it is moving as a low pressure area between the Zambezia Province (central-northern Mozambique) and the Mozambique Channel.Very heavy rainfall associated with the passage of FREDDY (after its second landfall on 11 March) across central-northern Mozambique and southern Malawi caused severe floods and mudslides that resulted in casualties and widespread damage.In Malawi, UN OCHA reports as of 14 March, 190 fatalities, 16 people missing, 59,000 affected and approximately 19,000 displaced people across the Southern Region. The President of Malawi has declared a State of Disaster for this region.In Mozambique, the National Institute for Disaster Management (INGD) reports ten fatalities, 14 injured and around 37,780 displaced people across Nassa, Zambezia, Tete, Manica and Sofala.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over southern Malawi and over Zambezia, Sofala and Tete Provinces (central-northern Mozambique).

title: Australia - Floods (ECHO 14 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Australia (in particular the northern Northern Territory and the neighbouring far northern Queensland) since 10 March, causing floods and the rising of rivers that have resulted in evacuations and damage.Media report, as of 14 March, at least 170 evacuated people and nearly 40 damaged houses across Burketown (the most affected), Riversleigh, Gregory Downs, Doomadgee, and Normanton Towns (all of these in the far northern Queensland, near the coast of the Gulf of Carpentaria). The Burketown airport was reported flooded and closed. In addition, several communities have been cut off across the Victoria Daly Region (Northern Territory).Over the next 24 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over the already affected area. The Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) has issued two major flood warnings over northern Queensland.

title: Mozambique, Malawi - Tropical cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 14 Mar 2023)
description: After its second landfall on central Mozambique on 11 March, tropical cyclone FREDDY continued northward inland over Zambezia and Tete Provinces (Mozambique) and southern Malawi, weakening. On 13 March at 12.00 UTC, its centre was located in the southern Tete Province very close to the border with southern Malawi, with maximum sustained winds of 51 km/h (tropical depression).The UN OCHA reports, as of 13 March, 101 fatalities, over 16,600 affected, more than 11,100 displaced people, 40 evacuation centres and 16 people missing in southern Malawi, bordering with Mozambique. Media also report five fatalities across Mozambique, due to the second landfall of FREDDY.On 14-16 March FREDDY is forecast to continue inland over southern Malawi and the Zambezia Province and re-enter into the Mozambique Channel, further weakening and dissipating.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is still forecast over southern Malawi and over Zambezia, Sofala, Manica, Tete, and Niassa Provinces (Mozambique).

title: Vanuatu - Tropical cyclones JUDY and KEVIN, update (ECHO 14 Mar 2023)
description: Following the passage of tropical cyclones JUDY and KEVIN on 28 February - 3 March over central-southern Vanuatu, 251,346 people (about 80% of the total population) have been affected.UN OCHA reports 5,156 still evacuated people in 106 evacuation centres located in Shefa and Tafea Province and 28 damaged and inaccessible schools. National authorities, NGOs and humanitarian partners are providing help for those most affected.Following Vanuatu’s request for assistance from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism, (UCPM) one country offered various capacities.The Copernicus Emergency Management Service was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 4 March and 16 maps have been produced so far.On 14-15 March, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is expected across most parts of Vanuatu, particularly over Shefa Province.

title: Syria – Water shortage in Northeast Syria  (ECHO 14 Mar 2023)
description: Alouk water station has not been operational for the past 7 months causing critical drinking water shortages for some 500,000 people in Hassakeh and surrounding areas.Moreover, the low level of the Euphrates river is restricting the power supply for water pumps, which will in turn further exacerbate the water shortage.While DG ECHO partners provide emergency water supply, a longer term solution is required urgently. Partners are also calling for support for monitoring and managing existing groundwater resources to ensure its safe and sustainable use.

title: Peru - Severe weather, update (ECHO 14 Mar 2023)
description: The number of casualties is increasing following heavy rainfall, floods and landslides that have been affecting several Departments of Peru since the beginning of March.According to UN OCHA, at least 58 people have died while the National Institute of Civil Defense of Peru (INDECI) reports more than 24,000 affected people and more than 6,400 damaged or destroyed houses.The State of Emergency has been declared in the Departments of Cajamarca, La Libertad, Lambayeque and Piura for the impact due to the huge precipitations.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is expected across north-western, western and south-western Peru while light to moderate rain is expected across the rest of the country.

title: JUDY-23 - UNITAR-UNOSAT Activation
description: UNITAR-UNOSAT Potentially Damaged Buildings has been activated

title: Indonesia - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 13 Mar 2023)
description: On 11 March, Mount Merapi, located between Central Java Province and the Special Region of Yogyakarta, increased its volcanic activity (still ongoing) with pyroclastic and lava flows that descended mostly into the southwestern flank from the summit.Following the eruption, several villages located in the Regencies of Boyolali and Magelang have been affected by volcanic ash but there have been no reports of significant humanitarian impact.National authorities issued a 7 km potential danger zone from the crater, the potential hazard is in the form of pyroclastic flows and lava flows through the south-southwest sector including the Boyong River for a maximum of 5 km, the Bedog River, Krasak, Bebeng for a maximum of 7 km and through the southeastern sector that includes the Woro River for a maximum of 3 km and the Gendol River for 5 km.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 13 Mar 2023)
description: Since 9 March, heavy rainfall has been affecting several Regencies of the South Sumatra and Lampung Provinces causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), one person died in Lahat Regency and more than 18,400 people have been affected across the Regencies of Muara Enim, Panukal Abab Lematang Ilir, Musi Rawas, Muara Enim, and Lahat. In addition, the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB) reports two fatalities due to a landslide occurred in Lampung Province.Furthermore, following the landslide that occurred on 6 March in Serasan District (Natuna Regency, northern Riau Islands, north-western Indonesia), the death toll reached 46 people while nine people are still missing.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over most parts of South Sumatra and Lampung Province while no rain is expected across Riau Islands Province.

title: Madagascar, Mozambique, Malawi - Tropical cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 13 Mar 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone FREDDY made its second landfall on Mozambique early in the afternoon (UTC) of 11 March very close to the coastal City of Quelimane (southern Zambezia Province, central-northern Mozambique), with maximum sustained winds up to 175 km/h.On 13 March at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located inland over the southern Tete Province (northern Mozambique) approximately 40 km west of the border with southern Malawi, with maximum sustained winds of 63 km/h (tropical storm).Media report, as of 13 March, at least one fatalities due to the second landfall of FREDDY in Mozambique, while needs assessments are still ongoing. The real impact of FREDDYs second landfall in Mozambique will only be known in the coming days.On 14-15 March FREDDY is forecast to continue north-west inland over the Tete Province and to turn south-east over southern Malawi and Zambezia Province (Mozambique), weakening into tropical depression.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall and strong wind are forecast over these Provinces in Mozambique and over southern Malawi.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 13 Mar 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, heavy snowfall, strong winds and thunderstorms have been affecting northern and central California and the neghbouring western Nevada over the past few days, causing floods, rivers overflow (in particular the Pajaro River) and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 12 March, two fatalities across the Monterey County (central California), 196 currently evacuated people across 23 shelters and approximately 6,000 mandatory evacuation orders in ten Counties throughout northern and central California.The Government of California declared the state of emergency for 21 Counties. In addition, also the Government of Nevada declared the state of emergency for 14 Counties.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall, heavy snowfall and strong winds are still forecast over the already affected area. Heavy rainfall is also forecast over southern California. NOAA has issued winter storm and high wind warnings over several Counties across northern and central California and north-western Nevada.

title: Peru - Cyclone Yaku, river overflow and floods, update  (ECHO 13 Mar 2023)
description: Due to Cyclone Yaku six people died in Piura and Lambayeque Departments. Landslide in Huancabamba (Piura Department) has blocked the main road, leading to 70,000 inhabitants isolated.The State of Emergency has been declared in various provinces of Ancash, Cajamarca, La Libertad, Lambayeque, Lima, Piura, Arequipa and Tumbes, departments.On 10 March, an increase in the flow of La Leche River was reported as result of the intense rains recorded in Lambayeque, five people are reported missing.Support mechanisms have been activated by Indeci, the Armed Forces, Police and the Ministries of Housing and Transport.

title: Vanuatu – Multiple crises, update  (ECHO 13 Mar 2023)
description: Vanuatu has been affected by destructive winds and heavy rains, brought by two category 4 cyclones and followed by a 6.6 M earthquake between 1- 4 of March.The disasters have caused widespread damage and destruction. Port Vila area and Tanna Island are the most affected areas. The cost of damages is estimated at USD 50 000 000. 30,000 households are affected, and 5,000 people are still displaced in evacuation centres.15 days after the disasters, food security, lack of drinkable water, and water-borne disease risks are a growing common concern among stakeholders.The National Disaster Management Office (NDMO) has announced that they will produce a National Response Plan (NRP) that will be shared with stakeholders this week.The EU and DG ECHO are in Vanuatu assessing the situation with the local authorities and the other humanitarian agencies. DG ECHO is finalizing the analysis about which funding could be used to provide assistance for the people affected by this crisis.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 28 Feb 2023)
description: Strong winds, tornadoes and hailstorms have been affecting central USA (in particular Oklahoma and the neighbouring Kansas States) over the past 48 hours, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to tornadoes) that have resulted in casualties and damage. Over the last 24 hours, nine tornadoes across both aforementioned States were reported by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).FEMA reports, as of 27 February, several injured people, 12 damaged houses, several closed roads and a number of power outages across Norman City and the Cleveland City area (Oklahoma).Over the next 48 hours, no more strong wind is forecast over the already affected States.

title: Brazil - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 28 Feb 2023)
description: The number of casualties has increased following heavy rain, floods and landslides that occurred in São Paulo State (particularly the northern coastal areas) over the past week.According to media reports, 65 people have died (64 in São Sebastião and one in Ubatuba) two are still missing and more than 4,000 have been evacuated.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast in the affected State. High hydrogeological risk is in effect across the north-eastern coastal areas of São Paulo State.

title: Vanuatu, Solomon Islands - Tropical cyclone JUDY, update (ECHO 28 Feb 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone JUDY continued moving south-west over the South Pacific Ocean, toward Vanuatu and well off southern Solomon Islands. On 28 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the ocean approximately 50 km north-east of Maewo Island (northern Vanuatu) and 120 km north-east of Luganville City (Espiritu Santo Island), with maximum sustained winds of 102 km/h (tropical storm).JUDY is expected to strengthen and pass over northern and central Vanuatu (approximately 20 km west of the capital city Port Vila) on 28 February in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 145 km/h (tropical cyclone).Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are forecast over Torba, Sanma, Penama, Malampa and Shefa provinces (northern and central Vanuatu). A red alert for cyclone is in effect over the first four mentioned provinces.The UNOSAT-UNITAR satellite mapping was activated on 28 February for the population exposure analysis across the country.

title: Türkiye, Syria - Earthquakes, update (ECHO 28 Feb 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.2 M (5.6 M as registered by AFAD) at a depth of 10 km occurred in Yesilyurt District (Malatya Province, southern Türkiye) on 27 February at 9.04 UTC (12.04 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 10 km south of Malatya City, and 160 km north-east of the 7.8 M earthquake occurred on 6 February.According to national authorities, one person died, 110 people have been injured, 32 rescued, and almost 30 buildings destroyed. In Syria, UN OCHA reports human and material damage across different locations, including at least 150 injured in Northwest Syria.According to AFAD, as of 24 February, 44,218 people died, and 528,146 others have been evacuated following the two earthquakes of 7.8 and 7.5 M of 6 February. In Syria, UN OCHA reports that more than 5,900 people have died, 8.8 million people have been affected, and over 10,000 buildings damaged or destroyed.Following Türkiye’s request for assistance, the mobilised search and rescue teams had been demobilised and the operations of the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) are currently focusing on medical and in-kind assistance.In response to the request for assistance by the Syrian Embassy in Lebanon, the UCPM in-kind assistance is being channelled through Gaziantep and through Beirut, under the ERCC coordination.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 27 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting several parts of Indonesia over the past few days, causing floods and resulting in widespread damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), more than 27,000 people have been affected in the Regencies of Sumbawa, Bima and Dompu (West Nusa Tenggara Province) due to floods. More than 3,500 people have been hit by heavy rain and floods in Hulu Sungai Tengah Regency (South Kalimantan Province) as well as almost 2,000 others in Karawang Regency (West Java Province).On 27-28 February, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over the affected provinces.

title: Philippines - Floods and landslides (ECHO 27 Feb 2023)
description: On 24 February, Zamboanga del Sur Province (Zamboanga Peninsula Region, south-western Mindanao, southern Philippines), experienced heavy rain and strong winds that resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports one injured person, and 5,770 displaced people, some of them evacuated in three evacuation centres.For the next 24 hours, partly cloudy to cloudy skies with isolated rain showers or thunderstorms and moderate to strong winds are expected across Mindanao Island.

title: Vanuatu - Tropical cyclone FIFTEEN (ECHO 27 Feb 2023)
description: Tropical cyclone FIFTEEN (JUDY for Vanuatu) formed over the South Pacific Ocean and is moving south-west over the northern Vanatu Islands. On 27 February at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located offshore approximately 405 km east-northeast of Sola Town (Vanua Lava Island, northern Vanuatu), with maximum sustained winds of 65 km/h (tropical storm).FIFTEEN is forecast to move south-southwest, strengthening, passing very close to the Banks Islands (north-eastern Vanuatu) on the morning of 28 February and to cross the central and southern islands (Epi, Efate, Erromango and Tanna) on 28-29 February.For the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over the northern provinces of Vanuatu with flash flooding expected in low-lying areas, and areas close to the river banks, including coastal flooding and storm surge. A Yellow Alert is in effect for Torba, Sanma, Penama, and Malampa Provinces (northern and central Vanuatu), while Blue Alert remains for Shefa and Tafea Provinces (southern Vanuatu).

title: Indonesia - Landslide and floods (ECHO 24 Feb 2023)
description: On 20-22 February, heavy rainfall affected parts of Indonesia triggering a landslide and causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.The Indonesian National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure reports six injured people, almost 20 people have been displaced, and seven houses have been damaged following a landslide that occurred in Tegal Regency (Central Java Province). According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), 1,000 people have been affected by floods in Morowali Regency (Central Sulawesi Province).Light to moderate rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over the affected Provinces.

title: Madagascar, Mozambique - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 24 Feb 2023)
description: On 23 February, Tropical Cyclone FREDDY continued moving westward over the Mozambique Channel toward the coast of central-southern Mozambique, as a Tropical Storm. On 24 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the sea approximately 60 km east of the coast, with maximum sustained winds of 114 km/h.In Madagascar, the National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC) reports, as of 24 February, seven fatalities, more than 27,800 displaced people and a total of over 85,224 affected people in seven Regions across central and southern Madagascar. 12,594 houses have been damaged.In Mozambique, media report some closed roads due to floods in the central Sofala Province.On the forecast track, FREDDY is expected to strenghten and to make landfall over the area of Vilankulos Town (southern Mozambique) on 24 February around 12.00 UTC, with maximum sustained winds up to 145 km/h. After that, FREDDY is forecast to weaken and to continue moving inland on 24-25 February.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are forecast over Inhambane, Gaza, Sofala, and Manica Provinces. The Mozambique National Institute of Meteorology (INAM) has issued a red alert for cyclone for these Provinces.

title: Morocco - Severe weather (ECHO 23 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy snowfall and low temperatures have been affecting eastern and southern Morocco (in particular the Drâa-Tafilalet Region and the Souss-Massa Region) since 18 February, leading to evacuations, people in need and damage.Media report, as of 23 February, 87 isolated villages and approximately 24,000 families in need of assistance across Zagora Province and Ouarzazate Province (both in the Drâa-Tafilalet Region). In addition, schools have been closed and roads blocked in these two mentioned Provinces and across the Taroudant Province (Souss-Massa Region).Over the next 24 hours, no more snowfall is forecast over the already affected area.

title: Tajikistan - Earthquake (ECHO 23 Feb 2023)
description: An earthquake of 6.8 M at a depth of 20 km occurred in eastern Tajikistan close to the border with western China on 23 February at 0.37 UTC (5.37 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 65 km west of Murghob Town (Gorno-Badakhshan Region).At least five aftershocks with magnitude up to 5.0 M have been recorded in the area. USGS estimates that up to 2,000 people were exposed to strong shaking.According to media reports there are no immediate reports of any causalties or damage.

title: China - Mine collapse and landslide (ECHO 23 Feb 2023)
description: On 22 February, a mine collapse occurred in the Alxa League Prefecture (Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, northern China) resulting in casualties.According to media reports, at least four people died while almost 50 are still missing. Search and rescue teams have been immediately deployed in the area, but the activities were disrupted following a landslide that hit the facility five hours after the initial collapse.For the next 24 hours, no rain is forecast over the affected area.

title: Ecuador - Floods, landslides and severe weather (ECHO 23 Feb 2023)
description: Over 18-21 February, floods and landslides triggered by heavy rainfall affected Ecuador and resulted in casualties and damage. The most affected Provinces are Chimborazo, Esmeraldas, Los Ríos, Loja, Manabí, El Oro and Guayas.According to the Risk Management Secretariat, at least six people have died due to flood events (four across Chimborazo Province and two others in Esmeraldas Province in central and northern Ecuador).For the next 24 hours, moderate to localised heavy rain is forecast across most of western, south-western and north-western Ecuador.

title: Brazil - Severe weather, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 23 Feb 2023)
description: The death toll reached 48 people (47 in São Sebastião and one in Ubatuba), following heavy rain, floods and landslides that have been occurring across São Paulo State (particularly the northern coastal areas) since 18-19 February.According to the Civil Protection of São Paulo State, 25 people have been injured while more than 3,500 people have been displaced.On 23-24 February, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over the affected State. Very high hydrogeological risk is issued across the north-eastern coastal areas of São Paulo State including the municipalities of São Sebastião and Ubatuba.

title: Madagascar, Mozambique - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 23 Feb 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone FREDDY passed over Vatovavy-Fitovinany, Haute Matsiatra, and northern Atsimo-Andrefana Regions (central-southern Madagascar) on 22 February, as a Tropical Storm. On 23 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located over the Mozambique Channel approximately 300 km east of the eastern coast of Mozambique, with maximum sustained winds of 74 km/h.The National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC) reports, as of 23 February, four fatalities, 8,644 displaced people (a part of these across 37 evacuation centres) and a total of 16,709 affected people across 4 regions: Vatovavy, Fitovinany, Atsimo-Andrefana, and Amoron'i Mania Regions. Thousands of houses have been flooded, damaged or destroyed. Assessments are on-going on the humanitarian situation. On the forecast track, FREDDY is expected to strenghten and to make landfall close to the Inhassoro Town (northern Inhambane Province, southern Mozambique) on 24 February very early in the morning (UTC), as a Tropical Storm. GloFAS forecasts indicate a Reasonable Worst-Case scenario of 1 in 100 year flooding, with a risk of directly affecting up to 130,000 people.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are still forecast over central and southern Madagascar and over central and southern Mozambique.
