title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 22 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central Indonesia (in particular Java Island) since 19 February, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 22 February, around 60 evacuated people, more than 750 affected houses and a total of approximately 3,000 affected people across the Bekasi Regency (West Java Provinces). Around 400 people have been affected and nearly 100 houses damaged across the Majalengka Regency (West Java).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Java Island.

title: Brazil - Severe weather, floods and lanslides, update (ECHO 22 Feb 2023)
description: The situation in São Paulo State is worsening following heavy rainfall and consequent floods and landslides that are affecting the country over the past few days.According to the Civil Protection of São Paulo State, 46 people have died (45 in São Sebastião and one in Ubatuba), 26 have been injured (including seven seriously injured) and more than 2,400 people are still displaced.Search and rescue emergencies are ongoing across the most affected areas. Local authorities are restoring water supply over parts of coastal areas of northern São Paulo State.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over the affected State. Very high hydrogeological risk is still in effect across the north-eastern coastal areas of São Paulo State.

title: Madagascar, Mozambique, Mauritius, Reunion - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 22 Feb 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone FREDDY made landfall over northern Vatovavy-Fitovinany Region (central-eastern Madagascar) on 21 February in the afternoon (UTC), with maximum sustained winds of 165 km/h. On 22 February at 6.00 UTC its centre was located inland in the northern Atsimo-Andrefana Region (south-western Madagascar) with maximum sustained winds of 63 km/h.Authorities in Madagascar (BNGRC) report on 22 February four fatalities, 16,600 affected people in four regions, Vatovavy, Fitovinany, Atsimo Atsinanana and Amoron’I Mania. 11,047 people are displaced, 2 276 houses flooded and 2,267 are damaged.Media report, as of 22 February, one fatality and around 500 evacuated families in a number of shelters across Mauritius main island.Around 25,000 power outages were also reported in the peak of the event across La Reunion while 80 people have been hosted in emergency shelters.On the forecast track, FREDDY is expected to enter into the Mozambique Channel as a Tropical Storm on 22-23 February. On 24 February, it is forecast to strenghten and to make landfall in the morning (UTC) over southern Mozambique, with maximum sustained winds up to 125 km/h.

title: Türkiye, Syria – Earthquakes, update (ECHO 22 Feb 2023)
description: Following the 6.3 M (6.4 M as registered by AFAD) earthquake occurred on 20 February in Defne District (Hatay Province, southern Türkiye), very close to the border with north-western Syria, the number of casualties is increasing. In Türkiye the death toll stands at six people.After the 7.8 M and 7.5 M earthquakes occurred on 6 February in Kahramanmaras Province, 42,310 people have died, and almost 450,000 have been evacuated in Türkiye, as reported by the latest update of AFAD. UN OCHA registered 5,914 fatalities and about 10,657 injured people across Syria.The EU has allocated EUR 5.7 million, and EUR 10 million in humanitarian aid to the earthquake response respectively for Türkiye and Syria, these include both newly allocated funds and redirected funds from ongoing humanitarian projects.The Copernicus Emergency Management System was activated for Türkiye (), 64 maps have been produced so far to provide analytical satellite information on the disaster.

title: Philippines - Landslide in Mindanao  (ECHO 21 Feb 2023)
description: A landslide occurred in Iligan City on 17 February due to continuous downpours of heavy rain. This is due to a weather system, Low-Pressure Area (LPA) that entered the country on 13 February.At least 40 families (200 individuals) were pre-emptively evacuated.The Iligan City Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office has prepared food packs for the affected population and conducted rapid damage and needs assessment.ECHO partner Plan International has distributed hygiene kits through the ECHO-funded Move Up Action.The City Government of Iligan and humanitarian agencies continue to monitor the landslide risk-prone areas and activate pre-positioned clusters if the situation requires a further emergency response.

title: South Africa - Floods, update (ECHO 21 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting most of South Africa (in particular the Provinces of Eastern Cape, Northern Cape, Mpumalanga, KwaZulu-Natal, and North West) since 17 February, causing floods and rivers overflow (particularly the Orange River) that have resulted in casualties and damage. This flooding follows the one already occurred across the Country during the first half of February, that caused at least 12 fatalities.Media report, as of 21 February, two fatalities and four people stil missing across the King Sabata Dalindyebo Municipality (Eastern Cape Province). In the same Province, one person is still missing in Komani Town (formerly Queenstown). Several people have been evacuated in Lekwa Municipality (Mpumalanga Province) and in Ngaka Modiri Molema Municipality (North West Province).Furthermore, residents in the area of Vaal, Vanderkloof, and Bloemhof Dams along the Orange River (Northern Cape Province) were invited to evacuate after the controlled water discharge operate by local authorities.In Mpumalanga, about 300 families have been displaced and are currently being accommodated in temporary shelters.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over north-eastern South Africa, including the already affected Mpumalanga, and North West Provinces.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 21 Feb 2023)
description: The number of casualties is increasing following heavy rainfall and consequent floods and landslides across São Paulo State.According to local authorities, 40 people have died (39 in Sao Sebastiao City and one in Ubatuba City), 23 have been injured (including six seriously injured), and more than 2,400 have been displaced. In addition, several roads have been blocked, particularly in the Sao Sebastiao City area.National authorities are providing help for those most affected.On 21-22 February, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms are forecast over the affected State. Very high hydrological and hydrogeological risk is still in effect across the north-eastern coastal areas of São Paulo State.

title: Mauritius, Reunion, Madagascar - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 21 Feb 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone FREDDY continued moving westward over the Indian Ocean toward eastern Madagascar and well north of Mauritius and Reunion.On 21 January at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 150 km east of the coastal town of Vatomandry (central-eastern Madagascar) with maximum sustained winds of 178 km/h.On the forecast track, FREDDY is forecast to make landfall in Madagascar on 21 February early in the afternoon (UTC) with maximum sustained winds up to 175 km/h. After that it is forecast to pass over central-southern Madagascar on 22-23 February, as a Tropical Storm, then enter into the Mozambique Channel on 24 February.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are still forecast over Reunion and Mauritius and over central and southern Madagascar. Cyclone warnings are in force in Madagascar.The Copernicus EMS was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 19 February for Madagascar, in order to support the impact assessment. So far, two satellite maps were produced as reference products.

title: Türkiye, Syria – Earthquake (ECHO 21 Feb 2023)
description: An earthquake of 6.3 M (6.4 M as registered by AFAD) at a depth of 16 km occurred in Defne District (Hatay Province, southern Türkiye) very close to the border with north-western Syria on 20 Feb at 17.04 UTC (20.04 local time). The epicentre was located in the Koyunoglu village area, approximately 15 km south-west of Antiochia City (capital of Hatay Province) and 95 km west of Aleppo City (north-western Syria).At least 90 aftershocks with magnitude up to 5.8 M have been recorded in the area. USGS PAGER estimates that up to 406,000 people were exposed to severe shaking, 351,000 to very strong and 470,000 to strong.According to AFAD, in Türkiye six people have died, and almost 300 others have been injured (18 of whom seriously injured). National authorities provided 6,000 tents fot the people affected in the area of the earthquake.In Syria, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reports over 470 injured people.Following the 7.8 M and 7.5 M earthquakes occurred on 6 February the number of fatalities stands at more than 46,000 people across Türkiye (41,020) and Syria (5,914).

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides (ECHO 20 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy rain has been affecting São Paulo State over the past few days, causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, at least 36 people have died, of which 35 in Sao Sebastiao City and one in neighbouring Ubatuba City, and dozens have been reported missing. In addition, hundreds have been displaced or evacuated, 50 houses collapsed and Carnival events were cancelled across the northern cities of the State.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over the affected State. Very high hydrological risk is in effect across the north-eastern areas of São Paulo State.

title: Philippines - Effects of low-pressure area (ECHO 20 Feb 2023)
description: A low-pressure area has been affecting at least seven Regions of the Philippines since the past week, causing floods, landslides and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.The affected Regions are Bicol, Western Visayas, Eastern Visayas, Zamboanga Peninsula, Davao Region, Soccsksargen and Caraga.The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports ten fatalities, five missing people, 32,764 displaced and almost 91,800 affected.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over most parts of the country, particularly over the norh-eastern Regions. Severe flood advisories are in effect over Cagayan, Quezon, and Bicol.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 20 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting central-Indonesia (in particular the Java Island) over the past 72 hours, causing floods and river overflows that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 20 February, nearly 7,500 affected people and approximately 1,440 affected houses across Demak, and Semarang City Regencies, both in Central Java Province. In this latter Regency, a number of people were evacuated.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the whole Java Island.

title: Mauritius, Reunion, Madagascar - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY, update (ECHO 20 Feb 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone FREDDY continued moving westward over the southern Indian Ocean toward eastern Madagascar. On 20 January at 6.00 UTC its centre was located offshore approximately 135 km north-northeast of Mauritius and 270 km north-east of Reunion, with maximum sustained winds of 243 km/h.On the forecast track, FREDDY is forecast to continue moving west, well off Mauritius and Reunion, and it is expected to make landfall over northern Vatovavy-Fitovinany Province (central-eastern coast of Madagascar) on 21 February late in the afternoon UTC), with maximum sustained winds up to 220 km/h.After that it is forecast to pass over central-southern Madagascar on 22-23 February, weakening, then enter into the Mozambique Channel on 24 February, toward central-southern Mozambique.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall, strong wind and storm surge are forecast over Reunion and Mauritius (while moderate rainfall is forecast over Rodrigues). Cyclone warnings are in force for Reunion and MauritiusThe Copernicus EMS was activated in rapid mapping mode (EMSR652) on 19 February for Madagascar, in order to support the impact assessment.

title: Mauritius, Reunion - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY  (ECHO 18 Feb 2023)
description: Tropical Cyclone FREDDY formed south-west of the Indian Ocean - currently classified category 4 - is moving westwards towards Madagascar with maximum sustained winds of 213 km/h, current coordinates Lat -16.4; Lon 69.1, as of today 8:45 CET.TC FREDDY continues moving westwards and is forecast to approach Mauritius Island and La Reunion on 20 February, before hitting the coast of Madagascar on 21 February.Heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast in the next days over the islands.The ERCC is closely monitoring the situation.

title: Türkiye, Syria – Earthquake, update (ECHO 18 Feb 2023)
description: According to the latest figures from the Turkish Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency (AFAD, 16 February) 38 044 people lost their lives and 108 068 people have been injured by the devastating earthquake that hit the Gaziantep province, Türkiye, on 6 February.According to media, more than 70 000 standing buildings in Türkiye need to be demolished and more than 374 000 people have been evacuated. The first field assessment results indicate the main areas affected by the disaster are the five provinces of Hatay, Kahramanmaras, Adiyaman, Malatya and part of Gaziantep. Priority needs are medical supplies, including ambulances and medicines, shelter, food, winterizations and WASH items.In Syria, more than 5 000 people have died and more than 10 000 are injured. In the north-west of the country, about 50 000 households need tents or emergency shelter and at least 88 000 households need mattresses, thermal blankets and clothing.Following Türkiye’s request for assistance, the EU mobilised 38 search and rescue teams and thousands of tents, blankets, heaters and other shelter assistance items through the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM). The search and rescue teams demobilised on 17 February. UCPM operations in Türkiye are now focusing on medical and in-kind assistance.In response to the request for assistance received on 8 February from the Syrian Embassy in Lebanon, UCPM in-kind assistance is being channelled through Gaziantep and through Beirut, under the ERCC coordination with the presence of Liaison officers in these two hubs.The Copernicus Emergency Management System was activated for Türkiye (), 64 maps have been produced so far to provide analytical satellite information on the disaster.

title: New Zealand - Floods and landslides update (ECHO 17 Feb 2023)
description: The number of casualties continues to increase in the North Island of New Zealand, after being impacted by floods and landslides caused by heavy rainfall related to post-Tropical Cyclone GABRIELLE.According to media reports, at least eight people died, while more than 4,500 are still unaccounted for, as search and rescue operations continue. Most of the impact has been reported in Hawke’s Bay on the eastern coast of the North Island, where up to 37,000 households are still experiencing power outages.On 17-18 February, drier conditions are expected over New Zealand.

title: Mauritius, Reunion - Tropical Cyclone FREDDY (ECHO 17 Feb 2023)
description: A new Tropical Cyclone named FREDDY formed in the south-west of the Indian Ocean and is moving westwards. As of 17 February at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located about 1,500 km north-east of Rodrigues Island (eastern Mauritius), with maximum sustained winds of 222 km/h.FREDDY is forecast to continue moving westwards as a Tropical Cyclone, approaching Rodrigues Island on 19 February, and then Mauritius and La Reunion on 20 February.Heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast over Rodrigues from 18 February and over Mauritius's main Island and La Reunion from 19 February.

title: Madagascar and Mozambique – Floods and Tropical Cyclone FREDDY (ECHO 17 Feb 2023)
description: Intense Tropical Cyclone FREDDY, a particularly powerful and compact tropical system, will likely pass just north of La Rèunion on 20 February, and is forecasted to make landfall in Madagascar on 21 February.FREDDY represents a significant flood risk for Madagascar as soils are already saturated in central parts of the island from the impact of Cyclone Cheneso, which stalled off the west coast of the island and brought torrential rains in late January that affected over 90,000 people with 33 people killed and 20 people still missing. Currently, about 34,000 people are still homeless.At the same time, over 89,090 people have been affected by extreme weather events in Mozambique since the beginning of the rainy season. Over 15,00 people are currently displaced due to the floods in Southern Mozambique alone.Authorities have issued warnings on expected heavy rains over the next days, while reading from the water stations downstream the Zambezi River are all above warning levels. On top of this, Tropical Cyclone Freddy is forecasted to make landfall in Mozambique on the evening of 23 February.

title: Chile - Wildfires, update (ECHO 16 Feb 2023)
description: Wildfires continue to affect central Chile, particularly the regions of Bío Bío, Ñuble, Maule, La Araucanía, Los Ríos, and Los Lagos.According to the Chilean National Office of Emergency (SINAPRED), the number of fatalities has increased to 25 people, 3,034 individuals sustained injuries. As of 15 February, there are 324 people in public shelters and more than 7,040 persons have been affected by wildfires, which destroyed 1,504 houses and damaged more than 900.The number of burned areas since January 2023 across Chile has reached more than 432,170 ha.Following Chile’s request for assistance from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) so far three countries offered assistance and over 250 emergency responders had been deployed to Chile through the UCPM, alongside with a Liaison Officer from the EU's Emergency Response Coordination Centre's and an EU Civil Protection Team.On 16-18 February, the fire danger forecast is mostly extreme over central Chile, specifically from Region Metropolitana to Rios, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS).

title: New Zealand - Floods and landslides update (ECHO 15 Feb 2023)
description: The number of casualties has increased in northern and central New Zealand after the country has been affected by floods and landslides caused by heavy rainfall related to post-Tropical Cyclone Gabrielle.According to media, at least four people died (of which three in Hawke's Bay, and one on the outskirts of Auckland), while more than 1,400 individuals have been reported as uncontactable, across Hawke's Bay, Tairawhiti, and other parts of the North Island.More than 9,000 people have been displaced, of which 3,000 were accommodated in temporary shelters. Pour outages have been reported for around 160,000 customers across North Island.On 15-16 February, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over central New Zealand, particularly north-eastern South Island, and southern North Island.

title: Afghanistan - Avalanches (ECHO 15 Feb 2023)
description: Several avalanches have been reported across Afghanistan, resulting in casualties.According to media, five people died and eight others were injured after two separate avalanche events that occurred on 10 and 14 February respectively in Raghistan District in Badakhshan Province (northern Afghanistan).On 6 February, another avalanche event was reported in Dangam District (Kunar Province, north-eastern Afghanistan), killing at least 10 people and injuring nine others.On 15-16 February moderate rainfall and snowfall are forecast over northern Afghanistan.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 15 Feb 2023)
description: Since 13 February, heavy rainfall and high waves have been reported across Makassar City in South Sulawesi Province (Indonesia).The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports nearly 1,900 displaced people across 21 evacuation points. Material damage due to flooding includes 554 housing units.On 15-17 February, moderate to heavy rainfall accompanied by strong winds is forecast over South Sulawesi Province, including Makassar City.

title: South Africa, Mozambique - Floods update (ECHO 15 Feb 2023)
description: Floods continue to affect eastern South Africa and southern Mozambique, resulting in an increased humanitarian impact.In South Africa, at least 12 people have died, while extensive damage includes houses and infrastructure, particularly in Mpumalanga Province (north-east South Africa).In Mozambique, the National Institute for Disaster Management (INGD) reports nine fatalities, five missing people, and three individuals that sustained injuries. About 39,225 individuals have been affected across Maputo City and Province, while the number of displaced people stands at 14,792. Material damage in southern Mozambique includes 7,643 houses, 15 health centres, and 15 schools.Copernicus Emergency Management System was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 9 February to support with damage assessment in Maputo Province.On 15-16 February, moderate rain is expected over central and northern Mozambique, while moderate to heavy rain is forecast across central and eastern South Africa.

title: Malawi - Floods (ECHO 15 Feb 2023)
description: Over the past few days, widespread floods caused by heavy rainfall affected particularly Blantyre City (Southern Region, southern Malawi), surrounding areas and 28 councils, leading to casualties and damage.According to media, at least four people died and three others are still missing. Damage to roads, bridges, houses and the material property was also reported.In the 2022/2023 rainy season, the Department of Disaster Management Affairs registered a total of 62 fatalities, 185 injured people and more than 94,000 affected people across the country.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over most parts of Malawi.

title: New Zealand - Floods (ECHO 14 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall related to post-tropical cyclone GABRIELLE has been affecting northern New Zealand, with extensive floodings and landslides.According to media reports, one person is missing in Muriwai after a landslide event and several residents have been isolated due to flooding in Hawke's Bay. Search and rescue operations are continuing, while damage to infrastructure has been reported across North Island. Power outages and communication disruptions have been affecting Hawke's Bay and Gisborne.There are 27 shelters and civil defense centres opened in Auckland, to host the affected population. A state of national emergency was declared for Northland, Auckland, Tairawhiti, Bay of Plenty, Waikato, and Hawkes Bay.On 14-15 February, strong winds, heavy rainfall, and high waves are forecast over northern and central New Zealand.

title: South Africa, Mozambique, Eswatini - Floods (ECHO 14 Feb 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect eastern South Africa, Ewatini, and southern Mozambique, causing extensive flooding and resulting in humanitarian impact.According to media reports, in South Africa, at least seven people died. Damage has been reported to infrastructure and agricultural land, and the national government declared a state of disaster in response to floods in Mpumalanga, the Eastern Cape, Gauteng, KwaZulu-Natal, Limpopo, the Northern Cape, and North West.In Mozambique, the number of fatalities increased to seven, while a number of affected people reached 37,000 in Maputo City and Province, as reported by the National Institute for Disaster Management (INGD). In the last 24 hours, authorities have rescued about 1,400 people in Boane, Magude, and Moamba Districts in Maputo Province, while 15,403 people have been rescued in the southern part of the country between 7 and 12 February. More than 7,000 houses, 15 health centres, and 15 schools have been damaged or destroyed by flooding. Authorities have begun discharges of the Pequenos Limbombos Dam located south of Maputo City.In Eswatini, nearly 260 people have been affected by floods, while extensive damage to some infrastructure, including six bridges, was reported across the country.On 14-15 February, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over most of eastern South Africa, most of Eswatini and central-western Mozambiuque.

title: Syria - Dam break and floods (ECHO 14 Feb 2023)
description: Following the earthquake in southern Türkiye on 6 February, a dam collapsed in north-western Syria, causing the overflow of the Orontes River, as recorded by UN OCHA. The flood event led to the displacements of people from the village of Al-Tlul (Salqin Nahiyah Subdistrict, Harem District, Idlib Governorate) to nearby camps as several houses have been submerged by water.In addition, the same source reports, 7,000 evacuated people and 1,000 flooded houses across the nearby villages of Hardana, Delbiya, Jakara, and Hamziyeh due to the same event.Heavy machinery has been deployed by the WASH partners to open channels and mitigate the flood in Al Tlul.For the next 24 hours, no rain is forecast across northwestern Syria, including the earthquake-affected Governorates.

title: Peru - Floods and landslides, update (ECHO 13 Feb 2023)
description: Since 5 February, Arequipa Department in southern Peru has been affected by floods and landslides caused by heavy rainfall.According to Peru's National Institute of Civil Defense (INDECI), the number of fatalities has increased to 18, while 20 individuals are missing in Camana Province. At least 27 persons sustained injuries, while the number of affected people is more than 6,300. Nearly 1,600 houses, 60 educational centres, and two hospitals have been affected by various degrees of damage.Flash floods and mudslides (huayco) in San Ramon District (Junin Department, central Peru), caused one fatality and two injured people.A red alert for river overflow has been issued for the Utcubamba River in Jamalca District, Amazon Department (northern Peru).Moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over central and southern Peru on 13-14 February.

title: Venezuela - Landslide (ECHO 13 Feb 2023)
description: A landslide, triggered by heavy rainfall, occurred on 8 February in the state of Mérida (north-western Venezuela) resulting in casualties and damage.The event occurred in the settlement of Onia in Alberto Adriani Municipality and, according to media reports, tw people died, four families have been evacuated and a bridge has been destroyed. In addition, the power supply in the area has been interrupted as a result of landslide damage.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over Merida State.

title: Mozambique - Floods (ECHO 13 Feb 2023)
description: In the past few days, heavy rainfall has been affecting southern Mozambique, particularly Maputo City, and Province, with flooding.According to National Institute for Disaster Management (INGD), at least six people died and two others have been injured. About 36,770 individuals have been affected, of which nearly 20,000 are in Maputo City. Material damage includes 7,365 houses, 15 health centres, and 15 schools. Up to 17,740 ha of agricultural land has been flooded, impacting the provision of food in the area.On 13-14 February, light to moderate rainfall is forecast over most of Mozambique, while moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected over Manica Province (central-western Mozambique).Based od the request from the World Food Programme, the Copernicus Emergency Management System was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 9 February to support national authorities' emergency response with a damage assessment of the affected areas in the Maputo province.

title: Türkiye, Syria - Earthquake, update (ECHO 13 Feb 2023)
description: After the earthquakes of 7.8 M in Pazarcik and 7.5 M in Elbistan Districts  (southern Türkiye) occurred on 6 February, the death toll has increased.In Türkiye, 29,605 people died, almost 80,300 others have been injured and 147,934 have been evacuated in the Provinces of Kahramanmaras, Gaziantep, Sanliurfa, Diyarbakir, Adana, Adiyaman, Osmaniye, Hatay, Kilis, Malatya and Elazig, as reported by the Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency (AFAD).In Syria, as of 12 February, UN OCHA reports 5,714 fatalities and 9,949 injured across the affected areas in Northwest Syria and government-controlled areas.Following Syria’s and the World Food Programme’s requests for assistance from the Union Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM), so far nine countries offered assistance, tents, blankets, beds and other shelter items.After Türkiye’s request for assistance from the UCPM, 26 countries offered 38 search and rescue teams, medical teams and thousands of tents, blankets, heaters and other shelter items.

title: Flood in Mozambique - JRC emergency report
description: A new JRC Emergency report is now available

title: Zambia - Floods (ECHO 31 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorms have been affecting central-southern Zambia (in particular Southern, Central, Eastern, and Lusaka Provinces) since 11 January, causing severe floods and rivers overflow (particularly Luangwa, and Mkushi Rivers) that have resulted in casualties and damage.The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) reports, as of 28 January, a total of more than 22,000 affected people across Kalomo, Namwala, and Choma Districts in the Southern Province (the worst affected one). IFRC also reports 500 displaced families in a number of temporary evacuation centres in the Namwala Districts.Media also report several collapsed and severely damaged houses, a number of damaged bridges, and many isolated communities across the aforementioned affected provinces.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole country, with locally very heavy rainfall over the Central Province.

title: Iran – Earthquake, update  (ECHO 31 Jan 2023)
description: Preliminary needs assessments on the 5.9 M earthquake occurred on the night of 28 January in Firouragh district, Khoy county, and followed by 62 aftershocks with the greatest of 4.5 M, report so far 261,387 people affected, 1,017 injured and three died across two cities and 86 villages. 20% to 80% of residential buildings in 70 villages have been destroyed, as reported by the governorate general office of West-Azarbaijan.The severity of the humanitarian situation and the needs are intensified by the heavy snowfall and zero temperature present in the area.The fear of aftershocks has prevented affected households from returning to their houses and displaced people are hosted in the 31 camps across the affected region, provided by the Iranian Red Crescent (IRCS).

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides, update  (ECHO 31 Jan 2023)
description: After flash floods, landslides, and the Tondano River overflow that occurred in the Manado City area (North Sulawesi Province, northern-central Indonesia) on 27 January, the number of casualties has increased.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 31 January, five fatalities, more than 1,900 displaced people, over 1,100 damaged houses (of which 453 totally damaged), two damaged bridges, and a total of nearly 16,700 affected people across the Manado City area.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole of Sulawesi Island.

title: New Zealand - Floods (ECHO 30 Jan 2023)
description: Since 27 January, floods caused by heavy rainfall have been reported across northern New Zealand, affecting particularly Auckland Region and resulting in casualties.According to national authorities and media reports, at least four people have died. Search and rescue operations continue to be performed by emergency teams as floods have damaged houses and roads, isolating several communities across Auckland.Thousands of households experienced power outages or water disruptions. Physical attendance for schools and education services has been interrupted in the Auckland Region until the 3 of February.A state of local emergency was declared for the Auckland region due to severe weather events and flooding.Red warnings for heavy rainfall are in effect for northern New Zealand, including Auckland, as up to 140 mm of rainfall accompanied by strong winds and thunderstorms are forecast from 30 January to 1 February.

title: Argentina - Severe weather (ECHO 30 Jan 2023)
description: Severe weather including hailstorms affected on 27 January San Luis Province in central Argentina.According to media reports, one person died and several others were injured as material damage was reported to a number of properties.On 30-31 January, dry meteorological conditions are forecast over Argentina.

title: Philippines - Effects of shear line, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 30 Jan 2023)
description: The number of casualties and affected people continues to increase following heavy rain and strong winds due to the combined effects of low-pressure area, the northeast monsoon, and the shear line across 14 regions of the Philippines.According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC), 43 people have died, 11 have been injured, and eight people are missing. In addition, almost 111,300 people have been displaced, of which 83,723 were served inside 297 evacuation centres, and more than two million people have been affected (of which more than 1 million in Eastern Visayas Region).For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over most parts of central, north-eastern and southern Philippines.Severe flood advisories are in effect for Eastern Visayas and Caraga.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 30 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall affected the Manado City area (North Sulawesi Province, norhern-central Indonesia) on 27 January, triggering landslides, and causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the National Agency for Disaster Countermeasure (BNPB), one person has died and dozens have been affected. More than 30 houses located in six Districts have been hit by widespread landslides and dozens of homes have been flooded in five sub-districts following the overflow of the Tondanao River.The Manado City Government has declared a state of emergency until the 2nd of February, and national authorities are providing help with emergency items for the most affected people.For the next 24 hours, light to moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast across North Sulawesi Province.

title: Madagascar - Tropical Cyclone CHENESO, update (ECHO 30 Jan 2023)
description: The humanitarian impact in northern and central Madagascar continues to increase after the island was affected by the passage of tropical cyclone CHENESO on 19-23 January.According to the National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC), 27 people have died and 21 others are reportedly missing. Nearly 40,000 individuals remain displaced across seven regions of Madagascar, while approximately 85,000 persons have been affected.Material damage caused by floods, strong winds, and landslides includes 27,000 houses, 10 health centres, and about 150 schools. The flyover assessment of the North West area is currently underway.The Copernicus Emergency Management System was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 25 January to provide a damage assessment of the affected areas and 33 maps have been produced so far.On 30-31 January, light rainfall is forecast over eastern Madagascar.

title: Iran - Earthquake (ECHO 29 Jan 2023)
description: A 5.9 M earthquake at a depth of 10 km shook Iran’s West Azerbaijan Province, close to the border with Türkiye, on January 28 at 18:14 UTC. The epicentre was located 14 km south of the city of Khoy.Two other earthquakes ranging from 4.1 M and 4.5 M, both at a 10 km depth, followed the 5.9 M quake. According to media reports, the quake was felt in multiple cities, including in Khoy, Tabriz and in the provincial capital and largest city Urmia.The Islamic Republic News Agency (IRNA) reports that at least three people have been killed and more than 800 injured. Some 70 villages have suffered damages in the earthquake.The responsible authorities are currently providing assistance to the affected population in the West Azerbaijan Province.The province was shook by a 5.4-magnitude earthquake earlier this month, which caused extensive damage to properties in the city of Khoy.

title: La Réunion, France - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Jan 2023)
description: Since 26 January, several municipalities in La Réunion have been affected by strong winds and heavy rainfall, related to a low-pressure system in the area.The north and east of the Islands have been impacted by floods, several families have been evacuated, and houses have been flooded. Emergency services performed numerous rescue interventions, including one in Sainte-Marie Municipality. Teaching was suspended in the Municipalities of Sainte-Rose, Saint-Benoît, and Ste Suzanne.Light to moderate rainfall is expected over La Réunion on 27-28 January.

title: Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 27 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds and heavy snowfall have been affecting the Sardinia Island (particularly central and northern provinces) since 25 January, causing floods and rivers overflow that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media reports, as of 27 January, some roads have been temporarily closed across the Nuoro Province (central Sardinia) due to the heavy snowfall.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over north-western and southern Sardinia Island.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 27 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect western and central Indonesia (in particular northern Sumatra Island, western Java Island and northern Sulawesi Island) since 24 January, causing floods that have resulted in casualties and damage.According to media, as of 27 January, one person died, around 3,000 people have been evacuated and a total of approximately 45,000 affected across the Aceh Tamiang Regency (Aceh Province, northern Sumatra).In addition, the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports more than 40 evacuated people, 18 damaged houses, two damaged bridges and a total of over 1,000 affected people in the Sangihe Islands Regency (North Sulawesi Province). More than 6,100 people have been affected  across the Cirebon Regency (West Java Province), due to floods.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall with locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole country.

title: Madagascar - Tropical Cyclone CHENESO, update (ECHO 27 Jan 2023)
description: Madagascar still is impacted by the passage of CHENESO as a tropical storm on 19-23 January, resulting in at least 16 fatalities, and 19 missing people, as reported by the National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC).The number of temporarily displaced people stands at 26,000 individuals, while about 55,000 people have been affected, as material damage includes 13,350 houses, 18 medical centres, and more than 100 classrooms. Many settlements continue to be isolated.The Copernicus Emergency Management System was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 25 January and 12 maps have been produced so far.The centre of tropical storm CHENESO was located on 27 January at 7.00 UTC on the Mozambique Channel, about 160 km of south-western Madagascar. CHENESO is expected to increase to a tropical cyclone, leaving the Mozambique Channel on the night of 28 January.On 27-28 January, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over most of Madagascar, while red warnings for strong winds are in effect for the central western and southern coast.

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 26 Jan 2023)
description: Since 24 January, heavy rain and widespread floods have been affecting parts of Malaysia both the peninsular areas and the Malaysian regions of Borneo Island, resulting in displacement and damage. The most affected states are Johor, Pahang, and Sabah States.According to media reports, more than 5,000 people have been evacuated across several localities of Johor State and more than 6,000 people have been evacuated in Sabah State due to floods.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over eastern peninsular Malaysia and most of the Borneo Regions.

title: Japan - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Jan 2023)
description: Severe weather including low temperatures and heavy snowfall has been reported across Japan, resulting in casualties.According to media, at least five people died (two in Niigata, two in Okayama and one in Oita Prefectures) due to severe related accidents. More than 30 injured people were reported in Kyoto Prefecture, while up to 400 houses across Japan were affected by power outages.Red warnings for heavy snowfall are in effect over northern Japan. On 26-27 January, snowfall is forecast over most of central and northern Japan.

title: China - Earthquake (ECHO 26 Jan 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.5 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in Luding County (southeastern Garze Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Sichuan Province, southern China) on 25 January at 19.49 UTC (26 January at 3.49 local time). The epicentre was located 27 km south-southeast of Kangding City (Garzê Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture).USGS PAGER estimates that up to 6,000 people were exposed to strong shaking.According to the media, there are no immediate reports of any casualties or damage but roads into the area of the earthquake have been blocked by rockslides triggered by the seismic event.On 5 September 2022, a 6.6 M earthquake occurred in the same area resulting in more than 90 fatalities.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 26 Jan 2023)
description: Strong winds and tornadoes have affected the southern USA over the past few days resulting in casualties and damage. In addition, the northern USA has been experiencing heavy precipitation (snow and rain).The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, three injured people in Pointe Coupee Parish (Louisiana), one injured person in Pasadena (Harris County, Texas), and almost 20 people sheltered people in Texas due to strong winds and tornadoes. In addition, 150,000 people have been affected by power outages across Texas, Louisiana, and Arkansas.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavily mixed precipitations are forecast over most of the northern USA.Winter Storm Warnings are in effect for parts of the north-eastern USA.

title: Madagascar - Tropical Cyclone CHENESO, update (ECHO 26 Jan 2023)
description: At least eight people died, and ten others are missing after the passage of Tropical Cyclone CHENESO on 19-23 January, as reported by the National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC). The number of temporarily displaced people increased to 60,603. Some 47,000 people are affected, about 13,000 houses and some 100 classrooms are damaged. Search and rescue operationsv could be hindered by the disruption of several roads, which has isolated several communities.The Copernicus Emergency Management System was activated in rapid mapping mode () on 25 January to support damage assessment.Tropical Cyclone CHENESO remains nearly stationary in the Mozambique Channel. On 26 January at 7.00 UTC its center was located about 145 km west of coastal Morondava City, with maximum sustained winds of 137 km/h. On 26 January, CHENESO should start moving south-westward in the Mozambique Channel.On 26-27 January, heavy rainfall is expected over central-western Madagascar with light to moderate rainfall over the rest of the Island. Risk of flooding and landslides is of great concern.

title: Madagascar - Tropical storm CHENESO, update (ECHO 24 Jan 2023)
description: After moving across northern and central-western Madagascar, CHENESO has reached the Mozambique Channel. On 24 January at 7.00 UTC, its center was located on the sea, about 180 km west of coastal Morondava City (Menabe Region, central-western Madagascar, with maximum sustained winds of 74 km/h.To date, the reported humanitarian impact caused by the passage of CHENESO includes three fatalities, 14 missing people and 17,129 affected people across 9 regions as reported by the National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC). The number of displaced people has increased to 8,334 material damage has been reported to 5,600 flooded houses.However, heavy and persistent rainfall continue across Madagascar. The national Met-Service had issued a red Flood Watch for several river basins in the Northwest and Southeast of the country.Over the next three days, CHENESO is expected to intensify, while moving south over the Mozambique Channel, not far from the Malagasy coast.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 24 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia (in particular central and northern Sumatra Island) since 20 January, causing severe floods and triggering landslides that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 24 January, two fatalities, five injured people, around 3,750 evacuated people and approximately 150 damaged buildings (of which 30 schools) across the Padang Pariaman Regency (West Sumatra Province) due to landslides and floods. A total of 7,500 affected people were reported.In the nearby Aceh Province (northern Sumatra), several regencies were also affected by floods, in particular North Aceh, East Aceh, Pidie, Pidie Jaya, and Bireuen. ADINet and the Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) report more than 10,400 evacuated people across the aforementioned regencies. A part of the evacuated people were relocated in seven evacuation centres across the North Aceh Regency.Over the next 48 hours, very heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the Sumatra Island.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides (ECHO 23 Jan 2023)
description: Floods and several landslides have been reported across Santa Caterina State (southern Brazil), resulting in casualties and damage.According to media, two people died and one is missing after a landslide event, while two others were killed in a flood-related accident that occurred in Rodeio Municipality.National authorities performed several rescue operations in Rodeo. Other landslide events in Indaial Municipality damaged several highways, while extensive flooding affected Rio Negrinho Municipality, displacing 80 people.The weather forecast over Santa Caterina is expected to be light to locally moderate rainfall on 23 January, while drier weather conditions are forecast on 24 January.

title: China - Avalanche, update (ECHO 23 Jan 2023)
description: Following the avalanche that occurred in Nyingchi City (Nyingchi County, Autonomous Region of Tibet, south-western China) on 17 January, the death toll has increased.According to media reports, 28 people have died, five have been injured, and 53 have been rescued.For the next 24 hours, no precipitations are forecast over the affected area.

title: Madagascar - Tropical Storm CHENESO, update (ECHO 23 Jan 2023)
description: Tropical Storm CHENESO affecting northern and central Madagascar on 19-23 January, has led to casualties and damage.The National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC), reports 3 deaths, 6 missing, about 7,240 individuals displaced and 13,180 people affected. Nearly 4,000 houses and 85 classrooms have been damaged or destroyed, while a number of settlements are isolated, as several road sections have been damaged. Disturbed weather will continue at least until the middle of this week. The sustained heavy rains are likely to generate widespread flooding and landslides.BNGRC is leading the response coordination. Local authorities are providing assistance to cover basic needs of displaced population. Humanitarian partners remain on standby to support the Government-led response if required.The tropical storm is preparing to come out to sea today. For the next 3 days, its potential for re-intensification into a tropical storm is significant.

title: Philippines – Effects of shear line, floods and landslides, update (ECHO 23 Jan 2023)
description: Almost 2 million people have been affected by heavy rain and strong winds due to the combined effects of low-pressure area, the northeast monsoon, and shear line across 14 regions of the Philippines.According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC), 35 people have died, 12 have been injured, and seven people are missing. In addition, almost 122,000 people have been displaced, of which 92,118 were served inside 358 evacuation centres, and approximately 1,800 houses have been damaged or destroyed.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over most parts of the country. Severe flood advisories are in effect for Davao and Caraga regions.

title: Mali - Floods (ECHO 23 Jan 2023)
description: Widespread floods and river overflow due to heavy rainfall have been affected several parts of Mali from December 2022 to mid-January 2023, resulting in displacement and damage.According to UN OCHA, on 12 December, more than 600 people living in the village of Nangadourou (Baye Commune, Mopti Region) have been displaced by the overflow of Sourou River. Media reported more than 1,000 affected households in Tombouctou Region, as several houses were damaged and destroyed, following the overflow of the Niger River that occurred in December 2022.Humanitarian partners mobilized to assess the need for immediate response for the affected people in Baye Commune.For the next 24 hours, no rain is expected across the whole of Mali.

title: Serbia, Montenegro - Floods and severe weather (ECHO 20 Jan 2023)
description: Floods caused by heavy rainfall and river overflow have been affecting parts of Serbia, resulting in casualties.According to media reports, two people went missing in Novi Pazar Municipality (Sumadija and Western Serbia Region, south-western Serbia) after the overflow of the Trnavica River. About 70 houses have been flooded in the Municipalities of Sjenica and Brodarevo near the border with Montenegro, caused by the overflow of several rivers.In the neighbouring Montenegro, one person is missing in the coastal town of Herceg Novi, affected by high waves.On 20-21 January, light rainfall with moderate winds is forecast over Montenegro, while light to moderate snowfall is expected over most of Serbia.

title: Philippines – Effects of shear line, floods and landslides, update  (ECHO 20 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rain and strong winds - due to the combined effects of low pressure area, northeast monsoon, and shearline - continue to hit several parts of the Philippines, causing floods, landslides, and severe weather-related events that resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.The most affected regions are Cagayan Valley, Central Luzon, Calabarzon, Mimaropa, Bicol, Western Visayas, Eastern Visayas, Zamboanga Peninsula, Northern Mindanao, Davao Region, Soccsksargen, Caraga and Barmm.According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC), 33 people have died, 12 have been injured, and seven people are still missing. Almost 264,000 people have been displaced, more than 196,000 evacuated in 496 evacuation centres, and approximately 1,7 million were affected.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast across Bicol Region, most parts of north-eastern, central and southern Philippines. Extreme flood advisories are in effect over Bicol Region.

title: China - Avalanche (ECHO 20 Jan 2023)
description: On 17 January, an avalanche occurred in Nyingchi City (Nyingchi County, Autonomous Region of Tibet, south-western China), resulting in casualties.According to media reports, at least eight people have died and many others are estimated to be missing.National and local authorities deployed rescue and emergency teams in the affected area.For the next 24 hours, no precipitations are forecast over the affected area.

title: Madagascar - Tropical storm CHENESO, update (ECHO 20 Jan 2023)
description: Tropical Storm CHENESO made landfall on 19 January in the north of Antalaha, in Sava Region, on the north-eastern coast of Madagascar, with maximum sustained winds up to 106 km/h.According to the National Bureau of Risk and Disaster Management (BNGRC), initial data collected on the 19 January show: 1 death (Sava region), 1 missing person (Diana region), 2,224 disaster victims, i.e. 738 households, spread over 2 regions; 214 people displaced preventively in 2 accommodation sites. Data for Diana and Sava regions are not yet available.CHENESO is forecast to move south-west across central-western Madagascar, as a Tropical Depression, and reach the Mozambique Channel in the early morning of 23 January.Authorities are worried about flash floods, landslides, strong winds and dangerous sea movements. Heavy rains are expected to continue throughout the end of the week along the central-eastern coast and the north-west region.DG ECHO continues to monitor the situation.

title: Afghanistan - Cold wave (ECHO 20 Jan 2023)
description: Afghanistan is going through and extreme cold snap. For the last two weeks, many provinces in Afghanistan have been witnessing exceptionally cold weather, with the central region of Ghor recording the lowest reading of -33°C. The very cold weather is expected to continue during the coming days.According to the de-facto-government, at least 70 people died because of the cold weather. More than 70,000 cattle are reported to have perished in the provinces of Baghlan, Sar-e-Pul, Faryab, Takhar, Kandahar, Nimroz and Badghis.It is reported that at least 140 people were hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning in Herat province, using gas as their only option for heating.Afghanistan remains is in the midst of a humanitarian crisis, with close to 24 million people (60% of the population) facing an acute shortage of food. The recent ban of the Taliban on women working for humanitarian organisation is expected to aggravate the situation.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy snowfall, ice conditions, and low temperatures have been affecting the Departments of Pyrénées-Atlantiques and Hautes-Pyrénées in south-western France.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) reports one fatality in the Pyrénées-Atlantiques. Several rescue operations were performed by national authorities.Orange alerts for snow and ice have been issued for 19 and 20 January in south-western France, for ten departments, as of 6 pm.

title: Madagascar - Tropical Storm CHENESO (ECHO 19 Jan 2023)
description: Tropical Storm CHENESO formed over south-western Indian Ocean and made landfall north of Antalaha around 10:45 a.m. local time on 19 January. It is moving southwest at 15 km/h. The average wind is estimated at 90 km/h with gusts of 120 km/h.Despite the weakening of the system, the gusts of winds remain dangerous and are likely to damage or destroy vulnerable homes and infrastructure, especially for the Sava and Analanjirofo regions for the next 10 hours.The alert level remains unchanged. Red alerts have been issued for Sava, Dana, and Analanjirofo Regions in northern Madagascar, as heavy rainfall and strong winds are expected to affect this area on 19-20 January. The main concern is a possible severity of floods in all the cities and areas vulnerable to floods, especially those located in the north-east, in the highland and in the eastern coasts.BNGRC and UN OCHA have asked all the rapid assessment teams to be on stand-by for any eventual deployment.

title: Iran - Earthquake (ECHO 19 Jan 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.8 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in north-western Iran (near the border with eastern Türkiye) on 18 January at 10:08 UTC (13:38 local time). The epicentre was located inland approximately 13 km south of Khoy City (Khoy County, West Azerbaijan Province). USGS PAGER estimates that up to 28,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 294,000 people to strong shaking.The earthquake was followed by an aftershock of 4.4 M at a depth of 18 km occurred in the same area approximately 11 km north-west of the epicentre of the main event.The Islamic Republic News Agency (IRNA) reports, as of 19 January, 194 injured people and around 500 damaged houses across the area of Firoraq City and Khoy City (both in Khoy County).The responsible authorities are currently providing relief items and tents to the affected population in the West Azerbaijan Province.

title: Spain - Severe weather (ECHO 18 Jan 2023)
description: Several parts of Spain have been affected by heavy rainfall, snowfall, strong winds, and high waves, impacting particularly the northern third of the Peninsula.According to media reports, one person died in Bermeo Town located in Biscay Province (Basque Country in northern Spain). Very strong winds were reported across Galicia Community (north-western Spain), affecting particularly A Coruña, where a number of road sections were damaged and damns overflow.In Cantabria Community (northern Spain), some 4,800 students have been affected by the suspension of classes in 13 educational centres due to severe weather. Incidents related to falling obstacles on the road were also recorded in Andalusia, Valencia, and Catalonia, as reported by the Spanish Department of Homeland Security (DSN).Orange alerts for heavy snowfall have been issued for northern and south-eastern Spain, while orange alerts due to coastal events are in place for the northern coast and eastern coast of Spain. On 18-19 January, snowfall is forecast over northern and central areas of Spain, while strong winds are expected in eastern Spain, including the Balearic Islands.

title: Peru - Landslide (ECHO 18 Jan 2023)
description: On 16 January, a landslide occurred in the Puca Toro sector of the Locroja District (Churcampa Province, Huancavelica Department, central-western Peru), resulting in casualties and damage.According to the National Institute of Civil Defense of Peru (INDECI), three people have died, three others have been injured, and 50 m of roads were affected by the event.National authorities provided emergency and rescue responses in the affected area.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with thunderstorms is forecast over the whole Huancavelica Department.

title: Mexico - Severe weather (ECHO 18 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, accompanied by low temperatures has caused floods and landslides across Baja California State (north-western Mexico), affecting particularly Tijuana City with casualties and damage.According to media, two people died, two others were rescued and some houses have been damaged after a landslide that occurred in the Tejamen neighbourhood of Tijuana. Two other individuals died in a flood-related accident. A number of individuals have been displaced to emergency shelters, while power outages due to damage of electrical poles have affected approximately 87,000 users.On 18-19 January, low temperatures, strong winds, and high waves have been forecast for Baja California.

title: Indonesia - Earthquake (ECHO 18 Jan 2023)
description: An earthquake of 7.0 M at a depth of 48 km (7.1 M at a depth of 64 km as reported by the Meteorology, Climatology, and Geophysical Agency - BMKG) occurred in Molucca Sea (northern-central Indonesia) on 18 January at 06.06 UTC (13.06 local time).The epicentre was located offshore approximately 115 km north-west of the north-western coast of Halmahera Island (North Maluku Province, Maluku Islands) and 150 km north-east of the north-eastern coast of Northern Sulawesi Province.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 7,000 people were exposed to strong shaking.The BMKG registered more than ten aftershocks of magnitude up to 5.4 M in the area.According to media, there are no initial reports of any casualties or damage following the seismic event.

title: France - Severe weather, update (ECHO 17 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind, and thunderstorms affected northern and western France (in particular Normandy, Brittany, Pays de la Loire, and Nouvelle-Aquitaine Regions) over 15-16 January, causing some severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) reports, as of 16 January, one fatality in the Saint-Mariens Municipality (central Gironde Department, Nouvelle-Aquitaine Region) due to the strong wind. In addition, the same source also reports four slightly injured people and approximately 68,000 power outages across the affected area.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall, snowfall, and strong wind are forecast over central-northern, south-eastern, and south-western France. Meteo France has issued orange warnings for wind and rainfall over some south-western Departments and for snow over several western Departments.

title: Colombia - Floods and severe weather (ECHO 17 Jan 2023)
description: On 14 January, heavy rain and strong winds affected Medellín city (capital of Antioquia Department, north-western Colombia), causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the local authorities, two people have died in the Conquistadores neighbourhood, 23 have been injured and five houses have been affected across the city.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with thunderstorms is forecast over Medellín city where an orange hydrological alert is in effect.

title: Philippines - Heavy rains and floods (ECHO 17 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rains continue to cause massive flooding in various parts of the country. A total of 1,956 villages in 48 provinces have been affected by series of low pressure areas (LPAs), northeast monsoon, and shear line in the last three weeks.The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) has reported about 1.4 million affected population. The death toll has climbed to 29 while 203,396 people remain displaced.The heaviest hit area, Misamis Occidental in Northern Mindanao suffers from flood of up to 2 m high causing damages to shelters and livelihoods. The flashfloods have affected 80% of the population of that region.DG ECHO partners’ field assessments indicate that priority needs are shelter assistance, food, livelihood and health. DG ECHO field offices continue to monitor the situation.

title: France - Severe weather (ECHO 16 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong wind, and thunderstorms affected northern France (in particular Centre-Val de Loire, and Brittany Regions) over the past 48 hours, causing some severe weather-related incidents (particularly due to the strong wind) that have resulted in casualties and damage. The affected Departments include Eure-et-Loir (Centre-Val de Loire Region), Morbihan, and Finistère (these two both in Brittany Region).The Interdepartmental Crisis Management Operational Centre (COGIC) reports, as of 15 January, one injured person in the Eure-et-Loir Department.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall, snowfall, and strong wind are forecast over Centre-Val de Loire, and Brittany Regions. Meteo France has issued orange warnings for wind and snow over several Department across these two Regions.

title: El Salvador, Guatemala - Earthquakes (ECHO 16 Jan 2023)
description: An earthquake of 5.2 M at a depth of 10 km occurred on 15 January 23.07 UTC (15 January at 17.07 local time) in south-western El Salvador, close to the border with south-eastern Guatemala. The epicentre was located in Ahuachapán Department, about 9 km north of Ahuachapán Municipality (El Salvador), and about 9 km south of Aldea El Coco Settlement (Jutiapa Department, Guatemala).Two aftershocks of 5.0 M and 4.5 M respectively were reported in Jutiapa Department (Guatemala), close to the main earthquake event.According to national authorities in El Salvador, a number of families have been displaced to public shelters. Media report that some houses have been affected by the earthquake activity and related landslides, particularly the communities of San Lorenzo and Ahuachapan, where a red alert for seismic activity is in force.In Guatemala, light damage was reported to houses in the Municipalities of Aldea Estanzuela, Comapa, Jutiapa, as reported by  National Coordinator for Disaster Reduction (CONRED).

title: Malaysia - Floods (ECHO 16 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Peninsular Malaysia (particularly Perak, and Terengganu States) since 11 January, causing floods that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 16 January, more than 160 evacuated people in two evacuation centres and three damaged roads across Kampar  (southern Perak State) and Hulu Terengganu (central Terengganu State) districts.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole of Peninsular Malaysia.

title: Indonesia - Earthquake (ECHO 16 Jan 2023)
description: An earthquake of 6.2 M at a depth of 37 km occurred in northern Indonesia on 15 January at 22:29 UTC (16 January at 5:29 local time). The epicentre was located over the sea just west of the coast of southern Aceh Province (northern Sumatra Island) approximately 22 km south of Silabuhan Town (Aceh Singkil Regency, Aceh Province).USGS PAGER estimates that up to 329,000 people were exposed to moderate shaking.The Indonesian National Board for Disaster Management (BNPB) reports that the earthquake was felt across four Regencies in the Aceh Province: Aceh Singkil, Central Tapanuli, North Nias, and South Aceh.As of 16 January, no initial reports of any damage or casualties have been reported.

title: USA - Severe weather, update  (ECHO 13 Jan 2023)
description: Heavy rainfall, strong winds, and thunderstorms have been affecting most of California since early January, causing floods, landslides, mudslides, and a number of severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in an increasing number of casualties. Currently, the worst affected counties in California include San Benito, Ventura, Santa Cruz, Monterey, Merced, Mono, Stanislaus, Santa Barbara, Mendocino, Humboldt, and Santa Clara. The declaration of the state of emergency remains in effect.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 12 January, 18 fatalities, 717 evacuated people in 29 shelters, 429 closed schools, 47 closed roads, and 33,000 power outages across the affected counties. The same source reports 16,000 evacuation orders across the affected area.Strong winds have been affecting also Alabama and Georgia over the last 24 hours, causing casualties and damage. Media report seven fatalities, six in Autauga (central Alabama) and one in Butts County (central Georgia).Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are forecast over central and northern California. Winter storm warnings issued by NOAA for several counties remain in effect.

title: Philippines – Effects of shear line, floods and landslides, update  (ECHO 13 Jan 2023)
description: Since the past week, heavy rain and strong winds, (due to the combined effects of low-pressure area, northeast monsoon, and shearline), have been affecting several parts of the Philippines, causing floods, landslides, and severe weather-related events that resulted in an increasing number of casualties and damage.The most affected regions are Cagayan Valley, Central Luzon, Calabarzon, Mimaropa, Bicol, Western Visayas, Eastern Visayas, Zamboanga Peninsula, Northern Mindanao, Davao Region, and BARMM.According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC), 17 people have died, seven have been injured, and two people are still missing. Almost 6,000 people have been evacuated in 123 evacuation centres, and approximately 524,000 were affected.On 12 January at 19.00 UTC, the low-pressure area was estimated approximately 140 km east of Hinatuan, Surigao del Sur (Mindanao), while the northeast monsoon is affecting Northern and Central Luzon.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast across most parts of central and southern Philippines. Extreme flood advisories are in effect over Eastern Visayas, Caraga, Zamboanga Peninsula, and BARMM.

title: Philippines – Effects of shear line and floods (ECHO 28 Dec 2022)
description: Since 25 December 2022, shear line and floods have affected Visayas, the northern portion of Mindanao and Luzon in Philippines. The most affected area is Misamis Occidental, which has been declared state of calamity. Around 136,357 people (44,282 families) in 385 Barangays are affected. 13 persons are reported dead, 6 injured and 23 persons missing. Around 45,337 people (10,536 families) have stayed in 87 evacuation centres (ECs). Around 3,376 families have taken temporary shelters outside ECs or with relatives.534 damaged houses were reported in Regions VIII, IX, X, MIMAROPA, and BARMM. 110 road sections and 4 bridge sections have been affected (15 roads and 3 bridges still not passable) and 56 cities/municipalities experienced power outage.The government continues to publish warnings and advisories for shear line. Search, Rescue, and Retrieval operations and damages assessments are ongoing. The Philippine Red Cross is on the ground providing health, food, hygiene promotion, and rescues assistance.Wetter conditions are expected in the coming week according to ASEAN Specialised Meteorological Centre.

title: USA - Severe weather (ECHO 22 Dec 2022)
description: Heavy snowfall and very low temperatures have been affecting northern USA (particularly South Dakota) and the Pacific Northwest region (in particular Oregon, Washington and Idaho) over the last 72 hours, causing a number of severe weather-related incidents (in particular due to the snow) that have resulted in casualties and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 21 December, five fatalities and some evacuated people in two shelters in the area of Mission, Rosebud, Oglala, and Elisworth Towns (central-southern South Dakota).In addition, media report as of 22 December, one fatality in the Portland City area (Oregon) and a number of closed roads across northern Idaho and east of the Seattle City area (Washington).Over the next 24 hours, more snowfall, freezing rainfall and low temperatures are forecast over the whole of Oregon, most of Washington and western Idaho. NOAA has issued winter storm warnings over parts of Oregon and Washington.

title: Indonesia - Floods and landslides (ECHO 22 Dec 2022)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting northern Indonesia (in particular the northern Sumatra Island) since 18 December, causing floods, rivers overflow and triggering landslides that have resulted in evacuations and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 22 December, more than 2,400 evacuated people, nearly 2,200 affected houses and a total of approximately 7,400 affected people across the Aceh Province. In addition, ADINet also reports 35 evacuated people, over 4,000 affected houses and nearly 16,900 affected people throughout the North Sumatra Province.Over the next 48 hours, moderate rainfall is forecast over the Sumatra Island.

title: Philippines - Floods and landslides (ECHO 22 Dec 2022)
description: On 19-20 December, heavy rainfall affected parts of the Bicol Region (central-eastern Brazil), causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in widespread damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) and national authorities, more than 7,650 people have been displaced and most of them evacuated in 120 evacuation centres while almost 15,900 people have been affected. In addition, 86 sections of road have been interrupted and 11 cities experienced power cuts.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rainfall with localised thunderstorms is forecast over the Bicol Region, Eastern Visayas, Central Visayas, Caraga, Cagayan Valley and Apayao.An extreme flood advisory is in effect across parts of Caraga while a severe flood advisory has been issued for areas of Eastern Visayas.

title: Brazil - Floods and landslides (ECHO 22 Dec 2022)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall has been hitting parts of south-eastern Brazil, causing floods, triggering landslides and leading to casualties and damage.According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) and national authorities, two people died, and 47 others have been evacuated in Santa Catarina State. More than 1,500 people have been evacuated across the Espírito Santo State.For the next three days, moderate to heavy rain is forecast mostly over the States of north-western, central and south-eastern Brazil.Orange alerts for hydrological risk are in effect across parts of Minas Gerais, the whole Espírito Santo and Rio de Janeiro States. Orange alerts for geological risks have been issued in north-eastern Espírito Santo State.

title: Ecuador - Volcanic activity (ECHO 22 Dec 2022)
description: Over the past two days, Cotopaxi volcano, located close to Latacunga city in Cotopaxi province (central Ecuador) about 50 km south of Quito, continued its explosive activity, and the ash plume reached up to approximately 1 km above the summit of the crater as recorded by the Geophysical Institute of Ecuador (IGEPN).According to the latest report of IGEPN, as of 20 December, the ash has been travelling north-northwestwards, falling across the sectors of San Pedro de Taboada, Uyumbicho, Güitig Alta, Güitig Baja, Conocoto, Sur de Quito, Chimbacalle, La Magdalena, Barrio Nuevo,  Villaflora,  Miraflores and La  Floresta.As of 21 December, the activity is still ongoing.

title: Japan - Severe weather (ECHO 21 Dec 2022)
description: Heavy snowfall affected parts of northern Honshu Island (northern Japan) over the past few days, resulting in casualties and damage. The most affected Prefectures are Niigata, Yamagata, and Aomori.According to media reports, three people died (one in Kashiwazaki Town, one in Hokkaido City and another in Akita City), thousands experienced power outages, and several trains have been disrupted.For the next 24 hours, moderate precipitations (including snow over northern Honshu) are forecast across central-northern Japan.

title: USA - Earthquake (ECHO 21 Dec 2022)
description: An earthquake of 6.4 M at a depth of 18 km occurred off the coast of north-western California State (western USA) on 20 December at 10.34 UTC (2.34 local time). The epicentre was located offshore approximately 15 km west-southwest of Ferndale City (Humboldt County, California).USGS PAGER estimated that up to 74,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking while 50,000 to strong shaking.Around 80 aftershocks with magnitude up to 4.9 M have been recorded in the area.According to media reports, as of 21 December, two people have died due to medical emergencies occurring during or just after the main event. Media also report 12 injured people and approximately 71,000 customers that have been impacted by power outages, most of them in the Humboldt county. In additon, there are reports of some damaged roads and houses.

title: Malaysia, Thailand - Floods, update (ECHO 20 Dec 2022)
description: Heavy rain continues to affect nine provinces of southern Thailand and five states of Peninsular Malaysia, causing floods, casualties and damage.In Thailand, according to media, four people died (three in Narathiwat province and one in Songkhla province). More than 55,000 people have been affected across the provinces of Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Phatthalung, Satun, Songkhla, Pattani, Yala, and Narathiwat. The hardest hit areas were Narathiwat, Nakhon Si Thammarat and Songkhla provinces. The government is expediting the damage assessment. Provincial Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Office provided boats to the municipality to facilitate the helping of flood victims.In Peninsular Malaysia, following widespread floods that are hitting the states of Johor, Kelantan, Pahang, Perak, and Terengganu, the number of fatalities reached five people. More than 63,000 people have been displaced and most of them were evacuated in 458 evacuation centres (ASEAN Disaster Information Network - ADINet).For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is expected over southern Thailand while heavy, very heavy rainfall is forecast across north-eastern Malaysia.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo - Flash floods and landslides, update (ECHO 20 Dec 2022)
description: Following landslides, flash floods, mudflows and rivers overflow that occurred across several neighbourhoods of the capital Kinshasa (western Democratic Republic of the Congo) over 12-14 December, the number of casualties has increased and severe damage was reported.The worst affected areas are in the south-western Kinshasa metropolitan area, in particular Mont-Ngafula, Ngaliema and Mitendi. In this latter occurred a massive sinkhole that caused a significant number of casualties.UN OCHA reports at least 169 fatalities, 30 injured people, around 280 destroyed houses and a total of approximately 38,000 affected people across the Kinshasa metropolitan area.Over the next 24 hours, more rainfall is forecast over the Kinshasa area and over western Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Dec 2022)
description: Heavy rainfall and strong winds have been affecting central Indonesia (in particular Sumatra, Java, and Sulawesi Islands) since 17 December, causing floods, rivers overflow and strong wind-related incidents that have resulted in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports, as of 19 December, one fatality, more than 600 affected people and over 120 damaged houses across the South Lampung regency (Lampung province, southern Sumatra) due to strong wind. Nearly 1,300 affected people were also reported in the neighbouring West Java province, due to floods. In addition, ADINet reports one fatality, nearly 8,000 affected people and approximately 3,000 damaged houses across the northern Sulawesi Island (gorontalo, and North Sulawesi Provinces), also in this case due to floods.Over the next 24 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over Sumatra, Java, and Sulawesi Islands.

title: Morocco - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Dec 2022)
description: Heavy rain has affected parts of northern Morocco over the past week, causing severe weather-related events and leading to casualties and damage.According to media reports, three people died in Casablanca city (north-western Morocco) following a partial collapse of a house triggered by heavy rainfall.For the next 24 hours, drier conditions are expected over the country.

title: Malaysia – Flooding and landslides in Peninsular Malaysia (ECHO 19 Dec 2022)
description: Northeast Monsoon have caused a series of floods and landslides in several states.
