description: The humanitarian impact is increasing following widespread floods triggered by the 2022 rainy season that is impacting several States of Sudan.According to the latest data from UN OCHA and Sudan's National Civil Defence Council, 89 people have died, 30 have been injured and almost 200,000 affected across 15 out of the 18 States of Sudan. In addition, more than 12,700 houses have been destroyed and over 29,000 damaged.Humanitarian organisations are supporting and providing help to the affected people.On 24-25 August, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected over eastern, southern and western Sudan.

title: The Philippines - Tropical Cyclone Ma-On (ECHO 24 Aug 2022)
description: Tropical Cyclone (TC) Ma-On, known in the Philippines as Florita, has affected 4,646 people or 1,344 families as of 24 August, a day after it has made landfall in the province of Isabela, Cagayan Valley region. According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC), 60 barangays have been hit mostly in the regions of Ilocos, Cagayan Valley, and Cordillera Administrative Region (CAR). Abra province in CAR was devastated by a  magnitude 7 earthquake only last month. The President has ordered suspension of work in government offices today in several provinces in Luzon and Metro Manila.TC Ma-On left the Philippine Area of Responsibility on 24 August although eleven areas in northern Luzon remain under TC Wind Signal No 1 (gusts reaching strong breeze to gale-force strength may still be experienced in the next 24 hours).DG ECHO Manila continues to monitor the situation, especially of the flooded areas in northern Luzon that have been recently affected by the earthquake and which have  experienced non-stop rain in the last two days.

title: Chad - Floods (ECHO 24 Aug 2022)
description: Recent rainfall has affected more than 341,000 people in 11 of the 23 provinces of Chad, as reported by UN OCHA.One of the most impacted areas includes the province of Logone Occidental with 147,129 affected people, followed by Sila with 77,357 and N'Djamena with 41,262. National authorities, as well as intergovernmental agencies, are responding to the emergency by providing food and non-food kits to the affected provinces.On 24-25 August, heavy to locally very heavy rainfall is forecast over central and southern Chad.

title: China - Floods and landslides update (ECHO 24 Aug 2022)
description: Recent floods and landslides caused by heavy rainfall in north-west China's Qinghai Province have resulted in at least 23 fatalities, while eight people are missing, as reported by the official Chinese news agency (Xinhua).More than 6,000 residents in Datong County have been affected, and about 1,800 individuals have been displaced to temporary shelters.On 24-25 August, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast in eastern Qinghai Province.

title: The Philippines, China - Tropical Storm MA-ON
description: Tropical storm MA-ON (FLORITA in the Philippines) made landfall over eastern Cagayan Valley crossed northern Luzon, and continued moving north-west over northern South China Sea towards south-eastern China. On 24 August at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located about 470 km southeast of Hong Kong City, with maximum sustained winds of 93 km/h (tropical storm).According to national authorties, almost 2,800 people have been displaced (2,129 evacuated in 51 evacuation centres), and more than 7,600 affected across the Regions of Ilocos, Cagayan Valley, Central Luzon, Metro Manila and CAR.MA-ON is forecast to continue moving north-west, and it will make landfall over the south-eastern coast of Guangdong Province on 25 August with maximum sustained winds up to 110 km/h.On 24-25 August, moderate to heavy rainfall with strong winds is forecast over the coastal regions of southern Guangdong, northeastern Hainan Island, southern Guangxi (southeastern China), and northern Luzon (northern Philippines).

title: Nepal - Landslides and floods update
description: Since the beginning of August, several Provinces of Nepal have been affected by landslides, floods, strong winds, and heavy rainfall-related events.According to the Nepal Disaster Risk Reduction Portal (DRR), 11 people have died and 13 others have been injured. About 60 houses have been fully or partially damaged, while 26 individuals have been displaced.On 24-25 August, light to moderate rainfall is forecast over most of Nepal.

title: Nigeria - Floods update (ECHO 23 Aug 2022)
description: Floods continue to affect Jigawa State (northern Nigeria), resulting in an increased humanitarian impact.According to Nigeria National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA)  and media reports, at least 50 people have died across Jigawa, since the beginning of the rainy season. Hundreds of households have been displaced to 11 temporary camps, as floods have destroyed many houses, infrastructure, farmlands, livestock, and properties.On 23-25 August, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over most of Nigeria, including Jigawa State.

title: The Philippines, China - Tropical Storm MA-ON (ECHO 23 Aug 2022)
description: Tropical storm MA-ON (FLORITA in the Philippines) formed over the western Philippine Sea, and is moving north-west towards northern Luzon (northern Philippines). On 23 August at 0.00 UTC, its centre was located about 20 km east-southeast of Palanan City (Isabela Province, Cagayan Valley Region), with maximum sustained winds of 111 km/h (tropical storm).MA-ON is forecast to make landfall over the north-east of Cagayan Valley region,very close to Palanan City, during the morning of 23 August (UTC). Afterwards, it will cross northern Cagayan Valley, CAR and Ilocos regions, and will move over the northern South China Sea. It could reach the central-eastern coast of Guangdong Province (southern China) on 25 August.On 23-24 August, heavy rain, strong winds and storm surge are forecast over most parts of northern Luzon where a severe tropical storm warning is in effect.

title: Indonesia - Floods (ECHO 23 Aug 2022)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting Sumatra Island (western Indonesia) over the past few days, causing floods, and triggering landslides that have resulted in damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), almost 10,000 people have been affected as well as more than 2,000 houses in North Sumatra Province. In addition, more than 5,000 people have been affected and more than 1,000 houses damaged in Bengkulu Province.On 23-24 August, moderate to heavy rain with thunderstorms is forecast over the affected Provinces.

title: China - Wildfires (ECHO 23 Aug 2022)
description: Persistent drought and hot meteorological conditions have led to multiple wildfires across Chongqing Municipality (south-west China).According to media reports, more than 1,500 people have been evacuated and over 5,000 personnel have been mobilised for firefighting operations.Red warnings for fire danger and high temperatures have been issued on 23 August by meteorological authorities in Chongqing.According to the Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire risk on 23-25 August is expected to be from very high to extreme over Chongqing.

title: Bangladesh – Cox’s Bazar floods
description: Since the beginning of June, Rohingya refugee camps and host communities in Cox’s Bazar (Chattogram Division, south-eastern Bangladesh) have been affected by heavy monsoon rainfall and strong winds.According to the latest UN OCHA, one person has died and 328 refugees have been displaced. More than 52,310 refugees have been affected by monsoon rainfall. There has been extensive damage to at least 13,100 refugee shelters, and to two education centres.On 23-24 August, light to moderate rainfall with thunderstorms is forecast over most of Chattogram Division.

title: Pakistan - Monsoon floods update (ECHO 22 Aug 2022)
description: The monsoon floods continue to affect several provinces of Pakistan, resulting in increased humanitarian needs.Over the last 24 hours, 49 deaths were reported, the majority in Sindh, taking the death toll to 777 since mid-June, and 59,665 houses were damaged, taking the total damaged houses to 176,436, mostly in Sindh and Balochistan.According to National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), as of 21 August, around 1,868,098 people were rescued, and 37,996 individuals are living in relief camps across the country.In Sindh, as of 20 August, 1,356,863 people are affected, with 309,944 households affected and around 495,381 are displaced due to floods in the province.According to Flood Forecasting Division (FFD), the River Indus at Taunsa, Guddu and Sukkur is in medium flood level. The River Indus at Tarbela, Kalabagh, Chashma, Kotri and River Kabul at Nowshera are in low flood level.Moderate to heavy flash flooding is expected in the Rivers/Nullahs of eastern Balochistan during next 24 hours. Very high to exceptionally high-level flooding is likely in the hill torrents of Dera Ghazi Khan Division during the next 24 hours.

title: India - Monsoon rain update (ECHO 22 Aug 2022)
description: Heavy monsoon rains continue to affect northern and eastern India over the past three days, triggering landslides, causing rivers to overflow. Severe weather-related incidents, and severe floods that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage.According to media reports, at least 50 people died in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Jharkhand States due to floods and landslides. At least 13 were reported missing. In addition, across the eastern State of Odisha, at least six people died and 800,000 were displaced following ongoing torrential rains.On 22-23 August, moderate to heavy rain with localised thunderstorms is forecast over most parts of northern, central-northern, eastern and western India.

title: Afghanistan - Flash floods update (ECHO 22 Aug 2022)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall has affected eastern Afghanistan, causing flash floods that resulted in casualties and widespread damage.According to media reports, as of 21 August, at least 20 people have died, and 30 others have been injured across Logar province. In addition, 3,000 houses have been destroyed as well as several hectares of crops.National authorities are providing help to those affected and are evacuating the displaced people after their houses were destroyed.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over most parts of eastern and north-eastern Afghanistan.

title: Portugal - Forest fires (ECHO 20 Aug 2022)
description: According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 20-21 August is expected to be from very high to extreme danger.The risk for forest fires in Portugal is expected to increase significantly in the upcoming days, according to the National Meteorological Authority.Due to forecasts of very low levels of humidity and very high temperatures, the Portuguese government has issued an alert declaration for 21-24 August. 8 out of 18 districts are set on orange alert, while 7 additional districts will be on red alert level as from tomorrow.On 19 August, Portugal activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism requesting two aerial firefighting modules to be prepositioned during 21-25 August in the Military Base of Monte Real. In response, the ERCC has mobilised ECPP aerial firefighting means (two Canadair planes) from Greece.The planes departed today at 10:15 UTC and are scheduled to arrive in Portugal tomorrow 21 August (arrival time TBC).The ERCC is in contact with other Member States checking availability of their AFF fleet.

title: India, Bangladesh - Tropical Storm FOUR (ECHO 19 Aug 2022)
description: The newly formed Tropical Storm FOUR, is moving north-westwards over the northern Bay of Bengal, towards north-eastern India, and south-western Bangladesh.FOUR is forecast to strengthen as it makes landfall in the morning of 19 August over an area between Digha City (West Bengal) and Balasore (Odisha), with maximum sustained winds up to 85 km/h. After that FOUR is expected to downgrade to a tropical depression.Odisha State has already been impacted by recent heavy rainfall, which has caused widespread floods and landslides. According to media reports, more than 467,000 people have been affected across 10 districts of Odisha, and over 60,000 individuals have been evacuated.On 19-20 August, heavy to locally very heavy rainfall with strong winds and thunderstorms is forecast over north-eastern India (inclduing Odisha and West Bengal), while moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected over southern Bangladesh.

title: China - Flash floods (ECHO 19 Aug 2022)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall has affected Qinghai Province (western China), causing flash floods, triggering mudslides and resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least 16 people have died, 36 are still missing and more than 6,200 people have been affected across the Province.Search and rescue operations conducted by 600 people and 107 vehicles are ongoing.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain with localized thunderstorms is forecast over eastern Qinghai Province.

title: Cameroon - Landslide and floods (ECHO 19 Aug 2022)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect parts of Cameroon, triggering landslides and causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to media reports, five people died and many others have been injured after a landslide occurred in Northwest Region (western Cameroon) on 11 August. In addition, on the same day, 100 people have been displaced and 30 houses were destroyed following floods in Southwest Region (south-western).On 19-20 August, moderate rain is expected over western, eastern and northern Cameroon.

title: Austria, France, Italy - Severe weather (ECHO 19 Aug 2022)
description: On 18 August, heavy rainfall with thunderstorms and strong winds affected several parts of Austria, France, and Italy, causing floods and severe weather-related incidents that resulted in casualties and damage.In France, the Operational Centre for Inter-ministerial Crisis Management (COGIC) reports five fatalities and thirty-three injuries, following severe thunderstorms across Corsica Island. In addition, media reports power cuts and flooded streets in some southern areas of the French mainland.In Austria, five people died due to severe weather-related incidents (three in Lower Austria province and two others in Lake Carinthia) as reported by media.Furthermore, in Italy, two people died, and fifteen have been injured in Tuscany region due to strong winds. Widespread damage has been reported across parts of central and northern Italy (particularly in Liguria Region where the Genoa-La Spezia railway has been temporarily suspended).On 19 August, moderate rain with localised thunderstorms is forecast over Corsica Island, eastern French mainland, central-western and northern Italy, and most parts of Austria. On 20 August, moderate rain is expected over western and northern Austria.

title: Algeria - Wildfires update (ECHO 19 Aug 2022)
description: Wildfires continue to burn across northern and north-eastern Algeria, causing a considerate humanitarian impact.According to the Algeria Press Service (APS) and media reports, since 15 August, at least 37 people have died (most of them in  El Taref Province, north-eastern Algeria), and more than 200 others have been injured, including 10 firefighters. The affected areas include the Provinces of El Taref, Souk Ahras, Sétif Province, and Guelma.On 18-19 August, the Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), has reported several active fires across northern Algeria.According to GWIS, the fire danger forecast on 19-21 August is expected to be from very high to extreme over most of northern Algeria.

title: Sudan - Floods, update
description: The death toll has increased following widespread floods across most parts of Sudan.According to media, as of 18 August, 77 people have died, while UN OCHA reports more than 146,000 affected people and almost 31,600 houses damaged or destroyed. The worst hit State is Central Darfur with 26,340 affected people and more than 5,200 impacted houses.On 19-20 August, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over the western, eastern, and southern States.

title: Afghanistan - Floods and flash floods update (ECHO 18 Aug 2022)
description: Between 11 and 15 August, heavy rainfall caused floods and flash floods across several provinces across the eastern, southern, south-eastern, and central regions of Afghanistan, leading to a humanitarian impact.According to the latest UN OCHA report, the number of fatalities has increased to 41 people (11 in Parwan province, 11 in Nangarhar province, and nine in Logar province), while 17 individuals were injured.Across the impacted areas, heavy rainfall destroyed or damaged almost 790 houses (434 in Nangarhar), affecting more than 3,720 families in total. Floods have destroyed crops, agricultural land, and the local transportation infrastructure, isolating several communities.A number of international humanitarian organisations are assisting the local affected population with food, emergency shelter and non-food items, as well as conducting inter-agency impact and needs assessments.On 18-19 August, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over eastern areas of Afghanistan.

title: Madagascar - Drought and cyclones (ECHO 18 Aug 2022)
description: In consultation with the national authorities, a technical extension of the humanitarian appeal in Madagascar has been published on 16 August in order to mobilise additional resources for life-saving interventions until the end of 2022 for areas affected by drought and cyclones.This third version of the Flash Appeal asks an additional USD 154.7 million over the next six months, and will target 1.9 million people, to complete the government response.Despite its humanitarian nature, this third version of the Appeal emphasises a resilience approach, taking into account the specific needs of communities in drought and cyclones affected areas.

title: Chad - Floods update (ECHO 18 Aug 2022)
description: The most recent rains from Monday 15 August worsened the estimated number of populations affected by floods. According to the latest figures (17 August) communicated by the national flood’s crisis committee, led by the Ministry of Health and Solidarity, 46,090 households (292,585 people) have been estimated to be affected over 11 provinces throughout the country.The southern provinces remain the most affected: Logone Oriental and Occidental, Mayo Kebbi Est and Ouest, Salamat and Sila. The number of people affected in the city of N'Djamena is estimated at 41,262.A very high risk of additional river flooding is expected in the coming days. In Western Chad, 60,000 people could be directly exposed.Contingency plans are being revised in light of the situation and assessment missions have been deployed to affected areas.

title: Algeria - Forest fires (ECHO 18 Aug 2022)
description: Over the past days, almost 40 forest fires have affected 14 provinces of northern Algeria, resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least 26 people have died, 24 of whom in El Tarf province and two in Sétif province (north-eastern Algeria). In addition, 350 residents have been evacuated in various provinces.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (EFFIS), on 18-19 August, the fire risk will be extreme over northern-central Algeria, and from moderate to very high over the north-eastern and north-western areas.

title: The Philippines - Floods (ECHO 18 Aug 2022)
description: Over the past week, heavy rainfall has affected the municipalities of Aurora and San Manuel in Isabela province (north-eastern Luzon, northern Philippines), causing floods that resulted in casualties and damage.According to the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD-DROMIC), more than 1,700 people have been evacuated to seven evacuation centres, while almost 21,000 have been affected.For the next 24 hours, scattered moderate to heavy rain with isolated thunderstorms is forecast over the affected province.

title: New Zealand - Severe weather (ECHO 18 Aug 2022)
description: Heavy rain has been affecting parts of New Zealand over the past three days, causing damaing floodsand landslides and resulting in evacuations.According to media reports, at least 230 homes have been evacuated in Nelson town (northern South Island), and residents have been isolated in some areas of North Island following localised landslides. Schools have been closed, several roads have been blocked and flights cancelled across the country.According to the New Zealand Civil Defense, local states of emergency have been declared for Nelson-Tasman and West Coast regions.On 18-19 August moderate to heavy rain is forecast over most parts of New Zealand.

title: Niger - Floods update (ECHO 17 Aug 2022)
description: The rainy season that started at the beginning of June continues to affect Niger, resulting in increased humanitarian impact.According to media reports, so far at least 32 people have died and more than 66,000 persons have been affected.The most impacted regions include Zinder (southern Niger), Diffa (south-east Niger) and Tillabéri (south-west Niger). Across the affected areas, heavy rainfall destroyed or damaged more than 7,000 homes and caused the collapse of classrooms, health care centres, granaries and other buildings.On 17-19 August, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over southern and central-western Niger.

title: Pakistan - Monsoon rain update (ECHO 17 Aug 2022)
description: Parts of Pakistan continue to be affected by monsoon rain, which has caused floods, landslides, flash floods, and severe weather-related incidents.According to the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), on 16 August, 635 people died across seven provinces, most of them in Balochistan (196 fatalities). More than 1,010 individuals have been injured, while damage has been reported to at least 72,500 houses. In addition, 110,440 livestock has been lost and more than 2,800 km of roads and 130 bridges have been damaged.On 17-18 August, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over most parts of Pakistan, particualrly in central and southern areas.

title: Morocco - Forest fire (ECHO 17 Aug 2022)
description: A forest fire reportedly broke out on 15 August in the Koudiat Taifour forest, near M'diq town (Tanger-Tetouan-Al Hoceima Region, northern Morocco), resulting in casualties.According to media reports, three firefighters died and two others were injured during operations. The forest fire has affected an approximate area of 120 ha.Rescuers are continuing their efforts to control the forest fire, and prevent it from spreading to densely populated areas.According to the Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire risk is expected to be from very high to extreme on 17-19 August over most of Morocco, including M'diq town.

title: Spain - Wildfires update (ECHO 17 Aug 2022)
description: Wildfires continue to particularly affect the Valencian Community (central coast of eastern Spain), resulting in casualties and preventive evacuations, as reported by the Spanish Department of Homeland Security (DSN).A wildfire in Bejís (Castellón province), affected the train route Valencia Nord - Miraflores, causing injury to twenty five passengers and three firefighters, while preventive evacuations occurred for about 2,000 people in the localities of Bejís, Torás, Teresa, and Sacañet, in addition to the confinement of the village of Viver.As the wildfire in Vall de Ebo (Alicante province) continues to advance, new evacuations have been carried out in Benimasot village.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 17-18 August, is expected to be mostly extreme over the Valencian Community.

title: Afghanistan - Floods (ECHO 16 Aug 2022)
description: Unseasonally heavy rains and flash floods continue to affect several provinces in Afghanistan since the end of July.Severe flooding caused by heavy rainfall was reported on 13-14 August particularly affecting the central, eastern and south-eastern regions (Kapisa, Khost, Nangarhar, Parwan, Paktia, Paktika, Logar, Maidan-Wardak and Ghazni provinces).The Afghan State news agency (Bakhtar News) reported that in Siagard and Shenwari districts (Parwan province), at least 31 people have died and 17 others sustained injuries. About 100 individuals are missing as search and rescue operations are ongoing. Floods have destroyed more than 700 shelters and buildings, while damaging hundreds of hectares of farmland, livestock, transportation infrastructure, and dams, as reported by the Afghan Red Crescent.Humanitarian agencies are currently deployed to assess the impact and plan for an emergency response.On 16-18 August, moderate to locally heavy rainfall is forecast over eastern Afghanistan, including Parwan province.

title: Sudan - Floods update (ECHO 16 Aug 2022)
description: Floods and flash floods continue to impact various states in Sudan resulting in an increasing number of casualties and damage.According to the authorities and humanitarian organisations, as of 15 August, 52 people have died, more than 8,900 houses have been destroyed and another 20,600 damaged in 12 states. About 136,000 people have been affected since May 2022.The floods have also affected 238 health facilities, more than 1,500 water sources and damaged or washed away 1,500 latrines.Compared to the same period of 2021, the number of affected people and localities this year has doubled, but the water levels along the five major stations on the Nile remain below the alert level for now.

title: South East Asia - Severe Weather (ECHO 16 Aug 2022)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rain and strong winds have affected parts of Vietnam, northern Thailand, Myanmar, and northern Laos causing floods, triggering landslides and resulting in casualties and damage.In Vietnam, at least six people have died throughout the northern region following torrential rains and floods as reported by the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet). The same source and media report one fatality and 3,000 affected people in northern Thailand. Furthermore, in northern Laos, thousands of people have been affected by river overflows.On 16-17 August, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over southern Myanmar and most parts of Vietnam, Thailand, Laos and Cambodia.

title: Mexico - Flash Floods (ECHO 16 Aug 2022)
description: On 13 August, flash floods caused by heavy rainfall were reported across Sonora State (north-western Mexico), affecting particularly Nogales City and resulting in casualties.According to national authorities, three people died and 11 others were rescued in different parts of Nogales. Damage was reported to a number of roads and bridges.On 16-17 August, very to locally very heavy rainfall with thunderstorms and hailstorm is forecast over western Mexico, including Sonora State.

title: Spain - Wildfires (ECHO 16 Aug 2022)
description: A number of wildfires have been reported across Spain, as reported by the Spanish Department of Homeland Security (DSN).A wildfire in Vall de Ebo Municipality (Alicante Province), resulted in the evacuation of more than 2,100 people from across a dozen villages.The improvement of meteorological conditions, as well as firefighting operations, have contributed to the stabilisation of a wildfire in Añón del Moncayo Municipality (Zaragoza Province). Most of the 1,500 evacuated people from 7 villages have been able to return to their homes.On 13 August, the EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated for wildfire in Añón del Moncayo () to provide a first estimation and delineation with monitoring and grading products.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 16 August is from very high to extreme over most of Spain, while on 17 August it is expected to be from high to very high over central Spain and up to extreme over southern and central-eastern Spain.

title: France - Forest Fires update (ECHO 16 Aug 2022)
description: Over the weekend, rainfall occurred in Gironde and Brittany, which improved the situation. However, due to the ongoing fires in these regions, operations are still ongoing.The 10,000 people evacuated in Gironde have returned to their homes.As part of the UCPM response, ground firefighting teams from Austria, Romania, Poland and Germany are still active in France. The aerial forest fire fighting capacities from Sweden, Italy and Greece (rescEU) completed their missions on 15 August.The EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated ().

title: Nigeria - Floods update
description: Over recent days, heavy rainfall and widespread floods continue to affect northern Nigeria, leading to casualties and damage.According to media reports, in Jigawa State, at least 50 people have died, and thousands of houses have been damaged leaving several displaced people.The authorities are providing help for those displaced, and eleven temporary camps have been set up in various parts of the State.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over the affected State.

title: M7 in Philippines - UNITAR-UNOSAT activation
description: UNITAR-UNOSAT Potentially Damaged Buildings has been activated

title: Albania - Forest Fire update (ECHO 31 Jul 2022)
description: ·        On 30 July, Greece offered 2 firefighting planes (PZL) to Albania under the EU Civil Protection Mechanism. The planes operated on 30 July and are operating again today 31 July.·        The operations carried out by the Greek firefighting planes and national ground forces made possible to keep the villages of Dropull municipality out of danger.·        Today, the fire has passed in the Municipality of Finiq and heading towards the village of Kardhikaq. As a result of the wind, the fire has spread towards the village of Pece. If the situation remains the same, the fire is expected to move towards Syri Kalter, which is a natural monument.·        The fire continues in the village of Bogë, municipality of Malësi e Madhe. This is a mountainous area where it is difficult to operate.·        50 armed forces and 30 local government forces are engaged since the early hours of the morning in the fire in Rehove village, Polican municipality, in forest area. Part of the fire was isolated, although the wind is a real risk as it can reactivate the fire.·        Local government forces and the Armed Forces of the central government continue working on the ground and the intervention from the air is still needed.·        According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger for 1 August is very high to extreme in the affected areas.

title: Iran - Landslides and Floods (ECHO 29 Jul 2022)
description: Heavy rain has affected Tehran province (northern Iran) in the past few days, triggering landslides and flash floods resulting in casualties and damage.According to the Iranian Red Crescent, the events occurred in Emamzadeh Davoud village (western Tehran) where eight people died, 19 are still missing, and nine others have been injured.The Iranian Red Crescent is providing help to those affected and has already relocated 500 people to safe areas.Over the past week, 18 provinces of Iran have been affected by flood events.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over the affected area.

title: Philippines - Earthquake - update (ECHO 29 Jul 2022)
description: The number of the casualties has increased following the 7.0 M earthquake which occurred on 27 July in Abra province (northern Philippines).On 29 July, a series of aftershocks of magnitude up to 3.7 M have been reported over the affected area.According to the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC), six people died, four are still missing, and 136 have been injured. In addition, 7,331 people have been displaced, more than 79,260 affected, and 1,583 houses damaged across Ilocos region and Cordillera administrative region.On 29-30 July, moderate rain is forecast over northern Luzon. A general flood advisory is in effect for Abra province.The EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated on 27 July () to support damage assessment.

title: USA - Floods (ECHO 29 Jul 2022)
description: Since 26 July, floods, triggered by heavy rainfall, have been affecting central-eastern USA, particularly Kentucky and Missouri states, resulting in casualties.According to media reports, at least eight people died and several are still missing across south-eastern Kentucky, as search and rescue operations continue. More than 23,000 households are without power and many communities in the impacted areas don't have access to water.In Missouri state, two people died, about 70 were rescued, and several houses were damaged by the flooding which occurred in St. Louis region (central-eastern Missouri).A state of emergency due to severe flooding has been declared for eastern Kentucky. Flood and flash flood warnings have been issued for eastern Kentucky and south-western Virginia.On 29-30 July, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over central USA, including Missouri and Kentucky.

title: Pakistan - Monsoon Rains - update (ECHO 29 Jul 2022)
description: Monsoon rain continues to affect several provinces of Pakistan, causing floods, landslides, flash floods, and severe weather-related incidents which have resulted in casualties, damage, and increased humanitarian impact.According to the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), as of 28 July, 357 people died across seven provinces, most of them in Balochistan (106 fatalities), more than 400 sustained injuries, and approximately 23,800 houses have been damaged.Warnings for floods and flash floods have been issued for urban areas in northern Pakistan, including the cities of Islamabad and Peshawar. On 29-30 July, more heavy rain with thunderstorms is expected in Punjab, Islamabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, north and eastern Balochistan, Kashmir and Gilgit-Baltistan.

title: Japan, China - Tropical Depression SONGDA (ECHO 29 Jul 2022)
description: The tropical depression SONGDA formed over the western North Pacific on 28 July and is moving north-west, towards Ryukyu islands (southern Japan). On 29 July at 0.00 UTC, its center was located about 370 km south-east of Tanegashima island (northern Ryukyu), with maximum sustained winds of 56 km/h.After passing over Ryukyu on 29 July, SONGDA is forecast to enter the East China Sea on 30 July and continue moving westwards as a tropical depression. It could reach the coast of Shanghai city on the evening of 30 July, as a tropical depression.Strong winds, moderate rainfall, and high waves are forecast on 29-30 July over Ryukyu, while heavy rainfall, strong winds, and lightnings, are expected on 30-31 July for the Shanghai area.

title: Czechia - Forest Fire - update (ECHO 29 Jul 2022)
description: Firefighting operations continue for the forest fire that is burning in the Bohemian Switzerland National Park (northern Czechia) and in the Saxony Switzerland National Park (central-eastern Germany), affecting an area of more than 1,000 ha.In Czechia, operations continue, and the situation remains serious. On 28 July 2022, almost 500 firefighters from 80 fire units have been intervening. Over the night, the operations were limited, as the fire units focused on the defence of the inhabited areas.Two Air Tractor Fireboss airplanes mobilised by the Emergency Response and Coordination Centre from the rescEU reserve in Sweden have joined eight helicopters (of which one was deployed by Poland, and two by Slovakia through the EU's Civil Protection Mechanism) and two airplanes to support firefighting operations. The two Canadair firefighting planes from the rescEU reserve have returned to Italy today.The EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service () has produced maps of the area affected by the fire.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger is moderate on 29 July and low on 30 July over northern Czechia and central-eastern Germany.

title: Philippines - Earthquake, update (ECHO 28 Jul 2022)
description: After a strong earthquake of 7.0M at a depth of 10 km occurred on 27 July in the area of Abra province (Cordillera administrative region, northern Luzon, northern Philippines) the number of casualties has increased and more damage was reported across the affected area.The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) reports, as of 28 July, four fatalities, 131 injured people, more than 1,800 evacuated people (of which 567 across 21 evacuation centres) and a total of 12,945 affected people across Ilocos, and Cordillera administrative regions. In addition, NDRRMC reports 868 damaged houses, five damaged bridges and over 20 damaged roads.DG ECHO partners have started rapid assessments in the provinces of Ilocos Sur, Ilocos Norte, Abra, Mountain Province, and continue providing information on the situation. DG ECHO Manila office will start an assessment in the affected areas on 29 July 2022, with support mobilised by DG ECHO Bangkok office.Over the next 24 hours, heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Luzon island.

title: Niger - Floods (ECHO 28 Jul 2022)
description: Heavy rainfall continues to affect the country (in particular the southern regions) since the beginning of the rainy season (early June), causing severe floods that have resulted in casualties and widespread damage. The worst affected regions are: Zinder, Maradi, Diffa, Tahoua, Dosso, and Tillabéri.Media report, as of 28 July, 20 fatalities, 27 injured people, and a total of more than 48,400 affected people across the aforementioned regions.Over the next 48 hours, more heavy rainfall is forecast over southern Diffa and southern Zinder regions. Very heavy rainfall is forecast over the whole Maradi region.

title: Czechia, Germany - Forest fire update (ECHO 28 Jul 2022)
description: Firefighting operations continue for the forest fire that is burning in the Bohemian Switzerland National Park (northern Czechia) and in the Saxony Switzerland National Park (central-eastern Germany), affecting an area of more than 1,000 ha.On 27 July, the German Joint Information and Situation Centre (GMLZ) reported that two people were injured during firefighting operations, which are hindered by the difficult terrain and strong winds. In Czechia, operations continue and during the night the forces focused on protecting the evacuated municipalitities of Hrensko, Janov, Mezná, Mezní Louka and Vysoká Lípa.Two Canadair firefighting planes from the rescEU reserve in Italy mobilised by the Emergency Response and Coordination Centre have joined nine helicopters (of which one was deployed by Poland, and two by Slovakia through the EU's Civil Protection Mechanism) and two airplanes to support firefighting operations. The EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service () has released a first estimate product of the area affected by the fire.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger is from moderate to high on 28-29 July over northern Czechia and central-eastern Germany.

title: France - Wildfire (ECHO 28 Jul 2022)
description: A major wildfire broke out near Lussas town (Ardèche department, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, southern France), aggravated by the dry and windy weather conditions.According to the Operational Centre for Inter-ministerial Crisis Management (COGIC), the wildfire has affected more than 1,200 ha of vegetation and has caused the preventive evacuation of 400 people.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger over Ardèche department is high on 28 July and very low to low on 29 July.

title: Philippines - Earthquake (ECHO 27 Jul 2022)
description: A magnitude 7,0 earthquake hit northern Philippines at 08:43hr (UTC +8) 27 July 2022, severely affecting the provinces of Abra, Benguet, Ilocos Sur, Pangasinan, Mountain Province, Nueva Vizcaya. The epicenter was at 17km depth of focus resulting in a shallow earthquake of intensity 7 (very devastating) and intensity 6 (devastating) in 4 areas and intensity 5 in various localities including some in Metropolitan Manila. Landslides are reported.  At least six national road networks are not passable. Baguio City reports disruption of their water system.Reports from the national police and local government show at least three people dead. At least three major hospitals, Northern Benguet State Hospital, Abra Provincial Hospital, and Baguio General Hospital have reported a number of injured people waiting to be served outside the hospital premises. Displacement has been noted in various localities but still with no official reports. Rescue and retrieval operations are prioritized.DG ECHO Manila and Bangkok offices are monitoring the situation, DG ECHO partners are present on the ground in the affected areas and are providing first-hand localised information.

title: Central African Republic - Floods (ECHO 27 Jul 2022)
description: Since 21 July, heavy rain has been affecting several parts of the country, including the area of Bangui city, causing floods and flash floods causing in casualties and damage.According to media reports, at least 10 people died (of which nine in the prefecture of Lobaye, southern Central African Republic), three are still missing, and 250 houses collapsed displacing thousands of people.For the next 24 hours, moderate rain is forecast over most parts of the country.

title: Czechia, Germany - Forest fire update (ECHO 27 Jul 2022)
description: The forest fire which broke out on 24 July in the Bohemian Switzerland National Park (northern Czechia) continues to burn and it has spread further to the Saxony Switzerland National Park (central-eastern Germany).According to reports from the German Joint Information and Situation Centre (GMLZ) and the Czech Fire Rescue Service (HZSCR), the forest fire has affected an area of 1,000 hectares. In Czechia, residents from Hrensko, Mezná, Mezní Louka and Vysoká Lípa have been evacauted, as a number of houses have been damaged.Fire fighting operations have been hampered by unfavorable weather conditions (including high winds) and difficult terrain, which makes it difficult for operators to reach the affected area.On 26 July, Poland and Slovakia each deployed one helicopter to support operations, while Italy mobilised two Canadair from the rescEU reserve. One liaison officer from the ERCC is scheduled to arrive on 27 July in Prague and the EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated on 26 July ().According to the European Forest Fire Information System (), the fire danger on 27-28 July is mostly moderate over the affected area.

title: Germany - Wildfire (ECHO 27 Jul 2022)
description: On 25 July, a wildfire broke out in the Elbe-Elster district of Bradenburg state (central-eastern Germany), burning so far an area of 850 hectares, as reported by the German Joint Information and Situation Centre (GMLZ).During firefighting operations, eight people have been injured. A building has been severely damaged and the wildfire has caused the death of numerous animals. The towns of Kölsa, Kölsa-Siedlung and Rehfeld were preventively evacuated. The affected area is partially contaminated with ammunitions, hindering firefighting operations.The EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated on 26 July () to support damage assessment.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (), the fire danger on 27-28 July is from moderate to high over Bradenburg state.

title: France - Wildfires (ECHO 27 Jul 2022)
description: A wildfire has been burning in the Hérault department (southern France), affecting the natural area of Gignac and resulting in evacuations. At least 950 hectares have burned.According to the Operational Centre for Inter-ministerial Crisis Management (COGIC), at least 280 people have been evacuated, while authorities are focus their efforts on protecting the communes of Aumelas and Saint-Paul-et-Valmalle.National authorities mobilised five canadairs, 220 firefighters, reinforced by 130 extra-departmental firefighters, 260 extra-zonal firefighters and 40 rescuers.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (), the fire danger on 27-28 July for Hérault department is expected to be from high to very high.

title: M7 in Philippines - JRC emergency report
description: A new JRC Emergency report is now available

title: Pakistan - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 26 Jul 2022)
description: Monsoon rain continues to affect several provinces of Pakistan, causing floods, landslides, flash floods, and severe weather-related incidents that have resulted in casualties, damage and increased humanitarian impact.According to the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), as of 13 July, 312 people have died across seven provinces, most of them in Balochistan (102 fatalities), almost 300 have been injured, and approximately 10,500 houses were damaged.National authorities and the Pakistan Red Crescent Society (PRCS) are providing help across the affected provinces.On 26-27 July, more heavy rain with thunderstorms and strong winds is expected in Sindh, Balochistan, Punjab, Islamabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Kashmir, and Gilgit-Baltistan.

title: Ecuador - Earthquake (ECHO 26 Jul 2022)
description: An earthquake of 5.7 M (5.2 M as reported by national authorities) at a depth of 10 km occurred in northern Ecuador close to the border with Colombia, on 25 July at 13:33 UTC (08:33 local time). The epicentre was located in the Carchi province approximately 5 km south-west of San Gabriel city.The Geophysical Institute of Ecuador (IGEPN) reported eight aftershocks of magnitude up to 4.1 M.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 1,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 59,000 to strong shaking.According to the National Risk and Emergency Management Service (SNGRE), eight people have been injured, 18 houses have been destroyed, and 332 others damaged across six cantones.National authorities are providing emergency assistance for the affected people.

title: Czech Republic - Forest fire (ECHO 26 Jul 2022)
description: A forest fire reportedly broke out on 25 July in the Bohemian Switzerland National Park, close to Hrensko municipality (northern Czech Republic, near the border with Germany).According to national authorities, several hundreds of people have been evacuated, and an accommodation shelter has been opened in Decín municipality. During the evening of 25 July, firefighting operations focused on the immediate protection of the municipalities of Hrensko, Mezná, Mezní Louka, and Janov.On 26 July, Czech Republic activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism, requesting support with aerial firefighting means, due to the high wind conditions affecting the area.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger on 26-27 July is mostly high over the area affected by the forest fire and from high to very high over western Czech Republic.

title: Portugal - Wildfire (ECHO 26 Jul 2022)
description: On 25 July a new wildfire broke out in São Marcos da Serra locality (Silves municipality, northern Algarve region, southern Portugal), affecting an approximate area of 1,000 ha.According to media reports, preventive evacuations have occurred in several villages of Silves, and a section of the highway connecting Lisbon to Algarve was closed.More than 580 firefighters supported by 207 vehicles and 7 aerial means have been deployed to the area. The EU Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service () was activated on 26 July to assist authorities in firefighting operations.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger on 26 July is from extreme to very extreme over eastern Algarve (including Silves), while on 27-28 July it is from very high to extreme over Algarve.

title: Forest fire in Germany, Czech Republic - Copernicus EMS activation (EMSR610)
description: EMSR610: Copernicus Emergency Management Service has been activated

title: Forest fire in Germany, Czech Republic - JRC emergency report
description: A new JRC Emergency report is now available

title: Afghanistan - Floods (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: According to Ministry for Disaster Management, on 24 July flash floods killed at least 13 people and injured 20, in ten provinces in eastern Afghanistan. Most of the damages occurred in the provinces of Wardak, Paktia, Paktika, Nangarhar, Nuristan, Parwan and Panjshir.Parts of the Kabul-Jalalabad highway have been washed away, some bridges are damaged.  The main highway to Panjshir province has been blocked.The National Meteorological Department has issued a warning that heavy rainfall in the eastern and southern provinces may continue.

title: USA - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: A number of wildfires continue to burn across California and Texas over the past few days, prompting evacuations and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 24 July, two major active fires: the Oak fire located in Mariposa county (central California) and the Chalk Mountain fire located across Somervell, and Hood counties (central Texas, west of Dallas area). These two fires have burnt so far an area of more than 7,500 hectares (nearly 5,000 by the Oak fire alone) and they are currently not contained.For the wildfire in California, FEMA reports a mandatory evacuation order for over 3,200 people, ten destroyed and five damaged buildings. For the wildfire in Texas, 16 destroyed and five damaged buildings were reported.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to extreme over central California and central Texas.

title: Iran - Floods (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: Heavy rainfall has been affecting south-western Iran (particularly Fars province) since 22 July, triggering rivers overflow (in particular the Roudbal river) floods and flash floods and that have resulted in casualties and damage.Media report, as of 25 July, 22 fatalities, two persons still missing and around 90 injured people across ten villages in the aforementioned province. The worst affected areas are the villages nearby Estahban city.Over the next 24 hours, dryer conditions are forecast over Fars province.

title: Yemen - Floods (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: On 24 July, floods caused by heavy rainfall affected Sanaa and Dhamar governorates in central-western Yemen, resulting in at least 10 casualties.On 25-26 July, moderate rainfall is forecast over north-western (Saada city) and south-western (Taiz and Lahj cities) Yemen.Every year, Yemen is hit by devastating floods caused by heavy rains, which further exacerbates the humanitarian situation in the affected areas.

title: Japan - Volcanic eruption (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: On 24 July at 11:05 UTC (20.05 local time) Sakurajima volcano (located on the southern tip of Kyushu island near the city of Kagoshima, southern Japan) erupted and the volcanic products reached about 2.5 km from the crater, as reported by the Japanese Meteorological Agency (JMA).There were no immediate reports of damage or injuries in nearby cities. A volcanic alert level 5 (the highest level) was issued and residents in Kagoshima prefecture located within 3 km from Minamidake summit crater and Showa crater have been alerted to evacuate.

title: Slovenia - wildfires - update (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: The fire which broke out initially on 15 July 2022 in Western Slovenia became the biggest wildfire in the history of the country. According to Slovenian Civil Protection authorities, on 24 July afternoon, the fire was under control, but the situation can change again due to weather conditions.On 17 July, Slovenia activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism (UCPM) requesting for aerial firefighting means and ground forces. Five Member and Participating States to the UCPM assisted Slovenia in extinguishing the fire, providing five helicopters (from Austria, Croatia, Serbia, Slovakia), four airplanes (Croatia, Romania) and ground forces (Croatia). In addition, Hungary and Italy (Friuli Venezia region) offered two helicopters bilaterally.On 21 July, Copernicus EMS service was activated and maps are available at [].The fire danger in the Primorska region remains very high. As 26 July, showers and thunderstorms are forecast over most of Slovenia.

title: Italy - Wildfires, update (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: Forest fires continue to burn across most of Italy, in particular in Pordedone and Udine provinces (Friuli-Venezia Giulia region, north-eastern Italy), and the Matera province (Basilicata region, southern Italy) over the past few days triggering evacuations. Dry weather and very high temperatures have worsened the situation.Media report, as of 24 July, 300 evacuated people (in a number of evacuation centres) from Gabria and San Michele del Carso villages (Savogna d'Isonzo municipality, Gorizia province). In addition, media report 500 evacuated people in Cinigiano municipality (Grosseto province) and 150 evacuated people in Pisticci municipality (Matera province.The Italian Civil Protection reports, as of 24 July, one air intervention requested each from Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Tuscany, and Basilicata regions (in addition to 16 requested from other regions throughout the country).Over the next 24 hours, according to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC EFFIS), the fire danger forecast remains from high to etreme over the already affected Regions.Copernicus satellite mapping system have been activated for the fires in Tuscany () and Friuli-Venezia Giulia ().

title: Greece - Wildfires (ECHO 25 Jul 2022)
description: Several wildfires have been affecting parts of Greece, resulting in evacuations as reported by the Greek Civil Protection.In Eastern Macedonia and Thrace regions (north-eastern Greece, Dadia-Lefkimi-Soufli Forest National Park), a wildfire is burning near Dadia village, close to the border with Turkey, prompting precautionary evacuations of residents. Other evacuations are occurring in Vatera, Vrissa and Stavros localities due to a wildfire in southern Lesbos island, which has damaged a number of buildings. Residents have been preventively evacuated also in Ilia (north-western Peloponnese peninsula), after an active wildfire in the municipality of Andritsaina-Krestena.On 22-24 July 249 wildfires have been burning across Greece, prompting an immediate response of firefighting authorities thanks to which most of the fires have been brought under control.The EU's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated on 24 July for the wildfire in Lesbos () to assist authorities in firefighting operations and managing damage assessments.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger on 25-26 July is expected to be from very high to extreme over most of Greece.

title: USA - Wildfires
description: A number of wildfires continue to burn across California and Texas over the past few days, prompting evacuations and damage.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) reports, as of 24 July, two major active fires: the Oak fire located in Mariposa County (central California) and the Chalk Mountain fire located across Somervell, and Hood Counties (central Texas, west of Dallas area). These two fires have burnt so far an area of more than 7,500 hectares (nearly 5,000 by the Oak fire alone) and they are currently not contained.For the wildfire in California, FEMA reports a mandatory evacuation order for over 3,200 people, ten destroyed and five damaged buildings. For the wildfire in Texas, 16 destroyed and five damaged buildings were reported.Over the next 24 hours, according to the JRC Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS), the fire danger forecast is from very high to extreme over central California and central Texas.

title: Slovenia - wildfires (ECHO 23 Jul 2022)
description: The fire that broke out on 20 July 2022, in the municipality of Miren-Kostanjevica (north-western Slovenia) is still active and spreading over Karst ridge.The latest  analyses indicate that 2,500 ha were burnt.On 22 July, some 500 people were evacuated from 15 different villages. Inhabitants of two villages spent the night in evacuation centres while the others returned home in the evening.More than 1,000 firefighters, with support from Slovenian Armed Forces, Police, explosive ordnance disposal Units, forestry services and volunteers are involved in the operations. Three helicopters and one plane are providing aerial support for the ground forces.In addition, five helicopters from Austria, Croatia, Serbia (2), Slovakia, one rescEU Canadair hosted by Croatia, and two firefighting planes from Romania have been deployed to support the operations within the UCPM framework.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS) the fire risk on 23-24 July is expected to be extreme over western Slovenia.

title: Thailand - Floods (ECHO 22 Jul 2022)
description: Over the past few days, heavy rainfall has been affecting parts of northeastern, eastern, and central Thailand, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.According to the ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet), one person died, one is still missing, and 950 people have been affected.On 22-23 July, moderate to heavy rain is forecast across most parts of the country, particularly over northern and central Thailand.

title: Myanmar - Earthquake (ECHO 22 Jul 2022)
description: An arthquake of 5.9 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in eastern Myanmar, approximately 85 km west of the border with north-western Laos, on 21 July at 17:07 UTC (23:37 local time). The epicentre was located approximately 53 km south of Keng Tung town (Shan state).Two aftershocks of 4.8 M and 5.0 M have been recorded in the area.USGS PAGER estimates that up to 1,000 people were exposed to very strong shaking and up to 24,000 to strong shaking.According to media reports, there have been no initial reports of damage or casualties as a result of the earthquake.

title: Indonesia - Severe weather and floods (ECHO 22 Jul 2022)
description: Heavy rain and strong winds have been occurring across parts of Indonesia over the past few days, causing floods and resulting in casualties and damage.The ASEAN Disaster Information Network (ADINet) reports two fatalities and 215 affected people following a tornado event in Karimun regency (Riau Islands). In addition, 625 people have been affected by floods in Selayar Islands regency (South Sulawesi province).On 22 July, light rain is forecast over parts of Riau Islands while no rain is expected on 23 July over the affected provinces.

title: Spain - Wildfires (ECHO 21 Jul 2022)
description: Wildfires continue to affect parts of Spain, as reported by the Spanish Department of Homeland Security (DSN).In Zaragoza Province (Aragon Region, north-eastern Spain), more than 1,700 residents remain evacuated due to the Ateca wildfire, which cut off several sections of the A2 Main road and the high-speed rail line. In Guadalajara Province (Castilla-La Mancha, central Spain), residents remain displaced due to the wildfire in Valdepenas dela Sierra.In Galicia (north-western Spain), multiple fires continue to be active. Those affecting Folgoso do Courel (Lugo Province) and Carballeda de Valdeorras (Ourense Province) registered an improvement favored by weather conditions, although they continue to be out of control. Several active wildfires are burning in Castilla y León and the fire extinction works are hampered by changing winds.On 20 July, the Commission's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated for wildfires in Galicia () and in Castilla y León (, ).According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 21-22 July is mostly extreme over central and southern Spain and from high to very high danger over northern Spain.

title: Ivory Coast – Floods (ECHO 20 Jul 2022)
description: Since the 16 June heavy rains including torrential rains on 21 June with nearly 200 mm of water in less than 24 hours, equivalent of several weeks of rain, have caused major flooding and landslides in several neighbourhoods of Abidjan. To date, 15 people died and 114 were injured. A total of 11,478 people are affected and need emergency assistance including shelter for 2,418 people who lost their houses.On 13 July, the International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC) has launched an appeal to intervene in the communities Abobo, Anyama, Attecoubé, Bingerville, Port-Bouët, Grand-Bassam, Azaguié, Bonoua, and Dabou. With the support of DG ECHO, the IFRC will assist at least 4,686 people with shelter and livelihoods support through cash transfers, and activities to limit the spread of waterborne diseases.

title: Afghanistan - Earthquake (ECHO 20 Jul 2022)
description: An earthquake of  5.1 M at a depth of 10 km occurred in eastern Afghanistan, near the border with north-western Pakistan, on 18 July at 12:22 UTC (16:52 local time). The epicentre was located in the Spera district (Khost province), approximately 10 km south-west of Spera town.Media report, as of 20 July, 44 injured people and around 600 destroyed houses across the Spera district and the neighbouring Giya district (Paktika province).On 21 June 2022, the same area has been affected by a 5.9 M earthquake that resulted in more than 1,000 fatalities.In parallel, 2 hours before the earthquake in the Spera district, an earthquake of  4.8 M hit the province of Badakhshan, reportedly not causing damage. The epicentre was located in Eshkashem, at the entry of the Wakhan corridor.

title: France - Wildfires (ECHO 20 Jul 2022)
description: Three active wildfires are burning across the municipalities of Brasparts and Brennilis (Finistere department in the extreme west of Brittany, north-western France), affecting the natural area of Monts d’Arrée.The Operational Centre for Inter-ministerial Crisis Management (COGIC), reports that the wildfire in Brasparts has burned at least 1,700 ha of vegetation. In Brennilis, more than 500 people have been preventively evacuated, while authorities are monitoring the decommissioned Brennilis nuclear power plant located near the wildfire.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger on 20 July for Brittany region is expected to be up to high and improve to moderate on 21 July.

title: Italy - Wildfires (ECHO 20 Jul 2022)
description: Wildfires have been affecting north-eastern Italy (in particular the Trieste and the Gorizia provinces in the Friuli-Venezia Giulia region, bordering with Slovenia) and the Lucca province (Tuscany region, northern Italy) over the past 48 hours, causing evacuations and widespread damage. Dry weather and very high temperatures have worsened the situation.The Italian Civil Protection confirms, as of 20 July, 15 evacuated people in the Sablici village (Doberdò del Lago municipality, Gorizia province) as well as the main highways, roads and railways closed across the Gorizia, and Trieste province. In addition, 300 people were evacuated, at least 5 houses burned and several roads were closed in the area of Massarosa municipality (Lucca province)According to the Italian Civil Protection, on 19 July, both Friuli-Venezia Giulia, and the Tuscany region requested one air intervention each, out of a total of 17 intervention at national level.Over the next 24 hours, according to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC EFFIS), the fire danger forecast remains from high to extreme over Trieste, Gorizia and Lucca provinces.

title: Greece - Wildfire (ECHO 20 Jul 2022)
description: A wildfire has reportedly broken out on Mount Penteli, located north of Athens (Attica region), resulting in evacuations.According to the Greek Civil Protection and media reports, 600 people and a hospital have been preventively evacuated, as the wildfire has damaged a number of settlements. More than 485 firefighters, 120 fire vehicles, 28 hiking teams, nine aircrafts and nine helicopters, police, army, forestry and municipality forces have been deployed to the area. They were supported by 28 firefighters from Romania prepositioned in Greece under the EU Civil Protection Mechanism.The Commission's Copernicus Emergency Mapping Service was activated on 20 July for Mount Penteli in the northern suburbs of Athens () to assist authorities in firefighting operations and managing damage assessments.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire danger on 20-21 July is expected to be from extreme to very extreme over Attica Region.

title: Sudan - Flash floods, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2022)
description: On 15 July, flash floods caused by heavy rainfall, have occurred in Kas District (South Darfur State, south-western Sudan), resulting in casualties and damage.According to the latest report of UN OCHA, 12 people have died, 537 people have been affected and more than 100 houses damaged or destroyed. Most of the affected people are in two IDP camps: Ardeida (4,320 IDPs) and Al Batary (11,759 IDPs).Since the beginning of the rainy season in June, at least 9,336 people have been affected across the states of South Darfur, South Kordofan, White Nile and Kassala.On 18-19 July, heavy rainfall is forecast over south-western Sudana while moderate to heavy rain is expected over other parts of southern Sudan.

title: Pakistan - Monsoon rains, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2022)
description: The monsoon season continues to affect several provinces of Pakistan, causing floods, landlsides, and severe weather-related incidents, with humanitarian impact.According to the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), as of 18 July, up to 238 fatalities have been reported across seven provinces, most of them in Balochistan (75 fatalities), Punjab (55), and Sindh (48), and 187 individuals have been injured. Almost 3,400 houses have been damaged, as well as 22 bridges and 11,5 km of roads.The provincial disaster management authority in Balochistan has declared state of emergency in the wake of flash floods and heavy rains in Quetta and Pishin districts.According to initial assessments at least 150,000 people require humanitarian assistance, 30,000 people have been severely affected in Balochistan, and 400 families have been displaced as per initial field reports.Disaster Management Authorities at national and provincial levels are conducting rescue and relief activities. Besides, humanitarian actors including International Rescue Committee, Charitas, Islamic Relief are providing food and non-food items in the affected districts in Balochistan, Sindh and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa provinces.On 19-20 July, isolated rain with thundershower and strong winds are expected in lower Sindh, central-southern Balochistan, north-eastern Punjab, upper Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Gilgit-Baltistan, and Kashmir. Hot and humid weather is expected in most parts of the country.

title: Nigeria - Floods (ECHO 19 Jul 2022)
description: On 17 July, floods and flash floods were reported in Yobe state (north-eastern Nigeria), resulting in casualties.According to media, four people died and a number of people sustained injuries. Over 100 households have been displaced across 11 communities in Gulani and one community in Gujba. Several towns, including Gulani, Bara, Gagure, and Njibulwa, are inaccessible as the main bridge linking these areas was cut off.On 19-21 July, moderate to locally heavy rainfall accompanied by strong winds is forecast over Yobe state.

title: Portugal - Wildfires, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2022)
description: Wildfires continue to burn across Portugal, resulting in a number of casualties.According to media, two people died due to a car accident in Penabeice locality, after a wildfire has been burning across Murça municipality (Vila Real district, northern Portugal).Several people have been evacuated in Penabeice and Jou localities, and relief and reception centres have been established to host the affected population.A firefighter airplaine pilot died during firefighting operations in Torre de Moncorvo, (Bragança district) on 15 July.As of 18 July, 728 firefighters have been deployed to control five active wildfires burning across Portugal, of which two in the Vila Real district.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 19-20 July is expected to be from moderate to very high over Vila Real district and eastern Portugal.

title: Spain - Wildfires, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2022)
description: More than 30 active wildfires continue to affect Spain, resulting in casualties, as reported by the Spanish Department of Homeland Security (DSN).At least two people died and three were severely injured after the Losacio wildfire in Zamora province (Castile and León region, north-western Spain). About 2,000 individuals from 32 localities across Zamora have been preventively evacuated.A fire in Cebreros, Ávila province (Castile and León region, western Spain) caused the evacuation of 4,000 people.In Galicia, one person was injured, 800 individuals were evacuated and several buildings have been affected after the Vilariño de Conso wildfire in Orense province. In addition, more than 700 people from 30 urban centers have been evacuated due to wildfires in Carballeda de Valdeorras (Ourense province) and Folgoso do Courel (Lugo province) and the rail traffic between Madrid and Galicia has been interrupted for the high-speed rail.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 19-20 July is expected to be from extreme to very extreme over north-central Spain, particularly Castile and León, and over most of Spain, including Castile and León.

title: France -  Wildfires, update (ECHO 19 Jul 2022)
description: Due to drought conditions and high temperatures, intense wildfire activity was reported on 17 July across southern and north-western France, as reported by the Operational Centre for Inter-ministerial Crisis Management (COGIC).In Gironde department (Nouvelle-Aquitaine region, south-western France), more than 19,000 hectares of vegetation have been burned since 12 July due to the Landiras and Teste-de-Buch wildfires. Nearly 43,000 people have been evacuated. Several other wildfires, including new active ones, have been reported in south-eastern France.In Finistère department (Brittany region, north-western France), at least 1,300 ha have been burned after the Baspart wildfire.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 19 July is expected to be mostly extreme over north and southern France, and up to very extreme in ares north of Paris, Avignon and Nimes. On 20 July, the situation is expected to improve for most of France, with the exception of south-eastern Frace, where the fire risk is forecast to be extreme.

title: Syria - Severe Drought (ECHO 18 Jul 2022)
description: The World Meteorological Organisation (WMO) seasonal outlook for Syria indicates that a severe and long-term drought is affecting Syria. Water deficits have been exacerbated by unusual dry conditions during the wet season, but also by abnormally high air temperatures, which are forecast to continue into the July–September hot and dry season.The multi-year drought and the scarcity and high cost of water, food, and energy are mutually reinforcing and are underpinning Syria’s food security crisis.Humanitarian partners are working to update the  of September 2021.

title: China - Floods (ECHO 18 Jul 2022)
description: Floods, flash floods and mudslides have been affecting parts of China over the past few days, resulting in casualties and damage.According to media reports, in Sichuan (south-western China), six people have died, 12 are still missing, and 1,300 people have been evacuated. In Gansu province (north-western China), six fatalities and 3,000 evacuated people have been reported.National authorities have dispatched more than 400 rescue workers to search for those reported missing in Sichuan.For the next 24 hours, moderate to heavy rain is forecast over most parts of central, southern and north-eastern China.

title: France - Wildfires update (ECHO 18 Jul 2022)
description: Since 12 July, wildfires have been affecting south-western France, in particular Gironde department (Nouvelle-Aquitaine region), burning an area of more than 12,900 hectares of vegetation, as reported by the Operational Centre for Inter-ministerial Crisis Management (COGIC).On 17 July, 2,100 people were evacuated in Cabanac Town, due to the Teste de Buch wildfire, which remains active and uncontrollable.For the Landiras and Teste de Buch wildfires, six Canadair and at least three DASH8 aircraft will support response operations, while Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping was activated (EMSR592) on 12 July to provide First Estimate, Delineation monitoring and Grading products.On 14 July, France activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism requesting aerial firefighting means and Greece deployed firefighting airplanes in response.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), on 18 July, the fire risk over Gironde department is expected to be up to extreme, and could improve to high on 19 July.

title: Slovenia - Wildfire (ECHO 18 Jul 2022)
description: A new wildfire broke out on 17 July in Miren-Kostanjevica municipality (Goriška region, western Slovenia, on the border with Italy).Due to the dry vegetation and strong winds, the wildfire spread fast to the nearby settlements. An additional danger is the presence of unexploded ordnance, remnants from the First World War period, as reported by Civil protection authorities (URSZR).On 17 July, the Slovenian Civil protection authorities activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism, requesting support with aerial firefighting capacity. So far, Croatia responded., and the Italian Civil Protection provided bilateral assistance.According to the European Forest Fire Information System (JRC-EFFIS), the fire risk on 18-19 July is expected to be from high to very high over most of Goriška region.

title: Sudan - Flash floods, update
description: On 15 July, flash floods caused by heavy rainfall, have occurred in Kas District (South Darfur State, south-western Sudan), resulting in casualties and damage.According to the latest report of UN OCHA, 12 people have died, 537 people have been affected and more than 100 houses damaged or destroyed. Most of the affected people are in two IDP camps: Ardeida (4,320 IDPs) and Al Batary (11,759 IDPs).The Humanitarian Aid Commission (HAC) and humanitarian partners are working to determine the extent of the damage and priority needs of the affected people.Since the beginning of the rainy season in June, at least 9,336 people have been affected by floods across the states of South Darfur, South Kordofan, White Nile and Kassala.On 18-19 July, heavy rainfall is forecast over south-western Sudan while moderate to heavy rain is expected over other parts of southern Sudan.

title: Wildfires in Europe - Update (ECHO 16 Jul 2022)
description: Portugal has currently one active fire, in the Porto district (139 firefighters and 49 vehicles). Two rescEU airplanes (Canadairs) from Italy have been operating since 13 July. Yesterday an amphibious Airtractor Fireboss airplane suffered a crash when fighting a fire in Torre de Moncorvo, Bragança district, resulting in the death of the pilot.Fires have been raging for a fifth day in the Gironde department in France, with close to 10,000 hectares burned and 11,300 people evacuated. Another fire broke out on Thursday in  Bouches-du-Rhône department, with 1,250 hectares burned. France activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism on 14 July. Two rescEU airplanes (Canadairs) from Greece were deployed on 15 July.Wildfires in the Spanish provinces of Cáceres, Salamanca and Málaga, are still active with the burned area reaching approximately 12,000 hectares. Other important fires are still active in Lugo (Galicia) and Zamora and Segovia (Castilla y León). Due to the high temperatures being registered in the country, the Civil Protection authorities have declared the “extreme risk” (red) warning for the regions of Zaragoza, Cantabria, Badajoz, Navarra y La Rioja.On 15 July fires broke out in Greece triggered by high temperatures and strong winds.  Preventive evacuations took place in Attica (Saronikos municipality) and Crete (Rethymno area). According to the General Secretariat for Civil Protection five regions are at higher fire risk, Attica, Central Greece (Viotia, Evia), Peloponnese (Corinthia and Argolida), Crete and Northern Aegean (Chios, Samos, Ikaria).

title: Peru - Earthquake, update (ECHO 15 Jul 2022)
description: Casualties and damage have been reported following the 5.5 M earthquake (5.4 M as registered by the National Institute of Civil Defense - INDECI) that occurred in La Capilla district (Moquegua department, southern Peru) on 12 July at 23.36 UTC (18.36 local time).According to INDECI, two people were injured, more than 300 affected, and almost 200 houses damaged across the departments of Moquegua  and Arequipa.

title: Colombia - Severe weather, update (ECHO 15 Jul 2022)
description: Since the start of July, heavy rainfall continues to fall over large areas of Colombia, causing 58 disaster events related to rainfall and affecting 51 municipalities located in 17 departments.According to the Colombia National Unit for Disaster Risk Management (UNGRD), between 1-11 July, two people died, one is still missing, six people were injured, and more than 10,000 families were affected. Additionally, almost 5,700 homes as well as roads and bridges were damaged .On 15-16 July, moderate to heavy rainfall is forecast over most of the country.

title: Somalia - Extreme drought, displacement (ECHO 15 Jul 2022)
description: In June 2022, 112 448 people were displaced by drought, a 231% increase compared to May. This brings the total number of people displaced by the deteriorating extreme drought to 918 200, of which 607 200 are children and 143 000 women, 82% of the total.60% of those displaced arrived in the Banadir region not only from neighbouring Lower and Middle Shabelle regions but further afield in Bay and Bakool regions where the risk of famine and presence of IPC Phase 5 caseloads is the highest.This spike of displacement is the second witnessed during the drought after 310 000 people were displaced in January. This delayed displacement is reportedly due to people holding out hope for the March – May rains which didn't occur.Camp Coordination and Camp Management partners have mapped displacement sites with evidence of exclusion of residents from minority groups, those most likely to suffer from disproportionately high mortality rates during famine. 78% of the 148 sites with the greatest humanitarian needs in Somalia are located in Banadir. All have reported minority exclusion.

title: France - Wildfires (ECHO 15 Jul 2022)
description: Wildfires continue to burn across southern France, affecting an area of more than 6 000 ha, and resulting in evacuations, as reported by the Operational Centre for Inter-ministerial Crisis Management (COGIC).In Gironde department (Nouvelle-Aquitaine region, south-western France), there are two active wildfires: Teste-de-Buch and Landiras, which have burned an area of 3 000 ha and 4 100 ha, respectively. Due to the Teste-de-Buch wildfire, 10 000 people in Cazaux town had to be preventively evacuated.
